1.question: This  _______  contains 4 Chapters as follows.
1.explanation: This Purana contains 4 Chapters as follows.

1.1.1.question: _______  OF BRAHMAJI According to the scriptures, Brahmaji was born on the lotus that had arisen from the navel of eternal ommipresent Lord Narayan Vishnu.
1.1.1.explanation: APPEARANCE OF BRAHMAJI According to the scriptures, Brahmaji was born on the lotus that had arisen from the navel of eternal ommipresent Lord Narayan Vishnu.

1.1.1.question: During the period of deluge (Pralaya) all the creations was destroyed and the creatures that had gone into Maharloka (the fourth of the upper worlds according to the  _______ ), take birth again on the earth as per their deeds.
1.1.1.explanation: During the period of deluge (Pralaya) all the creations was destroyed and the creatures that had gone into Maharloka (the fourth of the upper worlds according to the Puranas), take birth again on the earth as per their deeds.

1.1.2.question: Scriptures describe the appearance of Brahmaji thus: CHATURMUKHD VEDADHARAH SAKSHASUTRA KAMANDALUH | HANSARUDHO RAKTAVASA BRAHMALOKA PITAMAH || Meaning: He has four heads, holds Vedas,  _______ , Yagyopavita (Sacred thread) and Kamandalu (bowl); wears red cothes and rides a swan.
1.1.2.explanation: Scriptures describe the appearance of Brahmaji thus: CHATURMUKHD VEDADHARAH SAKSHASUTRA KAMANDALUH | HANSARUDHO RAKTAVASA BRAHMALOKA PITAMAH || Meaning: He has four heads, holds Vedas, Rosary, Yagyopavita (Sacred thread) and Kamandalu (bowl); wears red cothes and rides a swan.

1.1.2.question: Scriptures describe the appearance of Brahmaji thus: CHATURMUKHD VEDADHARAH SAKSHASUTRA KAMANDALUH | HANSARUDHO RAKTAVASA BRAHMALOKA PITAMAH || Meaning: He has four heads, holds  _______ , Rosary, Yagyopavita (Sacred thread) and Kamandalu (bowl); wears red cothes and rides a swan.
1.1.2.explanation: Scriptures describe the appearance of Brahmaji thus: CHATURMUKHD VEDADHARAH SAKSHASUTRA KAMANDALUH | HANSARUDHO RAKTAVASA BRAHMALOKA PITAMAH || Meaning: He has four heads, holds Vedas, Rosary, Yagyopavita (Sacred thread) and Kamandalu (bowl); wears red cothes and rides a swan.

1.1.5.question: Virtues that are not to be found in any creature of the eighty-four lakh incarnations, their virtue is NEERA-KSHEERA VIVEKA, that is, if milk is mixed with water, a  _______  is capable of separating milk from water and taking it rejecting the water.
1.1.5.explanation: Virtues that are not to be found in any creature of the eighty-four lakh incarnations, their virtue is NEERA-KSHEERA VIVEKA, that is, if milk is mixed with water, a swan is capable of separating milk from water and taking it rejecting the water.

1.1.6.question: Even the great deluge (Pralaya) could not destroy  _______  for almighty Brahma himself had taken incarnation to save  _______  during deluge.
1.1.6.explanation: Even the great deluge (Pralaya) could not destroy Vedas for almighty Brahma himself had taken incarnation to save Vedas during deluge.

1.1.6.question: Even the great deluge (Pralaya) could not destroy  _______  for almighty Brahma himself had taken incarnation to save  _______  during deluge.
1.1.6.explanation: Even the great deluge (Pralaya) could not destroy Vedas for almighty Brahma himself had taken incarnation to save Vedas during deluge.

1.1.6.question: Besides  _______  also remind Brahmaji of the previous Kalpa (the grand period that includes all the four Yugas).
1.1.6.explanation: Besides Vedas also remind Brahmaji of the previous Kalpa (the grand period that includes all the four Yugas).

1.1.6.question: _______  also teach us that everything is destructible, only the truth can not be destroyed.
1.1.6.explanation: Vedas also teach us that everything is destructible, only the truth can not be destroyed.

1.1.6.question: Brahmaji is also shown as holding  _______  is one of his hands why?
1.1.6.explanation: Brahmaji is also shown as holding Vedas is one of his hands why?

1.1.6.question: _______  are undoubtedly the most ancient scriptures in the word.
1.1.6.explanation: Vedas are undoubtedly the most ancient scriptures in the word.

1.1.6.question: Hence  _______  have no beginning and no end.
1.1.6.explanation: Hence Vedas have no beginning and no end.

1.1.7.question: Hence, comprehensing these things human being must keep on reciting and telling the name of omnipresent  _______  whether he is moving, or sitting, eating or drinking and sleeping or awakening.
1.1.7.explanation: Hence, comprehensing these things human being must keep on reciting and telling the name of omnipresent God whether he is moving, or sitting, eating or drinking and sleeping or awakening.

1.1.7.question: It is therefore written also - JAPATA SIDDHIH JAPATASIDDHIH JAPATASIDHIH NASANSHAYAH Meaning : One gets perfection only in the name of almighty  _______ , there is no doubt in it.
1.1.7.explanation: It is therefore written also - JAPATA SIDDHIH JAPATASIDDHIH JAPATASIDHIH NASANSHAYAH Meaning : One gets perfection only in the name of almighty God, there is no doubt in it.

1.1.7.question: Hence, by the rosary in second hand Brahmaji teaches that, always keep on telling the name of almighty  _______ , for your welfare.
1.1.7.explanation: Hence, by the rosary in second hand Brahmaji teaches that, always keep on telling the name of almighty God, for your welfare.

1.1.7.question: Because without reciting the name of almighty  _______  welfare of any human being is simply not possible.
1.1.7.explanation: Because without reciting the name of almighty God welfare of any human being is simply not possible.

1.1.9.question: Thus the  _______  seat of Brahmaji teaches that regardless of origin one must strive to be as free and pure as possible from the influences of one's origin.
1.1.9.explanation: Thus the lotus seat of Brahmaji teaches that regardless of origin one must strive to be as free and pure as possible from the influences of one's origin.

1.1.9.question: _______  is the seat for Lord Brahma  _______  also adorns the hand of Lord Vishnu and is an essential item to worship Lord Shiva.
1.1.9.explanation: Lotus is the seat for Lord Brahma Lotus also adorns the hand of Lord Vishnu and is an essential item to worship Lord Shiva.

1.1.9.question: Every one knows that the  _______  grows from the muck.
1.1.9.explanation: Every one knows that the lotus grows from the muck.

1.2.1.question: Thus, Saraswati is the goddess who rules all kinds of  _______  without worshipping her no one can be a learned person.
1.2.1.explanation: Thus, Saraswati is the goddess who rules all kinds of knowledge without worshipping her no one can be a learned person.

1.2.1.question: Literally, Saraswati means SARAH -  _______ , STHANAMYASYAH ASTITI.
1.2.1.explanation: Literally, Saraswati means SARAH - Knowledge, STHANAMYASYAH ASTITI.

1.2.1.question: I respectfully pray the Goddess who gives us  _______ .
1.2.1.explanation: I respectfully pray the Goddess who gives us knowledge.

1.2.1.question: Appearance of Saraswati is thus described in the scriptures : SHUKLAM BRAMHAVICHARASA RA PARMADYAM JAGADVYAPINEEM VEENAPUSTAK DHARINIMABHAYADAM JADYANDHAKARA PAHAM | HASTE SPHATIKA MALIIKAM VIDADHI PADMASANE SAMSTHITAM | VANDE TAM PARAME SHVAREEM BHAGWATEEM BUDDHI PRADAY SHARDAM || Meaning : Wearer of the white clothes giver of the power to reflect the essence of Brahma, supreme power, holder of veena ( _______ ), book, beaded rosarry, the benevolent Goddess is seated on a lotus.
1.2.1.explanation: Appearance of Saraswati is thus described in the scriptures : SHUKLAM BRAMHAVICHARASA RA PARMADYAM JAGADVYAPINEEM VEENAPUSTAK DHARINIMABHAYADAM JADYANDHAKARA PAHAM | HASTE SPHATIKA MALIIKAM VIDADHI PADMASANE SAMSTHITAM | VANDE TAM PARAME SHVAREEM BHAGWATEEM BUDDHI PRADAY SHARDAM || Meaning : Wearer of the white clothes giver of the power to reflect the essence of Brahma, supreme power, holder of veena (Lyre), book, beaded rosarry, the benevolent Goddess is seated on a lotus.

1.2.1.question: Appearance of Saraswati is thus described in the scriptures : SHUKLAM BRAMHAVICHARASA RA PARMADYAM JAGADVYAPINEEM VEENAPUSTAK DHARINIMABHAYADAM JADYANDHAKARA PAHAM | HASTE SPHATIKA MALIIKAM VIDADHI PADMASANE SAMSTHITAM | VANDE TAM PARAME SHVAREEM BHAGWATEEM BUDDHI PRADAY SHARDAM || Meaning : Wearer of the white clothes giver of the power to reflect the essence of Brahma, supreme power, holder of veena (Lyre), book, beaded rosarry, the benevolent  _______  is seated on a lotus.

1.2.1.question: Thus, Saraswati is the  _______  who rules all kinds of knowledge without worshipping her no one can be a learned person.
1.2.1.explanation: Thus, Saraswati is the goddess who rules all kinds of knowledge without worshipping her no one can be a learned person.

1.2.1.question: I respectfully pray the  _______  who gives us knowledge.
1.2.1.explanation: I respectfully pray the Goddess who gives us knowledge.

1.2.3.question: Similar teaching are given by the the  _______  seat and swan vehicle of the Goddess Saraswati.
1.2.3.explanation: Similar teaching are given by the the lotus seat and swan vehicle of the Goddess Saraswati.

1.2.3.question: It is so because  _______  beads depict spotless purity.
1.2.3.explanation: It is so because white beads depict spotless purity.

1.2.3.question: But why a rosary of  _______  beads only?
1.2.3.explanation: But why a rosary of white beads only?

1.3.2.question: SHANTAKARAM BHUJANGASHAYANAM PADMANABHAM SURESHAM, VISHWADHARAM GAGAN SADRISHAM MEGHAVARNAM SHUBHANGAM| LAKSHMIKANTAN KAMALNAYANAM YOGIMIRDHYANA GAMYAM, VANDE VISHNUM BHAVA BHAYAHARAM SARVA LOKAIKNATHAM || Meaning: I worship that Lord Vishnu who has a peaceful body (postures); who rests on Sheshanaga (the mighty serpant - cobra); who has a lotus in his navel, who is the base of the world, who is like the sky; who has a colour like cloud, who is the lord of Lakshmi (wealth); who has eyes like lotus; who is seen by yogis in their meditation; who is the remover of all the differences and who is the only Lord of all the three Lokas ( _______ ), I worship such Lord Vishnu.
1.3.2.explanation: SHANTAKARAM BHUJANGASHAYANAM PADMANABHAM SURESHAM, VISHWADHARAM GAGAN SADRISHAM MEGHAVARNAM SHUBHANGAM| LAKSHMIKANTAN KAMALNAYANAM YOGIMIRDHYANA GAMYAM, VANDE VISHNUM BHAVA BHAYAHARAM SARVA LOKAIKNATHAM || Meaning: I worship that Lord Vishnu who has a peaceful body (postures); who rests on Sheshanaga (the mighty serpant - cobra); who has a lotus in his navel, who is the base of the world, who is like the sky; who has a colour like cloud, who is the lord of Lakshmi (wealth); who has eyes like lotus; who is seen by yogis in their meditation; who is the remover of all the differences and who is the only Lord of all the three Lokas (Worlds), I worship such Lord Vishnu.

1.3.3.question: It is a common principle the worshipper should be a  _______  (God) first and worship the God then, Let us reflect the appearance of Lord Vishnu in light of this principle.
1.3.3.explanation: It is a common principle the worshipper should be a Deva (God) first and worship the God then, Let us reflect the appearance of Lord Vishnu in light of this principle.

1.3.5.question: The third virtue of Lord Vishnu is that he bears a  _______  on his navel,hence he is also known as Padmanabham.
1.3.5.explanation: The third virtue of Lord Vishnu is that he bears a lotus on his navel,hence he is also known as Padmanabham.

1.3.5.question: From the  _______  rises Lord Brahma.
1.3.5.explanation: From the lotus rises Lord Brahma.

1.3.5.question: Similarily he has made the snake, which has Tamoguna ( _______  of darkness), his seat, Thus only Satoguna ( _______  of the truth) remains with him, and God became Shantakaram (acquired a peaceful form).
1.3.5.explanation: Similarily he has made the snake, which has Tamoguna (virtue of darkness), his seat, Thus only Satoguna (Virtue of the truth) remains with him, and God became Shantakaram (acquired a peaceful form).

1.3.5.question: Similarily he has made the snake, which has Tamoguna ( _______  of darkness), his seat, Thus only Satoguna ( _______  of the truth) remains with him, and God became Shantakaram (acquired a peaceful form).
1.3.5.explanation: Similarily he has made the snake, which has Tamoguna (virtue of darkness), his seat, Thus only Satoguna (Virtue of the truth) remains with him, and God became Shantakaram (acquired a peaceful form).

1.3.5.question: The third  _______  of Lord Vishnu is that he bears a lotus on his navel,hence he is also known as Padmanabham.
1.3.5.explanation: The third virtue of Lord Vishnu is that he bears a lotus on his navel,hence he is also known as Padmanabham.

1.3.5.question: Similarily he has made the snake, which has Tamoguna (virtue of darkness), his seat, Thus only Satoguna (Virtue of the truth) remains with him, and  _______  became Shantakaram (acquired a peaceful form).
1.3.5.explanation: Similarily he has made the snake, which has Tamoguna (virtue of darkness), his seat, Thus only Satoguna (Virtue of the truth) remains with him, and God became Shantakaram (acquired a peaceful form).

1.3.6.question: Similarily, all these desirious of  _______ , must follow Vaishnava religion, otherwise any deviation in it may damage all of their penance.
1.3.6.explanation: Similarily, all these desirious of Salvation, must follow Vaishnava religion, otherwise any deviation in it may damage all of their penance.

1.3.6.question: Similarily, all these desirious of Salvation, must follow  _______  religion, otherwise any deviation in it may damage all of their penance.
1.3.6.explanation: Similarily, all these desirious of Salvation, must follow Vaishnava religion, otherwise any deviation in it may damage all of their penance.

1.3.10.question: _______ - _______  HOHI DHARAMA KI HANI… HARHINATH SAJJANA KAI PEERA | God takes various incarnations to protect his devotees.
1.3.10.explanation: JAB-JAB HOHI DHARAMA KI HANI… HARHINATH SAJJANA KAI PEERA | God takes various incarnations to protect his devotees.

1.3.10.question: Thus with the  _______ , God warns anti social elements that if they try to violate the sanctity of religion and torment his devotees, He will punish them.
1.3.10.explanation: Thus with the mace, God warns anti social elements that if they try to violate the sanctity of religion and torment his devotees, He will punish them.

1.3.10.question: _______  is a weapon that shows and dares for the physical strength.
1.3.10.explanation: Mace is a weapon that shows and dares for the physical strength.

1.3.10.question: Among all the ancient weapons,  _______  was the main.
1.3.10.explanation: Among all the ancient weapons, mace was the main.

1.3.11.question: Garuda ( _______ ) is said to be the king of the birds.
1.3.11.explanation: Garuda (eagle) is said to be the king of the birds.

1.3.11.question: _______  (eagle) is said to be the king of the birds.
1.3.11.explanation: Garuda (eagle) is said to be the king of the birds.

1.4.1.question: Second aspect of the message is for the people who want to get rich, that if they want the wealth, they must develop a devotion for the feet of Narayana, for Lakshmi ( _______  of wealth) is to be found there and no where else.
1.4.1.explanation: Second aspect of the message is for the people who want to get rich, that if they want the wealth, they must develop a devotion for the feet of Narayana, for Lakshmi (Goddess of wealth) is to be found there and no where else.

1.4.2.question: In the proxmity of  _______  whose main virtue is Satoguna, no one can remain freakish.
1.4.2.explanation: In the proxmity of God whose main virtue is Satoguna, no one can remain freakish.

1.4.3.question: And she visits the home of those devotees who worship Lord Vishnu first and then her, with Vishnu riding his vehicle  _______ .
1.4.3.explanation: And she visits the home of those devotees who worship Lord Vishnu first and then her, with Vishnu riding his vehicle Garuda.

1.4.3.question: An  _______  can't see in the day, Hence, Lakshmi visits the house of those devotees who only worship her, on her vehicle  _______ .
1.4.3.explanation: An owl can't see in the day, Hence, Lakshmi visits the house of those devotees who only worship her, on her vehicle owl.

1.4.3.question: An  _______  can't see in the day, Hence, Lakshmi visits the house of those devotees who only worship her, on her vehicle  _______ .
1.4.3.explanation: An owl can't see in the day, Hence, Lakshmi visits the house of those devotees who only worship her, on her vehicle owl.

1.4.3.question: Since  _______  is a bird that sees in the darkness alone, and darkness sumbolizes ignorance.
1.4.3.explanation: Since owl is a bird that sees in the darkness alone, and darkness sumbolizes ignorance.

1.4.3.question: It also implies that at places where black-money is main, Lakshmi rides an  _______ .
1.4.3.explanation: It also implies that at places where black-money is main, Lakshmi rides an owl.

1.4.3.question: Thus  _______  is a symbol of black money and misdeeds.
1.4.3.explanation: Thus owl is a symbol of black money and misdeeds.

1.4.3.question: _______  is the vehicle of goddess Lakshmi.
1.4.3.explanation: Owl is the vehicle of goddess Lakshmi.

2.question: This  _______  contains 5 Chapters as follows: Second among the eighteen  _______ s, Padma  _______  contains five parts- Srishtikhand, Bhumikhand, Swargkhand, Patalkhand and Uttarkhand.
2.explanation: This Purana contains 5 Chapters as follows: Second among the eighteen Puranas, Padma Purana contains five parts- Srishtikhand, Bhumikhand, Swargkhand, Patalkhand and Uttarkhand.

2.1.question: In course of time this particular place was famous as 'Naimish' because the term 'Nemi' in  _______  means circumference.
2.1.explanation: In course of time this particular place was famous as 'Naimish' because the term 'Nemi' in Sanskrit means circumference.

2.1.question: Having revealed the contents of all the  _______  to his son Ugrashrava, Sage Lomaharshan instructed him to go to 'Naimisharanya' and spread it among the sages doing penance over there.
2.1.explanation: Having revealed the contents of all the Puranas to his son Ugrashrava, Sage Lomaharshan instructed him to go to 'Naimisharanya' and spread it among the sages doing penance over there.

2.1.question: There is an interesting tale how this sacrosanct forest of Naimish derived it's name -- Once, the  _______  sought Lord Vishnu's help in finding a suitable place, where they could perform their religious activities unhindered.
2.1.explanation: There is an interesting tale how this sacrosanct forest of Naimish derived it's name -- Once, the sages sought Lord Vishnu's help in finding a suitable place, where they could perform their religious activities unhindered.

2.1.question: Having revealed the contents of all the Puranas to his son Ugrashrava, Sage Lomaharshan instructed him to go to 'Naimisharanya' and spread it among the  _______  doing penance over there.
2.1.explanation: Having revealed the contents of all the Puranas to his son Ugrashrava, Sage Lomaharshan instructed him to go to 'Naimisharanya' and spread it among the sages doing penance over there.

2.1.question: When Ugrashrava who was popularly known as 'Sutji' reached 'Naimisharnya' all the  _______  received him with enlighten all the  _______  on the divine tales of Padma Puran.
2.1.explanation: When Ugrashrava who was popularly known as 'Sutji' reached 'Naimisharnya' all the sages received him with enlighten all the sages on the divine tales of Padma Puran.

2.1.question: When Ugrashrava who was popularly known as 'Sutji' reached 'Naimisharnya' all the  _______  received him with enlighten all the  _______  on the divine tales of Padma Puran.
2.1.explanation: When Ugrashrava who was popularly known as 'Sutji' reached 'Naimisharnya' all the sages received him with enlighten all the sages on the divine tales of Padma Puran.

2.1.question: These tales were narrated to Lord Brahma by Lord Vishnu himself, who in turn propagated them in this world through various  _______ .
2.1.explanation: These tales were narrated to Lord Brahma by Lord Vishnu himself, who in turn propagated them in this world through various sages.

2.1.question: The  _______  followed the chakra as per the instruction of Lord Vishnu.
2.1.explanation: The Sages followed the chakra as per the instruction of Lord Vishnu.

2.1.1.question: The  _______  requested Sutji to narrate about the incident when sage Pulastya had met Bhishma.
2.1.1.explanation: The Sages requested Sutji to narrate about the incident when sage Pulastya had met Bhishma.

2.1.1.question: After that he created the three types of Ego from the Mahattatva---Satva,  _______  and Tamas.
2.1.1.explanation: After that he created the three types of Ego from the Mahattatva---Satva, Rajas and Tamas.

2.1.4.question: Lord Vishnu instructed them to collect all the medicinal herbs, and put them in the Ksheersagar, so that after the churning of the ocean  _______  could be retrieved.Lord Vishnu also advised them to use the Mandar mountain as a Churner and the serpent--Sheshnag as a rope for churning the ocean.The deities then reached an agreement with the demons according to which both the groups were supposed to unitedly churn the ocean.
2.1.4.explanation: Lord Vishnu instructed them to collect all the medicinal herbs, and put them in the Ksheersagar, so that after the churning of the ocean ambrosia could be retrieved.Lord Vishnu also advised them to use the Mandar mountain as a Churner and the serpent--Sheshnag as a rope for churning the ocean.The deities then reached an agreement with the demons according to which both the groups were supposed to unitedly churn the ocean.

2.1.4.question: Lord Vishnu then disguised himself as the most enchanting woman and fooled the demons into giving back the  _______ - pot.
2.1.4.explanation: Lord Vishnu then disguised himself as the most enchanting woman and fooled the demons into giving back the ambrosia- pot.

2.1.4.question: The churning of ocean also resulted into the manifestation of  _______ -pot, Uchchaishrava (horse) and Eravat (elephant).
2.1.4.explanation: The churning of ocean also resulted into the manifestation of ambrosia-pot, Uchchaishrava (horse) and Eravat (elephant).

2.1.4.question: The demons became furious and snatched the  _______ -pot from the hands of Sage Dhanvantari.
2.1.4.explanation: The demons became furious and snatched the ambrosia-pot from the hands of Sage Dhanvantari.

2.1.4.question: Lord Vishnu gave the pot to the deities who became immortal after drinking  _______ .
2.1.4.explanation: Lord Vishnu gave the pot to the deities who became immortal after drinking ambrosia.

2.1.4.question: The deities eulogised Lord Vishnu and returned to  _______ .
2.1.4.explanation: The deities eulogised Lord Vishnu and returned to heaven.

2.1.5.question: In the name of clothes, your husband puts on  _______ 's skin.

2.1.5.explanation: All species of serpents coil around his body.

2.1.6.explanation: Vasu had eight sons who became famous as the Vasus---yourself (Bheeshma), Dhruv, Soma, Dhar, Anil, Anal, Pratyush and Prabhas.

2.1.6.explanation: While Soma was the father of Varcha.

2.1.6.explanation: Sage Kashyap had thirteen wives---Aditi, Diti, Danu, Arishta, Sursa, Surabhi, Vinta, Tamra, Krodhvasha, Ira, Kadru, Khasa and Muni.

2.1.6.explanation: Ira was the mother of various vegetation like grass, trees, creepers and bushes.

2.4.7.explanation: Lav and Kush followed the instruction of Sita and released everybody from their captivity.

2.4.7.question: Shatrughan released volleys of arrow towards  _______  but all of them were neutralized by him.
2.4.7.explanation: Shatrughan released volleys of arrow towards Lav but all of them were neutralized by him.

2.4.7.question: When he reached the battlefield he saw  _______  who was held captive by the enemy's army's.
2.4.7.explanation: When he reached the battlefield he saw Lav who was held captive by the enemy's army's.

2.4.7.question: When Shatrughan learnt about Hanuman's fate he was infuriated and went to fight  _______ .
2.4.7.explanation: When Shatrughan learnt about Hanuman's fate he was infuriated and went to fight Lav.

2.4.7.question: But  _______  was not interested in his irrelevant queries and challenged him for a duel.
2.4.7.explanation: But Lav was not interested in his irrelevant queries and challenged him for a duel.

2.4.7.question: After regaining his consciousness, he aimed his most lethal weapon towards  _______ .
2.4.7.explanation: After regaining his consciousness, he aimed his most lethal weapon towards Lav.

2.4.7.question: It did not take much time for  _______  and Kush to vanquish the whole army.
2.4.7.explanation: It did not take much time for Lav and Kush to vanquish the whole army.

2.4.7.question: _______ 's companions went and informed Sita about the whole incident.
2.4.7.explanation: Lav's companions went and informed Sita about the whole incident.

2.4.7.question: The arrow hit  _______  and he fell down unconscious.
2.4.7.explanation: The arrow hit Lav and he fell down unconscious.

2.4.8.question: He then narrated the brave deed of  _______  and Kush.He also revealed how mighty warriors like Hanuman, Sugreeva Shatrughan etc had been defeated by both of them.
2.4.8.explanation: He then narrated the brave deed of Lav and Kush.He also revealed how mighty warriors like Hanuman, Sugreeva Shatrughan etc had been defeated by both of them.

2.4.8.question: He instructed Sumati to make all the necessary arrangements for the safe return of the  _______ , which comprised not only of Sri Ram's army but also of all the defeated kings and their vanquished armies.
2.4.8.explanation: He instructed Sumati to make all the necessary arrangements for the safe return of the Caravan, which comprised not only of Sri Ram's army but also of all the defeated kings and their vanquished armies.

2.4.9.question: Laxman followed his instruction and went to Valmiki's hermitage for the second time.Meanwhile, Valmiki instructed  _______  and Kush to sing the praise of Sri Ram in their melodious voice.
2.4.9.explanation: Laxman followed his instruction and went to Valmiki's hermitage for the second time.Meanwhile, Valmiki instructed Lav and Kush to sing the praise of Sri Ram in their melodious voice.

2.4.9.question: Sri Ram asked him about the identity of the two children-- _______  and Kush, Valmiki said --- Sita was pregnant at the time you had abandoned her.
2.4.9.explanation: Sri Ram asked him about the identity of the two children--Lav and Kush, Valmiki said --- Sita was pregnant at the time you had abandoned her.

2.4.9.question: When Sri Ram found that only  _______  and Kush had come, he once again sent Laxman to bring Sita.
2.4.9.explanation: When Sri Ram found that only Lav and Kush had come, he once again sent Laxman to bring Sita.

2.4.9.question: I gave her refuge in my hermitage where she gave birth to twins-- _______  and Kush.
2.4.9.explanation: I gave her refuge in my hermitage where she gave birth to twins--Lav and Kush.

2.4.9.question: Sita refused to return but sent  _______  and Kush along with Laxman.
2.4.9.explanation: Sita refused to return but sent Lav and Kush along with Laxman.

2.4.9.question: He instructed Laxman to bring Sita along with  _______  and Kush.
2.4.9.explanation: He instructed Laxman to bring Sita along with Lav and Kush.

2.4.9.question: Sri Ram took  _______  and Kush in his embrace.
2.4.9.explanation: Sri Ram took Lav and Kush in his embrace.

2.4.9.question: So,  _______  and Kush are your sons.
2.4.9.explanation: So, Lav and Kush are your sons.

2.4.10.question: Having said this the man attained to the  _______ .
2.4.10.explanation: Having said this the man attained to the heaven.

2.5.2.question: Bhagirath did an austere penance on the  _______  for ten thousand years.
2.5.2.explanation: Bhagirath did an austere penance on the Himalayas for ten thousand years.

2.5.2.question: I ( _______ ) held her in the locks of my hair and she remained there for ten thousand more years.
2.5.2.explanation: I (Shiva) held her in the locks of my hair and she remained there for ten thousand more years.

2.5.4.question: Giving a detailed description of the qualities of a  _______ , Lord Mahadeva told Narad --- A person who has total devotion in Lord Vishnu is called a  _______ .
2.5.4.explanation: Giving a detailed description of the qualities of a Vaishnava, Lord Mahadeva told Narad --- A person who has total devotion in Lord Vishnu is called a Vaishnava.

2.5.4.question: Giving a detailed description of the qualities of a  _______ , Lord Mahadeva told Narad --- A person who has total devotion in Lord Vishnu is called a  _______ .
2.5.4.explanation: Giving a detailed description of the qualities of a Vaishnava, Lord Mahadeva told Narad --- A person who has total devotion in Lord Vishnu is called a Vaishnava.

2.5.4.question: He is well versed in sacred text like the vedas, Purans etc.The mere sight of a  _______  is enough to liberate a sinner from all his sins.
2.5.4.explanation: He is well versed in sacred text like the vedas, Purans etc.The mere sight of a Vaishnava is enough to liberate a sinner from all his sins.

2.5.4.question: Feeding a  _______  bestowes virtue equivalent to feeding thousand of ordinary Brahmins.
2.5.4.explanation: Feeding a Vaishnava bestowes virtue equivalent to feeding thousand of ordinary Brahmins.

2.5.4.question: Feeding a Vaishnava bestowes virtue equivalent to feeding thousand of ordinary  _______ .
2.5.4.explanation: Feeding a Vaishnava bestowes virtue equivalent to feeding thousand of ordinary Brahmins.

2.5.7.question: Makar was a mighty demon, Who after deceitfully acquiring the  _______  from Lord Brahma had hidden himself inside an ocean.
2.5.7.explanation: Makar was a mighty demon, Who after deceitfully acquiring the Vedas from Lord Brahma had hidden himself inside an ocean.

2.5.7.question: Lord Vishnu then took the incarnation of Matsya and after killing Makar gave back the  _______  to Lord Brahma.
2.5.7.explanation: Lord Vishnu then took the incarnation of Matsya and after killing Makar gave back the vedas to Lord Brahma.

2.5.7.question: Lord Brahma requested Vishnu to liberate the sacred  _______  from the possession of Makar.
2.5.7.explanation: Lord Brahma requested Vishnu to liberate the sacred Vedas from the possession of Makar.

2.5.9.question: The deities informed him that  _______  was busy performing a yagya and he would not turn down any demand made to him because if he did so there was a fear of loosing all his virtues attained by the performance of the yagya.
2.5.9.explanation: The deities informed him that Bali was busy performing a yagya and he would not turn down any demand made to him because if he did so there was a fear of loosing all his virtues attained by the performance of the yagya.

2.5.9.question: Continuing with the various incarnations of Lord Vishnu, Lord Mahadeva told Parvati --- Prahlad had a son named Virochan.The most benevolent king--'Mahabahu- _______ ' was Virochan's son.
2.5.9.explanation: Continuing with the various incarnations of Lord Vishnu, Lord Mahadeva told Parvati --- Prahlad had a son named Virochan.The most benevolent king--'Mahabahu-Bali' was Virochan's son.

2.5.9.question: The helpless  _______  agreed to donate all the three worlds to protect his vow.Ultimately, Lord Vishnu sent  _______  to the Rasatala and thus Indra became the ruler of heaven once again.
2.5.9.explanation: The helpless Bali agreed to donate all the three worlds to protect his vow.Ultimately, Lord Vishnu sent Bali to the Rasatala and thus Indra became the ruler of heaven once again.

2.5.9.question: The helpless  _______  agreed to donate all the three worlds to protect his vow.Ultimately, Lord Vishnu sent  _______  to the Rasatala and thus Indra became the ruler of heaven once again.
2.5.9.explanation: The helpless Bali agreed to donate all the three worlds to protect his vow.Ultimately, Lord Vishnu sent Bali to the Rasatala and thus Indra became the ruler of heaven once again.

2.5.9.question: _______  agreed to meet the demand of his guest inspite of Shukracharya's warning. _______  resolved to donate land by holding holy water in his palm.
2.5.9.explanation: Bali agreed to meet the demand of his guest inspite of Shukracharya's warning.Bali resolved to donate land by holding holy water in his palm.

2.5.9.question: _______  agreed to meet the demand of his guest inspite of Shukracharya's warning. _______  resolved to donate land by holding holy water in his palm.
2.5.9.explanation: Bali agreed to meet the demand of his guest inspite of Shukracharya's warning.Bali resolved to donate land by holding holy water in his palm.

2.5.9.question: Lord Vaman went to the oblation site where  _______  was performing a yagya and demanded a small piece of land measured by his three steps.
2.5.9.explanation: Lord Vaman went to the oblation site where Bali was performing a yagya and demanded a small piece of land measured by his three steps.

2.5.9.question: _______  had defeated the deities and ruled over all the three worlds.
2.5.9.explanation: Bali had defeated the deities and ruled over all the three worlds.

2.5.9.question: The helpless Bali agreed to donate all the three worlds to protect his vow.Ultimately, Lord Vishnu sent Bali to the Rasatala and thus Indra became the ruler of  _______  once again.
2.5.9.explanation: The helpless Bali agreed to donate all the three worlds to protect his vow.Ultimately, Lord Vishnu sent Bali to the Rasatala and thus Indra became the ruler of heaven once again.

2.5.9.question: Sage Kashyap commenced the most austere penance--Payovrata to help the deities regain their lost kingdom ( _______ ) once again.
2.5.9.explanation: Sage Kashyap commenced the most austere penance--Payovrata to help the deities regain their lost kingdom (heaven) once again.

2.5.11.question: When Marich tried to disrupt the yagya, Sri  _______  attacked him with Pavan-astra, which sent Marich flying across the sea-shore.Meanwhile, on learning that Janak was performing Vajapeya yagya at Janakpur, Vishwamitra took Sri- _______  and Laxman to attend it.
2.5.11.explanation: When Marich tried to disrupt the yagya, Sri Ram attacked him with Pavan-astra, which sent Marich flying across the sea-shore.Meanwhile, on learning that Janak was performing Vajapeya yagya at Janakpur, Vishwamitra took Sri-Ram and Laxman to attend it.

2.5.11.question: Although all the four brothers were very close to each other, yet Laxman could not bear to live in  _______ 's separation even for a moment and was specially close to him.
2.5.11.explanation: Although all the four brothers were very close to each other, yet Laxman could not bear to live in Ram's separation even for a moment and was specially close to him.

2.5.12.question: He abducted Sita with the help of Marich.When Jatayu saw Ravan carrying Sita to Lanka, he fought with valiance but was injured in the ensuing battle.Sri  _______  went in search of Sita and met Jatayu, who was injured and who informed  _______  that Sita had been abducted by the demon king Ravan.Sri  _______  met Hanuman at the Rishyamook mountain.
2.5.12.explanation: He abducted Sita with the help of Marich.When Jatayu saw Ravan carrying Sita to Lanka, he fought with valiance but was injured in the ensuing battle.Sri Ram went in search of Sita and met Jatayu, who was injured and who informed Ram that Sita had been abducted by the demon king Ravan.Sri Ram met Hanuman at the Rishyamook mountain.

2.5.12.question: Khar attacked  _______  with a huge army, which comprised of brave warriors like Trishira Dushan etc.
2.5.12.explanation: Khar attacked Ram with a huge army, which comprised of brave warriors like Trishira Dushan etc.

2.5.12.question: Dasharath could not bear the sorrow of  _______ 's separation and died in his sorrow.
2.5.12.explanation: Dasharath could not bear the sorrow of Ram's separation and died in his sorrow.

2.5.12.question: Shurpanakha went to Ravan and informed him about the misdeeds of  _______ .
2.5.12.explanation: Shurpanakha went to Ravan and informed him about the misdeeds of Ram.

2.5.13.question: Sri Ram's heart was filled with remorse but thinking that it was perhaps in his destiny to live in separation with Sita, returned to Ayodhya accompanied by  _______  and Kush.
2.5.13.explanation: Sri Ram's heart was filled with remorse but thinking that it was perhaps in his destiny to live in separation with Sita, returned to Ayodhya accompanied by Lav and Kush.

2.5.13.question: He appointed  _______  and Kush as the kings of Dwarawati and Kushawati respectively and decided to leave for heavenly abode.
2.5.13.explanation: He appointed Lav and Kush as the kings of Dwarawati and Kushawati respectively and decided to leave for heavenly abode.

2.5.13.question: Feeling pity on her condition, Valmiki took her to his hermitage where Sita gave birth to  _______  and Kush.
2.5.13.explanation: Feeling pity on her condition, Valmiki took her to his hermitage where Sita gave birth to Lav and Kush.

2.5.13.question: Meanwhile Sri Ram decided to perform Ashwamedha yagya at the  _______  of river Gomati.
2.5.13.explanation: Meanwhile Sri Ram decided to perform Ashwamedha yagya at the bank of river Gomati.

2.5.14.question: After her marriage, while Devaki was going to her husband's house on a chariot being driven by  _______ , suddenly a heavenly voice was heard.
2.5.14.explanation: After her marriage, while Devaki was going to her husband's house on a chariot being driven by Kansa, suddenly a heavenly voice was heard.

2.5.14.question: Thus  _______  imprisoned both Vasudev and Devaki.In course of time, Devaki gave birth to seven sons and  _______  killed each of them.
2.5.14.explanation: Thus Kansa imprisoned both Vasudev and Devaki.In course of time, Devaki gave birth to seven sons and Kansa killed each of them.

2.5.14.question: Thus  _______  imprisoned both Vasudev and Devaki.In course of time, Devaki gave birth to seven sons and  _______  killed each of them.
2.5.14.explanation: Thus Kansa imprisoned both Vasudev and Devaki.In course of time, Devaki gave birth to seven sons and Kansa killed each of them.

2.5.14.question: But, Vasudev requested  _______  to spare Devaki's life and promised to hand over any child that she gave birth to.
2.5.14.explanation: But, Vasudev requested Kansa to spare Devaki's life and promised to hand over any child that she gave birth to.

2.5.14.question: _______  tried to kill that baby girl by smashing her head, but she escaped from his hands and flew up in the sky.
2.5.14.explanation: Kansa tried to kill that baby girl by smashing her head, but she escaped from his hands and flew up in the sky.

2.5.14.question: He was married to Devaki--the daughter of Ugrasena.Ugrasena also had a mighty son named  _______ .
2.5.14.explanation: He was married to Devaki--the daughter of Ugrasena.Ugrasena also had a mighty son named Kansa.

2.5.14.question: _______  became very scarred and wanted to kill his sister then and there.
2.5.14.explanation: Kansa became very scarred and wanted to kill his sister then and there.

2.5.14.question: One day  _______  sent a wicked ogress named Putna to kill Sri Krishna.
2.5.14.explanation: One day Kansa sent a wicked ogress named Putna to kill Sri Krishna.

2.5.14.question: ' _______ , you would meet death at the hands of Devaki's eighth son.'
2.5.14.explanation: 'Kansa, you would meet death at the hands of Devaki's eighth son.'

2.5.14.question: They informed  _______  about the birth of Devaki's eighth child.
2.5.14.explanation: They informed Kansa about the birth of Devaki's eighth child.

2.5.14.question: _______  was extremely affectionate towards his sister Devaki.
2.5.14.explanation: Kansa was extremely affectionate towards his sister Devaki.

2.5.14.question: _______  was terrified at the prospect of his death.
2.5.14.explanation: Kansa was terrified at the prospect of his death.

2.5.15.question: Continuing with the divine tales of Sri Krishna, Lord Mahadeva told Parvati-- When  _______  failed in his repeated attempts to kill Sri Krishna, he instructed 'Akrura' to invite both Krishna and Balaram to Mathura on the pretext of attending a ceremony called Dhanush-yagya.
2.5.15.explanation: Continuing with the divine tales of Sri Krishna, Lord Mahadeva told Parvati-- When Kansa failed in his repeated attempts to kill Sri Krishna, he instructed 'Akrura' to invite both Krishna and Balaram to Mathura on the pretext of attending a ceremony called Dhanush-yagya.

2.5.15.question: Sri Krishna lifted the divine bow kept there and broke it into two pieces.When  _______  learnt that the divine bow had been broken, he ordered Chaanur to kill Krishna in a wrestling-bout.
2.5.15.explanation: Sri Krishna lifted the divine bow kept there and broke it into two pieces.When Kansa learnt that the divine bow had been broken, he ordered Chaanur to kill Krishna in a wrestling-bout.

2.5.15.question: _______  also fortified his palace by positioning wild elephants and mighty warriors at all the entrance-points.Sri Krishna and Balaram spent the night at the oblation-site.
2.5.15.explanation: Kansa also fortified his palace by positioning wild elephants and mighty warriors at all the entrance-points.Sri Krishna and Balaram spent the night at the oblation-site.

2.5.15.question: _______  became terrified and ordered his trusted lientenants--Chanur and Mushtik to kill Krishna.Chanur confronted Sri Krishna while Mushtik fought a duel with Balaram.
2.5.15.explanation: Kansa became terrified and ordered his trusted lientenants--Chanur and Mushtik to kill Krishna.Chanur confronted Sri Krishna while Mushtik fought a duel with Balaram.

2.5.15.question: Now,  _______  was left all alone, Sri Krishna pulled  _______  from the throne where he was sitting and slapped him so hard that he fell down on the ground.
2.5.15.explanation: Now, Kansa was left all alone, Sri Krishna pulled Kansa from the throne where he was sitting and slapped him so hard that he fell down on the ground.

2.5.15.question: Now,  _______  was left all alone, Sri Krishna pulled  _______  from the throne where he was sitting and slapped him so hard that he fell down on the ground.
2.5.15.explanation: Now, Kansa was left all alone, Sri Krishna pulled Kansa from the throne where he was sitting and slapped him so hard that he fell down on the ground.

2.5.15.question: _______  had planned to kill Sri Krishna by deceitful means.Akrura was a great devotee of Sri Krishna and was aware of  _______ 's evil intentions.
2.5.15.explanation: Kansa had planned to kill Sri Krishna by deceitful means.Akrura was a great devotee of Sri Krishna and was aware of Kansa's evil intentions.

2.5.15.question: _______  had planned to kill Sri Krishna by deceitful means.Akrura was a great devotee of Sri Krishna and was aware of  _______ 's evil intentions.
2.5.15.explanation: Kansa had planned to kill Sri Krishna by deceitful means.Akrura was a great devotee of Sri Krishna and was aware of Kansa's evil intentions.

2.5.15.question: Akrura conveyed the instructions of  _______  to Nanda and requested him to send both Sri Krishna and Balaram to Mathura.
2.5.15.explanation: Akrura conveyed the instructions of Kansa to Nanda and requested him to send both Sri Krishna and Balaram to Mathura.

2.5.15.question: Sri Krishna and Balaram chose some beautiful set of clothes for themselves and proceeded towards the palace of  _______ .
2.5.15.explanation: Sri Krishna and Balaram chose some beautiful set of clothes for themselves and proceeded towards the palace of Kansa.

2.5.15.question: Akrura said--'Sri Krishna is the incarnation of Lord Vishnu and  _______  will be killed by him.
2.5.15.explanation: Akrura said--'Sri Krishna is the incarnation of Lord Vishnu and Kansa will be killed by him.

2.5.15.question: After killing  _______ , Krishna and Balaram went to meet their parents--Vasudev and Devaki.
2.5.15.explanation: After killing Kansa, Krishna and Balaram went to meet their parents--Vasudev and Devaki.

2.5.15.question: They also freed their maternal grandfather- Ugrasena who had been imprisioned by  _______ .
2.5.15.explanation: They also freed their maternal grandfather- Ugrasena who had been imprisioned by Kansa.

2.5.15.question: Sri Krishna saw a dyer with colourful apparels going towards  _______ 's palace.
2.5.15.explanation: Sri Krishna saw a dyer with colourful apparels going towards Kansa's palace.

2.5.15.question: But, he had no other option but to follow the command of his master- _______ .
2.5.15.explanation: But, he had no other option but to follow the command of his master-Kansa.

2.5.15.question: Balaram also killed  _______ 's younger brother whose named was Sunama.
2.5.15.explanation: Balaram also killed Kansa's younger brother whose named was Sunama.

2.5.15.question: The injury proved to be fatal and as a result  _______  died.
2.5.15.explanation: The injury proved to be fatal and as a result Kansa died.

2.5.15.question: Sri Krishna and Balaram entered the chamber of  _______ .
2.5.15.explanation: Sri Krishna and Balaram entered the chamber of Kansa.

2.5.16.question: Balaram attacked Jarasandh with his dangerous weapon--Hala ( _______ ) and destroyed his chariot.
2.5.16.explanation: Balaram attacked Jarasandh with his dangerous weapon--Hala (plough) and destroyed his chariot.

2.5.16.question: When he learnt about  _______ ' death he surrounded Mathura with a huge army.
2.5.16.explanation: When he learnt about Kansa' death he surrounded Mathura with a huge army.

2.5.16.question: Jarasandh was the father-in-law of  _______ .
2.5.16.explanation: Jarasandh was the father-in-law of Kansa.

2.5.18.question: Sri Krishna flew up in the sky mounted on the back of  _______ .
2.5.18.explanation: Sri Krishna flew up in the sky mounted on the back of Garuda.

2.5.20.question: One day, some Yadva children went at the  _______  of river Narmada where sage Kanva was doing penance.
2.5.20.explanation: One day, some Yadva children went at the bank of river Narmada where sage Kanva was doing penance.

2.5.20.question: A long battle was fought at the  _______  of river yamuna, which continued for many days.
2.5.20.explanation: A long battle was fought at the bank of river yamuna, which continued for many days.

2.5.21.question: There are some specific days which are considered to be specially auspicious for the worship of lord Vishnu--Amavasya,  _______ , Solar eclipse, lunar eclipse etc.
2.5.21.explanation: There are some specific days which are considered to be specially auspicious for the worship of lord Vishnu--Amavasya, Saturday, Solar eclipse, lunar eclipse etc.

2.5.21.question: While worshipping, it is most necessary that a devotee followes the rituals as mentioned in the ancient scriptures like Shruti, Smriti,  _______  etc.
2.5.21.explanation: While worshipping, it is most necessary that a devotee followes the rituals as mentioned in the ancient scriptures like Shruti, Smriti, Vedas etc.

3.1.1.question: The ego  _______  produced ten sense organs whereas the ruling deities of these organs were produced by Sattvic ego.
3.1.1.explanation: The ego Rajas produced ten sense organs whereas the ruling deities of these organs were produced by Sattvic ego.

3.1.1.question: From this great element originated three egos- Sattvic,  _______  and Taamas.
3.1.1.explanation: From this great element originated three egos- Sattvic, Rajas and Taamas.

3.1.2.question: Thereafter, the Lord acquired a new body with  _______  virtue from which the human beings were produced.
3.1.2.explanation: Thereafter, the Lord acquired a new body with Rajas virtue from which the human beings were produced.

3.1.2.question: When the Lord shed that  _______  body it formed dawn- the twilight between the night and the day.
3.1.2.explanation: When the Lord shed that Rajas body it formed dawn- the twilight between the night and the day.

3.1.2.question: Then the Lord assumed yet another body with  _______  virtues and produced desire from it.
3.1.2.explanation: Then the Lord assumed yet another body with Rajas virtues and produced desire from it.

3.1.2.question: In that world, many ugly looking human beings, who had long beard and  _______  appeared and ran towards Him.
3.1.2.explanation: In that world, many ugly looking human beings, who had long beard and moustache appeared and ran towards Him.

3.1.3.question: Paddy, barley, wheat, lesser cereals,  _______ , millet, rice, peas, pulses, beans, rye, gram and hemp are common agricultural produce that have edible as well as medicinal values in the villages.
3.1.3.explanation: Paddy, barley, wheat, lesser cereals, sesame, millet, rice, peas, pulses, beans, rye, gram and hemp are common agricultural produce that have edible as well as medicinal values in the villages.

3.1.3.question: Paddy, barley, wheat, lesser cereals, sesame,  _______ , rice, peas, pulses, beans, rye, gram and hemp are common agricultural produce that have edible as well as medicinal values in the villages.
3.1.3.explanation: Paddy, barley, wheat, lesser cereals, sesame, millet, rice, peas, pulses, beans, rye, gram and hemp are common agricultural produce that have edible as well as medicinal values in the villages.

3.1.3.question: _______  appeared from his chest, Vaishyas from his thighs and from his feet, Shudras appeared.
3.1.3.explanation: Kshatriyas appeared from his chest, Vaishyas from his thighs and from his feet, Shudras appeared.

3.1.3.question: Thus, from his mouth,  _______  appeared.
3.1.3.explanation: Thus, from his mouth, Brahmins appeared.

3.1.3.question: _______ , barley, wheat, lesser cereals, sesame, millet, rice, peas, pulses, beans, rye, gram and hemp are common agricultural produce that have edible as well as medicinal values in the villages.
3.1.3.explanation: Paddy, barley, wheat, lesser cereals, sesame, millet, rice, peas, pulses, beans, rye, gram and hemp are common agricultural produce that have edible as well as medicinal values in the villages.

3.1.3.question: Kshatriyas appeared from his chest, Vaishyas from his thighs and from his feet,  _______  appeared.
3.1.3.explanation: Kshatriyas appeared from his chest, Vaishyas from his thighs and from his feet, Shudras appeared.

3.1.3.question: With the desire of creating the world,  _______  produced different kinds of human beings from his different organs.
3.1.3.explanation: With the desire of creating the world, Brahma produced different kinds of human beings from his different organs.

3.1.4.question: From his thirteen wives, Dharma produced Kama,  _______ , Niyam, Santosh, Lobha, Shrut, Dand, Naya, Vinay, Bodh, Vyavasaay, Kshema, Sukh and Yash.
answers: Air Force Intelligence Surveillance And Reconnaissance
3.1.4.explanation: From his thirteen wives, Dharma produced Kama, Darpa, Niyam, Santosh, Lobha, Shrut, Dand, Naya, Vinay, Bodh, Vyavasaay, Kshema, Sukh and Yash.

3.1.4.question: _______  married Hinsa and produced a son Anrit and a daughter Nikriti.
answers: Air Force Intelligence Surveillance And Reconnaissance
3.1.4.explanation: Darpa married Hinsa and produced a son Anrit and a daughter Nikriti.

3.1.4.question: Anrit and Nikriti got married and produced Bhaya and Narak and their wives  _______  and Vedana.
3.1.4.explanation: Anrit and Nikriti got married and produced Bhaya and Narak and their wives Maya and Vedana.

3.1.4.question: _______  produced Mrityu, the destroyer of all the creatures in the world.
3.1.4.explanation: Maya produced Mrityu, the destroyer of all the creatures in the world.

3.1.4.question: From his thirteen wives,  _______  produced Kama, Darpa, Niyam, Santosh, Lobha, Shrut, Dand, Naya, Vinay, Bodh, Vyavasaay, Kshema, Sukh and Yash.
3.1.4.explanation: From his thirteen wives, Dharma produced Kama, Darpa, Niyam, Santosh, Lobha, Shrut, Dand, Naya, Vinay, Bodh, Vyavasaay, Kshema, Sukh and Yash.

3.1.4.question: Daksha and Prasooti produced twenty-four daughters, thirteen of which were married to  _______ .
3.1.4.explanation: Daksha and Prasooti produced twenty-four daughters, thirteen of which were married to Dharma.

3.1.5.question: These eleven idols of  _______  have wives like Suvarchala, Usha, Vikeshi, Apara,  _______ a, Swaha, Disha and Rohini.
3.1.5.explanation: These eleven idols of Shiv have wives like Suvarchala, Usha, Vikeshi, Apara, Shiva, Swaha, Disha and Rohini.

3.1.5.question: Brahma addressed the boy with names like Rudra, Bhava,  _______ , Ibhaan, Pashupati, Bheema, Ugra and Mahadev.
3.1.5.explanation: Brahma addressed the boy with names like Rudra, Bhava, Shiv, Ibhaan, Pashupati, Bheema, Ugra and Mahadev.

3.1.5.question: Since then, all these things idolise  _______ .
3.1.5.explanation: Since then, all these things idolise Shiv.

3.1.5.question: Parvati too got married to  _______ .
3.1.5.explanation: Parvati too got married to Shiv.

3.1.5.question: Brahma also fixed Surya, water, earth, air, fire, sky, Dikshit (graduate scholar)  _______  and the Moon His abode.
3.1.5.explanation: Brahma also fixed Surya, water, earth, air, fire, sky, Dikshit (graduate scholar) Brahmin and the Moon His abode.

3.1.7.question: I grant you a fixed position that is far above the Sun, the  _______ , the planets, constellations, Saptarishis and all the gods who fly about in divine aircraft.
3.1.7.explanation: I grant you a fixed position that is far above the Sun, the Moon, the planets, constellations, Saptarishis and all the gods who fly about in divine aircraft.

3.1.7.question: His penance is increasing like a waxing  _______ .
3.1.7.explanation: His penance is increasing like a waxing Moon.

3.1.8.question: Manu had sons- Puru,  _______ , Shatadyumna, Tapasvi, Satyavaan, Suchi, Agnishtome, Atiraatra, Sudyumna and Abhimanyu.
3.1.8.explanation: Manu had sons- Puru, Kuru, Shatadyumna, Tapasvi, Satyavaan, Suchi, Agnishtome, Atiraatra, Sudyumna and Abhimanyu.

3.1.8.question: _______  had sons- Anga, Suman, Khyaati, Kratu, Angira and Shivi.
3.1.8.explanation: Kuru had sons- Anga, Suman, Khyaati, Kratu, Angira and Shivi.

3.1.9.question: At the end of their penance, Shri Hari appeared before them radiating with blue light like a freshly bloomed blue  _______ .
3.1.9.explanation: At the end of their penance, Shri Hari appeared before them radiating with blue light like a freshly bloomed blue lotus.

3.1.10.question: Ten of them were married to Dharma, thirteen to Kashyap, twenty- seven to  _______ , four to Arishtnemi and two to Angira and Krishasva each.
3.1.10.explanation: Ten of them were married to Dharma, thirteen to Kashyap, twenty- seven to Soma, four to Arishtnemi and two to Angira and Krishasva each.

3.1.10.question: Thus, coerced by  _______ , Prachetas dropped their angry stance and accepted Marisha as their wife.
3.1.10.explanation: Thus, coerced by Soma, Prachetas dropped their angry stance and accepted Marisha as their wife.

3.1.10.question: Names of the eight Vasus were Aap, Dhruv,  _______ , Dharma, Anil, Anal, Pratyush and Prabhas.
3.1.10.explanation: Names of the eight Vasus were Aap, Dhruv, Soma, Dharma, Anil, Anal, Pratyush and Prabhas.

3.1.10.question: Seeing that  _______ , the king of the trees approached Prachetas and requested- 'O kings!
3.1.10.explanation: Seeing that Soma, the king of the trees approached Prachetas and requested- 'O kings!

3.1.10.question: The trees will present you that same girl as your wife", said  _______ .
3.1.10.explanation: The trees will present you that same girl as your wife", said Soma.

3.1.10.question: The twenty-seven wives of  _______  gave birth to many talented sons.
3.1.10.explanation: The twenty-seven wives of Soma gave birth to many talented sons.

3.1.10.question: Varcha was the son of  _______ .
3.1.10.explanation: Varcha was the son of Soma.

3.1.10.question: Ten of them were married to  _______ , thirteen to Kashyap, twenty- seven to Soma, four to Arishtnemi and two to Angira and Krishasva each.
3.1.10.explanation: Ten of them were married to Dharma, thirteen to Kashyap, twenty- seven to Soma, four to Arishtnemi and two to Angira and Krishasva each.

3.1.10.question: Arundhati, Vasu, Yaami, Lambaa, Bhaanu, Marutvati, Sankalpa, Muhurta, Saadhya and Vishwa were the wives of  _______ .
3.1.10.explanation: Arundhati, Vasu, Yaami, Lambaa, Bhaanu, Marutvati, Sankalpa, Muhurta, Saadhya and Vishwa were the wives of Dharma.

3.1.10.question: Names of the eight Vasus were Aap, Dhruv, Soma,  _______ , Anil, Anal, Pratyush and Prabhas.
3.1.10.explanation: Names of the eight Vasus were Aap, Dhruv, Soma, Dharma, Anil, Anal, Pratyush and Prabhas.

3.1.10.question: Dravin, Huta, Ityavar, Shishir, Pran and Varun were the sons of  _______ .
3.1.10.explanation: Dravin, Huta, Ityavar, Shishir, Pran and Varun were the sons of Dharma.

3.1.10.question: He got ten of those women married to  _______ .
3.1.10.explanation: He got ten of those women married to Dharma.

3.1.10.question: Names of the eight Vasus were Aap, Dhruv, Soma, Dharma,  _______ , Anal, Pratyush and Prabhas.
3.1.10.explanation: Names of the eight Vasus were Aap, Dhruv, Soma, Dharma, Anil, Anal, Pratyush and Prabhas.

3.1.10.question: Manojav and Avigyaatgati were the sons of  _______ .
3.1.10.explanation: Manojav and Avigyaatgati were the sons of Anil.

3.1.11.question: He had driven the gods out of  _______  and used to receive the oblations offered to Surya, Vayu, Agni, Varun, Chandrama, Kuber, Yamaraaj etc.
3.1.11.explanation: He had driven the gods out of heaven and used to receive the oblations offered to Surya, Vayu, Agni, Varun, Chandrama, Kuber, Yamaraaj etc.

3.1.11.question: Prahlad replied- "Lord Vishnu is he who is contemplated about by the  _______ .
3.1.11.explanation: Prahlad replied- "Lord Vishnu is he who is contemplated about by the Yogis.

3.1.12.question: You ask me what have I to do with He, who helps all the human beings to attain these four goals-  _______ , Arth, Kama and Moksha.
3.1.12.explanation: You ask me what have I to do with He, who helps all the human beings to attain these four goals- Dharma, Arth, Kama and Moksha.

3.1.12.question: You should also take refuge of your  _______  and stop praising his opponent.
3.1.12.explanation: You should also take refuge of your father and stop praising his opponent.

3.1.12.question: I also do not doubt regarding my  _______ ’s reverence and greatness.
3.1.12.explanation: I also do not doubt regarding my father’s reverence and greatness.

3.1.12.question: _______  is revered and even greater than the teachers."
3.1.12.explanation: Father is revered and even greater than the teachers."

3.1.12.question: The whole world is dependent on your  _______ .
3.1.12.explanation: The whole world is dependent on your father.

3.1.12.question: I know the prowess of my  _______ .
3.1.12.explanation: I know the prowess of my father.

3.1.13.question: Hence all those who wish for  _______  must strive to accumulate pious actions.
3.1.13.explanation: Hence all those who wish for splendour must strive to accumulate pious actions.

3.1.14.question: As soon as Prahlad began to pray the  _______ , his Naagpaash broke and the mountains that the demons had thrown into the sea also lightened up causing great relief for Prahlad.
3.1.14.explanation: As soon as Prahlad began to pray the Lord, his Naagpaash broke and the mountains that the demons had thrown into the sea also lightened up causing great relief for Prahlad.

3.1.14.question: As soon as he hit the pillar, it broke and  _______  appeared from it in Narsimha incarnation.
3.1.14.explanation: As soon as he hit the pillar, it broke and Lord appeared from it in Narsimha incarnation.

3.1.15.question: The prowessive  _______  was sent to the nether world by Vaaman incarnation of Lord.
3.1.15.explanation: The prowessive Bali was sent to the nether world by Vaaman incarnation of Lord.

3.1.15.question: _______  had one hundred sons among whom Baanasur was the eldest.
3.1.15.explanation: Bali had one hundred sons among whom Baanasur was the eldest.

3.1.15.explanation: Virochan in his turn had Bali as his son.

3.1.15.question: Garud became the vehicle of  _______  Vishnu while Arun became the charioteer of the Sun.
3.1.15.explanation: Garud became the vehicle of Lord Vishnu while Arun became the charioteer of the Sun.

3.1.15.question: The prowessive Bali was sent to the nether world by Vaaman incarnation of  _______ .
3.1.15.explanation: The prowessive Bali was sent to the nether world by Vaaman incarnation of Lord.

3.1.16.explanation: He also appointed Kuber as the ruler of the kings, Varun as the ruler of the water bodies, Vishnu as the ruler of Adityas and Agni as the ruler of Vasus.

3.1.16.explanation: Thus, Brahma appointed Chandrama as the ruler of all the Nakshatras, planets, Brahmins, vegetation, Yagya, penance etc.

3.2.1.explanation: Since then, this landmass that stretches from the snowy peaks of Himalayas to the splashing Indian Ocean is known as Bharatvarsha.

3.2.3.explanation: It has seven native mountains- Mahendra, Malay, Sahaya, Shuktimaan, Riksha, Vindhya and Paariyaatra.

3.2.3.explanation: In the mid part of Bharat, live population of Brahmins, Kshatriyas, Vaishyas and Shudras who pass their lives engage in works ascribed to their respective class.

3.2.3.explanation: In Bharatvarsha, sages observe penance to attain better life in another world, people organise Yagyas and offer donations to the Brahmins respectfully.

3.2.3.question: Rivers in India- From the  _______  rise Shatudri (Sutlej) and Chandrabhaaga rivers.
3.2.3.explanation: Rivers in India- From the Himalayas rise Shatudri (Sutlej) and Chandrabhaaga rivers.

3.2.3.question: The landmass that is present between  _______  and the ocean is known as Bharat.
3.2.3.explanation: The landmass that is present between Himalayas and the ocean is known as Bharat.

3.2.4.question: Its ruler Meghatithi had seven sons- Shaanthaya, Shishir, Sukhodaya, Anand,  _______ , Kshemak and Dhruv.
3.2.4.explanation: Its ruler Meghatithi had seven sons- Shaanthaya, Shishir, Sukhodaya, Anand, Shiva, Kshemak and Dhruv.

3.2.5.question: When he returned to  _______ , he told the people there that the nether world was more beautiful than  _______ .
3.2.5.explanation: When he returned to heaven, he told the people there that the nether world was more beautiful than heaven.

3.2.5.question: When he returned to  _______ , he told the people there that the nether world was more beautiful than  _______ .
3.2.5.explanation: When he returned to heaven, he told the people there that the nether world was more beautiful than heaven.

3.2.7.explanation: At a height of 2,00,000 Yojans above, the sphere of stars is Buddh (Mercury) and 2,00,000 Yojans above it is Shukra (Venus).

3.2.8.question: Flowing through the sphere of the  _______ , the Ganges falls on Mount Meru and flows in every direction to sanctify the entire world.
3.2.8.explanation: Flowing through the sphere of the Moon, the Ganges falls on Mount Meru and flows in every direction to sanctify the entire world.

3.2.8.explanation: During winter season, this water released by the Moon falls on earth as snow and dew.

3.2.8.explanation: The water that is evaporated by the Sun also nourishes the Moon.

3.2.8.explanation: But the Moon itself does not consume that water.

3.2.8.question: Flowing through the sphere of the Moon, the  _______  falls on Mount Meru and flows in every direction to sanctify the entire world.
3.2.8.explanation: Flowing through the sphere of the Moon, the Ganges falls on Mount Meru and flows in every direction to sanctify the entire world.

3.2.8.question: The sacred  _______  which is the destroyer of every sin also rises from the abode of Lord Vishnu.
3.2.8.explanation: The sacred Ganges which is the destroyer of every sin also rises from the abode of Lord Vishnu.

3.2.8.question: Offering of oblations in the waters of  _______  satiates dead ancestors for one hundred years.
3.2.8.explanation: Offering of oblations in the waters of Ganges satiates dead ancestors for one hundred years.

3.2.8.explanation: Bathing in the water of the Ganges destroys all the sins.

3.2.8.question: Dhruv bears the  _______  on his head.
3.2.8.explanation: Dhruv bears the Ganges on his head.

3.2.8.question: Then travelling through Aries,  _______  and Gemini, the Sun enters Cancer to begin its southward journey.
3.2.8.explanation: Then travelling through Aries, Taurus and Gemini, the Sun enters Cancer to begin its southward journey.

3.2.8.question: Then travelling through Aries, Taurus and  _______ , the Sun enters Cancer to begin its southward journey.
3.2.8.explanation: Then travelling through Aries, Taurus and Gemini, the Sun enters Cancer to begin its southward journey.

3.2.8.question: The recitation of hymns by learned  _______  during dusk twilight helps the Sun regain his lost radiance.
3.2.8.explanation: The recitation of hymns by learned Brahmins during dusk twilight helps the Sun regain his lost radiance.

3.2.8.explanation: It is also mandatory for the Brahmins to perform evening worship.

3.2.8.question: Travelling through  _______  and Pisces, it reaches the equator which is at the centre of the earth.
3.2.8.explanation: Travelling through Aquarius and Pisces, it reaches the equator which is at the centre of the earth.

3.2.8.question: Then travelling through  _______ , Taurus and Gemini, the Sun enters Cancer to begin its southward journey.
3.2.8.explanation: Then travelling through Aries, Taurus and Gemini, the Sun enters Cancer to begin its southward journey.

3.2.8.question: Sun’s rays that reach  _______ loka return back rendered ineffective by the radiance of  _______ .
3.2.8.explanation: Sun’s rays that reach Brahmaloka return back rendered ineffective by the radiance of Brahma.

3.2.8.question: Travelling through Aquarius and  _______ , it reaches the equator which is at the centre of the earth.
3.2.8.explanation: Travelling through Aquarius and Pisces, it reaches the equator which is at the centre of the earth.

3.2.8.question: Then travelling through Aries, Taurus and Gemini, the Sun enters  _______  to begin its southward journey.
3.2.8.explanation: Then travelling through Aries, Taurus and Gemini, the Sun enters Cancer to begin its southward journey.
