3.2.10.question: In the noontime, Yajurveda prays the  _______  whereas in the evening, Shrutis of Samaveda pray the  _______ .
3.2.10.explanation: In the noontime, Yajurveda prays the Sun whereas in the evening, Shrutis of Samaveda pray the Sun.

3.2.10.question: In the noontime, Yajurveda prays the  _______  whereas in the evening, Shrutis of Samaveda pray the  _______ .
3.2.10.explanation: In the noontime, Yajurveda prays the Sun whereas in the evening, Shrutis of Samaveda pray the Sun.

3.2.10.question: These together stay within the  _______  and provide it with energy necessary to sustain the world.
3.2.10.explanation: These together stay within the Sun and provide it with energy necessary to sustain the world.

3.2.10.question: The water that the  _______  draws from earth is returned to the earth in the form of rains.
3.2.10.explanation: The water that the Sun draws from earth is returned to the earth in the form of rains.

3.2.10.question: One of the  _______ ’s rays named Sushumna nourishes the Moon during its brighter phase.
3.2.10.explanation: One of the Sun’s rays named Sushumna nourishes the Moon during its brighter phase.

3.2.10.question: Energies of the trinity stays within the  _______  in synergetic form.
3.2.10.explanation: Energies of the trinity stays within the Sun in synergetic form.

3.2.10.question: Thus, the  _______  satiates the gods and the deceased ancestors.
3.2.10.explanation: Thus, the Sun satiates the gods and the deceased ancestors.

3.2.10.question: Hence the  _______  glows brilliantly and destroys the darkness.
3.2.10.explanation: Hence the Sun glows brilliantly and destroys the darkness.

3.2.10.question: In the morning, Rigveda prays the  _______  with its Shrutis.
3.2.10.explanation: In the morning, Rigveda prays the Sun with its Shrutis.

3.2.10.question: Thus, Lord Vishnu always energises the  _______ .
3.2.10.explanation: Thus, Lord Vishnu always energises the Sun.

3.2.10.question: Then during the darker phase, the gods drink the phases of the  _______ , which are in fact, ambrosia accumulated during the brighter phase.
3.2.10.explanation: Then during the darker phase, the gods drink the phases of the Moon, which are in fact, ambrosia accumulated during the brighter phase.

3.2.10.question: When two days are left for the completion of darker phase, Pitragana drink the remaining two phases of the  _______ .
3.2.10.explanation: When two days are left for the completion of darker phase, Pitragana drink the remaining two phases of the Moon.

3.2.10.question: One of the Sun’s rays named Sushumna nourishes the  _______  during its brighter phase.
3.2.10.explanation: One of the Sun’s rays named Sushumna nourishes the Moon during its brighter phase.

3.2.10.question: Omnipotent para-power of Lord Vishnu is nothing but the three  _______ .
3.2.10.explanation: Omnipotent para-power of Lord Vishnu is nothing but the three Vedas.

3.2.10.question: Their trinity too represents the three  _______ .
3.2.10.explanation: Their trinity too represents the three Vedas.

3.2.11.question: With his rays, the Sun nourishes the  _______ , which loses its strength because of drinking of its ambrosia by the gods.
3.2.11.explanation: With his rays, the Sun nourishes the Moon, which loses its strength because of drinking of its ambrosia by the gods.

3.2.11.question: When the gods brought even the last drop of nectar from the  _______ , it enters the Sun’s sphere.
3.2.11.explanation: When the gods brought even the last drop of nectar from the Moon, it enters the Sun’s sphere.

3.2.11.question: Thus,  _______  sates the gods during the brighter phase and the Pitragana during darker phase.
3.2.11.explanation: Thus, Moon sates the gods during the brighter phase and the Pitragana during darker phase.

3.2.11.question: That day, the  _______  first enters the water then the foliage of the trees, creepers etc.
3.2.11.explanation: That day, the Moon first enters the water then the foliage of the trees, creepers etc.

3.2.11.question: During its entire journey, the  _______  passes through all the twenty-seven Nakshatras.
3.2.11.explanation: During its entire journey, the Moon passes through all the twenty-seven Nakshatras.

3.2.11.question: On the day of Amavasya, Pitragana drink the nectar from the  _______  and feel sated.
3.2.11.explanation: On the day of Amavasya, Pitragana drink the nectar from the Moon and feel sated.

3.2.11.question: The  _______  also showers its nectar on the trees, creepers and other vegetation.
3.2.11.explanation: The Moon also showers its nectar on the trees, creepers and other vegetation.

3.2.11.question: These horses haul the  _______ ’s chariot for a complete Kalpa.
3.2.11.explanation: These horses haul the Moon’s chariot for a complete Kalpa.

3.2.11.question: The  _______  rides a chariot with three wheels.
3.2.11.explanation: The Moon rides a chariot with three wheels.

3.2.11.question: Buddha (Mercury) is the son of the  _______ .
3.2.11.explanation: Buddha (Mercury) is the son of the Moon.

3.2.11.question: With his rays, the  _______  nourishes the Moon, which loses its strength because of drinking of its ambrosia by the gods.
3.2.11.explanation: With his rays, the Sun nourishes the Moon, which loses its strength because of drinking of its ambrosia by the gods.

3.2.11.question: When the gods brought even the last drop of nectar from the Moon, it enters the  _______ ’s sphere.
3.2.11.explanation: When the gods brought even the last drop of nectar from the Moon, it enters the Sun’s sphere.

3.2.11.question: and ultimately enters the  _______ ’s sphere.
3.2.11.explanation: and ultimately enters the Sun’s sphere.

3.2.11.question: Mangal ( _______ ) rides a golden chariot, which is born from the fire.
3.2.11.explanation: Mangal (Mars) rides a golden chariot, which is born from the fire.

3.2.11.question: That is why, anybody who cuts trees or even plucks a leaf commits crime equal to killing of  _______ .
3.2.11.explanation: That is why, anybody who cuts trees or even plucks a leaf commits crime equal to killing of Brahmin.

3.2.12.question: The king at once got down from the palanquin and fell at Jadabharat’s feet and said- "O  _______ !
3.2.12.explanation: The king at once got down from the palanquin and fell at Jadabharat’s feet and said- "O Brahmin!

3.2.12.question: In his next birth, Bharat was born in a cultured  _______  family.
3.2.12.explanation: In his next birth, Bharat was born in a cultured Brahmin family.

3.2.12.question: What did he do in his next birth as a  _______ ?"
3.2.12.explanation: What did he do in his next birth as a Brahmin?"

3.2.12.question: There he used to recite the names of  _______  and collect various materials for His worship.
3.2.12.explanation: There he used to recite the names of God and collect various materials for His worship.

3.2.12.question: He was born in a pious land and always contemplated on  _______ .
3.2.12.explanation: He was born in a pious land and always contemplated on God.

3.2.12.question: Parashar says- King Bharat always contemplated on  _______ .
3.2.12.explanation: Parashar says- King Bharat always contemplated on God.

3.2.12.question: That roar frightened the  _______  so much that she jumped across the river to save her life.
3.2.12.explanation: That roar frightened the doe so much that she jumped across the river to save her life.

3.2.12.question: One day while he was taking bath in the river, a  _______  arrived at the opposite bank.
3.2.12.explanation: One day while he was taking bath in the river, a doe arrived at the opposite bank.

3.2.12.question: On the other hand, the  _______  also could not bear the pain and died.
3.2.12.explanation: On the other hand, the doe also could not bear the pain and died.

3.2.13.question: For those who want to attain  _______ , action in the form of forming Yagya is the goal.
3.2.13.explanation: For those who want to attain heaven, action in the form of forming Yagya is the goal.

3.2.13.question: A  _______  must contemplate on that transcendental soul because it is the only means to merge with that supreme soul."
3.2.13.explanation: A Yogi must contemplate on that transcendental soul because it is the only means to merge with that supreme soul."

3.2.13.question: A Yogi must contemplate on that transcendental  _______  because it is the only means to merge with that supreme  _______ ."
3.2.13.explanation: A Yogi must contemplate on that transcendental soul because it is the only means to merge with that supreme soul."

3.2.13.question: A Yogi must contemplate on that transcendental  _______  because it is the only means to merge with that supreme  _______ ."
3.2.13.explanation: A Yogi must contemplate on that transcendental soul because it is the only means to merge with that supreme soul."

3.2.13.question: Its manifestation in different life forms is temporary and identification of  _______  with living beings is baseless.
3.2.13.explanation: Its manifestation in different life forms is temporary and identification of soul with living beings is baseless.

3.2.13.question: The  _______  is one, all pervasive, impartial, pure, intangible and transcendental.
3.2.13.explanation: The soul is one, all pervasive, impartial, pure, intangible and transcendental.

3.2.13.question: _______  which is present in scores of living beings is basically single and same.
3.2.13.explanation: Soul which is present in scores of living beings is basically single and same.

3.2.13.question: And consideration of  _______  separate from supreme  _______  is also futile.
3.2.13.explanation: And consideration of soul separate from supreme soul is also futile.

3.2.13.question: And consideration of  _______  separate from supreme  _______  is also futile.
3.2.13.explanation: And consideration of soul separate from supreme soul is also futile.

3.2.13.question: _______  of ignorance then parts with him.
3.2.13.explanation: Veil of ignorance then parts with him.

3.2.15.question: Like the  _______  who attains salvation because of impartial view, you also develop an impartial view regarding soul.
3.2.15.explanation: Like the Brahmin who attains salvation because of impartial view, you also develop an impartial view regarding soul.

3.3.1.question: Four  _______  Swarochish, Uttam, Taamas and Raivat are said to be the direct descendant of King Priyavrat.
3.3.1.explanation: Four Manus Swarochish, Uttam, Taamas and Raivat are said to be the direct descendant of King Priyavrat.

3.3.1.question: Now I wish to hear the description of all the Manvantaras and the  _______  who ruled those Manvantaras."
3.3.1.explanation: Now I wish to hear the description of all the Manvantaras and the Manus who ruled those Manvantaras."

3.3.1.question: After him five more  _______  occurred namely Swarochish, Uttam, Taamas, Raivat and Chaakshush.
3.3.1.explanation: After him five more Manus occurred namely Swarochish, Uttam, Taamas, Raivat and Chaakshush.

3.3.1.question: All these  _______  had occurred during the previous ages.
3.3.1.explanation: All these Manus had occurred during the previous ages.

3.3.1.question: The present Manu, Vaivasvat is the son of the  _______  and this Manvantara is seventh."
3.3.1.explanation: The present Manu, Vaivasvat is the son of the Sun and this Manvantara is seventh."

3.3.1.question: During the present Manvantara, the  _______ ’s brilliant son Shraaddhdev is Manu.
3.3.1.explanation: During the present Manvantara, the Sun’s brilliant son Shraaddhdev is Manu.

3.3.3.question: Parashar says- During each Dwaparyug, in every Kalpa, Lord Vishnu takes incarnation as Vedavyasa and effects the division of  _______  for the benefit of human beings.
3.3.3.explanation: Parashar says- During each Dwaparyug, in every Kalpa, Lord Vishnu takes incarnation as Vedavyasa and effects the division of Vedas for the benefit of human beings.

3.3.3.question: During every Dwaparyug of the present Vaivasvat Manvantara, different Vyasas have divided the  _______  twenty-eight times.
3.3.3.explanation: During every Dwaparyug of the present Vaivasvat Manvantara, different Vyasas have divided the Vedas twenty-eight times.

3.3.3.question: How did God divide  _______  in the form of Vedavyasa during different Yugas?"
3.3.3.explanation: How did God divide Vedas in the form of Vedavyasa during different Yugas?"

3.3.3.question: During the first Dwapar, Brahma himself had divided the  _______ .
3.3.3.explanation: During the first Dwapar, Brahma himself had divided the Vedas.

3.3.5.question: At that time, all the sages together constituted a rule that whoever did not join their group within seven days on Mahameru would be held as a sinner equal to killing a  _______ .
3.3.5.explanation: At that time, all the sages together constituted a rule that whoever did not join their group within seven days on Mahameru would be held as a sinner equal to killing a Brahmin.

3.3.5.question: Holding his breath, Yagyavalkya then started the worship of the  _______  with a desire to regain Yajurveda.
3.3.5.explanation: Holding his breath, Yagyavalkya then started the worship of the Sun with a desire to regain Yajurveda.

3.3.7.question: Yamaraaj is  _______  of all the human beings except Vaishnavas.
3.3.7.explanation: Yamaraaj is lord of all the human beings except Vaishnavas.

3.3.7.question: Yamaraaj is lord of all the human beings except  _______ .
3.3.7.explanation: Yamaraaj is lord of all the human beings except Vaishnavas.

3.3.8.question: A  _______  may take the occupation of a Vaishya during emergency but none of them should ever take to the occupation of Shudra.
3.3.8.explanation: A Kshatriya may take the occupation of a Vaishya during emergency but none of them should ever take to the occupation of Shudra.

3.3.8.question: In the time of emergency, a Brahmin may shift to the occupations meant for  _______  and Vaishya.
3.3.8.explanation: In the time of emergency, a Brahmin may shift to the occupations meant for Kshatriya and Vaishya.

3.3.8.question: A  _______  must organise Yagyas and study scriptures.
3.3.8.explanation: A Kshatriya must organise Yagyas and study scriptures.

3.3.8.question: Those who shun activities like criticising others, backbiting, womanising, stealing others’ wealth and violence; those who do not torture others and are always ready to serve the gods,  _______  and teachers are able to please Lord Vishnu.
3.3.8.explanation: Those who shun activities like criticising others, backbiting, womanising, stealing others’ wealth and violence; those who do not torture others and are always ready to serve the gods, Brahmins and teachers are able to please Lord Vishnu.

3.3.8.question: He should also make donations to  _______  and take weapons in order to protect the earth.
3.3.8.explanation: He should also make donations to Brahmins and take weapons in order to protect the earth.

3.3.8.question: A Kshatriya may take the occupation of a Vaishya during emergency but none of them should ever take to the occupation of  _______ .
3.3.8.explanation: A Kshatriya may take the occupation of a Vaishya during emergency but none of them should ever take to the occupation of Shudra.

3.3.8.question: A  _______  may also make donations and oblations to appease his dead ancestors.
3.3.8.explanation: A Shudra may also make donations and oblations to appease his dead ancestors.

3.3.8.question: Saluting learned people is equal to organising Yagya for a  _______ .
3.3.8.explanation: Saluting learned people is equal to organising Yagya for a Shudra.

3.3.8.question: A  _______  is expected to earn his livelihood through handicrafts.
3.3.8.explanation: A Shudra is expected to earn his livelihood through handicrafts.

3.3.10.question: During this custom, a  _______  couple is fed.
3.3.10.explanation: During this custom, a Brahmin couple is fed.

3.3.10.question: _______  made of barley flour, curd and berries should be offered as oblations.
3.3.10.explanation: Lumps made of barley flour, curd and berries should be offered as oblations.

3.3.11.question: Offering oblations to the  _______ , worship of tutelary god and other deities follows then.
3.3.11.explanation: Offering oblations to the Sun, worship of tutelary god and other deities follows then.

3.3.11.question: _______  is considered the best means to wash hands.
3.3.11.explanation: Soil is considered the best means to wash hands.

3.3.12.question: For Brahmins, it is ten days, for  _______ , it is twelve days, for Vaishyas, it is fifteen days and for Shudras, this period has been fixed for one month.
3.3.12.explanation: For Brahmins, it is ten days, for Kshatriyas, it is twelve days, for Vaishyas, it is fifteen days and for Shudras, this period has been fixed for one month.

3.3.12.question: For  _______ , it is ten days, for Kshatriyas, it is twelve days, for Vaishyas, it is fifteen days and for Shudras, this period has been fixed for one month.
3.3.12.explanation: For Brahmins, it is ten days, for Kshatriyas, it is twelve days, for Vaishyas, it is fifteen days and for Shudras, this period has been fixed for one month.

3.3.12.question: For Brahmins, it is ten days, for Kshatriyas, it is twelve days, for Vaishyas, it is fifteen days and for  _______ , this period has been fixed for one month.
3.3.12.explanation: For Brahmins, it is ten days, for Kshatriyas, it is twelve days, for Vaishyas, it is fifteen days and for Shudras, this period has been fixed for one month.

3.3.12.question: Since that day, Pindadaan (offering sweet balls made of barley flour,  _______  seeds, jaggery and honey) should be done for ten days.
3.3.12.explanation: Since that day, Pindadaan (offering sweet balls made of barley flour, sesame seeds, jaggery and honey) should be done for ten days.

3.3.12.question: _______  of a household is said to be defiled when a birth or death occurs in it.
3.3.12.explanation: Atmosphere of a household is said to be defiled when a birth or death occurs in it.

3.3.12.question: _______  on earth is like an infinite ocean in which birth appears like a bubble and death marks the bursting of that bubble after which it exists no more.
3.3.12.explanation: Life on earth is like an infinite ocean in which birth appears like a bubble and death marks the bursting of that bubble after which it exists no more.

3.3.14.question: AGNAYE KAVYA VAAHAANAYE SWAHAA | SOMAAY PITRAMATE SWAHAA | VAIVASVATAAY SWAAHA || Remaining cereals then should be served with the food to the  _______  and some parts should also be cast on earth and water should be offered on them.
3.3.14.explanation: AGNAYE KAVYA VAAHAANAYE SWAHAA | SOMAAY PITRAMATE SWAHAA | VAIVASVATAAY SWAAHA || Remaining cereals then should be served with the food to the Brahmins and some parts should also be cast on earth and water should be offered on them.

3.3.14.question: While making oblations to the dead ancestors, one should feed his near and dear ones as well as learned  _______  who respect their parents.
3.3.14.explanation: While making oblations to the dead ancestors, one should feed his near and dear ones as well as learned Brahmins who respect their parents.

3.3.14.question: After the feast, the  _______  should be seen off with respect.
3.3.14.explanation: After the feast, the Brahmins should be seen off with respect.

3.3.15.question: Milk of camel, sheep,  _______  and buffalo should not be used in oblations.
3.3.15.explanation: Milk of camel, sheep, doe and buffalo should not be used in oblations.

3.3.15.question: Milk of camel, sheep, doe and  _______  should not be used in oblations.
3.3.15.explanation: Milk of camel, sheep, doe and buffalo should not be used in oblations.

3.3.15.question: Offering of oblation in Gaya (a place of pilgrimage in  _______ ) is said to salve all the ancestors.
3.3.15.explanation: Offering of oblation in Gaya (a place of pilgrimage in Bihar) is said to salve all the ancestors.

3.3.15.question: Barley, wheat, rice,  _______  seeds, peas, and mustard are the common cereals and grains used in oblations.
3.3.15.explanation: Barley, wheat, rice, sesame seeds, peas, and mustard are the common cereals and grains used in oblations.

3.3.16.question: _______ , Sama and Yajurveda are like the clothes of Hindu society.
3.3.16.explanation: Rig, Sama and Yajurveda are like the clothes of Hindu society.

3.3.16.question: The illusion will influence the demons to violate the path shown by the  _______ .
3.3.16.explanation: The illusion will influence the demons to violate the path shown by the Vedas.

3.3.17.question: Mayamoha confused them further saying- "O demons, if you long for salvation or a place in the  _______ , give up sacrificing animals and attain enlightenment.
3.3.17.explanation: Mayamoha confused them further saying- "O demons, if you long for salvation or a place in the heaven, give up sacrificing animals and attain enlightenment.

3.3.17.question: If an animal which is sacrificed in Yagya attains  _______ , performer of Yagya would have killed his own father."
3.3.17.explanation: If an animal which is sacrificed in Yagya attains heaven, performer of Yagya would have killed his own father."

3.3.17.question: Ultimately, many demons were killed whereas those who remained came to be known as naked because they no longer followed the teachings of  _______ .
3.3.17.explanation: Ultimately, many demons were killed whereas those who remained came to be known as naked because they no longer followed the teachings of Vedas.

3.3.17.question: Thus with these witty talks, Mayamoha deviated the demons from the righteous path because of which they lost interest in  _______ .
3.3.17.explanation: Thus with these witty talks, Mayamoha deviated the demons from the righteous path because of which they lost interest in Vedas.

3.3.17.question: Thus, anybody who does not practice the teachings of  _______  in his life is known as naked.
3.3.17.explanation: Thus, anybody who does not practice the teachings of Vedas in his life is known as naked.

3.3.17.question: On the full moon day in the month of Kartik when the king and queen came out of the Ganges after taking bath, they happened to sight an imposter  _______  who was coming from the opposite direction.
3.3.17.explanation: On the full moon day in the month of Kartik when the king and queen came out of the Ganges after taking bath, they happened to sight an imposter Brahmin who was coming from the opposite direction.

3.3.17.question: The  _______  was a friend of the king’s teacher.
3.3.17.explanation: The Brahmin was a friend of the king’s teacher.

3.3.17.question: So, the king treated the  _______  with respect.
3.3.17.explanation: So, the king treated the Brahmin with respect.

3.3.17.question: Since the king had committed the sin of talking to an imposter during his penance the king had committed the sin of talking to an imposter during his penance, he took birth in a dog form whereas  _______  Shaivya took birth as the daughter of a Kashi king.
3.3.17.explanation: Since the king had committed the sin of talking to an imposter during his penance the king had committed the sin of talking to an imposter during his penance, he took birth in a dog form whereas queen Shaivya took birth as the daughter of a Kashi king.

3.3.17.question: On the full moon day in the month of Kartik when the king and  _______  came out of the Ganges after taking bath, they happened to sight an imposter Brahmin who was coming from the opposite direction.
3.3.17.explanation: On the full moon day in the month of Kartik when the king and queen came out of the Ganges after taking bath, they happened to sight an imposter Brahmin who was coming from the opposite direction.

3.3.17.question: On their return to the palace the king and the  _______  worshipped Lord Vishnu with proper rituals.
3.3.17.explanation: On their return to the palace the king and the queen worshipped Lord Vishnu with proper rituals.

3.3.17.question: The king and the  _______  had worshipped Lord Vishnu observing severe penance.
3.3.17.explanation: The king and the queen had worshipped Lord Vishnu observing severe penance.

3.3.17.question: His  _______  Shaivya was a righteous and religious woman.
3.3.17.explanation: His queen Shaivya was a righteous and religious woman.

3.3.17.question: On the full moon day in the month of  _______  when the king and queen came out of the Ganges after taking bath, they happened to sight an imposter Brahmin who was coming from the opposite direction.
3.3.17.explanation: On the full moon day in the month of Kartik when the king and queen came out of the Ganges after taking bath, they happened to sight an imposter Brahmin who was coming from the opposite direction.

3.3.17.question: On the full moon day in the month of Kartik when the king and queen came out of the  _______  after taking bath, they happened to sight an imposter Brahmin who was coming from the opposite direction.
3.3.17.explanation: On the full moon day in the month of Kartik when the king and queen came out of the Ganges after taking bath, they happened to sight an imposter Brahmin who was coming from the opposite direction.

3.4.3.question: Pleased by the action of Narmada, the  _______  blessed her with a boon that whoever remembered her would have no fear of snake venom and Purukutsa that he would have an immortal son.
3.4.3.explanation: Pleased by the action of Narmada, the Nagas blessed her with a boon that whoever remembered her would have no fear of snake venom and Purukutsa that he would have an immortal son.

3.4.3.question: Once upon a time Gandharvas of collective name Mauneya defeated the  _______  and snatched all their wealth and powers.
3.4.3.explanation: Once upon a time Gandharvas of collective name Mauneya defeated the Nagas and snatched all their wealth and powers.

3.4.3.question: The  _______  prayed Lord Vishnu to rescue them.
3.4.3.explanation: The Nagas prayed Lord Vishnu to rescue them.

3.4.3.question: Acting as per his oath, Sagar destroyed Haihaya  _______  whereas Shak  _______  got their heads shaven out of fear.
3.4.3.explanation: Acting as per his oath, Sagar destroyed Haihaya Kshatriyas whereas Shak Kshatriyas got their heads shaven out of fear.

3.4.3.question: Acting as per his oath, Sagar destroyed Haihaya  _______  whereas Shak  _______  got their heads shaven out of fear.
3.4.3.explanation: Acting as per his oath, Sagar destroyed Haihaya Kshatriyas whereas Shak Kshatriyas got their heads shaven out of fear.

3.4.3.question: Sagar then and there took an oath to exterminate the  _______  who had been the cause of his father’s death.
3.4.3.explanation: Sagar then and there took an oath to exterminate the Kshatriyas who had been the cause of his father’s death.

3.4.3.question: Since those  _______  had given up their religion, hence Brahmins boycotted them.
3.4.3.explanation: Since those Kshatriyas had given up their religion, hence Brahmins boycotted them.

3.4.3.question: Pleased by his selfless service, sage Vishwamitra sent Trishanku to the  _______  with his ephemeral body.
3.4.3.explanation: Pleased by his selfless service, sage Vishwamitra sent Trishanku to the heaven with his ephemeral body.

3.4.5.question: On the other hand, at end of Yagya when the gods appeared to accept their due share from the offerings, the sages prayed them to grant Nimi some  _______ .
3.4.5.explanation: On the other hand, at end of Yagya when the gods appeared to accept their due share from the offerings, the sages prayed them to grant Nimi some boon.

3.4.5.question: Nimi however sought nothing in  _______  but expressed his desire to stay in eyes of the people forever.
3.4.5.explanation: Nimi however sought nothing in boon but expressed his desire to stay in eyes of the people forever.

3.4.5.question: In order to save the kingdom from anarchy, the sages churned the dead body of Nimi with a stick of  _______  tree and produced a son.
3.4.5.explanation: In order to save the kingdom from anarchy, the sages churned the dead body of Nimi with a stick of Bombax tree and produced a son.

3.4.6.question: Afterwards blinded by his powers, Chandrama kidnapped  _______ , the wife of Brihaspati.
3.4.6.explanation: Afterwards blinded by his powers, Chandrama kidnapped Tara, the wife of Brihaspati.

3.4.6.question: To settle the matter, Brahma asked  _______  about the paternity of the child.
3.4.6.explanation: To settle the matter, Brahma asked Tara about the paternity of the child.

3.4.6.question: Feeling shy,  _______  revealed that Chandrama was the father of the child.
3.4.6.explanation: Feeling shy, Tara revealed that Chandrama was the father of the child.

3.4.6.question: Seeing her condition Brihaspati instigated  _______  to abort the baby.
3.4.6.explanation: Seeing her condition Brihaspati instigated Tara to abort the baby.

3.4.6.question: _______  aborted the baby amidst some shrubs but it did not die.
3.4.6.explanation: Tara aborted the baby amidst some shrubs but it did not die.

3.4.6.question: By that time  _______  had conceived a child.
3.4.6.explanation: By that time Tara had conceived a child.

3.4.9.question: All the five hundred sons of Raji approached Indra and requested him to give them the rule of  _______  but Indra refused plainly.
3.4.9.explanation: All the five hundred sons of Raji approached Indra and requested him to give them the rule of heaven but Indra refused plainly.

3.4.9.question: After their victory, Indra bowed before King Raji and expressed his desire to present him with the kingdom of  _______ .
3.4.9.explanation: After their victory, Indra bowed before King Raji and expressed his desire to present him with the kingdom of heaven.

3.4.9.question: After much time had passed, Indra approached Brihaspati and prayed him to help him regain the rule of  _______ .
3.4.9.explanation: After much time had passed, Indra approached Brihaspati and prayed him to help him regain the rule of heaven.

3.4.9.question: After the demise of Raji, Narad instigated his sons to acquire the rule of  _______ .
3.4.9.explanation: After the demise of Raji, Narad instigated his sons to acquire the rule of heaven.

3.5.1.question: Their lineage grew as follows  _______ - Sanskriti- Gurupreeti and Rantidev.
3.5.1.explanation: Their lineage grew as follows Nara- Sanskriti- Gurupreeti and Rantidev.

3.5.1.question: Manyu had many sons like Brihatkshatra, Mahaveer,  _______ , Garg etc.
3.5.1.explanation: Manyu had many sons like Brihatkshatra, Mahaveer, Nara, Garg etc.

3.5.2.question: On the other hand one day, King Shantanu proceeded towards the forest along with  _______  and his courtiers to hand over the kingdom to Devapi.
3.5.2.explanation: On the other hand one day, King Shantanu proceeded towards the forest along with Brahmins and his courtiers to hand over the kingdom to Devapi.

3.5.2.question: _______  informed him that he had no genuine right on the kingdom, which in fact belonged to his brother Devapi.
3.5.2.explanation: Brahmins informed him that he had no genuine right on the kingdom, which in fact belonged to his brother Devapi.

3.5.2.question: At that  _______  instructed the king to return to the kingdom, as there was no use to convince Devapi.
3.5.2.explanation: At that Brahmins instructed the king to return to the kingdom, as there was no use to convince Devapi.

3.5.2.question: Then Shantanu’s minister Ashmasari appointed certain  _______  who always spoke in anti-Vedas ways.
3.5.2.explanation: Then Shantanu’s minister Ashmasari appointed certain Brahmins who always spoke in anti-Vedas ways.

3.5.2.question: Perplexed by the continuous drought-like situation, Shantanu consulted learned  _______ .
3.5.2.explanation: Perplexed by the continuous drought-like situation, Shantanu consulted learned Brahmins.

3.5.2.question: There the  _______  tried to convince Devapi to accept the onus of the kingdom.
3.5.2.explanation: There the Brahmins tried to convince Devapi to accept the onus of the kingdom.

3.5.2.question: They also assured Shantanu that since Devapi had been disinclined from  _______ , he had lost his right to the kingdom and the famine would also come to an end.
3.5.2.explanation: They also assured Shantanu that since Devapi had been disinclined from Vedas, he had lost his right to the kingdom and the famine would also come to an end.

3.5.2.question: Then Shantanu’s minister Ashmasari appointed certain Brahmins who always spoke in anti- _______  ways.
3.5.2.explanation: Then Shantanu’s minister Ashmasari appointed certain Brahmins who always spoke in anti-Vedas ways.

3.5.2.question: They were sighting anecdotes from the  _______  to corroborate their argument.
3.5.2.explanation: They were sighting anecdotes from the Vedas to corroborate their argument.

3.5.2.question: Their continuous preaching disinclined Devapi’s mind from  _______ .
3.5.2.explanation: Their continuous preaching disinclined Devapi’s mind from Vedas.

3.5.2.question: But Devapi criticised  _______  and spoke in anti-religious ways.
3.5.2.explanation: But Devapi criticised Vedas and spoke in anti-religious ways.

3.5.3.question: _______  in the excitement was ready to kill Devaki ten and there but Vasudev convinced him saying that he would himself hand over all his children to him.
3.5.3.explanation: Kansa in the excitement was ready to kill Devaki ten and there but Vasudev convinced him saying that he would himself hand over all his children to him.

3.5.3.question: While this conversation was on, Devarshi Narad appeared before  _______  and informed him that Lord Vishnu would take birth as the eighth son of Devaki.
3.5.3.explanation: While this conversation was on, Devarshi Narad appeared before Kansa and informed him that Lord Vishnu would take birth as the eighth son of Devaki.

3.5.3.question: The same demon Kaalnemi whom Lord Vishnu had killed in his previous birth has taken incarnation of  _______ , the son of Ugrasena.
3.5.3.explanation: The same demon Kaalnemi whom Lord Vishnu had killed in his previous birth has taken incarnation of Kansa, the son of Ugrasena.

3.5.3.question: This black hair of mine shall take birth as the eighth son of Devaki and kill  _______  who is an re-incarnation of Kaalnemi."
3.5.3.explanation: This black hair of mine shall take birth as the eighth son of Devaki and kill Kansa who is an re-incarnation of Kaalnemi."

3.5.3.question: At that time, a celestial voice declared that the eighth son of Devaki would kill  _______ .
3.5.3.explanation: At that time, a celestial voice declared that the eighth son of Devaki would kill Kansa.

3.5.3.question: On that occasion of their marriage, Devaki’s cousin  _______  was driving their chariot.
3.5.3.explanation: On that occasion of their marriage, Devaki’s cousin Kansa was driving their chariot.

3.5.3.question: Hearing the words of Narad,  _______  angrily put Vasudev and Devaki behind the bars.
3.5.3.explanation: Hearing the words of Narad, Kansa angrily put Vasudev and Devaki behind the bars.

3.5.3.question: Thus assured by Vasudev,  _______  dropped the idea of killing Devaki.
3.5.3.explanation: Thus assured by Vasudev, Kansa dropped the idea of killing Devaki.

3.5.3.question: He knew that all of them would be killed by  _______ .
3.5.3.explanation: He knew that all of them would be killed by Kansa.

3.5.3.question: _______  instructed Mahamaaya to appear in the womb of Yashoda in Gokul while He Himself would appear as the eighth issue of Devaki.
3.5.3.explanation: Lord instructed Mahamaaya to appear in the womb of Yashoda in Gokul while He Himself would appear as the eighth issue of Devaki.

3.5.3.question: Thus assured by the  _______  all the gods and Brahma prayed once again.
3.5.3.explanation: Thus assured by the Lord all the gods and Brahma prayed once again.

3.5.3.question: Many other fearsome demons  _______ , Dhenuk, Keshi, Pralamb, Sunda, Banasura and many more have taken over the rule and tormenting the religious people in many ways.
3.5.3.explanation: Many other fearsome demons Arishth, Dhenuk, Keshi, Pralamb, Sunda, Banasura and many more have taken over the rule and tormenting the religious people in many ways.

3.5.4.question: Instructing the demons  _______  approached Vasudev and Devaki in the prison and released them apologising his cruel action in the way of killing their innocent children.
3.5.4.explanation: Instructing the demons Kansa approached Vasudev and Devaki in the prison and released them apologising his cruel action in the way of killing their innocent children.

3.5.4.question: Worried by the words of Yogamaaya,  _______  called a meeting of his prominent demons and said -"These evil gods have hatched a conspiracy to kill me.
3.5.4.explanation: Worried by the words of Yogamaaya, Kansa called a meeting of his prominent demons and said -"These evil gods have hatched a conspiracy to kill me.

3.5.4.question: _______  at once arrived there and snatching the baby from Devaki’s lap, he dashed her on the wall.
3.5.4.explanation: Kansa at once arrived there and snatching the baby from Devaki’s lap, he dashed her on the wall.

3.5.4.question: At the same time, he and Devaki also feared that  _______  would kill their eighth son also.
3.5.4.explanation: At the same time, he and Devaki also feared that Kansa would kill their eighth son also.

3.5.4.question: Her cries awakened the guards who ran to inform  _______  about the child’s birth.
3.5.4.explanation: Her cries awakened the guards who ran to inform Kansa about the child’s birth.

3.5.4.question: All the six children were killed by  _______  immediately after their birth.
3.5.4.explanation: All the six children were killed by Kansa immediately after their birth.

3.5.4.question: Laughing loudly then, mother Jagdamba said- "O  _______ !
3.5.4.explanation: Laughing loudly then, mother Jagdamba said- "O Kansa!

3.5.4.question: Vasudev arrived there and putting  _______  beside the sleeping Yashoda, he took her baby and returned to his prison in Mathura.
3.5.4.explanation: Vasudev arrived there and putting Lord beside the sleeping Yashoda, he took her baby and returned to his prison in Mathura.

3.5.4.question: Seeing the arrival of  _______  Himself as the eighth issue of Devaki, the gods prayed Him with devotion.
3.5.4.explanation: Seeing the arrival of Lord Himself as the eighth issue of Devaki, the gods prayed Him with devotion.

3.5.4.question: So when Vasudev reached in the open, Sheshnag spread its hood over him to shade the  _______  from rain.
3.5.4.explanation: So when Vasudev reached in the open, Sheshnag spread its hood over him to shade the Lord from rain.

3.5.4.question: Then on the eighth day in the darker phase of Bhaadrapad,  _______  took birth.
3.5.4.explanation: Then on the eighth day in the darker phase of Bhaadrapad, Lord took birth.

3.5.4.question: Then  _______  Himself appeared as the eighth issue of Devaki.
3.5.4.explanation: Then Lord Himself appeared as the eighth issue of Devaki.

3.5.4.question: So, they prayed the  _______  to hide His divine appearance.
3.5.4.explanation: So, they prayed the Lord to hide His divine appearance.

3.5.4.question: _______  assured them that their ordeals would end soon.
3.5.4.explanation: Lord assured them that their ordeals would end soon.

3.5.5.question: As soon as Akrur took a dip in Yamuna,  _______  showed him a sight of His abode Vaikunth and his Narayana's appearance in which, he was holding conch, wheel, mace and lotus in each of his four hands and was lying on the bed of Sheshnaga.
3.5.5.explanation: As soon as Akrur took a dip in Yamuna, Lord showed him a sight of His abode Vaikunth and his Narayana's appearance in which, he was holding conch, wheel, mace and lotus in each of his four hands and was lying on the bed of Sheshnaga.

3.5.5.question: Like common, ordinary people, the  _______  stayed on earth enjoying mundane comforts, performed Yagyas like kings, behaved like idealistic people; deterred His subjects and slayed evil kings to re-establish religion on earth.
3.5.5.explanation: Like common, ordinary people, the Lord stayed on earth enjoying mundane comforts, performed Yagyas like kings, behaved like idealistic people; deterred His subjects and slayed evil kings to re-establish religion on earth.

3.5.5.question: Thus driven by the illusion and to test the authenticity of  _______ 's incarnation, Brahma kidnapped all the cattle first and when Krishna went out to search the cattle Brahma kidnapped and concealed the cowherds also.
3.5.5.explanation: Thus driven by the illusion and to test the authenticity of lord's incarnation, Brahma kidnapped all the cattle first and when Krishna went out to search the cattle Brahma kidnapped and concealed the cowherds also.

3.5.5.question: Parashar says: When a wretched person like Shishupal, who always abused  _______  Krishna could find supreme position, there should be no doubt for Gopis who had such a profound passion for  _______ ."
3.5.5.explanation: Parashar says: When a wretched person like Shishupal, who always abused lord Krishna could find supreme position, there should be no doubt for Gopis who had such a profound passion for Lord."

3.5.5.question: Meanwhile, Devarshi Narad arrived in the court and informed the  _______  of Yudhisthir's intention to organise a grand Rajsuy Yagya and his cordial invitation for the  _______  to attend the ceremony.
3.5.5.explanation: Meanwhile, Devarshi Narad arrived in the court and informed the Lord of Yudhisthir's intention to organise a grand Rajsuy Yagya and his cordial invitation for the Lord to attend the ceremony.

3.5.5.question: Meanwhile, Devarshi Narad arrived in the court and informed the  _______  of Yudhisthir's intention to organise a grand Rajsuy Yagya and his cordial invitation for the  _______  to attend the ceremony.
3.5.5.explanation: Meanwhile, Devarshi Narad arrived in the court and informed the Lord of Yudhisthir's intention to organise a grand Rajsuy Yagya and his cordial invitation for the Lord to attend the ceremony.

3.5.5.question: When  _______  proceeded to take next handful, queen Rukmani held his hand and prayed: "O Vishvambhar (fosterer of the world) for the prosperity of entire world this one handful is sufficient."
3.5.5.explanation: When Lord proceeded to take next handful, queen Rukmani held his hand and prayed: "O Vishvambhar (fosterer of the world) for the prosperity of entire world this one handful is sufficient."

3.5.5.question: MARRIAGE OF SATYABHAMA AND KRISHNA  _______  summoned Satrajit to His court and in the presence of the king Ugrasen, related the sequence of incidents that took place in the jungle.
3.5.5.explanation: MARRIAGE OF SATYABHAMA AND KRISHNA Lord summoned Satrajit to His court and in the presence of the king Ugrasen, related the sequence of incidents that took place in the jungle.

3.5.5.question: _______  asked his friend Uddhav for an advice as to where He ought to go first - to Indraprasth in Rajsuy Yagya or to liberate the king from the captivity of Jarasandh.
3.5.5.explanation: Lord asked his friend Uddhav for an advice as to where He ought to go first - to Indraprasth in Rajsuy Yagya or to liberate the king from the captivity of Jarasandh.

3.5.5.question: But instead of getting angry,  _______  got up, bowed his head before the sage and begged pardon: "O Sage, pardon me, I could not welcome you at once, at your arrival.
3.5.5.explanation: But instead of getting angry, Lord got up, bowed his head before the sage and begged pardon: "O Sage, pardon me, I could not welcome you at once, at your arrival.

3.5.5.question: AKRUR HAS A SIGHT OF  _______  IN FOUR-ARMED FORM Hearing Akrur's words,  _______  understood that when he had arrived in Vraj, he was afflicted with a feeling of majesty.
3.5.5.explanation: AKRUR HAS A SIGHT OF LORD IN FOUR-ARMED FORM Hearing Akrur's words, Lord understood that when he had arrived in Vraj, he was afflicted with a feeling of majesty.

3.5.5.question: AKRUR HAS A SIGHT OF  _______  IN FOUR-ARMED FORM Hearing Akrur's words,  _______  understood that when he had arrived in Vraj, he was afflicted with a feeling of majesty.
3.5.5.explanation: AKRUR HAS A SIGHT OF LORD IN FOUR-ARMED FORM Hearing Akrur's words, Lord understood that when he had arrived in Vraj, he was afflicted with a feeling of majesty.

3.5.5.question: I don't want wealth.” Since then, Sudama enjoyed the comforts of the palace as the bounty of  _______  bestowed upon him by none other than the  _______  Krishna himself.
3.5.5.explanation: I don't want wealth.” Since then, Sudama enjoyed the comforts of the palace as the bounty of Lord bestowed upon him by none other than the Lord Krishna himself.

3.5.5.question: One more said: "O friend, look, even Bhagwati Lakshmi has left her luxurious abode in Vaikunth and arrived in Vrindavana to have a look of  _______  Devakinandan."
3.5.5.explanation: One more said: "O friend, look, even Bhagwati Lakshmi has left her luxurious abode in Vaikunth and arrived in Vrindavana to have a look of lord Devakinandan."

3.5.5.question: Sudama was still reflecting over the God's grace and praying: "May I have the friendship of  _______  in every birth, may my affection increase for  _______ 's feet.
3.5.5.explanation: Sudama was still reflecting over the God's grace and praying: "May I have the friendship of lord in every birth, may my affection increase for Lord's feet.

3.5.5.question: Sudama was still reflecting over the God's grace and praying: "May I have the friendship of  _______  in every birth, may my affection increase for  _______ 's feet.
3.5.5.explanation: Sudama was still reflecting over the God's grace and praying: "May I have the friendship of lord in every birth, may my affection increase for Lord's feet.

3.5.5.question: RELEASE OF SHIVA FROM CRISIS Maitreya asked: "Gurudev, those among the gods, human beings and the demons, who worship  _______  Shiva, get wealth very soon.
3.5.5.explanation: RELEASE OF SHIVA FROM CRISIS Maitreya asked: "Gurudev, those among the gods, human beings and the demons, who worship Lord Shiva, get wealth very soon.

3.5.5.question: But even amidst crores of Gopis, who were eager to devote their everything to Him,  _______  completely refrained from desires, feelings and even actions.
3.5.5.explanation: But even amidst crores of Gopis, who were eager to devote their everything to Him, Lord completely refrained from desires, feelings and even actions.

3.5.5.question: With his illusionary powers,  _______  wiped out the memory of this incidence from the mind of Yashoda, and she again immersed in love with her child.
3.5.5.explanation: With his illusionary powers, Lord wiped out the memory of this incidence from the mind of Yashoda, and she again immersed in love with her child.

3.5.5.question: Narad showed kindness as well that despite being in tree forms, they would have the memory of God alive and would be salved by  _______  Shri Krishna.
3.5.5.explanation: Narad showed kindness as well that despite being in tree forms, they would have the memory of God alive and would be salved by Lord Shri Krishna.

3.5.5.question: Saying this,  _______  lifted Giriraj on his little finger and called all the people of Vraj along with their cattle under the lee of Govardhan.
3.5.5.explanation: Saying this, Lord lifted Giriraj on his little finger and called all the people of Vraj along with their cattle under the lee of Govardhan.

3.5.5.question: SUDAMA: THE  _______ 'S FRIEND During his stay as a disciple at the hermitage of sage Sandipani,  _______  Krishna had a Brahmin friend named Sudama.
3.5.5.explanation: SUDAMA: THE LORD'S FRIEND During his stay as a disciple at the hermitage of sage Sandipani, Lord Krishna had a Brahmin friend named Sudama.

3.5.5.question: Thus, in order to get Kalyavan incinerated and show Muchkund with his Divine form,  _______  had gone to that spot where Muchkund was sleeping.
3.5.5.explanation: Thus, in order to get Kalyavan incinerated and show Muchkund with his Divine form, Lord had gone to that spot where Muchkund was sleeping.

3.5.5.question: _______  Purushottam said in a serious voice: "O Krishna and Arjuna, only to have a sight of both of you, I brought the Brahmin's sons to me.
3.5.5.explanation: Lord Purushottam said in a serious voice: "O Krishna and Arjuna, only to have a sight of both of you, I brought the Brahmin's sons to me.

3.5.5.question: _______ 'S MARRIAGE WITH BHADRA Parashar says: "Parikshit,  _______ 's aunt (father's sister) Shrutkirti was married in the kingdom of Kaikauja.
3.5.5.explanation: LORD'S MARRIAGE WITH BHADRA Parashar says: "Parikshit, Lord's aunt (father's sister) Shrutkirti was married in the kingdom of Kaikauja.

3.5.5.question: _______ 'S MARRIAGE WITH BHADRA Parashar says: "Parikshit,  _______ 's aunt (father's sister) Shrutkirti was married in the kingdom of Kaikauja.
3.5.5.explanation: LORD'S MARRIAGE WITH BHADRA Parashar says: "Parikshit, Lord's aunt (father's sister) Shrutkirti was married in the kingdom of Kaikauja.

3.5.5.question: But with the blows of his mace and arrows,  _______  easily broke the hills, destroyed strategic positions and cut the snares with sword.
3.5.5.explanation: But with the blows of his mace and arrows, Lord easily broke the hills, destroyed strategic positions and cut the snares with sword.

3.5.5.question: He had pleased  _______  Shiva and sought a boon that the person, upon whose head the demon put his hand, should be incinerated at once.
3.5.5.explanation: He had pleased Lord Shiva and sought a boon that the person, upon whose head the demon put his hand, should be incinerated at once.

3.5.5.question: At first he could not believe his eyes; but the people told him that he was in Dwarka and standing right before the  _______ 's palace.
3.5.5.explanation: At first he could not believe his eyes; but the people told him that he was in Dwarka and standing right before the lord's palace.

3.5.5.question: ORGANISATION OF YAGYA BY VASUDEV Devarshi Narad, Vyasa and many other great sages arrived in Kurukshetra to have a sight of  _______ .
3.5.5.explanation: ORGANISATION OF YAGYA BY VASUDEV Devarshi Narad, Vyasa and many other great sages arrived in Kurukshetra to have a sight of Lord.

3.5.5.question: With his ambrosial eye,  _______  resurrected these dead fellows and their cattle and together they came out of the demon's mouth.
3.5.5.explanation: With his ambrosial eye, Lord resurrected these dead fellows and their cattle and together they came out of the demon's mouth.

3.5.5.question: As soon as the  _______  and Balaram arrived in the ring, the wrestlers, who were already present there, stood up like springs.
3.5.5.explanation: As soon as the Lord and Balaram arrived in the ring, the wrestlers, who were already present there, stood up like springs.

3.5.5.question: Aghasur wanted to masticate the cowherds including  _______  Krishna; but the  _______  increased his body and choked demon throat.
3.5.5.explanation: Aghasur wanted to masticate the cowherds including lord Krishna; but the lord increased his body and choked demon throat.

3.5.5.question: With kindness,  _______  released Kaliy, who prayed thus: O  _______  in your creation we snakes represent Tamoguna (dark virtues).
3.5.5.explanation: With kindness, lord released Kaliy, who prayed thus: O lord in your creation we snakes represent Tamoguna (dark virtues).

3.5.5.question: With kindness,  _______  released Kaliy, who prayed thus: O  _______  in your creation we snakes represent Tamoguna (dark virtues).
3.5.5.explanation: With kindness, lord released Kaliy, who prayed thus: O lord in your creation we snakes represent Tamoguna (dark virtues).

3.5.5.question: At the  _______ 's words, Sudama felt ashamed and he did not reveal the four handfuls of raw rice that he had brought as gift.
3.5.5.explanation: At the Lord's words, Sudama felt ashamed and he did not reveal the four handfuls of raw rice that he had brought as gift.

3.5.5.question: _______  held Govardhan on one hand, and conch in the other, while with the remaining two hands He began to play this flute.
3.5.5.explanation: Lord held Govardhan on one hand, and conch in the other, while with the remaining two hands He began to play this flute.

3.5.5.question: THE KINGS IN CAPTIVITY SEEK  _______ 'S HELP Once  _______  Krishna was holding His court when an emissary arrived in the court.
3.5.5.explanation: THE KINGS IN CAPTIVITY SEEK LORD'S HELP Once Lord Krishna was holding His court when an emissary arrived in the court.

3.5.5.question: _______  Krishna accepted Satyabhama as his wife but returned the gem to Satrajit saying: "It is a gift of  _______  Suryadev.
3.5.5.explanation: Lord Krishna accepted Satyabhama as his wife but returned the gem to Satrajit saying: "It is a gift of lord Suryadev.

3.5.5.question: Taking permission from His priest and teachers,  _______  set out on a chariot with the whole family to reach Indraprasth.
3.5.5.explanation: Taking permission from His priest and teachers, Lord set out on a chariot with the whole family to reach Indraprasth.

3.5.5.question: With folded hands, Akrur prayed to  _______ : "O  _______ , you are the reason for the existence of Brahma and the Universe.
3.5.5.explanation: With folded hands, Akrur prayed to lord: "O lord, you are the reason for the existence of Brahma and the Universe.

3.5.5.question: With folded hands, Akrur prayed to  _______ : "O  _______ , you are the reason for the existence of Brahma and the Universe.
3.5.5.explanation: With folded hands, Akrur prayed to lord: "O lord, you are the reason for the existence of Brahma and the Universe.

3.5.5.question: On her way back, Rukmani was walking very slowly for she was awaiting  _______ 's arrival, which was due in any moment.
3.5.5.explanation: On her way back, Rukmani was walking very slowly for she was awaiting Lord's arrival, which was due in any moment.

3.5.5.question: Meanwhile the king Paundrak of Karush sent an envoy to  _______  Krishna with a message that said: 'I am  _______  Vasudev.'
