4.1.6.question: All the deities eulogized Lord Brahma and they heard a heavenly voice saying--- 'Nobody can kill Tarakasur except  _______ 's son.
4.1.6.explanation: All the deities eulogized Lord Brahma and they heard a heavenly voice saying--- 'Nobody can kill Tarakasur except Shiva's son.

4.1.6.question: The deities were aware that after the death of Sati,  _______  had lost all interest in life and was living like a recluse.
4.1.6.explanation: The deities were aware that after the death of Sati, Shiva had lost all interest in life and was living like a recluse.

4.1.6.question: Finally,  _______  gave his conscent and went to the place where Girija was doing penance.
4.1.6.explanation: Finally, Shiva gave his conscent and went to the place where Girija was doing penance.

4.1.6.question: She used to look after all the needs of  _______  while he was engrossed in his penance.
4.1.6.explanation: She used to look after all the needs of Shiva while he was engrossed in his penance.

4.1.6.question: He tried to sow seeds of compassion in  _______ 's heart only to receive his wrath.
4.1.6.explanation: He tried to sow seeds of compassion in Shiva's heart only to receive his wrath.

4.1.6.question: So you must put all your efforts to help  _______  get married.'
4.1.6.explanation: So you must put all your efforts to help Shiva get married.'

4.1.7.question: He then returned to the place where he had been meditating.After a while, Himalaya and Mena arrived there and asked Parvati how her  _______  had been progressing.
4.1.7.explanation: He then returned to the place where he had been meditating.After a while, Himalaya and Mena arrived there and asked Parvati how her penance had been progressing.

4.1.7.question: Jaya, one of Parvati's companions informed him that her friend was doing  _______  in order to get Lord Shiva as her husband.
4.1.7.explanation: Jaya, one of Parvati's companions informed him that her friend was doing penance in order to get Lord Shiva as her husband.

4.1.7.question: So he disguised himself as a hermit and asked her companions about the reason why Parvati was doing such a severe  _______ .
4.1.7.explanation: So he disguised himself as a hermit and asked her companions about the reason why Parvati was doing such a severe Penance.

4.1.7.question: After reaching there, Lord Shiva found Parvati engrossed in her  _______ .
4.1.7.explanation: After reaching there, Lord Shiva found Parvati engrossed in her penance.

4.1.7.question: Lord  _______ , who was in the guise of a hermit said---'Why is this tender girl so eager to marry  _______  who is an embodiment of inauspiciousness--who carries a skull in his hand and who lives in a crematorium.
4.1.7.explanation: Lord Shiva, who was in the guise of a hermit said---'Why is this tender girl so eager to marry Shiva who is an embodiment of inauspiciousness--who carries a skull in his hand and who lives in a crematorium.

4.1.7.question: Parvati, who had been listening to all those nonsensical utterances, told Jaya--- 'This fellow seems to abhor  _______ .
4.1.7.explanation: Parvati, who had been listening to all those nonsensical utterances, told Jaya--- 'This fellow seems to abhor Shiva.

4.1.7.question: Does your friend know that  _______  wears a snake around his neck and is surrounded by numerous spirits and ghosts?'
4.1.7.explanation: Does your friend know that Shiva wears a snake around his neck and is surrounded by numerous spirits and ghosts?'

4.1.7.question: Parvati narrated the whole incident how Lord Shiva had finally given his conscent to marry her.Himalaya and Mena were extremely pleased by this good  _______ .
4.1.7.explanation: Parvati narrated the whole incident how Lord Shiva had finally given his conscent to marry her.Himalaya and Mena were extremely pleased by this good news.

4.1.10.question: This is the reason why he is also known as  _______  senapati.Karitkeya was leading the deities' army, mounted on an elephant.
4.1.10.explanation: This is the reason why he is also known as Deva senapati.Karitkeya was leading the deities' army, mounted on an elephant.

4.1.11.question: Though he was a sinner yet he took his next birth in a royal family on account of his two virtuous deeds--he had remained awakened for the whole night of  _______ ratri and he had listened to the tales of  _______ .
4.1.11.explanation: Though he was a sinner yet he took his next birth in a royal family on account of his two virtuous deeds--he had remained awakened for the whole night of Shivaratri and he had listened to the tales of Shiva.

4.1.11.question: One day, Dussah went to a  _______  temple with the intention of committing robbery.
4.1.11.explanation: One day, Dussah went to a Shiva temple with the intention of committing robbery.

4.1.11.question: He spent his time listening to the divine tales of Lord Shiva that was being narrated by the  _______  priest.
4.1.11.explanation: He spent his time listening to the divine tales of Lord Shiva that was being narrated by the temple priest.

4.1.11.question: It was the festive night of Shivaratri and people had thronged the  _______  in a large number.
4.1.11.explanation: It was the festive night of Shivaratri and people had thronged the temple in a large number.

4.1.11.question: One day, Dussah went to a Shiva  _______  with the intention of committing robbery.
4.1.11.explanation: One day, Dussah went to a Shiva temple with the intention of committing robbery.

4.1.11.question: So, he did not get an opportunity to steal  _______  property.
4.1.11.explanation: So, he did not get an opportunity to steal temple property.

4.1.14.question: We assure you that each four of us ( _______ , Gyan, Vairagya and Aishwarya) will never abandon you."
4.1.14.explanation: We assure you that each four of us (Dharma, Gyan, Vairagya and Aishwarya) will never abandon you."

4.1.14.question: The names of these five ganas were  _______ , Gyan, Vairagya Aishwarya and A _______ .
4.1.14.explanation: The names of these five ganas were Dharma, Gyan, Vairagya Aishwarya and Adharma.

4.1.14.question: He was a great devotee of Lord Shiva.One day, as Kaalbhiti was meditating under a 'bael' tree ( _______  apple), he went into his trance.
4.1.14.explanation: He was a great devotee of Lord Shiva.One day, as Kaalbhiti was meditating under a 'bael' tree (wood apple), he went into his trance.

4.1.14.question: Suddenly, an effulgent Shivalinga appeared under that bael ( _______  apple) tree.
4.1.14.explanation: Suddenly, an effulgent Shivalinga appeared under that bael (wood apple) tree.

4.1.14.question: The fifth gana named Adharma on the contrary promised not to caste his evil  _______  on the baby.
4.1.14.explanation: The fifth gana named Adharma on the contrary promised not to caste his evil Shadow on the baby.

4.1.15.question: They accept only the essence of whatever is offered to them and not the gross materials as such.Karandham posed his second query--'I think a soul, after it has abandoned the mortal body is bound by its own  _______ .
4.1.15.explanation: They accept only the essence of whatever is offered to them and not the gross materials as such.Karandham posed his second query--'I think a soul, after it has abandoned the mortal body is bound by its own karma.

4.1.15.question: Mahakaal replied---Not all Pitras (dead ancestors) are bound by their  _______ .
4.1.15.explanation: Mahakaal replied---Not all Pitras (dead ancestors) are bound by their karma.

4.1.15.question: They also transcend the law of  _______ .
4.1.15.explanation: They also transcend the law of Karma.

4.1.17.question: Not only that Kashyap also fathered different species like Marut,  _______ , Yaksha, Gandharva and apsaras.
4.1.17.explanation: Not only that Kashyap also fathered different species like Marut, Nag, Yaksha, Gandharva and apsaras.

4.1.17.question: He also created the brahmins from his mouth,  _______  from both his arms, Vaishyas from both his thighs and Shudras from both his feet respectively.Both, the deities and demons came from the lineage of Sage Kashyap, who himself was Marichi's son.
4.1.17.explanation: He also created the brahmins from his mouth, Kshatriyas from both his arms, Vaishyas from both his thighs and Shudras from both his feet respectively.Both, the deities and demons came from the lineage of Sage Kashyap, who himself was Marichi's son.

4.1.17.question: All the sages as well as the  _______  are the descendants of Sage Atri.
4.1.17.explanation: All the sages as well as the Kshatriyas are the descendants of Sage Atri.

4.1.17.question: Not only that Kashyap also fathered different species like  _______ , Nag, Yaksha, Gandharva and apsaras.
4.1.17.explanation: Not only that Kashyap also fathered different species like Marut, Nag, Yaksha, Gandharva and apsaras.

4.1.17.question: He then attributed the qualities of ' _______ ' and 'Satva' to Brahma and Vishnu respectively.
4.1.17.explanation: He then attributed the qualities of 'Rajas' and 'Satva' to Brahma and Vishnu respectively.

4.1.18.question: Having accomplished her mission, Kali Kaushiki did a tremendous penance at 'Gauri- _______ ' and regained her fair complexion.
4.1.18.explanation: Having accomplished her mission, Kali Kaushiki did a tremendous penance at 'Gauri-peak' and regained her fair complexion.

4.2.1.question: She was curious to know about the identities of various mountains, which Lord Varah had established on her.Lord Varah told Prithvi about the prominent mountains---Mountains like Sumeru, Himavan, Mandarachal, Vindhyachal, Pariyatrak, Mahendra,  _______ , Sinhachal and Gandhamadan are situated to the north of Hi _______ a.
4.2.1.explanation: She was curious to know about the identities of various mountains, which Lord Varah had established on her.Lord Varah told Prithvi about the prominent mountains---Mountains like Sumeru, Himavan, Mandarachal, Vindhyachal, Pariyatrak, Mahendra, Malay, Sinhachal and Gandhamadan are situated to the north of Himalaya.

4.2.2.question: This mantra is capable of liberating a man and also brings all sort of worldly accomplishments to him.In the first Krita yuga, a Manu named  _______  had realized me by continuously chanting this mantra.
4.2.2.explanation: This mantra is capable of liberating a man and also brings all sort of worldly accomplishments to him.In the first Krita yuga, a Manu named Dharma had realized me by continuously chanting this mantra.

4.2.2.question: Even Indra regained the control of  _______  by chanting it.
4.2.2.explanation: Even Indra regained the control of heaven by chanting it.

4.2.2.question: Anant--the  _______  of all serpents, chanted Varaha mantra and as a result became capable of holding the earth on it's hood.'
4.2.2.explanation: Anant--the lord of all serpents, chanted Varaha mantra and as a result became capable of holding the earth on it's hood.'

4.2.4.question: On being asked by Vakulmalika, Sri Hari narrated the following tale to her --- In treta yuga, when I had incarnated as  _______ , Ravan had deceit- fully abducted my consort--Sita.
4.2.4.explanation: On being asked by Vakulmalika, Sri Hari narrated the following tale to her --- In treta yuga, when I had incarnated as Ram, Ravan had deceit- fully abducted my consort--Sita.

4.2.5.question: When he saw a dead snake coiling around his father's neck, he cursed--'Whoever has tried to insult my father will not live to see the seventh day because a takshak  _______  would bite him to death.'
4.2.5.explanation: When he saw a dead snake coiling around his father's neck, he cursed--'Whoever has tried to insult my father will not live to see the seventh day because a takshak nag would bite him to death.'

4.2.6.question: He remained immobile during the entire course of his penance resulting into the development of  _______  hills all over his body.Indra was scarred by Ramkrishna's penance and caused a heavy downpour for a week.
4.2.6.explanation: He remained immobile during the entire course of his penance resulting into the development of mole hills all over his body.Indra was scarred by Ramkrishna's penance and caused a heavy downpour for a week.

4.2.6.question: All the  _______  hills were washed away from Ramkrishna's body.Lord Srinivas became pleased and appeared before him.
4.2.6.explanation: All the mole hills were washed away from Ramkrishna's body.Lord Srinivas became pleased and appeared before him.

4.2.7.question: Among all these holy places, six are considered to be capable of bestowing salvation--- _______  pushkarini, Akash ganga, Papvinashan, Panduteerth, Kumar dharika teerth and Tumbu teerth.
4.2.7.explanation: Among all these holy places, six are considered to be capable of bestowing salvation---Swami pushkarini, Akash ganga, Papvinashan, Panduteerth, Kumar dharika teerth and Tumbu teerth.

4.2.8.question: Sage Matang also described the geographical location-- 'At a distance of ten yojans towards  _______  is situated Dhanachal mountain, which is believed to be the abode of Lord Nrisimha.
4.2.8.explanation: Sage Matang also described the geographical location-- 'At a distance of ten yojans towards south is situated Dhanachal mountain, which is believed to be the abode of Lord Nrisimha.

4.2.8.question: At a distance of ten yojans  _______  of Brahma teerth, flows river 'Suvarnamukhari'.
4.2.8.explanation: At a distance of ten yojans south of Brahma teerth, flows river 'Suvarnamukhari'.

4.2.8.question: You should then go towards north of  _______  teerth and you would reach Akashganga.'
4.2.8.explanation: You should then go towards north of Swami teerth and you would reach Akashganga.'

4.2.12.question: First he purified himself by taking a holy dip in Rohin kund and then went inside the  _______  to worship lord Jagannath.
4.2.12.explanation: First he purified himself by taking a holy dip in Rohin kund and then went inside the temple to worship lord Jagannath.

4.2.12.question: I collect the residuals of whatever is offered to Jagannath from the  _______  and bring it home.
4.2.12.explanation: I collect the residuals of whatever is offered to Jagannath from the temple and bring it home.

4.2.12.question: Lord Jagannath's  _______  is situated between Rohin kund and the kalpa vat.
4.2.12.explanation: Lord Jagannath's temple is situated between Rohin kund and the kalpa vat.

4.2.13.question: The entourage touched the  _______  of river Mahanadi by evening.
4.2.13.explanation: The entourage touched the bank of river Mahanadi by evening.

4.2.15.question: To the north of this  _______  tree and to the north of Nrisimha temple lies the place where lord Neelmadhav used to have his dwelling sometime ago but who has presently concealed himself.
4.2.15.explanation: To the north of this Banyan tree and to the north of Nrisimha temple lies the place where lord Neelmadhav used to have his dwelling sometime ago but who has presently concealed himself.

4.2.15.question: Narad took him near a  _______  tree and said--' Look at this huge  _______  tree that is two yojans in height and whose trunk is spread in the area of one yojan.
4.2.15.explanation: Narad took him near a Banyan tree and said--' Look at this huge Banyan tree that is two yojans in height and whose trunk is spread in the area of one yojan.

4.2.15.question: Narad took him near a  _______  tree and said--' Look at this huge  _______  tree that is two yojans in height and whose trunk is spread in the area of one yojan.
4.2.15.explanation: Narad took him near a Banyan tree and said--' Look at this huge Banyan tree that is two yojans in height and whose trunk is spread in the area of one yojan.

4.2.15.question: He eulogized the  _______  as if he were already present there and this was true as Jagannath's idol was indeed present there albeit hidden beneath heaps of sand.
4.2.15.explanation: He eulogized the lord as if he were already present there and this was true as Jagannath's idol was indeed present there albeit hidden beneath heaps of sand.

4.2.17.question: _______ , who had been listening to the tale narrated by Jaimini with rapt attention till then asked--' What did Indradyumna next do after the idol of Lord Nrisimha had been installed?'
4.2.17.explanation: Sages, who had been listening to the tale narrated by Jaimini with rapt attention till then asked--' What did Indradyumna next do after the idol of Lord Nrisimha had been installed?'

4.2.17.question: He sent invitations to all the deities, learned brahmins and  _______ .
4.2.17.explanation: He sent invitations to all the deities, learned brahmins and sages.

4.2.18.question: Indradyumna, following the instructions ordered his men to uproot the said tree and then install it on the 'Mahavedi' inside the  _______ .
4.2.18.explanation: Indradyumna, following the instructions ordered his men to uproot the said tree and then install it on the 'Mahavedi' inside the temple.

4.2.18.question: The main door of the  _______  should then be shut and nobody should try to enter the  _______  till the idols are ready.
4.2.18.explanation: The main door of the temple should then be shut and nobody should try to enter the temple till the idols are ready.

4.2.18.question: The main door of the  _______  should then be shut and nobody should try to enter the  _______  till the idols are ready.
4.2.18.explanation: The main door of the temple should then be shut and nobody should try to enter the temple till the idols are ready.

4.2.18.question: Now, you should make preparations to get this tree installed on the great altar inside the  _______ .'
4.2.18.explanation: Now, you should make preparations to get this tree installed on the great altar inside the temple.'

4.2.18.question: An old carpenter, who is standing among you, should be sent inside the  _______  premise.
4.2.18.explanation: An old carpenter, who is standing among you, should be sent inside the temple premise.

4.2.18.question: The old carpenter was sent inside and the main door of the  _______  shut.
4.2.18.explanation: The old carpenter was sent inside and the main door of the temple shut.

4.2.18.question: The colour of goddess Subhadra's idol should be reddish just like the rising  _______ .
4.2.18.explanation: The colour of goddess Subhadra's idol should be reddish just like the rising Sun.

4.2.18.question: Similarly, the idol of Balbhadra should be coloured in  _______  just like his fair complexion.
4.2.18.explanation: Similarly, the idol of Balbhadra should be coloured in white just like his fair complexion.

4.2.19.question: The day was  _______  and the Nakshatra was Pushya.
4.2.19.explanation: The day was Thursday and the Nakshatra was Pushya.

4.2.19.question: The chariot meant for lord Jagannath should have a mast on its top with the figure of  _______  on it.
4.2.19.explanation: The chariot meant for lord Jagannath should have a mast on its top with the figure of Garuda on it.

4.2.22.question: All the deities were ashamed of themselves and returned to  _______  with long faces.
4.2.22.explanation: All the deities were ashamed of themselves and returned to heaven with long faces.

4.2.23.question: At that time Lord Brahma had revealed to Narad that ' _______ ' was supreme among all the months just as lord Vishnu is supreme among all the deities and Badrikashram is the crown of all the places of pilgrimage.
4.2.23.explanation: At that time Lord Brahma had revealed to Narad that 'Kartik' was supreme among all the months just as lord Vishnu is supreme among all the deities and Badrikashram is the crown of all the places of pilgrimage.

4.2.23.question: Once, on being asked by some sages about the significance of the hindu month-  _______ , Sutji narrated the following tale-- 'Once, Narad had asked lord Brahma the same question.
4.2.23.explanation: Once, on being asked by some sages about the significance of the hindu month- Kartik, Sutji narrated the following tale-- 'Once, Narad had asked lord Brahma the same question.

4.2.23.question: _______  is very dear to Lord Vishnu and any virtuous deed done during this month never goes without being rewarded.
4.2.23.explanation: Kartik is very dear to Lord Vishnu and any virtuous deed done during this month never goes without being rewarded.

4.2.23.question: Once, on being asked by some sages about the significance of the  _______  month- Kartik, Sutji narrated the following tale-- 'Once, Narad had asked lord Brahma the same question.
4.2.23.explanation: Once, on being asked by some sages about the significance of the hindu month- Kartik, Sutji narrated the following tale-- 'Once, Narad had asked lord Brahma the same question.

4.2.23.question: Worshipping lord Vishnu with petals of  _______  helps him to become absolved of all the sins committed in his previous many births.
4.2.23.explanation: Worshipping lord Vishnu with petals of Lotus helps him to become absolved of all the sins committed in his previous many births.

4.2.25.question: Continuing with his tales, Sutji said--' Once, king Ambarish asked Narad about the reason why lord Vishnu had special liking for the  _______  month-Vaishakh.
4.2.25.explanation: Continuing with his tales, Sutji said--' Once, king Ambarish asked Narad about the reason why lord Vishnu had special liking for the hindu month-Vaishakh.

4.2.25.question: No charitable deed can ever match the virtue of donating food grains and one who accomplishes this great act can be aptly called a ' _______ ' (Father).
4.2.25.explanation: No charitable deed can ever match the virtue of donating food grains and one who accomplishes this great act can be aptly called a 'Pita' (Father).

4.2.25.question: No charitable deed can ever match the virtue of donating food grains and one who accomplishes this great act can be aptly called a 'Pita' ( _______ ).
4.2.25.explanation: No charitable deed can ever match the virtue of donating food grains and one who accomplishes this great act can be aptly called a 'Pita' (Father).

4.3.2.question: There are many holy places situated on the bridge prominent among which are Chakra-teerth, Paap-vinashan teerth, Sita -sarovar, Mangal- teerth, Amrit-watika, Brahma-kund, Hanumat- kund, Agastya-teerth, Ram-teerth, Laxman-teerth, Jaya-teerth, Laxmi-teerth, Agni-teerth,  _______ -teerth, Shankh- teerth, Yamuna-teerth, Ganga-teerth, Koti-teerth, Manas-teerth and Dhanushkoti teerth.
4.3.2.explanation: There are many holy places situated on the bridge prominent among which are Chakra-teerth, Paap-vinashan teerth, Sita -sarovar, Mangal- teerth, Amrit-watika, Brahma-kund, Hanumat- kund, Agastya-teerth, Ram-teerth, Laxman-teerth, Jaya-teerth, Laxmi-teerth, Agni-teerth, Shiv-teerth, Shankh- teerth, Yamuna-teerth, Ganga-teerth, Koti-teerth, Manas-teerth and Dhanushkoti teerth.

4.3.3.question: Rameshwar linga is so sacrosanct that all the holy places, sages and ancestors are believed to exist within the  _______  premise of Maheshwar linga.
4.3.3.explanation: Rameshwar linga is so sacrosanct that all the holy places, sages and ancestors are believed to exist within the temple premise of Maheshwar linga.

4.3.4.question: Indra then instructed a beautiful Apsara named Vardhini to go to the place where  _______  was doing penance and disturb him by corrupting his thoughts.
4.3.4.explanation: Indra then instructed a beautiful Apsara named Vardhini to go to the place where Dharma was doing penance and disturb him by corrupting his thoughts.

4.3.4.question: After his penance was over,  _______  also had created a holy reservoir over there which is believed to absolve a man of all his sins.
4.3.4.explanation: After his penance was over, Dharma also had created a holy reservoir over there which is believed to absolve a man of all his sins.

4.3.4.question: Since Shiva was aware of  _______ 's motive, he explained to the deities that there was nothing to worry about.
4.3.4.explanation: Since Shiva was aware of Dharma's motive, he explained to the deities that there was nothing to worry about.

4.3.4.question: _______  told Vardhini that he was doing penance with the objective of having a divine glimpse of lord Shiva.
4.3.4.explanation: Dharma told Vardhini that he was doing penance with the objective of having a divine glimpse of lord Shiva.

4.3.4.question: Vardhini went to the place where  _______  was engrossed in his penance and was successful in disturbing him.
4.3.4.explanation: Vardhini went to the place where Dharma was engrossed in his penance and was successful in disturbing him.

4.3.4.question: _______  was pleased by her truthfulness and wanted to reward her for that.
4.3.4.explanation: Dharma was pleased by her truthfulness and wanted to reward her for that.

4.3.4.question: When  _______  opened his eyes he found a beautiful Apsara in front of him.
4.3.4.explanation: When Dharma opened his eyes he found a beautiful Apsara in front of him.

4.3.4.question: _______  blessed her after which she returned to Indraloka.
4.3.4.explanation: Dharma blessed her after which she returned to Indraloka.

4.3.4.question: _______  once again engrossed himself in penance.
4.3.4.explanation: Dharma once again engrossed himself in penance.

4.3.5.question: Brahmins would be criticized because of their inappropriate conduct- They would become arrogant, would start trading their knowledge and would not follow the teachings of the  _______ .
4.3.5.explanation: Brahmins would be criticized because of their inappropriate conduct- They would become arrogant, would start trading their knowledge and would not follow the teachings of the Vedas.

4.3.5.question: Similarly,  _______  would become cowards and a mere reference of battle would be enough to scare them.
4.3.5.explanation: Similarly, Kshatriyas would become cowards and a mere reference of battle would be enough to scare them.

4.3.6.question: A devotee must not forget to perform the rituals of ' _______ ' after taking his daily bath.
4.3.6.explanation: A devotee must not forget to perform the rituals of 'Tarpan' after taking his daily bath.

4.3.8.question: Subsequently, amidst the chanting of tenth, eleventh, twelfth and thirteen richas, flowers, incense, lighted  _______  and naivedya are offered to the deity respectively.
4.3.8.explanation: Subsequently, amidst the chanting of tenth, eleventh, twelfth and thirteen richas, flowers, incense, lighted lamp and naivedya are offered to the deity respectively.

4.3.8.question: With the chanting of third richa, Lord Vishnu's  _______  feet are washed after which 'ardhya' is offered with the holy water collected from all the seven seas and other holy rivers.
4.3.8.explanation: With the chanting of third richa, Lord Vishnu's lotus feet are washed after which 'ardhya' is offered with the holy water collected from all the seven seas and other holy rivers.

4.3.8.question: Once, on being asked by Narad about the proper methods of performing Shodash upachar rituals, lord Brahma said --'In normal circumstances, when lord Vishnu is worshipped by employing the rituals of Shodashopachar it is considered as ' _______ '.
4.3.8.explanation: Once, on being asked by Narad about the proper methods of performing Shodash upachar rituals, lord Brahma said --'In normal circumstances, when lord Vishnu is worshipped by employing the rituals of Shodashopachar it is considered as 'Tapa'.

4.4.2.question: Goddess Mahalaxmi replied--' Your wishes will be fulfilled in the coming nineteenth dwapar, when you would incarnate as Vyas and would contribute a great deal in the propagation of the Vedas and  _______ .
4.4.2.explanation: Goddess Mahalaxmi replied--' Your wishes will be fulfilled in the coming nineteenth dwapar, when you would incarnate as Vyas and would contribute a great deal in the propagation of the Vedas and Puranas.

4.4.2.question: Goddess Mahalaxmi replied--' Your wishes will be fulfilled in the coming nineteenth dwapar, when you would incarnate as Vyas and would contribute a great deal in the propagation of the  _______  and Puranas.
4.4.2.explanation: Goddess Mahalaxmi replied--' Your wishes will be fulfilled in the coming nineteenth dwapar, when you would incarnate as Vyas and would contribute a great deal in the propagation of the Vedas and Puranas.

4.4.3.question: It is capable of bestowing all the four 'Purusharth' to man- _______ , Arth, Kaam and Moksha.
4.4.3.explanation: It is capable of bestowing all the four 'Purusharth' to man-Dharma, Arth, Kaam and Moksha.

4.4.4.question: Kashi can never be attained to until and unless one has the blessing of  _______  mahadeva.
4.4.4.explanation: Kashi can never be attained to until and unless one has the blessing of Lord mahadeva.

4.4.5.question: Just as the  _______  is visible in the whole world despite its presence at a particular point in the horizon, in the same manner Kashi has its influence throughout the length and breadth of the world.
4.4.5.explanation: Just as the Sun is visible in the whole world despite its presence at a particular point in the horizon, in the same manner Kashi has its influence throughout the length and breadth of the world.

4.5.1.question: This place is very dear to Lord Shiva and is also called by various other names like Ekamrak- _______ , Mahakaal- _______  and Vimukti-kshetra.
4.5.1.explanation: This place is very dear to Lord Shiva and is also called by various other names like Ekamrak-van, Mahakaal-van and Vimukti-kshetra.

4.5.1.question: This place is very dear to Lord Shiva and is also called by various other names like Ekamrak- _______ , Mahakaal- _______  and Vimukti-kshetra.
4.5.1.explanation: This place is very dear to Lord Shiva and is also called by various other names like Ekamrak-van, Mahakaal-van and Vimukti-kshetra.

4.5.2.question: Lord Shiva told them-' The followers of  _______  were planning to kill you while you were busy doing penance but no one of you was aware of their evil motive.
4.5.2.explanation: Lord Shiva told them-' The followers of Maya were planning to kill you while you were busy doing penance but no one of you was aware of their evil motive.

4.5.3.question: Continuing with the tale which described the reason why Ujjainipuri also came to be known as Padmavati, Sanatkumar told Vyas-' During the time of ocean churning  _______  had also emerged from the ocean bed along with many other valuable things.
4.5.3.explanation: Continuing with the tale which described the reason why Ujjainipuri also came to be known as Padmavati, Sanatkumar told Vyas-' During the time of ocean churning ambrosia had also emerged from the ocean bed along with many other valuable things.

4.5.3.question: The demons wanted to drink  _______  so that they could become immortal but the deities were against this idea.
4.5.3.explanation: The demons wanted to drink ambrosia so that they could become immortal but the deities were against this idea.

4.5.3.question: But, hardly had Rahu gulped down  _______  and before it could reach down his throat, Vishnu severed his head.
4.5.3.explanation: But, hardly had Rahu gulped down Ambrosia and before it could reach down his throat, Vishnu severed his head.

4.5.3.question: Lord Vishnu was unable to recognize Rahu and gave some  _______  to him mistaking him to be a deity.
4.5.3.explanation: Lord Vishnu was unable to recognize Rahu and gave some ambrosia to him mistaking him to be a deity.

4.5.3.question: Finally, he started giving  _______  to the deities who after drinking it became immortal.
4.5.3.explanation: Finally, he started giving ambrosia to the deities who after drinking it became immortal.

4.5.3.question: Rahu's head became immortal as the result of  _______ 's influence.
4.5.3.explanation: Rahu's head became immortal as the result of ambrosia's influence.

4.5.5.question: _______  instructed Narmada to descend down to earth but she told him that she needed a base for that to happen.
4.5.5.explanation: Shiva instructed Narmada to descend down to earth but she told him that she needed a base for that to happen.

4.5.5.question: Later on, Pururva did an austere penance to please  _______ .
4.5.5.explanation: Later on, Pururva did an austere penance to please Shiva.

4.5.5.question: Explaining the reason why Narmada had to descend down to earth, Sutji narrated a tale to the assembled sages-' Once, sage markandeya was taking rest at the  _______  of river Narmada where Yudhisthira accompanied by Draupadi arrived there.
4.5.5.explanation: Explaining the reason why Narmada had to descend down to earth, Sutji narrated a tale to the assembled sages-' Once, sage markandeya was taking rest at the bank of river Narmada where Yudhisthira accompanied by Draupadi arrived there.

4.5.5.question: Yudhishthira curiously asked Markandeya about the reason he had chosen the  _______  of Narmada as his resting place when there were so many other holy places of greater significance.
4.5.5.explanation: Yudhishthira curiously asked Markandeya about the reason he had chosen the bank of Narmada as his resting place when there were so many other holy places of greater significance.

4.5.6.question: After getting married, Purutkutsu requested her to liberate his ancestors so that they could attain to  _______ .
4.5.6.explanation: After getting married, Purutkutsu requested her to liberate his ancestors so that they could attain to heaven.

4.5.6.question: Narmada readily obliged and this way Purutkutsu contributed in his ancestors' departure to  _______ .
4.5.6.explanation: Narmada readily obliged and this way Purutkutsu contributed in his ancestors' departure to heaven.

4.5.6.question: King Purutkutsu was Samudra in his previous birth and had been cursed by  _______ .
4.5.6.explanation: King Purutkutsu was Samudra in his previous birth and had been cursed by Brahma.

4.5.8.question: Markandeya told Yudhishthir-' Sage Jamdagni was a great devotee of  _______  and he lived in Narmadapur.
4.5.8.explanation: Markandeya told Yudhishthir-' Sage Jamdagni was a great devotee of Shiva and he lived in Narmadapur.

4.5.8.question: Ultimately,  _______  manifested himself from the Siddheshwar Linga and appeared before him.
4.5.8.explanation: Ultimately, Shiva manifested himself from the Siddheshwar Linga and appeared before him.

4.5.8.question: While the greedy king was still on his way, Kaamdhenu cursed him that very soon not only he but the whole caste of  _______  would be liquidated by Parshuram- Jamdagni's son, as punishment for having committed such a ghastly sin of killing an innocent sage.
4.5.8.explanation: While the greedy king was still on his way, Kaamdhenu cursed him that very soon not only he but the whole caste of Kshatriya would be liquidated by Parshuram- Jamdagni's son, as punishment for having committed such a ghastly sin of killing an innocent sage.

4.5.8.question: Later on, when Parshuram learnt of his father's slaying, he liquidated Kartaveerya and the whole caste of  _______  as had been prophesized by Kaamdhenu.
4.5.8.explanation: Later on, when Parshuram learnt of his father's slaying, he liquidated Kartaveerya and the whole caste of Kshatriya as had been prophesized by Kaamdhenu.

4.5.8.question: After cursing Kartaveerya, Kaamdhenu went to her original abode-the  _______ .
4.5.8.explanation: After cursing Kartaveerya, Kaamdhenu went to her original abode-the heaven.

4.6.1.question: Lord Brahma told him that it was just impossible for any mortal to attain to  _______  in his physical form but he added that if Trishanku performed the rituals diligently then he would certainly attain to  _______  after his death.
4.6.1.explanation: Lord Brahma told him that it was just impossible for any mortal to attain to heaven in his physical form but he added that if Trishanku performed the rituals diligently then he would certainly attain to heaven after his death.

4.6.1.question: Lord Brahma told him that it was just impossible for any mortal to attain to  _______  in his physical form but he added that if Trishanku performed the rituals diligently then he would certainly attain to  _______  after his death.
4.6.1.explanation: Lord Brahma told him that it was just impossible for any mortal to attain to heaven in his physical form but he added that if Trishanku performed the rituals diligently then he would certainly attain to heaven after his death.

4.6.1.question: So, he assured Trishanku that he had the requisite power to send anybody to  _______  and said- ' I shall help you perform a grand yagya, which would allow you to attain to the  _______  with your mortal body.
4.6.1.explanation: So, he assured Trishanku that he had the requisite power to send anybody to heaven and said- ' I shall help you perform a grand yagya, which would allow you to attain to the heaven with your mortal body.

4.6.1.question: So, he assured Trishanku that he had the requisite power to send anybody to  _______  and said- ' I shall help you perform a grand yagya, which would allow you to attain to the  _______  with your mortal body.
4.6.1.explanation: So, he assured Trishanku that he had the requisite power to send anybody to heaven and said- ' I shall help you perform a grand yagya, which would allow you to attain to the heaven with your mortal body.

4.6.1.question: He decided to go to Brahma loka to request Lord Brahma to be present at the Yagya which was to be performed for the success of Trishanku's departure to  _______ .
4.6.1.explanation: He decided to go to Brahma loka to request Lord Brahma to be present at the Yagya which was to be performed for the success of Trishanku's departure to heaven.

4.6.1.question: Sage Vashishth laughed at his naive query and told him that there was no such Yagya by performing which a man could go to the  _______  with his mortal body.
4.6.1.explanation: Sage Vashishth laughed at his naive query and told him that there was no such Yagya by performing which a man could go to the heaven with his mortal body.

4.6.1.question: One day, he asked sage Vashishth whether there was any such Yagya by performing which, he would be entitled to go to  _______  with his physical form.
4.6.1.explanation: One day, he asked sage Vashishth whether there was any such Yagya by performing which, he would be entitled to go to heaven with his physical form.

4.6.1.question: Vishwamitra did not like Brahma's words and challenged him that no power on earth could stop him from sending Trishanku to  _______ .
4.6.1.explanation: Vishwamitra did not like Brahma's words and challenged him that no power on earth could stop him from sending Trishanku to Heaven.

4.6.1.question: Vishwamitra was delighted as the first condition for Trishanku's departure to  _______  had been met.
4.6.1.explanation: Vishwamitra was delighted as the first condition for Trishanku's departure to Heaven had been met.

4.6.2.question: Trishanku became dejected and told him about his decision to renounce everything and spend rest of his life doing penance as chances of attaining to  _______  appeared impossible.
4.6.2.explanation: Trishanku became dejected and told him about his decision to renounce everything and spend rest of his life doing penance as chances of attaining to heaven appeared impossible.

4.6.2.question: This way, the yagya continued for twelve long years but still there was no sign of Vishwamitra's desire of sending Trishanku to  _______  getting fulfilled.
4.6.2.explanation: This way, the yagya continued for twelve long years but still there was no sign of Vishwamitra's desire of sending Trishanku to heaven getting fulfilled.

4.6.2.question: But, Vishwamitra consoled him and said--' No power on earth can stop you from going to  _______  with your physical form.
4.6.2.explanation: But, Vishwamitra consoled him and said--' No power on earth can stop you from going to heaven with your physical form.

4.6.2.question: Vishwamitra told him that he was ready to do that if Brahma helped Trishanku attain to  _______  with his mortal body.
4.6.2.explanation: Vishwamitra told him that he was ready to do that if Brahma helped Trishanku attain to heaven with his mortal body.

4.6.2.question: This way, Vishwamitra was able to send Trishanku physically to  _______  with the help of Lord Brahma.
4.6.2.explanation: This way, Vishwamitra was able to send Trishanku physically to heaven with the help of Lord Brahma.

4.6.2.question: He created Sun,  _______ , Stars, oceans, Rivers, so on and so forth.
4.6.2.explanation: He created Sun, Moon, Stars, oceans, Rivers, so on and so forth.

4.6.2.question: He created Sun, Moon,  _______ , oceans, Rivers, so on and so forth.
4.6.2.explanation: He created Sun, Moon, Stars, oceans, Rivers, so on and so forth.

4.6.2.question: He created  _______ , Moon, Stars, oceans, Rivers, so on and so forth.
4.6.2.explanation: He created Sun, Moon, Stars, oceans, Rivers, so on and so forth.

4.6.2.question: He created Sun, Moon, Stars, oceans,  _______ , so on and so forth.
4.6.2.explanation: He created Sun, Moon, Stars, oceans, Rivers, so on and so forth.

4.7.1.question: One of the chief characteristics of  _______  is that each of them is divided into five sections- 'Sarg' (Description of how creation began), 'Pratisarga', 'Vansh' (Description of prominent dynasties), 'Manvantar' and 'Vanshanucharit' (Tales related with the descendants of the famous sages).

4.7.1.question: Once, while describing the origin of  _______ , Sutji told the sages who had assembled at Naimisharanya-' Lord Shiva had first revealed the contents of Skanda puran to Parvati at Kailash Mountain.
4.7.1.explanation: Once, while describing the origin of puranas, Sutji told the sages who had assembled at Naimisharanya-' Lord Shiva had first revealed the contents of Skanda puran to Parvati at Kailash Mountain.

4.7.1.question: These Up-  _______  are - Sanat kumar, Narsimha, Skand, Shiva Dharma, Durvasa, Narad, Kapil, Manu, Ushana, Brahmand, Varun, Kalika, Maheshwar, Saamb, Saura, Parashar, Maarich and Bhargava.'

4.7.1.question: Satvik  _______  contain the tales of Lord Vishnu while Rajas  _______  contain the tales of Brahma and Tamas Purans contain the tales of Agni and Rudra.
4.7.1.explanation: Satvik Puranas contain the tales of Lord Vishnu while Rajas Puranas contain the tales of Brahma and Tamas Purans contain the tales of Agni and Rudra.

4.7.1.question: Satvik  _______  contain the tales of Lord Vishnu while Rajas  _______  contain the tales of Brahma and Tamas Purans contain the tales of Agni and Rudra.
4.7.1.explanation: Satvik Puranas contain the tales of Lord Vishnu while Rajas Puranas contain the tales of Brahma and Tamas Purans contain the tales of Agni and Rudra.

4.7.1.question: Sutji told the sages that all the Up-  _______  owe their origin to the main  _______  which are eighteen in number.
4.7.1.explanation: Sutji told the sages that all the Up- Puranas owe their origin to the main Puranas which are eighteen in number.

4.7.1.question: Sutji told the sages that all the Up-  _______  owe their origin to the main  _______  which are eighteen in number.
4.7.1.explanation: Sutji told the sages that all the Up- Puranas owe their origin to the main Puranas which are eighteen in number.

4.7.1.question: Later on, all the eighteen  _______  too appeared from his mouth.
4.7.1.explanation: Later on, all the eighteen Puranas too appeared from his mouth.

4.7.2.question: As the name implies, each area has been named after one God forming the  _______ .
4.7.2.explanation: As the name implies, each area has been named after one God forming the Trinity.

4.7.2.question: In the same way there is a beautiful temple of goddess Bhavani to the north of Prabhas kshetra and towards it's  _______  lies the ocean.
4.7.2.explanation: In the same way there is a beautiful temple of goddess Bhavani to the north of Prabhas kshetra and towards it's south lies the ocean.

4.7.2.question: One whom scholars of the  _______  call 'Kaalagni Rudra' is famously known as Bhairav in Prabhas kshetra.
4.7.2.explanation: One whom scholars of the Vedas call 'Kaalagni Rudra' is famously known as Bhairav in Prabhas kshetra.

4.7.4.question: Lord Shiva also revealed to Parvati that the next kalpa-  _______  in order would have Chaturmukh as Brahma and the divine Linga would be known as Pran Nath.Goddess Parvati then asked Shiva about the exact location of the Linga in Prabhas Kshetra.
4.7.4.explanation: Lord Shiva also revealed to Parvati that the next kalpa- eighth in order would have Chaturmukh as Brahma and the divine Linga would be known as Pran Nath.Goddess Parvati then asked Shiva about the exact location of the Linga in Prabhas Kshetra.

4.7.5.explanation: Anybody who worships this linga on the auspicious day of trayodashi of the bright half of the hindu month Chaitra attains virtues similar to the accomplishment of 'Pundareek Yagya'.

4.7.5.question: Your feats achieved in spiritual things will be unmatched and you would become famous as ' _______ charya' or teacher of  _______ .
4.7.5.explanation: Your feats achieved in spiritual things will be unmatched and you would become famous as 'Yogacharya' or teacher of Yoga.

4.7.8.question: The names of these sages were Hiranya,  _______ , Nyanku and Kapil.
4.7.8.explanation: The names of these sages were Hiranya, Vajra, Nyanku and Kapil.

4.7.8.explanation: As she reached Prabhas Kashetra, four learned sages, who were well versed in Vedas arrived there and invoked Saraswati to give them the privilege of separate bath by dividing herself in four different streams.

4.7.9.question: To the  _______  of Gandharveshwar temple is situated Vimaleshwar temple.
4.7.9.explanation: To the east of Gandharveshwar temple is situated Vimaleshwar temple.

4.7.9.question: He also gave names of some of the prominent Shiva lingas situated over there and said- ' To the  _______ -East of Somnath temple is situated a grand temple of lord Sarveshvar Deva, who is also famously known as Siddheshwar.
4.7.9.explanation: He also gave names of some of the prominent Shiva lingas situated over there and said- ' To the North-East of Somnath temple is situated a grand temple of lord Sarveshvar Deva, who is also famously known as Siddheshwar.

4.7.10.question: There they not only found Prahlad but also the most charitable king- _______ .
4.7.10.explanation: There they not only found Prahlad but also the most charitable king-Bali.

4.7.10.question: The ways shown by the Vedas are no longer in practice and the Brahmins are being tormented by the  _______ , who have become the rulers.
4.7.10.explanation: The ways shown by the Vedas are no longer in practice and the Brahmins are being tormented by the Shudras, who have become the rulers.

4.7.11.question: Prahlad, being an ardent devotee of Vishnu himself, understood quite well, the desperation with which a devotee seeks his  _______ .
4.7.11.explanation: Prahlad, being an ardent devotee of Vishnu himself, understood quite well, the desperation with which a devotee seeks his Lord.

4.7.11.question: They then remembered  _______  Brahma, who immediately understood what they desired.
4.7.11.explanation: They then remembered Lord Brahma, who immediately understood what they desired.

4.7.11.explanation: Lord Brahma instructed Ganga by saying-' Ganga!

4.7.11.explanation: Prahlad then switched over to the second part of the sages' question and said-' There is an interesting tale describing how sage Vashishth had brought down Gomti from the heaven to earth.

5.5.20.explanation: She then handed over the Vedas to the deities.

5.7.11.explanation: 'Sthiti' nyas should be practiced by the householders 'Utpatti nyas' should be practiced by the celibates 'Laya nyas' should be practiced by those people who have relinquished the world (Vanprasth).

6.2.1.explanation: DAKSHA PERFORMS A GRAND YAGYA Pulastya says- "This way, both Shiva and Sati lived above the clouds till the end of rainy season.

6.2.1.explanation: Daksha had organised a grand Yagya in which he had invited all the prominent deities and sages except his own son-in-law, Shankar and his daughter, Sati."

6.2.1.explanation: DAKSHA PERFORMS A GRAND YAGYA Pulastya says- "This way, both Shiva and Sati lived above the clouds till the end of rainy season.

6.2.1.question: Narad was surprised as to why Maheshwar- the lord of all  _______  was not invited by Daksha.
6.2.1.explanation: Narad was surprised as to why Maheshwar- the lord of all splendours was not invited by Daksha.

6.2.4.question: In the end, Kaal (epithet of  _______ ) was successful in killing the deer, which was Yagya in reality.
6.2.4.explanation: In the end, Kaal (epithet of Shiva) was successful in killing the deer, which was Yagya in reality.

6.2.4.explanation: Shiva's anger generated so much heat that it was enough to melt the eight Vasus.

6.3.1.explanation: Infuriated, Indra attacked him with his Vajra, which destroyed all of Andhak's weapons.

6.3.1.explanation: Indra's Vajra then chased Andhak who jumped down from his chariot to save his life.

6.3.2.question: "The Siddha's  _______  is to engage himself in activities like practice of Yoga, study of Vedas, self-realisation and devotion to both Lord Vishnu and Shiva", said the sages.
6.3.2.explanation: "The Siddha's Dharma is to engage himself in activities like practice of Yoga, study of Vedas, self-realisation and devotion to both Lord Vishnu and Shiva", said the sages.

6.3.2.question: In this way, the sages enlightened Sukeshi on the  _______  of different sections of divine entities.
6.3.2.explanation: In this way, the sages enlightened Sukeshi on the Dharma of different sections of divine entities.

6.3.2.question: The sages told him that a man could achieve benediction only by following the path of  _______ .
6.3.2.explanation: The sages told him that a man could achieve benediction only by following the path of Dharma.

6.3.2.question: "The  _______  of the demons consists of negative qualities like jealousy etc.
6.3.2.explanation: "The Dharma of the demons consists of negative qualities like jealousy etc.

6.3.2.question: Sukeshi then asked them about the characteristics of  _______ .
6.3.2.explanation: Sukeshi then asked them about the characteristics of Dharma.

6.3.2.question: So, all these activities are the  _______  of the deities.
6.3.2.explanation: So, all these activities are the Dharma of the deities.

6.3.3.question: The sages replied- "People who condemn Veda, deities,  _______  etc.
6.3.3.explanation: The sages replied- "People who condemn Veda, deities, Brahmins etc.

6.3.3.explanation: The sages replied- "People who condemn Veda, deities, Brahmins etc.

6.3.4.explanation: The seven prominent mountains situated within Bharatvarsh are Mahendra, Malay, Sahya, Shukti, Maanriksh, Vindhya and Paariyaatra though there are many more mountains.

6.3.5.question: A  _______ 's life is categorised into four Ashrams- Brahmacharya, Grihastha, Vanprastha and Sanyaas.
6.3.5.explanation: A Brahmin's life is categorised into four Ashrams- Brahmacharya, Grihastha, Vanprastha and Sanyaas.

6.3.5.question: The sages say- " _______  consists of ten properties such as non-violence, truth, charity, not stealing the property of others, forgiveness, self-restraint, cleanliness etc.
6.3.5.explanation: The sages say- "Dharma consists of ten properties such as non-violence, truth, charity, not stealing the property of others, forgiveness, self-restraint, cleanliness etc.

6.3.6.question: Now it became very difficult to determine when the  _______  rose.
6.3.6.explanation: Now it became very difficult to determine when the Sun rose.

6.3.6.question: Its illumination even subdued the radiance of Surya ( _______ ).
6.3.6.explanation: Its illumination even subdued the radiance of Surya (Sun).

6.4.1.question: Four sons were born to them- Hari, Krishna,  _______  and  _______ yan.
6.4.1.explanation: Four sons were born to them- Hari, Krishna, Nara and Narayan.

6.4.1.question: Hari and Krishna engaged themselves in the practice of  _______  while Nar and Narayan went to the Himalaya Mountain and started doing penance for the welfare of humans.
6.4.1.explanation: Hari and Krishna engaged themselves in the practice of Yoga while Nar and Narayan went to the Himalaya Mountain and started doing penance for the welfare of humans.

6.4.1.question: Sage Pulastya says- " _______ , the possessor of divine body and who manifested from the heart of Lord Brahma married Murti, the daughter of Daksha.
6.4.1.explanation: Sage Pulastya says- "Dharma, the possessor of divine body and who manifested from the heart of Lord Brahma married Murti, the daughter of Daksha.

6.5.explanation: Pulastya says- "Lotus flower manifested from Vishnu's navel in the month of Ashwin.

6.6.1.question: In due course of time, the  _______  gave birth to a beautiful calf, which could change its appearance according to its wishes.
6.6.1.explanation: In due course of time, the buffalo gave birth to a beautiful calf, which could change its appearance according to its wishes.

6.6.1.question: The  _______  got aroused and forced Rambh to copulate with her and this resulted in the  _______ 's pregnancy.
6.6.1.explanation: The buffalo got aroused and forced Rambh to copulate with her and this resulted in the buffalo's pregnancy.

6.6.1.question: The  _______  got aroused and forced Rambh to copulate with her and this resulted in the  _______ 's pregnancy.
6.6.1.explanation: The buffalo got aroused and forced Rambh to copulate with her and this resulted in the buffalo's pregnancy.

6.6.1.question: The  _______  too decided to embrace death by jumping into the burning pyre.
6.6.1.explanation: The buffalo too decided to embrace death by jumping into the burning pyre.

6.6.1.question: He drove away all the Yakshas and killed the  _______  but spared her calf.
6.6.1.explanation: He drove away all the Yakshas and killed the buffalo but spared her calf.

6.6.1.question: Once, seeing the  _______  alone, a bull tried to breach her modesty.
6.6.1.explanation: Once, seeing the buffalo alone, a bull tried to breach her modesty.

6.6.1.question: Seeing the dead Rambh, the  _______  became engulfed in sorrow.
6.6.1.explanation: Seeing the dead Rambh, the buffalo became engulfed in sorrow.

6.6.1.question: Rambh returned to Paatal loka accompanied by the  _______ .
6.6.1.explanation: Rambh returned to Paatal loka accompanied by the buffalo.

6.6.1.question: Rambh saw a beautiful  _______  in the cowshed.
6.6.1.explanation: Rambh saw a beautiful buffalo in the cowshed.

6.6.1.question: The  _______  ran towards Rambh for her safety.
6.6.1.explanation: The buffalo ran towards Rambh for her safety.

6.6.1.question: The tale behind this curse is as follows- In the ancient times, Vindhya Mountain was so high that it became very difficult for the  _______  to make its movement.
6.6.1.explanation: The tale behind this curse is as follows- In the ancient times, Vindhya Mountain was so high that it became very difficult for the Sun to make its movement.

6.6.1.question: The  _______  went to sage Agastya and requested him to minimise the size of Vindhya Mountain.
6.6.1.explanation: The Sun went to sage Agastya and requested him to minimise the size of Vindhya Mountain.

6.6.1.question: This way, sage Agastya solved the problem of the  _______ .
6.6.1.explanation: This way, sage Agastya solved the problem of the Sun.

6.6.1.question: He had defeated all the deities including Indra, Rudra, Surya and  _______ .
6.6.1.explanation: He had defeated all the deities including Indra, Rudra, Surya and Marut.

6.6.1.question: All the deities, Siddhas,  _______ , Apsaras etc.
6.6.1.explanation: All the deities, Siddhas, Nagas, Apsaras etc.

6.6.2.question: He is  _______  of all the three worlds and is invincible but this victorious and mighty king has been enslaved by your beauty.
6.6.2.explanation: He is lord of all the three worlds and is invincible but this victorious and mighty king has been enslaved by your beauty.

6.6.2.question: Dundubhi went to Goddess Durga and boasted about Mahishasura's might and power by saying- "The mighty Mahishasura has defeated all the deities who ran out from  _______  to save their lives.
6.6.2.explanation: Dundubhi went to Goddess Durga and boasted about Mahishasura's might and power by saying- "The mighty Mahishasura has defeated all the deities who ran out from heaven to save their lives.

6.6.2.question: The  _______  refused by saying- "No demon can stand before me in a battle."
6.6.2.explanation: The Goddess refused by saying- "No demon can stand before me in a battle."

6.6.4.question: Lord Vishnu told them- "During the initial phase of Satya Yuga, there was a mighty king named Riksh, who was the descendant of  _______ .
6.6.4.explanation: Lord Vishnu told them- "During the initial phase of Satya Yuga, there was a mighty king named Riksh, who was the descendant of Soma.

6.7.question: When  _______  revealed his intentions, Lord Vishnu was surprised and wondered as to from where he would get the seeds to grow these things.
6.7.explanation: When Kuru revealed his intentions, Lord Vishnu was surprised and wondered as to from where he would get the seeds to grow these things.

6.7.question: _______  told him that all these eight virtues were present in his own body and it would not be a difficult task to cultivate these things.
6.7.explanation: Kuru told him that all these eight virtues were present in his own body and it would not be a difficult task to cultivate these things.

6.7.question: All the pieces were distributed among the deities but  _______  was unfazed and again stretched his left hand towards Lord Vishnu.
6.7.explanation: All the pieces were distributed among the deities but Kuru was unfazed and again stretched his left hand towards Lord Vishnu.

6.7.question: After becoming the king,  _______  ruled his subjects in a just manner but very soon he got bored of his monotonous life.
6.7.explanation: After becoming the king, Kuru ruled his subjects in a just manner but very soon he got bored of his monotonous life.

6.7.question: _______  outstretched his right hand but Lord Vishnu cut it into thousands of pieces with his chakra.
6.7.explanation: Kuru outstretched his right hand but Lord Vishnu cut it into thousands of pieces with his chakra.

6.7.question: In this way, the most generous and benevolent King  _______  offered all his organs to Lord Vishnu.
6.7.explanation: In this way, the most generous and benevolent King Kuru offered all his organs to Lord Vishnu.

6.7.question: _______  replied- "All the area cultivated by me should become famous as a sacred pilgrimage.
6.7.explanation: Kuru replied- "All the area cultivated by me should become famous as a sacred pilgrimage.

6.7.question: When  _______  revealed his intentions, Indra made fun of him and went back.
6.7.explanation: When Kuru revealed his intentions, Indra made fun of him and went back.

6.7.question: At last,  _______  offered his head as he had nothing else to offer.
6.7.explanation: At last, Kuru offered his head as he had nothing else to offer.

6.7.question: But  _______  was not worried and continued to cultivate the land.
6.7.explanation: But Kuru was not worried and continued to cultivate the land.

6.7.question: With the objective of making his name immortal, he went to the most sacred place called Samantpanchak and decided to cultivate the eight virtues -  _______ , Satya, Kshama, Daya, Shauch, Daan, Yuga and Brahmacharya on its barren land.
6.7.explanation: With the objective of making his name immortal, he went to the most sacred place called Samantpanchak and decided to cultivate the eight virtues - Tapa, Satya, Kshama, Daya, Shauch, Daan, Yuga and Brahmacharya on its barren land.

6.7.question: With the objective of making his name  _______ , he went to the most sacred place called Samantpanchak and decided to cultivate the eight virtues - Tapa, Satya, Kshama, Daya, Shauch, Daan, Yuga and Brahmacharya on its barren land.
6.7.explanation: With the objective of making his name immortal, he went to the most sacred place called Samantpanchak and decided to cultivate the eight virtues - Tapa, Satya, Kshama, Daya, Shauch, Daan, Yuga and Brahmacharya on its barren land.

6.7.question: He knew that only those kings became  _______  who accomplished amazing feats.
6.7.explanation: He knew that only those kings became immortal who accomplished amazing feats.

6.7.question: After growing up, he mastered all the four  _______  and other scriptures within a very short period.
6.7.explanation: After growing up, he mastered all the four Vedas and other scriptures within a very short period.

6.8.question: This chapter contains 7 sections: Lomaharshan told the sages- " _______  was the descendant of Virochan and the son of Hiranyakashipu.
6.8.explanation: This chapter contains 7 sections: Lomaharshan told the sages- "Bali was the descendant of Virochan and the son of Hiranyakashipu.

6.8.question: This way,  _______  acquired all the splendours of the world.
6.8.explanation: This way, Bali acquired all the splendours of the world.

6.8.1.question: Lomaharshan replied- "After being defeated by  _______ , Indra went to Meru Mountain where his mother Aditi lived and narrated the woeful tale of the deities' defeat.
6.8.1.explanation: Lomaharshan replied- "After being defeated by Bali, Indra went to Meru Mountain where his mother Aditi lived and narrated the woeful tale of the deities' defeat.

6.8.1.question: The sages asked- "How were the deities able to defeat  _______  and why did Lord Vishnu take the incarnation of Vaaman?"
6.8.1.explanation: The sages asked- "How were the deities able to defeat Bali and why did Lord Vishnu take the incarnation of Vaaman?"

6.8.1.question: When they reached there, they found numerous  _______  engaged in religious activities.
6.8.1.explanation: When they reached there, they found numerous Brahmins engaged in religious activities.

6.8.2.question: He was of the opinion that the mighty  _______  could be defeated only by the Almighty himself and nobody else.
6.8.2.explanation: He was of the opinion that the mighty Bali could be defeated only by the Almighty himself and nobody else.

6.8.2.question: Its boundary seemed limitless and even the  _______ 's rays could not reach it.
6.8.2.explanation: Its boundary seemed limitless and even the Sun's rays could not reach it.

6.8.5.question: Prahlad was surprised but the next moment he controlled himself and told  _______ - "Now I know the reason why the demons have become devoid of their radiance and power.
6.8.5.explanation: Prahlad was surprised but the next moment he controlled himself and told Bali- "Now I know the reason why the demons have become devoid of their radiance and power.

6.8.5.question: Lomaharshan says- "When  _______  saw the demons becoming devoid of radiance and power, he enquired about the reasons from his grandfather, Prahlad.
6.8.5.explanation: Lomaharshan says- "When Bali saw the demons becoming devoid of radiance and power, he enquired about the reasons from his grandfather, Prahlad.

6.8.5.question: Prahlad became furious at  _______ 's utterances and cursed him by saying- "How dare you say like this!
6.8.5.explanation: Prahlad became furious at Bali's utterances and cursed him by saying- "How dare you say like this!

6.8.5.explanation: Bali curiously asked Prahlad- "Who is this Hari, the tormentor of the demons?

6.8.6.question: _______  felt sorry for hurting Prahlad's feelings.
6.8.6.explanation: Bali felt sorry for hurting Prahlad's feelings.

6.8.7.question: _______  was surprised by this demand and requested him to ask for more land but Lord Vaaman told him that he needed only that much land.
6.8.7.explanation: Bali was surprised by this demand and requested him to ask for more land but Lord Vaaman told him that he needed only that much land.

6.8.7.question: Lomaharshan says- "The shaking and trembling of earth surprised  _______  and he enquired about this strange happening to Shukracharya.
6.8.7.explanation: Lomaharshan says- "The shaking and trembling of earth surprised Bali and he enquired about this strange happening to Shukracharya.

6.8.7.question: He informed  _______  that Vaaman was on his way to the oblation site and his each step was causing turbulence on the earth.
6.8.7.explanation: He informed Bali that Vaaman was on his way to the oblation site and his each step was causing turbulence on the earth.

6.8.7.question: Lord Vishnu then made Indra, the king of all the three worlds and sent  _______  to the nether world named Sutal.
6.8.7.explanation: Lord Vishnu then made Indra, the king of all the three worlds and sent Bali to the nether world named Sutal.

6.8.7.question: _______  was pleased that he would get an opportunity to see the Almighty God whom the sages contemplate upon.
6.8.7.explanation: Bali was pleased that he would get an opportunity to see the Almighty God whom the sages contemplate upon.

6.8.7.question: As the conversation between Shukracharya and  _______  continued, suddenly, Lord Vaaman arrived at the site.
6.8.7.explanation: As the conversation between Shukracharya and Bali continued, suddenly, Lord Vaaman arrived at the site.

6.8.7.question: Shukracharya aware of the reason for Vaaman's arrival warned  _______  against making any promise to him.
6.8.7.explanation: Shukracharya aware of the reason for Vaaman's arrival warned Bali against making any promise to him.

6.8.7.question: He blessed  _______  by saying- "You would enjoy a long life till the end of this present Kalpa.
6.8.7.explanation: He blessed Bali by saying- "You would enjoy a long life till the end of this present Kalpa.

6.8.7.question: This way,  _______  was forced to donate all the three worlds according to his vow.
6.8.7.explanation: This way, Bali was forced to donate all the three worlds according to his vow.

6.8.7.question: _______  replied- "How can I refuse if the Almighty God demands anything from me?
6.8.7.explanation: Bali replied- "How can I refuse if the Almighty God demands anything from me?

6.8.7.question: _______  agreed and took a vow to donate a piece of land measured by three steps.
6.8.7.explanation: Bali agreed and took a vow to donate a piece of land measured by three steps.

6.8.7.question: Hardly had  _______  taken his vow, when suddenly Lord Vaaman expanded his size.
6.8.7.explanation: Hardly had Bali taken his vow, when suddenly Lord Vaaman expanded his size.

6.8.7.question: _______  eulogised and worshipped his esteemed guest.
6.8.7.explanation: Bali eulogised and worshipped his esteemed guest.

6.8.7.question: As long as you remain supportive of the  _______  and the deities, you would enjoy all the pleasures of life.
6.8.7.explanation: As long as you remain supportive of the Brahmins and the deities, you would enjoy all the pleasures of life.

6.9.explanation: While describing about her majesty, sage Markandeya felt that Saraswati was the source from, which everything originated- all the three worlds, three Vedas, Vidya (learning), heavenly bodies like Sun, Moon etc.

6.9.explanation: While describing about her majesty, sage Markandeya felt that Saraswati was the source from, which everything originated- all the three worlds, three Vedas, Vidya (learning), heavenly bodies like Sun, Moon etc.

6.9.explanation: While describing about her majesty, sage Markandeya felt that Saraswati was the source from, which everything originated- all the three worlds, three Vedas, Vidya (learning), heavenly bodies like Sun, Moon etc.

6.9.question: Saraswati was pleased by his devotion and said- "O  _______ !
6.9.explanation: Saraswati was pleased by his devotion and said- "O Brahmin!

6.12.2.question: But, this was not the case with the demons, who lived happily at the  _______  of river Saraswati thriving on the blood mixed in her water.
6.12.2.explanation: But, this was not the case with the demons, who lived happily at the bank of river Saraswati thriving on the blood mixed in her water.

6.12.2.question: One day, some sages arrived at the  _______  of river Saraswati and became distressed after seeing her water mixed with blood.
6.12.2.explanation: One day, some sages arrived at the bank of river Saraswati and became distressed after seeing her water mixed with blood.

6.12.2.question: Saraswati became scared and carried Vashishth to safety as she did not want to acquire the sin of collaborating in the killing of a  _______ .
6.12.2.explanation: Saraswati became scared and carried Vashishth to safety as she did not want to acquire the sin of collaborating in the killing of a Brahmin.

6.12.2.explanation: They used to live happily- dancing and rejoicing, as if they had won the heaven from the deities.

6.12.3.explanation: When Saraswati saw such a large gathering of Brahmins, desirous of having bath in her holy waters, she created a garden (Kunj) and started flowing towards west.

6.12.4.explanation: All the three major castes (Brahmin, Kshatriya and Vaishya) originated from that tree.

6.12.4.explanation: All the three major castes (Brahmin, Kshatriya and Vaishya) originated from that tree.

6.14.1.question: Indra said- "If things continue like this then the  _______  will be dominated by mortals and we will have no option but to move out from there.
6.14.1.explanation: Indra said- "If things continue like this then the heaven will be dominated by mortals and we will have no option but to move out from there.

6.14.1.question: In course of time, the  _______  became crowded with human beings due to virtues attained by going on pilgrimages to Sthanu Tirtha.
6.14.1.explanation: In course of time, the heaven became crowded with human beings due to virtues attained by going on pilgrimages to Sthanu Tirtha.

6.14.1.question: But still Indra's objective remained unfulfilled as Lord Shiva lifted Sthanu Linga and Tirtha Vata ( _______  tree) in his hands.
6.14.1.explanation: But still Indra's objective remained unfulfilled as Lord Shiva lifted Sthanu Linga and Tirtha Vata (Banyan tree) in his hands.

6.14.2.question: By the side of that  _______  tree (Vata Tirtha) is situated- Bateshwar Linga, which was established by Lord Brahma.
6.14.2.explanation: By the side of that Banyan tree (Vata Tirtha) is situated- Bateshwar Linga, which was established by Lord Brahma.

6.14.3.question: He was wicked and always criticised the  _______ .
6.14.3.explanation: He was wicked and always criticised the Vedas.

6.14.4.question: After blessing Prithu, Ven departed for  _______ .
6.14.4.explanation: After blessing Prithu, Ven departed for heaven.

6.14.4.question: Due to the sins acquired by criticising the  _______ , he would be born in the family of the notorious demon Hiranyaaksh."
6.14.4.explanation: Due to the sins acquired by criticising the Vedas, he would be born in the family of the notorious demon Hiranyaaksh."

6.14.4.question: He performed many religious activities and gave unlimited donations to the  _______ .
6.14.4.explanation: He performed many religious activities and gave unlimited donations to the Brahmins.

6.16.question: Vrihaspati agreed to do that and entered into the Mrigshira Nakshatra along with the  _______  and the Moon on Akshay Tritiya.
6.16.explanation: Vrihaspati agreed to do that and entered into the Mrigshira Nakshatra along with the Sun and the Moon on Akshay Tritiya.

6.16.explanation: The day on which Moon, Sun and Jupiter unitedly come under Mrigshira Nakshatra is called Akshay Tritiya.

6.16.explanation: Vrihaspati agreed to do that and entered into the Mrigshira Nakshatra along with the Sun and the Moon on Akshay Tritiya.

6.16.question: The day on which  _______ , Sun and Jupiter unitedly come under Mrigshira Nakshatra is called Akshay Tritiya.
6.16.explanation: The day on which Moon, Sun and Jupiter unitedly come under Mrigshira Nakshatra is called Akshay Tritiya.

6.17.1.question: Reacting to her mother's advises,  _______  pronounced 'U' 'Ma' and as a result she was named Uma by her mother.
6.17.1.explanation: Reacting to her mother's advises, Kali pronounced 'U' 'Ma' and as a result she was named Uma by her mother.

6.17.1.question: The youngest daughter-  _______  was dark complexioned and had beautiful eyes like the petals of blue lotus.
6.17.1.explanation: The youngest daughter- Kali was dark complexioned and had beautiful eyes like the petals of blue lotus.

6.17.1.question: After losing her two daughters, Mena tried to dissuade  _______  from doing penance.
6.17.1.explanation: After losing her two daughters, Mena tried to dissuade Kali from doing penance.

6.17.1.question: But  _______  was not to listen.
6.17.1.explanation: But Kali was not to listen.

6.17.1.question: The youngest daughter- Kali was dark complexioned and had beautiful eyes like the petals of blue  _______ .
6.17.1.explanation: The youngest daughter- Kali was dark complexioned and had beautiful eyes like the petals of blue lotus.

6.17.1.question: Kutila was fair complexioned and had beautiful eyes like that of  _______  petals.
6.17.1.explanation: Kutila was fair complexioned and had beautiful eyes like that of lotus petals.

6.17.1.question: _______  and the Vasu Ganas took Kutila to Brahma loka and asked Lord Brahma- "O lord!
6.17.1.explanation: Aditya and the Vasu Ganas took Kutila to Brahma loka and asked Lord Brahma- "O lord!

6.17.2.question: They said- " _______  would marry your daughter on Maitra Muhurta- the third day from today when the Moon will enter the Uttar Phalguni Nakshatra."
6.17.2.explanation: They said- "Shiva would marry your daughter on Maitra Muhurta- the third day from today when the Moon will enter the Uttar Phalguni Nakshatra."

6.17.2.explanation: The dead ancestors gave Uma to me on the condition that I would get her married with Shiva.
