7.3.3.question: Those who enjoyed carnal intimacy during daytime or had illicit relations with women are hammered with nails to a prickly  _______  tree.
7.3.3.explanation: Those who enjoyed carnal intimacy during daytime or had illicit relations with women are hammered with nails to a prickly Bombax tree.

7.3.4.question: _______  said- ' Though your pious actions are fathomless, be sure that their significance are not much than drops of water in an ocean, the stars in the sky.
7.3.4.explanation: Dharma said- ' Though your pious actions are fathomless, be sure that their significance are not much than drops of water in an ocean, the stars in the sky.

7.3.4.question: Look,  _______  and Indra have themselves arrived to escort you to the heaven. '
7.3.4.explanation: Look, Dharma and Indra have themselves arrived to escort you to the heaven. '

7.3.4.question: Thus a person has to face the result of his  _______  according to the gravity of his sins.
7.3.4.explanation: Thus a person has to face the result of his Karma according to the gravity of his sins.

7.3.4.question: A  _______  who carries out Yagya for a degraded person takes birth as worm after undergoing severe sufferings in different types of hell.
7.3.4.explanation: A Brahmin who carries out Yagya for a degraded person takes birth as worm after undergoing severe sufferings in different types of hell.

7.3.4.question: Yamadoot says- As a result of accepting money from a degraded person, a  _______  takes birth as an ass.
7.3.4.explanation: Yamadoot says- As a result of accepting money from a degraded person, a Brahmin takes birth as an ass.

7.3.4.question: A Shudra, who manages to establish intimacy with a  _______  woman, takes birth as a worm.
7.3.4.explanation: A Shudra, who manages to establish intimacy with a Brahmin woman, takes birth as a worm.

7.3.4.question: Look, Dharma and Indra have themselves arrived to escort you to the  _______ . '
7.3.4.explanation: Look, Dharma and Indra have themselves arrived to escort you to the heaven. '

7.3.4.question: Hence follow me to the  _______ .'
7.3.4.explanation: Hence follow me to the heaven.'

7.3.4.question: A Brahmin who carries out Yagya for a degraded person takes birth as worm after undergoing severe sufferings in different types of  _______ .
7.3.4.explanation: A Brahmin who carries out Yagya for a degraded person takes birth as worm after undergoing severe sufferings in different types of hell.

7.3.4.question: Sumati says- As Yamadoot began to push the king ahead, all the creatures in  _______  gave a loud cry- 'O king!
7.3.4.explanation: Sumati says- As Yamadoot began to push the king ahead, all the creatures in hell gave a loud cry- 'O king!

7.3.4.question: The king replied- 'No, I will not go anywhere leaving these thousands of people in the  _______ .'
7.3.4.explanation: The king replied- 'No, I will not go anywhere leaving these thousands of people in the hell.'

7.3.4.question: A  _______ , who manages to establish intimacy with a Brahmin woman, takes birth as a worm.
7.3.4.explanation: A Shudra, who manages to establish intimacy with a Brahmin woman, takes birth as a worm.

7.4.3.question: In course of time, two sons of Ashwatar, the king of Nagas became his friends in the guise of  _______  boys.
7.4.3.explanation: In course of time, two sons of Ashwatar, the king of Nagas became his friends in the guise of Brahmin boys.

7.4.3.question: King Shatrujit saw his son Ritudhwaj off with the  _______  riding that divine horse.
7.4.3.explanation: King Shatrujit saw his son Ritudhwaj off with the Brahmin riding that divine horse.

7.4.3.question: A  _______  named Gaalav lived in King Shatrujit's kingdom.
7.4.3.explanation: A Brahmin named Gaalav lived in King Shatrujit's kingdom.

7.4.3.question: I heard a heavenly voice, which said- 'O  _______ !
7.4.3.explanation: I heard a heavenly voice, which said- 'O Brahmin!

7.4.3.question: Now listen to the tale of a  _______  named Alark.
7.4.3.explanation: Now listen to the tale of a Brahmin named Alark.

7.4.3.question: In course of time, two sons of Ashwatar, the king of  _______  became his friends in the guise of Brahmin boys.
7.4.3.explanation: In course of time, two sons of Ashwatar, the king of Nagas became his friends in the guise of Brahmin boys.

7.4.3.question: Disguising as an elephant, lion,  _______ , wolf and many other wild animals, he terrorises me.
7.4.3.explanation: Disguising as an elephant, lion, tiger, wolf and many other wild animals, he terrorises me.

7.4.3.question: Disguising as an elephant, lion, tiger,  _______  and many other wild animals, he terrorises me.
7.4.3.explanation: Disguising as an elephant, lion, tiger, wolf and many other wild animals, he terrorises me.

7.4.5.question: One day he noticed that a sage was staying at the  _______  of river Yamuna.
7.4.5.explanation: One day he noticed that a sage was staying at the bank of river Yamuna.

7.4.5.question: The newly-wed couple had hardly spent few months together when King Shatrujit once again instructed Ritudhwaj to travel across the entire earth and see whether the  _______  were performing their religious duties without any obstacles.
7.4.5.explanation: The newly-wed couple had hardly spent few months together when King Shatrujit once again instructed Ritudhwaj to travel across the entire earth and see whether the Brahmins were performing their religious duties without any obstacles.

7.4.6.question: Ashwatar organised a Shraadh in the same way as told by the  _______  and consumed the middle portion of the food offered to the ancestors.
7.4.6.explanation: Ashwatar organised a Shraadh in the same way as told by the Lord and consumed the middle portion of the food offered to the ancestors.

7.4.6.question: Saying this, Naagraj Ashwatar reached Plakshaavataran, a place of pilgrimage at the foothills of  _______  along with his brother Kambal.
7.4.6.explanation: Saying this, Naagraj Ashwatar reached Plakshaavataran, a place of pilgrimage at the foothills of Himalayas along with his brother Kambal.

7.5.1.question: Performing Yagya for others, teaching and accepting donation are the three vocations of  _______ .
7.5.1.explanation: Performing Yagya for others, teaching and accepting donation are the three vocations of Brahmin.

7.5.1.question: Madalasa says- 'Donation, study and Yagya, these three are the religion of a  _______ .
7.5.1.explanation: Madalasa says- 'Donation, study and Yagya, these three are the religion of a Brahmin.

7.5.1.question: Donation, study and Yagya are also the religious duties of  _______ .
7.5.1.explanation: Donation, study and Yagya are also the religious duties of Kshatriyas.

7.5.1.question: Protection of land and using weapons are vocation for  _______ .
7.5.1.explanation: Protection of land and using weapons are vocation for Kshatriyas.

7.5.1.question: Serving all these three above mentioned castes as well as making donations and performing Yagya are the religious duties of a  _______ .
7.5.1.explanation: Serving all these three above mentioned castes as well as making donations and performing Yagya are the religious duties of a Shudra.

7.5.1.question: Tilling the earth, serving Brahmins, feeding animals, selling and purchasing items are professions of a  _______ .
7.5.1.explanation: Tilling the earth, serving Brahmins, feeding animals, selling and purchasing items are professions of a Shudra.

7.5.1.question: At the completion of education, he should pay Dakshina to his  _______ .
7.5.1.explanation: At the completion of education, he should pay Dakshina to his Guru.

7.5.1.question: There he is expected to serve the  _______  sincerely.
7.5.1.explanation: There he is expected to serve the Guru sincerely.

7.5.2.question: Sacrifice to Brahmaji should be offered in the central part of the home, to Vishwadeva in the eastern side of the home, to Dhanvantari in the northern side, to Indra again in the eastern side, to Yama in the southern side, to Varun in the western side and to  _______  in the northern side of the home.
7.5.2.explanation: Sacrifice to Brahmaji should be offered in the central part of the home, to Vishwadeva in the eastern side of the home, to Dhanvantari in the northern side, to Indra again in the eastern side, to Yama in the southern side, to Varun in the western side and to Soma in the northern side of the home.

7.5.2.question: Entire universe is reflected in this  _______ .
7.5.2.explanation: Entire universe is reflected in this Ashram.

7.5.2.question: All the four  _______  are present in this 'cow' that is Grihasthashram.
7.5.2.explanation: All the four Vedas are present in this 'cow' that is Grihasthashram.

7.5.2.question: If possible, a Grihastha should feed one or more  _______  in order to pacify his ancestors.
7.5.2.explanation: If possible, a Grihastha should feed one or more Brahmins in order to pacify his ancestors.

7.5.2.question: Those people who discharge their duties as a householder by fostering all the living beings attain to the  _______  automatically.
7.5.2.explanation: Those people who discharge their duties as a householder by fostering all the living beings attain to the heaven automatically.

7.6.1.question: After a year, Shraadh is organised in which one, three or five  _______  are fed.
7.6.1.explanation: After a year, Shraadh is organised in which one, three or five Brahmins are fed.

7.6.1.question: Then he should circumambulate around two  _______  and worship them.
7.6.1.explanation: Then he should circumambulate around two Brahmins and worship them.

7.6.1.question: During the Shraadh, the host should sit facing the north or the east and offer a loaf made of barley flour and  _______ .
7.6.1.explanation: During the Shraadh, the host should sit facing the north or the east and offer a loaf made of barley flour and yoghurt.

7.6.1.question: Donation of 'Pind' comprising of barley flour,  _______ , honey etc.
7.6.1.explanation: Donation of 'Pind' comprising of barley flour, yoghurt, honey etc.

7.6.1.question: Donation of 'Pind' comprising of barley flour, yoghurt,  _______  etc.
7.6.1.explanation: Donation of 'Pind' comprising of barley flour, yoghurt, honey etc.

7.6.1.question: The time when the  _______  crosses the equator during its northward and southward journey is also good for Shraadh.
7.6.1.explanation: The time when the Sun crosses the equator during its northward and southward journey is also good for Shraadh.

7.6.1.question: Every month, during the waning phase of the  _______  or on the day of Amavasya, Shraadh should be carried out.
7.6.1.explanation: Every month, during the waning phase of the Moon or on the day of Amavasya, Shraadh should be carried out.

7.6.1.question: Then sitting on the seat of Kusha grass, the host should offer a Pind made of  _______  seeds, barley flour, sugar, ghee etc.
7.6.1.explanation: Then sitting on the seat of Kusha grass, the host should offer a Pind made of sesame seeds, barley flour, sugar, ghee etc.

7.6.1.question: While reciting the Rakshodhn mantra, grains of  _______  and mustard should be scattered on the ground.
7.6.1.explanation: While reciting the Rakshodhn mantra, grains of sesame and mustard should be scattered on the ground.

7.6.1.question: Then oblation of water with  _______  seeds should be offered in the name of the dead person.
7.6.1.explanation: Then oblation of water with sesame seeds should be offered in the name of the dead person.

7.6.1.question: It is said that such a man, who indulges in sexual intercourse on the same day after carrying out Shraadh or eating food of Shraadh, causes his dead ancestors to sleep in  _______  for one month.
7.6.1.explanation: It is said that such a man, who indulges in sexual intercourse on the same day after carrying out Shraadh or eating food of Shraadh, causes his dead ancestors to sleep in semen for one month.

7.6.1.question: Ancestors of such a man, who performs Shraadh immediately after having a sexual intercourse, drink urine and  _______  for one month.
7.6.1.explanation: Ancestors of such a man, who performs Shraadh immediately after having a sexual intercourse, drink urine and semen for one month.

7.6.2.question: Different varieties of rice, barley, millet, wheat,  _______ , moong dal, mustard etc.
7.6.2.explanation: Different varieties of rice, barley, millet, wheat, sesame, moong dal, mustard etc.

7.6.2.question: This is the reason why  _______  seeds are scattered at the site of Shraadh secretly.
7.6.2.explanation: This is the reason why sesame seeds are scattered at the site of Shraadh secretly.

7.6.2.question: These include cereals like barley, wheat, rice, millet, corn, etc., fish, flesh of deer, rabbit, bird, wild boar, goat and Neelgai ( _______ ).
7.6.2.explanation: These include cereals like barley, wheat, rice, millet, corn, etc., fish, flesh of deer, rabbit, bird, wild boar, goat and Neelgai (antelope).

7.6.2.question: Flesh of different types of deer and  _______  causes satisfaction for eight, nine and ten months respectively.
7.6.2.explanation: Flesh of different types of deer and antelope causes satisfaction for eight, nine and ten months respectively.

7.6.2.question: Milk of doe, camel, goat,  _______  and other one-hoof animals, yak and such a cow that was milked for the past ten days is also forbidden for use in Shraadh.
7.6.2.explanation: Milk of doe, camel, goat, buffalo and other one-hoof animals, yak and such a cow that was milked for the past ten days is also forbidden for use in Shraadh.

7.6.2.question: Milk of doe, camel,  _______ , buffalo and other one-hoof animals, yak and such a cow that was milked for the past ten days is also forbidden for use in Shraadh.
7.6.2.explanation: Milk of doe, camel, goat, buffalo and other one-hoof animals, yak and such a cow that was milked for the past ten days is also forbidden for use in Shraadh.

7.6.2.question: These include cereals like barley, wheat, rice, millet, corn, etc., fish, flesh of deer, rabbit, bird, wild boar,  _______  and Neelgai (antelope).
7.6.2.explanation: These include cereals like barley, wheat, rice, millet, corn, etc., fish, flesh of deer, rabbit, bird, wild boar, goat and Neelgai (antelope).

7.6.2.question: Flesh of  _______  causes satisfaction for seven months.
7.6.2.explanation: Flesh of goat causes satisfaction for seven months.

7.6.2.question: Similarly, such people who are violent, wretched, killers of  _______ , impotent or have fiendish characters should not be involved in the Shraadh.
7.6.2.explanation: Similarly, such people who are violent, wretched, killers of Brahmins, impotent or have fiendish characters should not be involved in the Shraadh.

7.6.2.question: It is also not necessary to feed a host of  _______ .
7.6.2.explanation: It is also not necessary to feed a host of Brahmins.

7.6.2.question: _______  that is infested with insects, dry, baked with fire, stinking or collected from an unholy place should not be used.
7.6.2.explanation: Soil that is infested with insects, dry, baked with fire, stinking or collected from an unholy place should not be used.

7.6.2.question: These include cereals like  _______ , wheat, rice, millet, corn, etc., fish, flesh of deer, rabbit, bird, wild boar, goat and Neelgai (antelope).
7.6.2.explanation: These include cereals like barley, wheat, rice, millet, corn, etc., fish, flesh of deer, rabbit, bird, wild boar, goat and Neelgai (antelope).

7.6.2.question: Different varieties of rice,  _______ , millet, wheat, sesame, moong dal, mustard etc.
7.6.2.explanation: Different varieties of rice, barley, millet, wheat, sesame, moong dal, mustard etc.

7.6.2.question: Use of  _______ , carrot, onion, radish, refined salt, red gum, gourd etc.
7.6.2.explanation: Use of garlic, carrot, onion, radish, refined salt, red gum, gourd etc.

7.6.2.question: Use of garlic, carrot, onion, radish, refined salt, red gum,  _______  etc.
7.6.2.explanation: Use of garlic, carrot, onion, radish, refined salt, red gum, gourd etc.

7.6.3.question: Performing Shraadh on the eleventh day helps him to attain the knowledge of  _______ .
7.6.3.explanation: Performing Shraadh on the eleventh day helps him to attain the knowledge of Vedas.

7.6.4.question: Seat, bed, vehicle, boat, grass, rays of the  _______  and Moon and air are naturally pure things.
7.6.4.explanation: Seat, bed, vehicle, boat, grass, rays of the Sun and Moon and air are naturally pure things.

7.6.4.question: Sighting of the  _______  however purifies the defiled person.
7.6.4.explanation: Sighting of the Sun however purifies the defiled person.

7.6.4.question: Those who do not respect the deities, teachers, wife of the teacher, cow,  _______  etc.
7.6.4.explanation: Those who do not respect the deities, teachers, wife of the teacher, cow, Brahmin etc.

7.6.4.question: After birth or death in the family, a  _______  becomes purified in ten days.
7.6.4.explanation: After birth or death in the family, a Brahmin becomes purified in ten days.

7.6.4.question: _______  can eat flesh offered to him in a Shraadh.
7.6.4.explanation: Brahmin can eat flesh offered to him in a Shraadh.

7.6.4.question: Seat, bed, vehicle, boat, grass, rays of the Sun and  _______  and air are naturally pure things.
7.6.4.explanation: Seat, bed, vehicle, boat, grass, rays of the Sun and Moon and air are naturally pure things.

7.6.4.question: Thus abiding by these norms, the householder can easily attain the four objectives of life that is  _______ , Arth, Kama and Moksha.
7.6.4.explanation: Thus abiding by these norms, the householder can easily attain the four objectives of life that is Dharma, Arth, Kama and Moksha.

7.6.4.question: Touch by a woman who is in her menses, dog, jackal, a mother who has recently given birth to a child, a Chandaal, carriers of the  _______  etc.
7.6.4.explanation: Touch by a woman who is in her menses, dog, jackal, a mother who has recently given birth to a child, a Chandaal, carriers of the brier etc.

7.6.4.question: In similar conditions, a Kshatriya gets purified in twelve days after a birth or death in his family, a Vaishya in fifteen days and a  _______  in one month.
7.6.4.explanation: In similar conditions, a Kshatriya gets purified in twelve days after a birth or death in his family, a Vaishya in fifteen days and a Shudra in one month.

7.6.4.question: Touch by a woman who is in her menses, dog,  _______ , a mother who has recently given birth to a child, a Chandaal, carriers of the brier etc.
7.6.4.explanation: Touch by a woman who is in her menses, dog, jackal, a mother who has recently given birth to a child, a Chandaal, carriers of the brier etc.

7.6.4.question: In similar conditions, a  _______  gets purified in twelve days after a birth or death in his family, a Vaishya in fifteen days and a Shudra in one month.
7.6.4.explanation: In similar conditions, a Kshatriya gets purified in twelve days after a birth or death in his family, a Vaishya in fifteen days and a Shudra in one month.

7.6.4.question: Naked are those who are devoid of  _______ , other religious scriptures and rituals.
7.6.4.explanation: Naked are those who are devoid of Vedas, other religious scriptures and rituals.

7.6.4.question: Kicking the following things like broom, hearth and  _______  etc.
7.6.4.explanation: Kicking the following things like broom, hearth and mortar etc.

7.7.2.question: He followed the dictates of  _______ , Arth and Kama while ruling his kingdom.
7.7.2.explanation: He followed the dictates of Dharma, Arth and Kama while ruling his kingdom.

7.7.4.question: With the attainment of  _______ , Yogis take refuge in none other than Brahma.
7.7.4.explanation: With the attainment of Yoga, Yogis take refuge in none other than Brahma.

7.7.4.question: But the path of attaining  _______  is indeed difficult, if not impossible.
7.7.4.explanation: But the path of attaining Yoga is indeed difficult, if not impossible.

7.7.4.question: This phenomenon is known as  _______ .
7.7.4.explanation: This phenomenon is known as Yoga.

7.7.4.question: With the attainment of Yoga,  _______  take refuge in none other than Brahma.
7.7.4.explanation: With the attainment of Yoga, Yogis take refuge in none other than Brahma.

7.7.5.question: Dattatreya says-During the process of conquering the soul, different kinds of allurements begins to divert the mind of the  _______ .
7.7.5.explanation: Dattatreya says-During the process of conquering the soul, different kinds of allurements begins to divert the mind of the Yogis.

7.7.6.question: Before going to dine, a  _______  should offer his food to the deities reciting he following mantras- PRANANYAY SWAHA AAPANAY SWAHA SAMANAY SWAHA UDANAY SWAHA VYANAY SWAHA After reciting these mantras one by one and offering food to the deities who are present in his body as different forms of air, the  _______  may now proceed to dine.
7.7.6.explanation: Before going to dine, a Yogi should offer his food to the deities reciting he following mantras- PRANANYAY SWAHA AAPANAY SWAHA SAMANAY SWAHA UDANAY SWAHA VYANAY SWAHA After reciting these mantras one by one and offering food to the deities who are present in his body as different forms of air, the Yogi may now proceed to dine.

7.7.6.question: Before going to dine, a  _______  should offer his food to the deities reciting he following mantras- PRANANYAY SWAHA AAPANAY SWAHA SAMANAY SWAHA UDANAY SWAHA VYANAY SWAHA After reciting these mantras one by one and offering food to the deities who are present in his body as different forms of air, the  _______  may now proceed to dine.
7.7.6.explanation: Before going to dine, a Yogi should offer his food to the deities reciting he following mantras- PRANANYAY SWAHA AAPANAY SWAHA SAMANAY SWAHA UDANAY SWAHA VYANAY SWAHA After reciting these mantras one by one and offering food to the deities who are present in his body as different forms of air, the Yogi may now proceed to dine.

7.7.6.question: A  _______  should accept alms only from those households whose inmates are gentle, religious and free from blemishes and should accept things like whey, milk, fruits, edible roots, gram flour etc.
7.7.6.explanation: A Yogi should accept alms only from those households whose inmates are gentle, religious and free from blemishes and should accept things like whey, milk, fruits, edible roots, gram flour etc.

7.7.6.question: Alark says- O lord, now kindly narrate about the daily routine, a  _______  should abide by in order to preserve his piousness.
7.7.6.explanation: Alark says- O lord, now kindly narrate about the daily routine, a Yogi should abide by in order to preserve his piousness.

7.7.6.question: Control of anger, service to the Guru, sanctity, eating less and studying Vedas regularly are the five norms for a  _______ .
7.7.6.explanation: Control of anger, service to the Guru, sanctity, eating less and studying Vedas regularly are the five norms for a Yogi.

7.7.6.question: A  _______  should therefore never attend social functions like Shraadh, marriage ceremonies or other festivities.
7.7.6.explanation: A Yogi should therefore never attend social functions like Shraadh, marriage ceremonies or other festivities.

7.7.6.question: Control of senses and greed, celibacy, renunciation and non-violence are the five resolutions of a  _______ .
7.7.6.explanation: Control of senses and greed, celibacy, renunciation and non-violence are the five resolutions of a Yogi.

7.7.6.question: A  _______  must practice meditation at a desolate place, forest, cave or peak of a mountain.
7.7.6.explanation: A Yogi must practice meditation at a desolate place, forest, cave or peak of a mountain.

7.7.6.question: A  _______  should seek alms only after the householder and his family has dined.
7.7.6.explanation: A Yogi should seek alms only after the householder and his family has dined.

7.7.6.question: Alark says- O  _______ , now kindly narrate about the daily routine, a Yogi should abide by in order to preserve his piousness.
7.7.6.explanation: Alark says- O lord, now kindly narrate about the daily routine, a Yogi should abide by in order to preserve his piousness.

7.7.6.question: Control of anger, service to the Guru, sanctity, eating less and studying  _______  regularly are the five norms for a Yogi.
7.7.6.explanation: Control of anger, service to the Guru, sanctity, eating less and studying Vedas regularly are the five norms for a Yogi.

7.7.6.question: Control of anger, service to the  _______ , sanctity, eating less and studying Vedas regularly are the five norms for a Yogi.
7.7.6.explanation: Control of anger, service to the Guru, sanctity, eating less and studying Vedas regularly are the five norms for a Yogi.

7.7.7.question: These three syllables represent the virtues (gunas) of Sata, Tama and  _______  respectively.
7.7.7.explanation: These three syllables represent the virtues (gunas) of Sata, Tama and Raja respectively.

7.7.7.question: Dattatreya says- Those  _______  who abide by their resolution are never degraded from their supreme position.
7.7.7.explanation: Dattatreya says- Those Yogis who abide by their resolution are never degraded from their supreme position.

7.7.7.question: Such  _______  always recite Om while contemplating on the eternal God.
7.7.7.explanation: Such Yogis always recite Om while contemplating on the eternal God.

7.7.8.question: Those  _______  whose heels appear cracked while walking on sand or mud die within seven months.
7.7.8.explanation: Those Yogis whose heels appear cracked while walking on sand or mud die within seven months.

7.7.8.question: Dattatreya says- A person who is unable to see the path of the deities, or the heavenly bodies like- Dhruv, Shukra (Venus),  _______  (Moon), or his own shadow or Goddess Arundhati, must understand that his death is near.
7.7.8.explanation: Dattatreya says- A person who is unable to see the path of the deities, or the heavenly bodies like- Dhruv, Shukra (Venus), Soma (Moon), or his own shadow or Goddess Arundhati, must understand that his death is near.

7.7.8.question: Whenever a Yogi perceives the appearance of all or some of these disastrous symptoms, he must at once take to  _______  to minimise the effects.
7.7.8.explanation: Whenever a Yogi perceives the appearance of all or some of these disastrous symptoms, he must at once take to Yoga to minimise the effects.

7.7.8.question: Brahmagyan- A Yogi experiences extreme joy when he meditates while doing  _______ .
7.7.8.explanation: Brahmagyan- A Yogi experiences extreme joy when he meditates while doing Yoga.

7.7.8.question: Hence, a Yogi must train his mind in  _______  ignoring sorrow or affection.
7.7.8.explanation: Hence, a Yogi must train his mind in Yoga ignoring sorrow or affection.

7.7.8.question: Now controlling my senses, I will attain perfection in  _______ .'
7.7.8.explanation: Now controlling my senses, I will attain perfection in Yoga.'

7.7.8.explanation: Dattatreya says- A person who is unable to see the path of the deities, or the heavenly bodies like- Dhruv, Shukra (Venus), Soma (Moon), or his own shadow or Goddess Arundhati, must understand that his death is near.

7.7.8.question: He also tried to instigate Alark by saying that his conduct did not suit the  _______ .
7.7.8.explanation: He also tried to instigate Alark by saying that his conduct did not suit the Kshatriyas.

7.7.8.question: For those people to whom, the  _______  appears without radiance but fire appears as the  _______ , die within eleven months.
7.7.8.explanation: For those people to whom, the Sun appears without radiance but fire appears as the Sun, die within eleven months.

7.7.8.explanation: For those people to whom, the Sun appears without radiance but fire appears as the Sun, die within eleven months.

7.7.9.question: Subahu said- "Attainment of  _______ , Arth, Kama and Moksha are the four major objectives for the attainment of which humans have been created.

7.7.9.explanation: Such people are degraded from their position of Dharma, Arth, Kama and Moksha and are criticised everywhere."

7.7.9.question: You have already attained  _______ , Artha and Kama.
7.7.9.explanation: You have already attained Dharma, Artha and Kama.

7.7.9.question: Subahu said- " _______  of Dharma, Arth, Kama and Moksha are the four major objectives for the  _______  of which humans have been created.
7.7.9.explanation: Subahu said- "Attainment of Dharma, Arth, Kama and Moksha are the four major objectives for the attainment of which humans have been created.

7.7.9.explanation: Subahu said- "Attainment of Dharma, Arth, Kama and Moksha are the four major objectives for the attainment of which humans have been created.

7.7.9.question: Alark crowned his elder son as the new king and he began to practice  _______  in a forest.
7.7.9.explanation: Alark crowned his elder son as the new king and he began to practice Yoga in a forest.

7.7.9.question: Now you too must take refuge in  _______  in order to attain Brahma.
7.7.9.explanation: Now you too must take refuge in Yoga in order to attain Brahma.

7.7.9.question: So I am leaving to attain perfection in  _______ .
7.7.9.explanation: So I am leaving to attain perfection in Yoga.

7.8.1.question: 'In the beginning of creation, as soon as lord Brahma manifested himself, all the four Vedas and eighteen  _______  came out from his four mouths.
7.8.1.explanation: 'In the beginning of creation, as soon as lord Brahma manifested himself, all the four Vedas and eighteen Puranas came out from his four mouths.

7.8.1.question: 'Later on, sage Chyavan got the  _______  from one of the Saptarishis- sage Bhrigu and read out its contents to the assembled sages.
7.8.1.explanation: 'Later on, sage Chyavan got the Puranas from one of the Saptarishis- sage Bhrigu and read out its contents to the assembled sages.

7.8.1.question: Lord Brahma then created the Saptarishis merely by wishing, who took all the Vedas and  _______  in their possession.'
7.8.1.explanation: Lord Brahma then created the Saptarishis merely by wishing, who took all the Vedas and Puranas in their possession.'

7.8.1.question: The virtues of listening to  _______  are capable of destroying all sins of a man.
7.8.1.explanation: The virtues of listening to Puranas are capable of destroying all sins of a man.

7.8.1.question: Daksha narrated the contents of the  _______  to me (Markandeya).
7.8.1.explanation: Daksha narrated the contents of the Puranas to me (Markandeya).

7.8.1.question: The sages then retold the  _______  to Daksha.
7.8.1.explanation: The sages then retold the Puranas to Daksha.

7.8.1.question: 'In the beginning of creation, as soon as lord Brahma manifested himself, all the four  _______  and eighteen Puranas came out from his four mouths.
7.8.1.explanation: 'In the beginning of creation, as soon as lord Brahma manifested himself, all the four Vedas and eighteen Puranas came out from his four mouths.

7.8.1.question: Lord Brahma then created the Saptarishis merely by wishing, who took all the  _______  and Puranas in their possession.'
7.8.1.explanation: Lord Brahma then created the Saptarishis merely by wishing, who took all the Vedas and Puranas in their possession.'

7.8.1.question: When the time is appropriate for commencing the process of creation, the whole atmosphere is covered by the great element (Mahatatva), which itself comprises of the three basic gunas- Satva (pure), Rajas (semi-pure) and Taamas ( _______ ).'
7.8.1.explanation: When the time is appropriate for commencing the process of creation, the whole atmosphere is covered by the great element (Mahatatva), which itself comprises of the three basic gunas- Satva (pure), Rajas (semi-pure) and Taamas (dark).'

7.8.1.question: When the time is appropriate for commencing the process of creation, the whole atmosphere is covered by the great element (Mahatatva), which itself comprises of the three basic gunas- Satva (pure),  _______  (semi-pure) and Taamas (dark).'
7.8.1.explanation: When the time is appropriate for commencing the process of creation, the whole atmosphere is covered by the great element (Mahatatva), which itself comprises of the three basic gunas- Satva (pure), Rajas (semi-pure) and Taamas (dark).'

7.8.2.question: Fourteen  _______  appear in succession during the whole day of Brahma.
7.8.2.explanation: Fourteen Manus appear in succession during the whole day of Brahma.

7.8.3.question: The third creation is called  _______  and which consists of creatures possessing intelligence and flawed sensual perceptions.
7.8.3.explanation: The third creation is called Prakrit and which consists of creatures possessing intelligence and flawed sensual perceptions.

7.8.3.question: The ninth creation of Brahmaji is known as  _______  (natural) and Vikari (flawed).
7.8.3.explanation: The ninth creation of Brahmaji is known as Prakrit (natural) and Vikari (flawed).

7.8.3.question: The root causes of this universe are  _______  and Vikari.'
7.8.3.explanation: The root causes of this universe are Prakrit and Vikari.'

7.8.4.question: He created the goat from his mouth, lamb from his heart, cow from his stomach and back, animals like horse, elephant, donkey, rabbit, deer, camel and mule were created by  _______  from both his legs.
7.8.4.explanation: He created the goat from his mouth, lamb from his heart, cow from his stomach and back, animals like horse, elephant, donkey, rabbit, deer, camel and mule were created by Brahma from both his legs.

7.8.4.question: Markandeya replied- 'With the objective of creating the deities, demons, ancestors and human beings,  _______  abandoned the part of his physical body in the ocean.
7.8.4.explanation: Markandeya replied- 'With the objective of creating the deities, demons, ancestors and human beings, Brahma abandoned the part of his physical body in the ocean.

7.8.4.question: ' _______  then created the following things from the first of his four mouths- Gayatri, Tri- rik, tri- vrit, Saam, Rathantar and Agnishtom.
7.8.4.explanation: 'Brahma then created the following things from the first of his four mouths- Gayatri, Tri- rik, tri- vrit, Saam, Rathantar and Agnishtom.

7.8.4.question: 'This way after having created these eight types of divine creation,  _______  created all the animals and birds from his body.
7.8.4.explanation: 'This way after having created these eight types of divine creation, Brahma created all the animals and birds from his body.

7.8.4.question: 'In the beginning of Kalpa,  _______  created the natural things like lightning, Vajra, cloud, rainbow and birds.
7.8.4.explanation: 'In the beginning of Kalpa, Brahma created the natural things like lightning, Vajra, cloud, rainbow and birds.

7.8.4.question: This part of  _______ 's body which was Saatvik (pure) in nature became famous as day.'
7.8.4.explanation: This part of Brahma's body which was Saatvik (pure) in nature became famous as day.'

7.8.4.question: Lord  _______  blessed the demons with physical bodies, which were Taamasik in nature.
7.8.4.explanation: Lord Brahma blessed the demons with physical bodies, which were Taamasik in nature.

7.8.4.question: After that  _______  created the deities from his mouth with the help of Satva guna.
7.8.4.explanation: After that Brahma created the deities from his mouth with the help of Satva guna.

7.8.4.question: This is the way  _______  had done creation at the end of the dissolution period.'
7.8.4.explanation: This is the way Brahma had done creation at the end of the dissolution period.'

7.8.4.question: 'After this,  _______  acquired another physical body and created the ancestors.
7.8.4.explanation: 'After this, Brahma acquired another physical body and created the ancestors.

7.8.4.question: ' _______  then created creatures who had moustaches and beard on their face.
7.8.4.explanation: 'Brahma then created creatures who had moustaches and beard on their face.

7.8.4.question: This part of  _______ 's body became famous as Ratri (night).
7.8.4.explanation: This part of Brahma's body became famous as Ratri (night).

7.8.4.question: ' _______  was very displeased by their tantrums.
7.8.4.explanation: 'Brahma was very displeased by their tantrums.

7.8.4.question: After that,  _______  created the Gandharvas.'
7.8.4.explanation: After that, Brahma created the Gandharvas.'

7.8.5.question: Subsequently they started living in various types of abodes- Pura, village, Dronimukha, Shakhanagar, Kharvatak, Drami,  _______  and Sanghosh etc.'
7.8.5.explanation: Subsequently they started living in various types of abodes- Pura, village, Dronimukha, Shakhanagar, Kharvatak, Drami, Gram and Sanghosh etc.'

7.8.5.question: Once again, Brahmaji created one thousand couples from his chest but this time they possessed the quality of  _______ .
7.8.5.explanation: Once again, Brahmaji created one thousand couples from his chest but this time they possessed the quality of Rajas.

7.8.5.question: These couples were both  _______  as well as Taamasik by nature.
7.8.5.explanation: These couples were both Rajas as well as Taamasik by nature.

7.8.6.question: Twenty-four daughters were born to Daksha and Prasuti out of which thirteen of them were married to  _______ .
7.8.6.explanation: Twenty-four daughters were born to Daksha and Prasuti out of which thirteen of them were married to Dharma.

7.8.6.explanation: After this, he first created the ferocious Rudra and then Sankalpa and Dharma.

7.8.6.explanation: Kama, the son of Dharma was the father of Atihrishta.'

7.8.6.question: ' _______  gave birth to Mrityu, whereas Dukha was born as a result of Narak's marriage with Vedana.
7.8.6.explanation: 'Maya gave birth to Mrityu, whereas Dukha was born as a result of Narak's marriage with Vedana.

7.8.6.question: Two sons named Narak and Bhaya and two daughters named  _______  and Vedana were born to them.'
7.8.6.explanation: Two sons named Narak and Bhaya and two daughters named Maya and Vedana were born to them.'

7.8.8.explanation: The following eight things respectively symbolize the forms of all these eight rudras- Sun, water, earth, fire, air, sky, Dikshit Brahmin and Soma.

7.8.8.explanation: 'Ansuya, the wife of sage Atri gave birth to three sons- Soma, Durvaasa and Dattatreya.

7.8.8.explanation: Brahma named these seven children as Bhava, Sharva, Ishaan, Pashupati, Bheem, Ugra and Mahadev.

7.8.8.question: One of the eight sons of  _______  started wailing after being created from his ( _______ ) body.
7.8.8.explanation: One of the eight sons of Brahma started wailing after being created from his (Brahma) body.

7.8.8.question: One of the eight sons of  _______  started wailing after being created from his ( _______ ) body.
7.8.8.explanation: One of the eight sons of Brahma started wailing after being created from his (Brahma) body.

7.8.8.question: _______  named him as Rudra since he was wailing at the time of his birth.
7.8.8.explanation: Brahma named him as Rudra since he was wailing at the time of his birth.

7.8.8.explanation: The crying child requested Brahma to give him a name.

7.8.8.explanation: Brahma asked him as to why he was crying.

7.8.8.explanation: Urja- the wife of Vashishta gave birth to seven sons- Raja, Gatra, Urdhwabahu, Sabal, Anagh, Sutapa and Shukra.

7.13.5.explanation: Marut enquired from him as to why he was trying to kill his own son, who was just performing his duty of protecting the oblation site from the serpents.

7.13.5.question: Aveekshit told  _______  that the serpents had taken his refuge and hence he should forgive them to protect the honour of his father's promise.
7.13.5.explanation: Aveekshit told Marut that the serpents had taken his refuge and hence he should forgive them to protect the honour of his father's promise.

7.13.5.question: He requested  _______  to drop his weapon but  _______  refused by saying- 'O father!
7.13.5.explanation: He requested Marut to drop his weapon but Marut refused by saying- 'O father!

7.13.5.question: He requested  _______  to drop his weapon but  _______  refused by saying- 'O father!
7.13.5.explanation: He requested Marut to drop his weapon but Marut refused by saying- 'O father!

7.13.5.question: When  _______  did not listen, Aveekshit picked up his weapon 'Kaal' to kill him.
7.13.5.explanation: When Marut did not listen, Aveekshit picked up his weapon 'Kaal' to kill him.

7.13.5.question: From then onwards,  _______  took proper care while ruling his kingdom.
7.13.5.explanation: From then onwards, Marut took proper care while ruling his kingdom.

7.13.5.question: Aveekshit told Marut that the serpents had taken his refuge and hence he should forgive them to protect the honour of his  _______ 's promise.
7.13.5.explanation: Aveekshit told Marut that the serpents had taken his refuge and hence he should forgive them to protect the honour of his father's promise.

7.13.5.question: When the sages saw both  _______  and son were bent on killing each other, they intervened and advised them against killing each other.
7.13.5.explanation: When the sages saw both father and son were bent on killing each other, they intervened and advised them against killing each other.

7.13.5.question: Thus, all the dead sons of the hermits became alive and once again, the  _______  and son were prevented from killing each other.
7.13.5.explanation: Thus, all the dead sons of the hermits became alive and once again, the father and son were prevented from killing each other.

7.13.5.question: He requested Marut to drop his weapon but Marut refused by saying- 'O  _______ !
7.13.5.explanation: He requested Marut to drop his weapon but Marut refused by saying- 'O father!

7.14.question: Narishyant felt joyous that due to his donations, the  _______  had become wealthy and at the same time, he was also sad that his desire of performing a grand Yagya was not going to be accomplished as the  _______  no longer needed donations.
7.14.explanation: Narishyant felt joyous that due to his donations, the Brahmins had become wealthy and at the same time, he was also sad that his desire of performing a grand Yagya was not going to be accomplished as the Brahmins no longer needed donations.

7.14.question: Narishyant felt joyous that due to his donations, the  _______  had become wealthy and at the same time, he was also sad that his desire of performing a grand Yagya was not going to be accomplished as the  _______  no longer needed donations.
7.14.explanation: Narishyant felt joyous that due to his donations, the Brahmins had become wealthy and at the same time, he was also sad that his desire of performing a grand Yagya was not going to be accomplished as the Brahmins no longer needed donations.

7.14.question: But this particular Yagya was unique of its kind because the  _______  played the part of host as well as that of priests.
7.14.explanation: But this particular Yagya was unique of its kind because the Brahmins played the part of host as well as that of priests.

7.14.question: Narishyant made such huge donations to the  _______  that it was more than enough for their future generations to come.
7.14.explanation: Narishyant made such huge donations to the Brahmins that it was more than enough for their future generations to come.

7.14.question: This grand Yagya was possible only because of the wealth donated to the  _______  by King Narishyant.
7.14.explanation: This grand Yagya was possible only because of the wealth donated to the Brahmins by King Narishyant.

7.14.question: The  _______  made donations to the  _______  who were acting as priests.
7.14.explanation: The Brahmins made donations to the Brahmins who were acting as priests.

7.14.question: The  _______  made donations to the  _______  who were acting as priests.
7.14.explanation: The Brahmins made donations to the Brahmins who were acting as priests.

7.14.question: At his repeated requests, some  _______  agreed to supervise the Yagya.
7.14.explanation: At his repeated requests, some Brahmins agreed to supervise the Yagya.

7.14.question: _______  ruled over his kingdom for 70,015 years after which Narishyant succeeded him as the king.
7.14.explanation: Marut ruled over his kingdom for 70,015 years after which Narishyant succeeded him as the king.

7.14.question: Markandeya says- 'Among the eighteen sons of  _______ , Narishyant was the eldest.
7.14.explanation: Markandeya says- 'Among the eighteen sons of Marut, Narishyant was the eldest.

7.14.question: _______  went to the forest to do penance.
7.14.explanation: Marut went to the forest to do penance.

7.14.1.question: One of the kings said that certainly a Swayamvara is religious and only  _______  has the right to marry Sumana as she had herself chosen him.
7.14.1.explanation: One of the kings said that certainly a Swayamvara is religious and only Dama has the right to marry Sumana as she had herself chosen him.

7.14.1.question: After the killing of Mahanand, Vayushmaan came forward to fight  _______  but his sword was broken into two pieces by the assault of  _______ .
7.14.1.explanation: After the killing of Mahanand, Vayushmaan came forward to fight Dama but his sword was broken into two pieces by the assault of Dama.

7.14.1.question: After the killing of Mahanand, Vayushmaan came forward to fight  _______  but his sword was broken into two pieces by the assault of  _______ .
7.14.1.explanation: After the killing of Mahanand, Vayushmaan came forward to fight Dama but his sword was broken into two pieces by the assault of Dama.

7.14.1.question: After staying for some days at his father-in-law's place,  _______  returned home accompanied by his wife- Sumana.
7.14.1.explanation: After staying for some days at his father-in-law's place, Dama returned home accompanied by his wife- Sumana.

7.14.1.question: Sumana, the daughter of King Charusharma had chosen  _______  as her husband in a Swayamvara.
7.14.1.explanation: Sumana, the daughter of King Charusharma had chosen Dama as her husband in a Swayamvara.

7.14.1.question: After that, Vayushmaan picked up his spiked mace but  _______  destroyed even this mace.
7.14.1.explanation: After that, Vayushmaan picked up his spiked mace but Dama destroyed even this mace.

7.14.1.question: Their evil intentions were corroborated by the friends of  _______ .
7.14.1.explanation: Their evil intentions were corroborated by the friends of Dama.

7.14.1.question: After that, Mahanand jumped and climbed on the chariot of  _______ .
7.14.1.explanation: After that, Mahanand jumped and climbed on the chariot of Dama.

7.14.1.question: A tremendous battle was fought between  _______  and his opponents.
7.14.1.explanation: A tremendous battle was fought between Dama and his opponents.

7.14.1.question: At last, Charusharma married his daughter Sumana with  _______ .
7.14.1.explanation: At last, Charusharma married his daughter Sumana with Dama.

7.14.1.question: Seeing him reluctant to fight,  _______  spared his life.
7.14.1.explanation: Seeing him reluctant to fight, Dama spared his life.

7.14.1.question: Markandeya says-  _______  was the son of Narishyant.
7.14.1.explanation: Markandeya says- Dama was the son of Narishyant.

7.14.1.question: But some other kings supported  _______ 's opponents.
7.14.1.explanation: But some other kings supported Dama's opponents.

7.14.1.question: _______  showered a volley of arrows at him.
7.14.1.explanation: Dama showered a volley of arrows at him.

7.14.2.question: As he had become old, he appointed  _______  as his successor and he went in the forest to do penance accompanied by his wife- Indrasena.
7.14.2.explanation: As he had become old, he appointed Dama as his successor and he went in the forest to do penance accompanied by his wife- Indrasena.

7.14.2.question: Markandeya says- 'When the newly married couple-  _______  and Sumana returned to the capital, King Narishyant was extremely pleased.
7.14.2.explanation: Markandeya says- 'When the newly married couple- Dama and Sumana returned to the capital, King Narishyant was extremely pleased.

7.14.2.question: Somehow, Vayushmaan came to know about his identity that he was none other than the father of his bitter enemy-  _______ .
7.14.2.explanation: Somehow, Vayushmaan came to know about his identity that he was none other than the father of his bitter enemy- Dama.

7.14.2.question: Indrasena requested one of the sages to go and inform  _______  about his father's death.
7.14.2.explanation: Indrasena requested one of the sages to go and inform Dama about his father's death.

7.15.1.question: Markandeya says- 'When  _______  came to know about his father's death, he became extremely furious.
7.15.1.explanation: Markandeya says- 'When Dama came to know about his father's death, he became extremely furious.

7.15.1.question: Now, I will perform my father's  _______  only with the blood of Vayushmaan.
7.15.1.explanation: Now, I will perform my father's Tarpan only with the blood of Vayushmaan.

7.15.2.question: Markandeya says- 'When  _______  came to know about his father's death, he became extremely furious.
7.15.2.explanation: Markandeya says- 'When Dama came to know about his father's death, he became extremely furious.

7.15.2.question: Now, I will perform my father's  _______  only with the blood of Vayushmaan.
7.15.2.explanation: Now, I will perform my father's Tarpan only with the blood of Vayushmaan.

7.16.question: The virtues attained by listening to Markandeya Puraan are equivalent to the virtues attained by making donations at Pushkar or by studying all the  _______ .'
7.16.explanation: The virtues attained by listening to Markandeya Puraan are equivalent to the virtues attained by making donations at Pushkar or by studying all the Vedas.'

8.1.2.question: Narad narrated about an interesting incident which had happened while he was on his way to meet Priyavrata- "I experienced an amazing incident yesterday while I was passing by a lake in Shwetdweepa.I saw a divinely beautiful woman who was standing alone at the  _______  of that lake.I was surprised to find such a beautiful woman at such a lonely place.For a moment I became so infatuated by her beauty that I lost all control over my senses.My lust had made me devoid of all my knowledge and learning.Now,I became very worried and ashamed of my conduct-but the damage had already been made.I immediately realized that she was not an ordinary woman.To my surprise,I saw a form of a divine person visible clearly within her body.Within nextfew moments two other male forms revealed themselves.Suddenly,all three of them disappeared leaving behind just that divine lady.I was dumbstruck by this amazing incident.I asked her as to who she was.The divine lady disclosed to me that she was none other than goddess Savitri - the mother of all the Vedas and since I was unable to recognize her therefore all the knowledge had vanished from my memory.She also revealed to me that the three divine men which had manifested themselves within her body were in fact the three Vedas- Rigveda,Samveda and Yajurveda.After revealing these amazing facts to me goddess Savitri assured me that by taking a bath in that lake I would not only regain my memory of the Vedas but also of all my previous births.I eulogized goddess Savitri and thanked her for the blessings showered on me.I then bathed in that lake and to my pleasant surprise I now remembered everything of my past births as had been prophesised by goddess Savitri."
8.1.2.explanation: Narad narrated about an interesting incident which had happened while he was on his way to meet Priyavrata- "I experienced an amazing incident yesterday while I was passing by a lake in Shwetdweepa.I saw a divinely beautiful woman who was standing alone at the bank of that lake.I was surprised to find such a beautiful woman at such a lonely place.For a moment I became so infatuated by her beauty that I lost all control over my senses.My lust had made me devoid of all my knowledge and learning.Now,I became very worried and ashamed of my conduct-but the damage had already been made.I immediately realized that she was not an ordinary woman.To my surprise,I saw a form of a divine person visible clearly within her body.Within nextfew moments two other male forms revealed themselves.Suddenly,all three of them disappeared leaving behind just that divine lady.I was dumbstruck by this amazing incident.I asked her as to who she was.The divine lady disclosed to me that she was none other than goddess Savitri - the mother of all the Vedas and since I was unable to recognize her therefore all the knowledge had vanished from my memory.She also revealed to me that the three divine men which had manifested themselves within her body were in fact the three Vedas- Rigveda,Samveda and Yajurveda.After revealing these amazing facts to me goddess Savitri assured me that by taking a bath in that lake I would not only regain my memory of the Vedas but also of all my previous births.I eulogized goddess Savitri and thanked her for the blessings showered on me.I then bathed in that lake and to my pleasant surprise I now remembered everything of my past births as had been prophesised by goddess Savitri."

8.1.2.question: It had become clear to me that there was more to life than just worrying about the gains and losses.So,I decided to do penance to attain salvation.I distributed all my wealth among my sons and went to the  _______  of river Saraswati,where I first performed the rituals of shraddh in the name of my ancestors and then performed yagyas.I also donated lot of wealth to poor people.Being satisfied,I then went to Pushkar teerth and did penance at the  _______  of river Saraswat by continuously chanting the sacred mantra"om namo narayan" and brahm paar stotra.Ultimately,lord Narayan became pleased and appeared before me.Lord Sri Hari asked me of my wish and I express my desire to get united with his divine form.But,lord Narayan told me that the world needed me and so this desire of mine could not be fulfilled.He blessed me and gave me my name- Narad because I had 'donated' water(naar) to my ancestors during the course of performing shraddh rituals.Although my wish of uniting with the divine form of Sri Hari had remain unfulfilled but still there was a consolation as I had been fortunate enough to see his divine form with my mortal eyes.
8.1.2.explanation: It had become clear to me that there was more to life than just worrying about the gains and losses.So,I decided to do penance to attain salvation.I distributed all my wealth among my sons and went to the bank of river Saraswati,where I first performed the rituals of shraddh in the name of my ancestors and then performed yagyas.I also donated lot of wealth to poor people.Being satisfied,I then went to Pushkar teerth and did penance at the bank of river Saraswat by continuously chanting the sacred mantra"om namo narayan" and brahm paar stotra.Ultimately,lord Narayan became pleased and appeared before me.Lord Sri Hari asked me of my wish and I express my desire to get united with his divine form.But,lord Narayan told me that the world needed me and so this desire of mine could not be fulfilled.He blessed me and gave me my name- Narad because I had 'donated' water(naar) to my ancestors during the course of performing shraddh rituals.Although my wish of uniting with the divine form of Sri Hari had remain unfulfilled but still there was a consolation as I had been fortunate enough to see his divine form with my mortal eyes.

8.1.2.question: Prithvi,who was listening to the tales narrated by Lord Varah with rapt attention asked him whether it was possible for anybody to see Lord Narayan with his/her mortal eyes.Lord Varah replied -"Lord Narayan has taken ten incarnations in various forms such as matsya(fish),kachchap(tortoise),varah(boar),narsimh(half human and half lion),vaman(dwarf),parshuram,Ram,Krishna, _______  and kalki.The last incarnation-Kalki is yet to take place.A man can realize Lord Narayan by having total devotion in any one of the ten incarnations.
8.1.2.explanation: Prithvi,who was listening to the tales narrated by Lord Varah with rapt attention asked him whether it was possible for anybody to see Lord Narayan with his/her mortal eyes.Lord Varah replied -"Lord Narayan has taken ten incarnations in various forms such as matsya(fish),kachchap(tortoise),varah(boar),narsimh(half human and half lion),vaman(dwarf),parshuram,Ram,Krishna,Buddha and kalki.The last incarnation-Kalki is yet to take place.A man can realize Lord Narayan by having total devotion in any one of the ten incarnations.

8.1.4.question: King Vasu expressed his gratitude to the entity for shedding light on his previous births.Suddenly,a divine aircraft descended from the  _______  and king Vasu left for Vishnuloka mounted on it.Meanwhile,sage Raimya got the news of Vasu's ascension to  _______  to Vishnuloka,he wanted to emulate the feat of his friend.He reached Gaya and performed shraddh in the name of his ancestors.He then engaged himself in an austere penance.Sanat kumar-one of the manasputras became very pleased by Raimya's penance and appeared before him.He complimented Raimya for liberating his ancestors by performing shraddh at Gaya.He then described the virtues of performing shraddh at Gaya and narrated the following tale – "There lived a king named Vishal who had no son.One day,he invited few brahmins to his palace and asked them how he could beget a son.All the brahmins revealed to him that he did not have son because of the curse of his ancestors.

8.1.5.question: Once, when lord Vishnu awakened from his yoga nidra, he found that the  _______  had submerged in the ocean as the result of pralaya (deluge).He incarnated as matsya(fish) to retrieve the  _______  from the ocean-bed.As soon as lord Matsya entered into the ocean,HE attained such an enormous size that the deities became frightened.
8.1.5.explanation: Once, when lord Vishnu awakened from his yoga nidra, he found that the Vedas had submerged in the ocean as the result of pralaya (deluge).He incarnated as matsya(fish) to retrieve the Vedas from the ocean-bed.As soon as lord Matsya entered into the ocean,HE attained such an enormous size that the deities became frightened.

8.1.5.question: Once, when lord Vishnu awakened from his yoga nidra, he found that the  _______  had submerged in the ocean as the result of pralaya (deluge).He incarnated as matsya(fish) to retrieve the  _______  from the ocean-bed.As soon as lord Matsya entered into the ocean,HE attained such an enormous size that the deities became frightened.
8.1.5.explanation: Once, when lord Vishnu awakened from his yoga nidra, he found that the Vedas had submerged in the ocean as the result of pralaya (deluge).He incarnated as matsya(fish) to retrieve the Vedas from the ocean-bed.As soon as lord Matsya entered into the ocean,HE attained such an enormous size that the deities became frightened.

8.1.5.question: On seeing the deities frightened, lord Matsya retrieved the  _______  from the seabed and transformed his appearance from the huge fish to that of lord Vishnu.The deities were filled with joy to see the divine appearance of lord Vishnu.
8.1.5.explanation: On seeing the deities frightened, lord Matsya retrieved the Vedas from the seabed and transformed his appearance from the huge fish to that of lord Vishnu.The deities were filled with joy to see the divine appearance of lord Vishnu.

8.1.5.question: You manifest yourself in each and every particle of this  _______ .You are omnipresent and exist even during the time of deluge when nothing else exist.
8.1.5.explanation: You manifest yourself in each and every particle of this Universe.You are omnipresent and exist even during the time of deluge when nothing else exist.

8.1.6.question: Mean while,Durjay being an ambitious king expanded his kingdom by subjugating all the neighbouring states.He conquered numerous mighty kingdoms and vanquished almost all the prominent warrior castes like- gandharvas,kinnars,demons and even the deities.Indra-the  _______  of the deities was defeated by Durjay and was forced to retreat towards east of Sumeru mountain alongwith the lokpals-various  _______ s protecting different regions of the Universe.The whole world went into turmoil as the fallout of lokpal's power being snatched by Durjay.While Durjay was returning to his capital along with his victorious army,he met two asuras-Vidyut and Suvidyut, who had diguised themselves as sages.Both the impersonators requested Durjay to make some alternative arrangements so that the world could function smoothly.In reality,both of them harboured wishes of having the powers of lokpal's so they offered their services in this regard.Durjay,being unaware of their real identity agreed to appoint them as lokpal's and then proceeded towards his capital.While he was passing by the mandarachal mountain,he saw two beautiful women.Durjay was surprised to find them at such a deserted place.As he stood their wondering about their identity,he saw two hermits approaching him.Both the hermits asked Durjay-"Who are you?
8.1.6.explanation: Mean while,Durjay being an ambitious king expanded his kingdom by subjugating all the neighbouring states.He conquered numerous mighty kingdoms and vanquished almost all the prominent warrior castes like- gandharvas,kinnars,demons and even the deities.Indra-the lord of the deities was defeated by Durjay and was forced to retreat towards east of Sumeru mountain alongwith the lokpals-various lords protecting different regions of the Universe.The whole world went into turmoil as the fallout of lokpal's power being snatched by Durjay.While Durjay was returning to his capital along with his victorious army,he met two asuras-Vidyut and Suvidyut, who had diguised themselves as sages.Both the impersonators requested Durjay to make some alternative arrangements so that the world could function smoothly.In reality,both of them harboured wishes of having the powers of lokpal's so they offered their services in this regard.Durjay,being unaware of their real identity agreed to appoint them as lokpal's and then proceeded towards his capital.While he was passing by the mandarachal mountain,he saw two beautiful women.Durjay was surprised to find them at such a deserted place.As he stood their wondering about their identity,he saw two hermits approaching him.Both the hermits asked Durjay-"Who are you?

8.2.2.question: The various nakshatras like Anuradha,Vishakha and Shwati are considered to be very auspicious for performing shraddh- especially, if the day happens to be amavasya.Shraddh performed on such a day pacifies the ancestor's soul for eight years.Similarly the combination of amavasya with either 'pushya nakshatra' or 'punarvasu nakshatra' is believed to pacify the ancstor's soul for twelve years.Some other days which are considered to be very auspicious for performing shraddh are-the third day of the bright half of the hindu month Vaishakh,the nineth day of the bright half of the hindu month  _______ ,the thirteenth day of the dark half of the hindu month Bhadrapad and amavasya falling in the hindu month of Magh.A man desirous of performing shraddh can do so on any of the above mentioned days.He should take bath in a holy river and offer 'tarpan'(libation) to his ancestors.
8.2.2.explanation: The various nakshatras like Anuradha,Vishakha and Shwati are considered to be very auspicious for performing shraddh- especially, if the day happens to be amavasya.Shraddh performed on such a day pacifies the ancestor's soul for eight years.Similarly the combination of amavasya with either 'pushya nakshatra' or 'punarvasu nakshatra' is believed to pacify the ancstor's soul for twelve years.Some other days which are considered to be very auspicious for performing shraddh are-the third day of the bright half of the hindu month Vaishakh,the nineth day of the bright half of the hindu month Kartik,the thirteenth day of the dark half of the hindu month Bhadrapad and amavasya falling in the hindu month of Magh.A man desirous of performing shraddh can do so on any of the above mentioned days.He should take bath in a holy river and offer 'tarpan'(libation) to his ancestors.

8.2.6.question: A person performing the shraddh rituals should have his seat made of 'kusha' grass.After taking his seat,he should invoke the deities and make offerings of 'ardhya' to them.While offering 'ardhya' to the deities water and barley are commonly used alongwith other articles like sandalwood,incense,etc.During the entire course of shraddh rituals 'yagyopavit'(sacred thread) should be worn in an inverse position-across the right shoulder and not across the left shoulder as it is normally worn.While performing the shraddh of ancestors offerings of articles like  _______  seeds,water and kusha grass are normally made.
8.2.6.explanation: A person performing the shraddh rituals should have his seat made of 'kusha' grass.After taking his seat,he should invoke the deities and make offerings of 'ardhya' to them.While offering 'ardhya' to the deities water and barley are commonly used alongwith other articles like sandalwood,incense,etc.During the entire course of shraddh rituals 'yagyopavit'(sacred thread) should be worn in an inverse position-across the right shoulder and not across the left shoulder as it is normally worn.While performing the shraddh of ancestors offerings of articles like sesame seeds,water and kusha grass are normally made.

8.3.2.question: King Prajapal requested Mahatapa to describe how both the Ashwini kumars manifested themselves.Sage Mahatapa narrated the following tale-'Marichi was Lord Brahma's son while Kashyap was Marichi's son.All the twelve  _______  are the sons of sage Kashyap.One of the  _______ -Martand,was marrird to Vishwakarma's daughter whose name was Sangya.Martand had two children from her and their names were-Yama and Yami.Being unable to bear the extreme radiance of Martand,Sangya created her shadow identity and after instructing her to serve her husband(Martand) in best possible ways,she herself went to live at Uttarkuru.Later on,when Martand came to know about the reality,he went to Uttarkuru and found Sangya in the form of a mare.He then changed his own form and became a horse.Both of them stayed there for a long time.In course of time,Sangya gave birth to two sons who became famous as Ashwini kumars.'
8.3.2.explanation: King Prajapal requested Mahatapa to describe how both the Ashwini kumars manifested themselves.Sage Mahatapa narrated the following tale-'Marichi was Lord Brahma's son while Kashyap was Marichi's son.All the twelve Adityas are the sons of sage Kashyap.One of the Adityas-Martand,was marrird to Vishwakarma's daughter whose name was Sangya.Martand had two children from her and their names were-Yama and Yami.Being unable to bear the extreme radiance of Martand,Sangya created her shadow identity and after instructing her to serve her husband(Martand) in best possible ways,she herself went to live at Uttarkuru.Later on,when Martand came to know about the reality,he went to Uttarkuru and found Sangya in the form of a mare.He then changed his own form and became a horse.Both of them stayed there for a long time.In course of time,Sangya gave birth to two sons who became famous as Ashwini kumars.'

8.3.4.question: When lord  _______  learnt about their problem,he burst into laughter.Hardly had he stopped laughing than a radiant adolescent manifested himself from his opened mouth.The child was so divinely charming that Parvati,who was sitting beside  _______  looked at him without dropping her eyelids.When  _______  found her staring at the child he became jealous.Jealousy transformed into anger and  _______  cursed the child-'From now onwards your face will resemble an elephant and your belly will become large as a pot.In the name of yagyopavit you would have nothing but a snake hanging across your shoulder.'
8.3.4.explanation: When lord Shiva learnt about their problem,he burst into laughter.Hardly had he stopped laughing than a radiant adolescent manifested himself from his opened mouth.The child was so divinely charming that Parvati,who was sitting beside Shiva looked at him without dropping her eyelids.When Shiva found her staring at the child he became jealous.Jealousy transformed into anger and Shiva cursed the child-'From now onwards your face will resemble an elephant and your belly will become large as a pot.In the name of yagyopavit you would have nothing but a snake hanging across your shoulder.'

8.3.4.question: King Prajapal then asked sage Mahatapa about the manifestation of lord Ganapati and about the significance of chaturthi in terms of Ganapati's worship.Mahatapa narrated the following tale- "Once,all the deities went to seek  _______ 's help in sorting out a peculiar problem they were faced with- while they experienced all sorts of hurdles and problems in their work resulting into repeated failures in their work,the demons on the contrary accomplished all their work successfully without any problem.
8.3.4.explanation: King Prajapal then asked sage Mahatapa about the manifestation of lord Ganapati and about the significance of chaturthi in terms of Ganapati's worship.Mahatapa narrated the following tale- "Once,all the deities went to seek Shiva's help in sorting out a peculiar problem they were faced with- while they experienced all sorts of hurdles and problems in their work resulting into repeated failures in their work,the demons on the contrary accomplished all their work successfully without any problem.

8.3.8.question: The battle commenced and a fierce dual fight broke out between Lord  _______  and Andhakasur. _______  attacked Andhakasur with his trident.Stream of blood oozed out from the wound,but to  _______ 's utter amazement each drop of blood falling on the ground resulted in into the creation of numerous Andhakasuras.In a short time the battle field was overcrowded with countless Andhakasuras.Now, _______ 's anger crossed all limits and he thundered loudly.Flames emanated from the mouth of enraged  _______  resulting into the manifestation of goddess 'Yogishwari'.Similarly,seven more goddesses manifested themselves from different deities- Vaishnavi from lord Vishnu,Brahmi from lord Brahma,Kaumari from Kartikeya,Mahendri from Indra,Yami from Yama,Varahi from lord Varah and Maheshwari from lord Narayan.All these eight goddesses came to be known as 'Matrikas' and lord assigned them the auspicious day for their worship.A devotee who worships these eight matrikas on ashtami are blessed.The use of 'bael'(wood-apple)fruit on this day has great significance.
8.3.8.explanation: The battle commenced and a fierce dual fight broke out between Lord Shiva and Andhakasur.Shiva attacked Andhakasur with his trident.Stream of blood oozed out from the wound,but to Shiva's utter amazement each drop of blood falling on the ground resulted in into the creation of numerous Andhakasuras.In a short time the battle field was overcrowded with countless Andhakasuras.Now,Shiva's anger crossed all limits and he thundered loudly.Flames emanated from the mouth of enraged Shiva resulting into the manifestation of goddess 'Yogishwari'.Similarly,seven more goddesses manifested themselves from different deities- Vaishnavi from lord Vishnu,Brahmi from lord Brahma,Kaumari from Kartikeya,Mahendri from Indra,Yami from Yama,Varahi from lord Varah and Maheshwari from lord Narayan.All these eight goddesses came to be known as 'Matrikas' and lord assigned them the auspicious day for their worship.A devotee who worships these eight matrikas on ashtami are blessed.The use of 'bael'(wood-apple)fruit on this day has great significance.

8.3.12.question: Describing how lord Vishnu manifested,sage Mahatapa told Prajapal -"Narayan - the almighty God incarnated as lord Vishnu to nurture all the living creatures inhabiting the world.Eventually,lord Vishnu entrusted the job of world's welfare to goddess Yoganidra and himself went into his meditative sleep.While he was still in his meditative sleep,a  _______  flower emanated from his navel.Lord Brahma was seated on that  _______  flower.
8.3.12.explanation: Describing how lord Vishnu manifested,sage Mahatapa told Prajapal -"Narayan - the almighty God incarnated as lord Vishnu to nurture all the living creatures inhabiting the world.Eventually,lord Vishnu entrusted the job of world's welfare to goddess Yoganidra and himself went into his meditative sleep.While he was still in his meditative sleep,a lotus flower emanated from his navel.Lord Brahma was seated on that lotus flower.

8.3.12.question: The almighty God was delighted to see himself in the incarnation of Vishnu.He blessed Vishnu by saying- 'May you destroy all kind of ignorance with the help of your sword.Hold this chakra I am giving you,to sever the evil influences of 'kaal- chakra'(wheel of time).May all the sins be destroyed by your mace.May the deity-Vayu adorn your hand in the form of a conch and vaijyanti mala in your neck.May the Sun and  _______  adorn your person in the form of shrivatsa and kaustubh diamonds.May Garuda be your mount and goddess Laxmi your consort.May people desirous of salvation worship you on the auspicious day of dwadashi.One who worship you on this day will definitely attain to the heaven.'

8.3.13.question: 'Once,a fierce battle was fought between the deities and demons.The bone of contention was a woman for whom both the side made claims. _______  intervened and solved the contentious issue to the satisfaction of both the warring sides.Lord Brahma was very impressed by the deftness with which  _______  had handled such a tough situation and blessed him by saying-I am assigning the auspicious day of tryodashi to you.One who observes a fast and worship you on this day will be liberated from all his sins.'
8.3.13.explanation: 'Once,a fierce battle was fought between the deities and demons.The bone of contention was a woman for whom both the side made claims.Dharma intervened and solved the contentious issue to the satisfaction of both the warring sides.Lord Brahma was very impressed by the deftness with which Dharma had handled such a tough situation and blessed him by saying-I am assigning the auspicious day of tryodashi to you.One who observes a fast and worship you on this day will be liberated from all his sins.'

8.3.13.question: The almighty God instructed him to protect the mankind from all evils and sins.All the four feet of  _______  signified four various virtues-truth,purity,penance and charity.In satyayuga, _______  was four footed-all the four virtues were prevalent during that era.In treta yuga,the feet reduced to three.The subsequent eras of dwapar and kaliyuga saw the further decline in virtuosity in which  _______  had two feet and one foot respectively.'
8.3.13.explanation: The almighty God instructed him to protect the mankind from all evils and sins.All the four feet of Dharma signified four various virtues-truth,purity,penance and charity.In satyayuga,Dharma was four footed-all the four virtues were prevalent during that era.In treta yuga,the feet reduced to three.The subsequent eras of dwapar and kaliyuga saw the further decline in virtuosity in which Dharma had two feet and one foot respectively.'

8.3.15.question: Describing the importance of amavasya,sage Mahatapa told Prajapal- "Once,while lord Brahma was just about to commence the process of creation,suddenly 'tanmatras'(subtle forms of matter) revealed themselves from his mind.All of them being extremely virtuous were eager to go up in the sky to do penance byt lord Brahma requested them to become the 'pitras'(ancestors)of the human beings.All the tanmatras then requested Brahma to make arrangement for their sustenance.Lord Brahma blessed them by saying-'I assign to you the auspicious day of amavasya.Anybody who performs the rituals of 'tarpan'(libation) on this day would become absolved of his sins.You would sustain yourselves on various things like water, _______  seeds, and kusha grass which are offered by human beings to their ancestors on this day.’
8.3.15.explanation: Describing the importance of amavasya,sage Mahatapa told Prajapal- "Once,while lord Brahma was just about to commence the process of creation,suddenly 'tanmatras'(subtle forms of matter) revealed themselves from his mind.All of them being extremely virtuous were eager to go up in the sky to do penance byt lord Brahma requested them to become the 'pitras'(ancestors)of the human beings.All the tanmatras then requested Brahma to make arrangement for their sustenance.Lord Brahma blessed them by saying-'I assign to you the auspicious day of amavasya.Anybody who performs the rituals of 'tarpan'(libation) on this day would become absolved of his sins.You would sustain yourselves on various things like water,sesame seeds, and kusha grass which are offered by human beings to their ancestors on this day.’

8.4.1.question: Matsya-dwadashi is celebrated on the twelfth day of  _______  month- Margashirsh.On this auspicious day a devotee should worship lord Matsya -the incarnation of lord Vishnu with appropriate rituals and give charity to brahmins.Prithvi was the first one to observe this particular austerity while she was being abducted to rasatala by a mighty demon named Hiranyaksha.A devotee who observes a fast on this day and worships lord Matsya with appropriate rituals attains to Brahma loka and remains their for eternity.
8.4.1.explanation: Matsya-dwadashi is celebrated on the twelfth day of hindu month- Margashirsh.On this auspicious day a devotee should worship lord Matsya -the incarnation of lord Vishnu with appropriate rituals and give charity to brahmins.Prithvi was the first one to observe this particular austerity while she was being abducted to rasatala by a mighty demon named Hiranyaksha.A devotee who observes a fast on this day and worships lord Matsya with appropriate rituals attains to Brahma loka and remains their for eternity.

8.4.3.question: Varah dwadashi is celebrated on the twelfth day of the bright half of the  _______  month-magh.This was the day on which Prithvi had been rescued by lord Varah- the incarnation of lord Vishnu.An idol of lord Varah is installed on a pot filled with water and worshipped with appropriate rituals amidst the continuous chanting of the mantra-'om varahay namah'.Offerings of various articles are made while worshipping lord Varah-sandal- wood,incense, naivedya,etc.After the accomplishment of the rituals brahmins are fed and charity given to them.One who observes a fast on this day enjoys a good health and prosperity.Such a man becomes absolved of all his sins and attains to heaven after his death.

8.4.5.question: Vaman dwadashi is celebrated on the twelfth day of the bright half of the  _______  month-chaitra.A devotee should observe a fast and worship lord Vaman by saying the following prayer-O Lord!Vaman-the dwarfish incarnation of the almighty Vishnu,who took incarnation on the auspicious day of dwadashi in the month of chaitra-I seek your blessings.
