8.4.6.question: This austerity is related with the worship of lord Parshuram who is also famous as Jamdagnya.It is cele- brated on the twelfth day of the bright half of the  _______  month-vaishakh.Before commencing the rituals, a devotee should purify himself by taking a bath and then worship an idol of lord Parshuram kept on a pot filled with water.While worshipping he should make offerings of various articles tothe deity-flowers, sandalwood,ardhya,etc.It is mandatory to remain awake for the whole night.On the following day,he should donate the idol to a brahmin.A devotee who observes a fast on this day gets all his wishes fulfilled and attains to Brahma loka.
8.4.6.explanation: This austerity is related with the worship of lord Parshuram who is also famous as Jamdagnya.It is cele- brated on the twelfth day of the bright half of the hindu month-vaishakh.Before commencing the rituals, a devotee should purify himself by taking a bath and then worship an idol of lord Parshuram kept on a pot filled with water.While worshipping he should make offerings of various articles tothe deity-flowers, sandalwood,ardhya,etc.It is mandatory to remain awake for the whole night.On the following day,he should donate the idol to a brahmin.A devotee who observes a fast on this day gets all his wishes fulfilled and attains to Brahma loka.

8.4.7.explanation: A devotee should commence this austerity by observing a fast on the eleventh day of the bright half of the hindu month-bhadrapad and break it on the following day-dwadashi.He should worship lord Kalki with appropriate rituals.As per the norms of the rituals,the idol of lord Kalki is placed on a pot which is filled with water.This idol is donated to a learned brahmin on the following day- trayodashi.

8.4.10.question: Lord Buddha is believed to be the incarnation of Lord Vishnu.The austerity begins on the eleventh day of the bright half of the  _______  month-shravan.On this day lord Vishnu is worshipped with appropriate rituals and by making offerings of various articles like flowers,fruits,incense,etc.The following mantras should be chanted while worshipping the various organs of lord Vishnu - • om damodaray namah - feet • om hrishikeshay namah - waist • om sanatanay namah - abdomen • om shri vatsadharine namah - chest • om chakrapanaye namah - arms • om haraye namah - throat • om manju keshay namah - head • om bhadray namah - top-knot(shikha).
8.4.10.explanation: Lord Buddha is believed to be the incarnation of Lord Vishnu.The austerity begins on the eleventh day of the bright half of the hindu month-shravan.On this day lord Vishnu is worshipped with appropriate rituals and by making offerings of various articles like flowers,fruits,incense,etc.The following mantras should be chanted while worshipping the various organs of lord Vishnu - • om damodaray namah - feet • om hrishikeshay namah - waist • om sanatanay namah - abdomen • om shri vatsadharine namah - chest • om chakrapanaye namah - arms • om haraye namah - throat • om manju keshay namah - head • om bhadray namah - top-knot(shikha).

8.5.1.question: This particular austerity on the first day of the  _______  month-margashirsh.It is related with the worship of lord Vishnu and the rituals have some special characteristics-having one meal on the eleventh day of the month(ekadashi),donating barley to brahmins,worshipping the idol of goddess Prithvi on 'ekadashi', etc.The austerity concludes on dwadashi.
8.5.1.explanation: This particular austerity on the first day of the hindu month-margashirsh.It is related with the worship of lord Vishnu and the rituals have some special characteristics-having one meal on the eleventh day of the month(ekadashi),donating barley to brahmins,worshipping the idol of goddess Prithvi on 'ekadashi', etc.The austerity concludes on dwadashi.

8.5.2.question: This particular austerity is a form of 'nakta-vrata',which means observing fast for the whole day and breaking it in the night.The austerity commences on the first day of the bright half of the hindu month- _______  and lasts for a year.Rituals include worshipping Agnideva-an embodiment of lord Vishnu,chanting of certain mantras praising the glory of the deity and performing 'havan'.There are specific instructions on the type of food a devotee should have during the course of this austerity-for four months(chaitra to ashadh) he should have delicacies like 'kheer' seasoned in pure ghee.From shravan to kartik he should have food- items prepared from gram-flour.
8.5.2.explanation: This particular austerity is a form of 'nakta-vrata',which means observing fast for the whole day and breaking it in the night.The austerity commences on the first day of the bright half of the hindu month-aghan and lasts for a year.Rituals include worshipping Agnideva-an embodiment of lord Vishnu,chanting of certain mantras praising the glory of the deity and performing 'havan'.There are specific instructions on the type of food a devotee should have during the course of this austerity-for four months(chaitra to ashadh) he should have delicacies like 'kheer' seasoned in pure ghee.From shravan to kartik he should have food- items prepared from gram-flour.

8.5.3.question: This austerity is related with the worship of sri Krishna and Balaram.It commences on the second day of the bright half of the  _______  month-kartik and lasts for a year whereby a devotee observes fast on the second day(bright half) of every month that follows.While worshipping Balarama,a devotee should chant-'om baldevay namah'and while worshipping sri Krishna he should chant- 'om keshavay namah'.
8.5.3.explanation: This austerity is related with the worship of sri Krishna and Balaram.It commences on the second day of the bright half of the hindu month-kartik and lasts for a year whereby a devotee observes fast on the second day(bright half) of every month that follows.While worshipping Balarama,a devotee should chant-'om baldevay namah'and while worshipping sri Krishna he should chant- 'om keshavay namah'.

8.5.3.question: Subsequently,'ardhya'is offered to both the deities.A devotee should have food prepared from barley-flour in the night but those devotees who have resolved to observe this austerity for four months beginning from 'falgun' should live only on 'kheer'.Offerings of rice and sesame seeds are made in the sacrificial- fire during the months of ' _______ ' and 'kartik' respectively.
8.5.3.explanation: Subsequently,'ardhya'is offered to both the deities.A devotee should have food prepared from barley-flour in the night but those devotees who have resolved to observe this austerity for four months beginning from 'falgun' should live only on 'kheer'.Offerings of rice and sesame seeds are made in the sacrificial- fire during the months of 'aghan' and 'kartik' respectively.

8.5.4.question: While worshipping,the devotee should chant the following  _______ -om gambhiray namah, om saubhagyay namah,om devdevay namah,om trinetray namah,om vachaspataye namah,om rudray namah,etc.One important feature of the rituals is making offerings of honey and ghee to the sacrificial fire.During the course of the rituals,a devotee should have food prepared from pure cereals preferably wheat.
8.5.4.explanation: While worshipping,the devotee should chant the following mantras-om gambhiray namah, om saubhagyay namah,om devdevay namah,om trinetray namah,om vachaspataye namah,om rudray namah,etc.One important feature of the rituals is making offerings of honey and ghee to the sacrificial fire.During the course of the rituals,a devotee should have food prepared from pure cereals preferably wheat.

8.5.4.question: This austerity commences on the third day of the bright half of the hindu month- falgun and lasts for a year whereby a devotee observes fast on the third day(bright half) of every month that follows.According to the tradition a devotee can either worship ' _______ -Parvati' or 'Sri Hari-Laxmi on this auspicious day.
8.5.4.explanation: This austerity commences on the third day of the bright half of the hindu month- falgun and lasts for a year whereby a devotee observes fast on the third day(bright half) of every month that follows.According to the tradition a devotee can either worship 'Shiva-Parvati' or 'Sri Hari-Laxmi on this auspicious day.

8.5.5.question: As the name implies,this austerity clears all the obstacles faced by a man.It commences on the fourth day of the bright half of the hindu month-falgun and lasts for four months whereby a devotee observes fast on the fourth day(bright half) of every month that follows.One important characteristic of this austerity is the importance and use of sesame seeds in it's rituals.It is not only the chief constituent of the diet but it is also offered in the sacrificial fire and donated to the brahmins as well.After observing this austerity for four months,a devotee should conclude it by worshipping lord Ganesh in the fifth month and donating the Ganesh-idol to a brahmin alongwith five pots filled with sesame seeds.While worshipping lord Ganesh,he should chant the following  _______ -om shooray namah, om dhiray namah,om gajananay namah,om lambodaray namah,om ekdanshtray namah,etc.A devotee thus becomes free from all kind of obstacles and all his wishes are fulfilled.
8.5.5.explanation: As the name implies,this austerity clears all the obstacles faced by a man.It commences on the fourth day of the bright half of the hindu month-falgun and lasts for four months whereby a devotee observes fast on the fourth day(bright half) of every month that follows.One important characteristic of this austerity is the importance and use of sesame seeds in it's rituals.It is not only the chief constituent of the diet but it is also offered in the sacrificial fire and donated to the brahmins as well.After observing this austerity for four months,a devotee should conclude it by worshipping lord Ganesh in the fifth month and donating the Ganesh-idol to a brahmin alongwith five pots filled with sesame seeds.While worshipping lord Ganesh,he should chant the following mantras-om shooray namah, om dhiray namah,om gajananay namah,om lambodaray namah,om ekdanshtray namah,etc.A devotee thus becomes free from all kind of obstacles and all his wishes are fulfilled.

8.5.7.question: This austerity is related with the worship of lord Kartikeya and is observed in the bright half of the  _______  month-pausha.On the sixth day of this month,a devotee is expected to live on nothing else but fruits.Lord Kartikeya is also known by several other names-Shadanan,Senani,Kritikasut,Kumar,Skand,etc.
8.5.7.explanation: This austerity is related with the worship of lord Kartikeya and is observed in the bright half of the hindu month-pausha.On the sixth day of this month,a devotee is expected to live on nothing else but fruits.Lord Kartikeya is also known by several other names-Shadanan,Senani,Kritikasut,Kumar,Skand,etc.

8.5.9.question: This austerity commences on the eighth day of the bright half of the  _______  month-bhadrapad.The rituals consist of taking a 'sankalp' on the preceding day(saptami)and worshipping lord sri Hari on the next day with appropriate rituals.Offerings are made to the sacrificial fire,which usually consist of articles like barley,sesame seeds,ghee,etc.The austerity concludes by feeding the invited brahmins and making donations to them.This way,the austerity continues for a year whereby a devotee observes fast on 'ashtami' of every month.A sonless person is blessed with a son if he observes this austerity with total devotion .This austerity,which is popularly known as 'Krishna ashtami'also helps a devotee to become absolved of gravest of sin.
8.5.9.explanation: This austerity commences on the eighth day of the bright half of the hindu month-bhadrapad.The rituals consist of taking a 'sankalp' on the preceding day(saptami)and worshipping lord sri Hari on the next day with appropriate rituals.Offerings are made to the sacrificial fire,which usually consist of articles like barley,sesame seeds,ghee,etc.The austerity concludes by feeding the invited brahmins and making donations to them.This way,the austerity continues for a year whereby a devotee observes fast on 'ashtami' of every month.A sonless person is blessed with a son if he observes this austerity with total devotion .This austerity,which is popularly known as 'Krishna ashtami'also helps a devotee to become absolved of gravest of sin.

8.6.1.question: As the name implies,an idol of a cow made from powdered  _______  seeds is donated to a brahmin.The idol should weigh not less than sixteen 'prasthas'(one prastha=four kudav,ancient units of weight measurment) Similarly,a calf's idol made from powdered  _______  seeds and weighing four 'prasthas'is donated to a brahmin.Apart from these idols ofcow and calf a devotee should also donate'deer-skin'.
8.6.1.explanation: As the name implies,an idol of a cow made from powdered sesame seeds is donated to a brahmin.The idol should weigh not less than sixteen 'prasthas'(one prastha=four kudav,ancient units of weight measurment) Similarly,a calf's idol made from powdered sesame seeds and weighing four 'prasthas'is donated to a brahmin.Apart from these idols ofcow and calf a devotee should also donate'deer-skin'.

8.6.1.question: As the name implies,an idol of a cow made from powdered  _______  seeds is donated to a brahmin.The idol should weigh not less than sixteen 'prasthas'(one prastha=four kudav,ancient units of weight measurment) Similarly,a calf's idol made from powdered  _______  seeds and weighing four 'prasthas'is donated to a brahmin.Apart from these idols ofcow and calf a devotee should also donate'deer-skin'.

8.6.2.question: The method of donating 'Jal Dhenu' is as follows-first of all small area of land is purified by coating it with cow dung and place two small pots are placed at the centre.These pots are filled with different things like water, _______ ,sandalwood,etc.The devotee should then imagine goddess Jal Dhenu and her calf to be dwelling in those pots respectively.Both the pots are adequately adorned with various articles like sandalwood,flowers and then worshipped.After the completion of the rituals both the idols are donated to brahmins.A person who donates Jal Dhenu or a brahmin who accepts it attains to Vishnu loka after being absolved of all his sins.
8.6.2.explanation: The method of donating 'Jal Dhenu' is as follows-first of all small area of land is purified by coating it with cow dung and place two small pots are placed at the centre.These pots are filled with different things like water,camphor,sandalwood,etc.The devotee should then imagine goddess Jal Dhenu and her calf to be dwelling in those pots respectively.Both the pots are adequately adorned with various articles like sandalwood,flowers and then worshipped.After the completion of the rituals both the idols are donated to brahmins.A person who donates Jal Dhenu or a brahmin who accepts it attains to Vishnu loka after being absolved of all his sins.

8.7.2.question: "Unfortunately,he forgot everything about his vow once he took rebirth as a girl.In course of time,the girl grew up and married a young nishad.She had many children from him.One day,the nishad girl who in reality was Somsharma,went to take a bath in the holy  _______ .As soon as she entered into the river,she got transformed into a hermit.She was filled with extreme bewilderment but this was not the end,as there were more surprises to come."
8.7.2.explanation: "Unfortunately,he forgot everything about his vow once he took rebirth as a girl.In course of time,the girl grew up and married a young nishad.She had many children from him.One day,the nishad girl who in reality was Somsharma,went to take a bath in the holy Ganges.As soon as she entered into the river,she got transformed into a hermit.She was filled with extreme bewilderment but this was not the end,as there were more surprises to come."

8.7.2.question: Finally I was left with no option but to fulfil his wish.One day Somsharma had gone to take his bath in the holy  _______ .Hardly had he taken a dip than he found himself experiencing the pangs of birth in the womb of a nishad woman.Evidently,lord sri Hari had began giving a glimpse of his divine powers to Somsharma.It was a terrible experience for him and he vowed to lead a chaste life as soon as he came out of the womb."
8.7.2.explanation: Finally I was left with no option but to fulfil his wish.One day Somsharma had gone to take his bath in the holy Ganges.Hardly had he taken a dip than he found himself experiencing the pangs of birth in the womb of a nishad woman.Evidently,lord sri Hari had began giving a glimpse of his divine powers to Somsharma.It was a terrible experience for him and he vowed to lead a chaste life as soon as he came out of the womb."

8.7.4.question: Continuing with his tale,lord Varah told Prithvi-"There is a sacred place in the Himalayas which is very inaccessible.It is famously known as Badrikashram and holds an important place among all the holy places.One who makes a pilgrimage to that place gets all his wishes fulfilled.There is a reservoir at the mountain top called Brahma kund.One who observes fast for three consecutive nights and takes a holy dip in that reservoir attains virtues similar to "Agnishtom yagya".One who takes his last birth in it's vicinity certainly attains to my abode.There are several other holy places in the vicinity of Badrikashram like Agnisatya pad, Indra loka,Satya loka,Chatuhsrota,Ved dhar,etc.Ved dhar is the same place where the  _______  had manifested from lord Brahma's mouth.
8.7.4.explanation: Continuing with his tale,lord Varah told Prithvi-"There is a sacred place in the Himalayas which is very inaccessible.It is famously known as Badrikashram and holds an important place among all the holy places.One who makes a pilgrimage to that place gets all his wishes fulfilled.There is a reservoir at the mountain top called Brahma kund.One who observes fast for three consecutive nights and takes a holy dip in that reservoir attains virtues similar to "Agnishtom yagya".One who takes his last birth in it's vicinity certainly attains to my abode.There are several other holy places in the vicinity of Badrikashram like Agnisatya pad, Indra loka,Satya loka,Chatuhsrota,Ved dhar,etc.Ved dhar is the same place where the vedas had manifested from lord Brahma's mouth.

8.7.9.question: "Once,lord Shiva visited the hermitage of sage Aurvanam accompanied by his consort-Uma.The purpose of the visit was to seek Aurvanam's help in curing his restlessness.Sage Aurvanam advised him to have a bath with the milk of surabhi cow.I(lord Vishnu) then brought down seventy-seven surabhi cows from the  _______  and thus helped Shiva take bath with their milk.At last,Shiva's reastlessness came to an end and this holy place became famous as 'Gonishkraman' teerth."
8.7.9.explanation: "Once,lord Shiva visited the hermitage of sage Aurvanam accompanied by his consort-Uma.The purpose of the visit was to seek Aurvanam's help in curing his restlessness.Sage Aurvanam advised him to have a bath with the milk of surabhi cow.I(lord Vishnu) then brought down seventy-seven surabhi cows from the heaven and thus helped Shiva take bath with their milk.At last,Shiva's reastlessness came to an end and this holy place became famous as 'Gonishkraman' teerth."

8.7.14.question: There are many other holy places in and around Mathura- Vishranti, Surya teerth,Koti teerth,Vayu teerth,etc.Each one of them has it's own religious significance.A holy  _______  named 'Vatsa-krindan' lies in Mathura region.Anybody taking a holy dip in that holy  _______  is certain to attain to the abode of 'Vayu'.In the vicinity lies Vrindavan,the holiest place which would be witness to many of my divine plays."
8.7.14.explanation: There are many other holy places in and around Mathura- Vishranti, Surya teerth,Koti teerth,Vayu teerth,etc.Each one of them has it's own religious significance.A holy pond named 'Vatsa-krindan' lies in Mathura region.Anybody taking a holy dip in that holy pond is certain to attain to the abode of 'Vayu'.In the vicinity lies Vrindavan,the holiest place which would be witness to many of my divine plays."

8.8.1.question: Lord Varah replied that a devotee desirous of making a wooden idol must select the wood of ' _______  latifolia' for his purpose.The wood should be purified and then given shape as per the appearance of the deity.The idol is then installed in a temple amidst the performance of appropriate .During installation ceremony various articles like camphor,vermillion, sandalwood,incense,etc.are offered to the deity.The swastika mark is a sign of auspiciousness so the devotee must keep this in mind while giving shape to the idol.
8.8.1.explanation: Lord Varah replied that a devotee desirous of making a wooden idol must select the wood of 'Bassia latifolia' for his purpose.The wood should be purified and then given shape as per the appearance of the deity.The idol is then installed in a temple amidst the performance of appropriate .During installation ceremony various articles like camphor,vermillion, sandalwood,incense,etc.are offered to the deity.The swastika mark is a sign of auspiciousness so the devotee must keep this in mind while giving shape to the idol.

8.8.1.question: This swastika mark must be carved out on the idol.Similarly,other signs of lord Vishnu like 'srivatsa' and'kaushtubh' should also be carved out on the idol.Lord Vishnu is then invoked and requested to dwell within that idol by chanting mantras.After the deity has been invoked, the 'wood' no longer remains a lifeless structure but it becomes the embodiment of the deity.The idol is then considered to be fit for worship.While worshipping, a devotee should offer a bhoga of kheer to the deity.Burning a ghee or sesame-oil lamp in front of the deity is considered good.The devotee should then circumambulate around the  _______  premise.While circumambulating, he should keep on chanting the sacred mantra 'om namo narayanay'.The idol thus installed should be worshipped daily without failure."

8.8.1.explanation: Lord Varah replied that a devotee desirous of making a wooden idol must select the wood of 'Bassia latifolia' for his purpose.The wood should be purified and then given shape as per the appearance of the deity.The idol is then installed in a temple amidst the performance of appropriate .During installation ceremony various articles like camphor,vermillion, sandalwood,incense,etc.are offered to the deity.The swastika mark is a sign of auspiciousness so the devotee must keep this in mind while giving shape to the idol.

8.8.2.question: "A proficient sculptor should be chosen to carve out the deity's shape from a pure and spotless stone.First of all the sculptor should clearly draw the outline of deity's appearance on the stone with a marker and then carefully carve it out from the stone.The idol is then purified by sprinkling 'akshat' on the deity's idol.While worshipping a devotee should burn a ghee lamp and invoke lord Vishnu to dwell in that idol by chanting the sacred  _______ -om namo narayanay.The installation of idol being complete,he should observe a fast for the whole night.Next morning,after finishing his daily chores he should put on white clothes and change his old 'yagyopavit' with a new one.The idol thus made is considered fit to be worshipped.Purva-bhadrapad is considered to be the best time for the installation of a stone-idol.During the course of installation ceremony,a devotee should live either on milk or cereal like barley.The rituals of worship consist of numerous activities like lighting four lamps in front of the deity,keeping four small pots each filled up with articles like 'panchagavya',water,sandalwood and milk.The rituals of worship are considered to be incomplete without the chantings of vedic  _______ s."
8.8.2.explanation: "A proficient sculptor should be chosen to carve out the deity's shape from a pure and spotless stone.First of all the sculptor should clearly draw the outline of deity's appearance on the stone with a marker and then carefully carve it out from the stone.The idol is then purified by sprinkling 'akshat' on the deity's idol.While worshipping a devotee should burn a ghee lamp and invoke lord Vishnu to dwell in that idol by chanting the sacred mantra-om namo narayanay.The installation of idol being complete,he should observe a fast for the whole night.Next morning,after finishing his daily chores he should put on white clothes and change his old 'yagyopavit' with a new one.The idol thus made is considered fit to be worshipped.Purva-bhadrapad is considered to be the best time for the installation of a stone-idol.During the course of installation ceremony,a devotee should live either on milk or cereal like barley.The rituals of worship consist of numerous activities like lighting four lamps in front of the deity,keeping four small pots each filled up with articles like 'panchagavya',water,sandalwood and milk.The rituals of worship are considered to be incomplete without the chantings of vedic mantras."

8.8.5.question: Anybody who either buys or sells a shaligram is certain to go to  _______ ."
8.8.5.explanation: Anybody who either buys or sells a shaligram is certain to go to hell."

8.9.1.question: 'The dead body should then be carried and kept under a tree where it is purified by smearing ghee,oil,perfumes,etc.It is then carried to creamation ground and kept at the bank of a river-feet pointing towards south.After this,the dead body should be bathed by remembering all the sacred places of pilgrimage.It should then be kept on the pyre-feet pointing south.The pyre should be lit and the following prayer should be said-O Agnideva!I pray to you to burn all the sins committed by this person so that he attains to  _______ .Now,circumambulation around the pyre is made and the pyre is lit towards the head side.'
8.9.1.explanation: 'The dead body should then be carried and kept under a tree where it is purified by smearing ghee,oil,perfumes,etc.It is then carried to creamation ground and kept at the bank of a river-feet pointing towards south.After this,the dead body should be bathed by remembering all the sacred places of pilgrimage.It should then be kept on the pyre-feet pointing south.The pyre should be lit and the following prayer should be said-O Agnideva!I pray to you to burn all the sins committed by this person so that he attains to heaven.Now,circumambulation around the pyre is made and the pyre is lit towards the head side.'

8.10.4.explanation: A man takes birth on the basis of his past Karmas.

8.10.4.explanation: A man should perform his duties with a sense of detachment,because attachment results into the transmigration of the soul.

8.10.4.explanation: So when a man finds himself amidst sorrows he must realize that he is reaping the fruits of his past actions.

8.10.4.explanation: If a man commits virtuous deeds then joy is experienced but sinful deeds invite sorrows and miseries.

8.10.4.explanation: A man can liberate himself from sins by engaging in virtuous deeds and abstaining from sinful deeds.

8.10.4.explanation: Observing fast on Ekadashi also helps a man to become liberated from his sins."

9.13.explanation: The underworld is a wonderful place, more beautiful than heaven itself.

9.15.explanation: Indradyumna's own capital was the city of Avanti, in the kingdom of Malva.

9.16.explanation: Suddenly he saw the banyan tree floating on the water.

9.17.explanation: Having thus taken an oath, king Shveta worshipped Shiva with one thousand and one hundred blue lotus flowers.

9.18.explanation: I shall grant Vishnu whatever he wants.” Vali went to the dwarf to ascertain what the dwarf wanted.

9.32.explanation: The monkey Hanumana then went to the Himalayas and brought a mountain named Grandhamadana to Lanka.

9.32.explanation: They again asked several people and most people said that is was adharma (evil) which triumphed.

9.32.explanation: Naturally most people said that it was the evil who thrived and prospered.

9.33.explanation: Pramlocha wished to return to heaven, but Kandu would not let her.

9.33.explanation: “I brought you to my hut and it is now evening, I don’t understand what you are trying to say.

9.33.explanation: After years and years had passed, Kandu came out of his hut, looking rather distracted.

9.33.explanation: These we will skip, since they are described in much greater detail in the other Puranas.

9.34.explanation: In similar fashion, a kshatriya is permitted to adopt the livelihoods of vaishyas or shudras and a vaishya is permitted to adopt the livelihoods of shudras.

9.34.explanation: The duties of kshatriya are to beat arms and protect the earth, donate alms and perform sacrifices.

9.34.explanation: Their names are brahmana, kshatriya, vaishya and shudra.

9.34.explanation: A kshatriya is also permitted to study the shastras.

9.34.explanation: The duties of a brahmana are to donate alms, perform tapasya, worship the gods, perform yajnas and study the Vedas.

9.34.question: During this period, the individual spends his days with his guru and studies the  _______  well.
9.34.explanation: During this period, the individual spends his days with his guru and studies the Vedas well.

9.35.explanation: He used to be a hermit well-versed in the Vedas and the shastras.

10.1.1.explanation: Bhuloka is the earth, svarloka or svarga is heaven and bhuvarloka is a region between the earth and heaven.

10.1.1.explanation: Bhuloka is the earth, svarloka or svarga is heaven and bhuvarloka is a region between the earth and heaven.

10.1.2.explanation: They defeated the demons and regained heaven.

10.1.3.explanation: Thus, Hiranyaksha became the king of the heaven, the earth and the underworld.

10.1.3.explanation: He comprehensively defeated the gods and conquered heaven.

10.1.3.explanation: Vishnu thus saved the gods and the principles of righteousness or dharma.

10.3.1.explanation: The listener attains his desires and goes to heaven.

10.3.2.explanation: The sages therefore killed Vena with a straw and after Vena had died, they began to knead the dead body’s right hand and it was thus that Prithu emerged.

10.3.2.explanation: And Prithu’s father Vena was also a king.

10.4.4.question: If one is going on a trip, then  _______  is the best day to start on.
10.4.4.explanation: If one is going on a trip, then Friday is the best day to start on.

10.4.4.question: If one wishes to have a bath after recovering from an illness, then  _______  is the best day for such a bath.
10.4.4.explanation: If one wishes to have a bath after recovering from an illness, then Saturday is the best day for such a bath.

10.4.4.question: The first time a child’s head is shaved should never be on Tuesday or a  _______ .
10.4.4.explanation: The first time a child’s head is shaved should never be on Tuesday or a Saturday.

10.4.4.question: A new house should not be entered into the months of Chaitra, Jyeshtha, Bhadra, Ashvina, Pousha or  _______ .
10.4.4.explanation: A new house should not be entered into the months of Chaitra, Jyeshtha, Bhadra, Ashvina, Pousha or Magha.

10.4.4.question: For example, marriages are never to be held in the months of Chaitra and Pousha or under the signs of  _______  or Gemini.
10.4.4.explanation: For example, marriages are never to be held in the months of Chaitra and Pousha or under the signs of Libra or Gemini.

10.4.4.question: For example, marriages are never to be held in the months of Chaitra and Pousha or under the signs of Libra or  _______ .
10.4.4.explanation: For example, marriages are never to be held in the months of Chaitra and Pousha or under the signs of Libra or Gemini.

10.4.4.question: The first time a child’s head is shaved should never be on  _______  or a Saturday.
10.4.4.explanation: The first time a child’s head is shaved should never be on Tuesday or a Saturday.

10.5.1.question: The eighth Manu’s name is Savarni and the eighth Indra’s  _______ .
10.5.1.explanation: The eighth Manu’s name is Savarni and the eighth Indra’s Vali.

10.5.2.question: The sacred thread ceremony is to be held at the age of eight years for brahmanas, eleven years for  _______  and twelve years for vaishyas.
10.5.2.explanation: The sacred thread ceremony is to be held at the age of eight years for brahmanas, eleven years for kshatriyas and twelve years for vaishyas.

10.5.2.question: Performing sacrifices, donating alms and studying the Vedas are duties that brahmanas,  _______  and vaishyas must perform.
10.5.2.explanation: Performing sacrifices, donating alms and studying the Vedas are duties that brahmanas, kshatriyas and vaishyas must perform.

10.5.2.question: In addition, the  _______  must protect the good and punish the evil.
10.5.2.explanation: In addition, the kshatriyas must protect the good and punish the evil.

10.5.2.question: The four varnas are brahmanas,  _______ , vaishyas and shudras.
10.5.2.explanation: The four varnas are brahmanas, kshatriyas, vaishyas and shudras.

10.5.2.question: Performing sacrifices, donating alms and studying the  _______  are duties that brahmanas, kshatriyas and vaishyas must perform.
10.5.2.explanation: Performing sacrifices, donating alms and studying the Vedas are duties that brahmanas, kshatriyas and vaishyas must perform.

10.5.2.question: He should never criticise the  _______ , the shastras, the devas, the sages and the king.
10.5.2.explanation: He should never criticise the Vedas, the shastras, the devas, the sages and the king.

10.5.2.question: It also meant the practice of the system of the four classes ( _______ ) and the four stages in life (ashrama).
10.5.2.explanation: It also meant the practice of the system of the four classes (varna) and the four stages in life (ashrama).

10.5.2.question: has become a hermit or is such a sinner that he is expelled from his own  _______ .
10.5.2.explanation: has become a hermit or is such a sinner that he is expelled from his own varna.

10.5.2.question: The husband and the wife should be from the same  _______ .
10.5.2.explanation: The husband and the wife should be from the same varna.

10.5.2.question: Marriage across  _______  is to be avoided.
10.5.2.explanation: Marriage across varna is to be avoided.

10.5.2.question: All the Manus practised the precepts of  _______  (righteousness).
10.5.2.explanation: All the Manus practised the precepts of dharma (righteousness).

10.5.2.question: All the  _______  practised the precepts of dharma (righteousness).
10.5.2.explanation: All the Manus practised the precepts of dharma (righteousness).

10.5.2.question: His duties are to discuss the shastras ( _______  texts) and associate with learned men.
10.5.2.explanation: His duties are to discuss the shastras (holy texts) and associate with learned men.

10.5.2.question: Apart from that, he will meditate in  _______  on the true nature of the brahman.
10.5.2.explanation: Apart from that, he will meditate in solitude on the true nature of the brahman.

10.5.3.question: Other sins are criticising the  _______ , the bearing of false witness, killing a friend, killing a cow, forsaking one’s parents or sons, the selling of ponds, murder, lying, killing animals and the cutting down of green trees for fodder.
10.5.3.explanation: Other sins are criticising the Vedas, the bearing of false witness, killing a friend, killing a cow, forsaking one’s parents or sons, the selling of ponds, murder, lying, killing animals and the cutting down of green trees for fodder.

10.5.3.question: Killing a cat, a  _______ , a frog, a dog, a lizard or a crow is as sinful as killing a shudra.
10.5.3.explanation: Killing a cat, a mongoose, a frog, a dog, a lizard or a crow is as sinful as killing a shudra.

10.5.4.question: Trayodashi vrata is on the thirteenth day of the lunar fortnight and this ritual was first performed by the god of lover when he wanted to please  _______ .
10.5.4.explanation: Trayodashi vrata is on the thirteenth day of the lunar fortnight and this ritual was first performed by the god of lover when he wanted to please Shiva.

10.5.4.question: It was on the third day of the lunar fortnight (tritiya), in shuklapaksha and in the month of Chaitra, that  _______  married Parvati or Gouri.
10.5.4.explanation: It was on the third day of the lunar fortnight (tritiya), in shuklapaksha and in the month of Chaitra, that Shiva married Parvati or Gouri.

10.5.4.question: The fourteenth day of the lunar fortnight (chaturdashi) is also earmarked for  _______ , particularly in the month of Kartika.
10.5.4.explanation: The fourteenth day of the lunar fortnight (chaturdashi) is also earmarked for Shiva, particularly in the month of Kartika.

10.5.4.question: These are Lalita, Vijaya, Bhadra Bhavani, Kumuda,  _______ , Vasudevi and Gouri.
10.5.4.explanation: These are Lalita, Vijaya, Bhadra Bhavani, Kumuda, Shiva, Vasudevi and Gouri.

10.5.4.question: _______  and Parvati have to be given offerings of fruit.
10.5.4.explanation: Shiva and Parvati have to be given offerings of fruit.

10.5.4.question: This is the tithi on which  _______  is worshipped.
10.5.4.explanation: This is the tithi on which Shiva is worshipped.

10.6.1.question: A person who does not perform yajnas goes to Kuttala and is  _______  blood.
10.6.1.explanation: A person who does not perform yajnas goes to Kuttala and is fed blood.

10.6.1.question: A person who eats sweets alone goes to Kakola and is  _______  only worms.
10.6.1.explanation: A person who eats sweets alone goes to Kakola and is fed only worms.

10.6.1.question: There are several other narakas for those who encourage inter-class marriages, those who kill animals, those who cut trees, those who eat too much meat, those who criticise the  _______ , those who bear also witness and those who criticise their teachers.
10.6.1.explanation: There are several other narakas for those who encourage inter-class marriages, those who kill animals, those who cut trees, those who eat too much meat, those who criticise the Vedas, those who bear also witness and those who criticise their teachers.

10.6.3.question: Their names are Apana, Samana, Udana, Vyana,  _______ , Kurma, Krikara, Devadatta and Dhananjaya.
10.6.3.explanation: Their names are Apana, Samana, Udana, Vyana, Naga, Kurma, Krikara, Devadatta and Dhananjaya.

10.6.4.question: _______  means to use illusions or deceit and upeksha is to deliberately ignore people so as to achieve one’s purpose.
10.6.4.explanation: Maya means to use illusions or deceit and upeksha is to deliberately ignore people so as to achieve one’s purpose.

10.6.4.question: These were known as sama, dana, danda, bheda,  _______ , upeksha and indrajala.
10.6.4.explanation: These were known as sama, dana, danda, bheda, maya, upeksha and indrajala.

10.6.4.question: His ministers should also be wise and his queen should be a woman who follows the path of  _______ .
10.6.4.explanation: His ministers should also be wise and his queen should be a woman who follows the path of dharma.

10.6.4.question: _______  ministers with silver vessels full of sweet and thickened milk will stand on the eastern side.
10.6.4.explanation: Kshatriya ministers with silver vessels full of sweet and thickened milk will stand on the eastern side.

10.6.4.question: The general has got to be a brahmana or a  _______ .
10.6.4.explanation: The general has got to be a brahmana or a kshatriya.

10.6.4.question: From whatever is received as taxes, half will go into the royal  _______  and the remaining half will be distributed amongst the brahmanas.
10.6.4.explanation: From whatever is received as taxes, half will go into the royal treasury and the remaining half will be distributed amongst the brahmanas.

10.6.4.question: If there is a theft in the kingdom, the king must immediately replace what has been stolen with wealth taken from his own royal  _______ .
10.6.4.explanation: If there is a theft in the kingdom, the king must immediately replace what has been stolen with wealth taken from his own royal treasury.

10.6.4.question: If the thief is caught and the stolen goods recovered, they are used to replenish the  _______ .
10.6.4.explanation: If the thief is caught and the stolen goods recovered, they are used to replenish the treasury.

10.7.1.question: Other examples are: where the  _______  dreams that he is playing with monkeys or chandalas, when he dreams that devas, brahmanas, the king or the guru is angry or when he dreams that his house had collapsed.
10.7.1.explanation: Other examples are: where the dreamer dreams that he is playing with monkeys or chandalas, when he dreams that devas, brahmanas, the king or the guru is angry or when he dreams that his house had collapsed.

10.7.1.question: Examples are: dreams about grass or trees growing on one’s body, dreams in which the  _______  is shaven-headed or is wearing shabby clothes or dreams in which one is falling form above.
10.7.1.explanation: Examples are: dreams about grass or trees growing on one’s body, dreams in which the dreamer is shaven-headed or is wearing shabby clothes or dreams in which one is falling form above.

10.7.1.question: Other dreams which have good interpretations are, for example, dreams of the  _______ ’s receiving blessings form devas or brahmanas or of being anointed with water.
10.7.1.explanation: Other dreams which have good interpretations are, for example, dreams of the dreamer’s receiving blessings form devas or brahmanas or of being anointed with water.

10.7.1.question: Especially good dreams are those of the  _______ ’s possessing many arms or many heads or of grass and bushes sprouting form his navel.
10.7.1.explanation: Especially good dreams are those of the dreamer’s possessing many arms or many heads or of grass and bushes sprouting form his navel.

10.7.1.question: Brahmanas have to be worshipped, a yajna has to be performed and the  _______  has to pray to Vishnu, Shiva, Brahma, Ganesha or Surya.
10.7.1.explanation: Brahmanas have to be worshipped, a yajna has to be performed and the dreamer has to pray to Vishnu, Shiva, Brahma, Ganesha or Surya.

10.7.1.question: Strangely enough, a dream where the  _______  sees that he is eating rice pudding is a good dream.
10.7.1.explanation: Strangely enough, a dream where the dreamer sees that he is eating rice pudding is a good dream.

10.7.1.question: The relatives of such a  _______  increase in number and he also prospers.
10.7.1.explanation: The relatives of such a dreamer increase in number and he also prospers.

10.7.1.question: Or the  _______  might dream that he is riding on a horse or a bull.
10.7.1.explanation: Or the dreamer might dream that he is riding on a horse or a bull.

10.7.1.question: The  _______  who dreams of his coronation is blessed.
10.7.1.explanation: The dreamer who dreams of his coronation is blessed.

10.7.2.question: Good omens are white flowers, full vessels, meat, distant noises, an old goat, a cow, a horse, an elephant, fire, gold silver, a sword, an umbrella, fruit, clarified butter, curds, a conch shell,  _______ , the sound of thunder, lightning and a dead body with no one crying over it.
10.7.2.explanation: Good omens are white flowers, full vessels, meat, distant noises, an old goat, a cow, a horse, an elephant, fire, gold silver, a sword, an umbrella, fruit, clarified butter, curds, a conch shell, sugarcane, the sound of thunder, lightning and a dead body with no one crying over it.

10.7.2.question: If a boar or a  _______  crosses over from the left to the right, that is a good omen.
10.7.2.explanation: If a boar or a buffalo crosses over from the left to the right, that is a good omen.

10.7.3.question: On the first day, Vishnu,  _______  and Ganesha have to be worshipped.
10.7.3.explanation: On the first day, Vishnu, Shiva and Ganesha have to be worshipped.

10.7.3.question: The start of the  _______  must be accompanied with the playing of musical instruments.
10.7.3.explanation: The start of the march must be accompanied with the playing of musical instruments.

10.7.3.question: Once the army has begun to  _______ , it must never look back.
10.7.3.explanation: Once the army has begun to march, it must never look back.

10.7.3.question: If a soldier dies in the course of battle, he goes straight to  _______ .
10.7.3.explanation: If a soldier dies in the course of battle, he goes straight to heaven.

10.7.4.question: These are the king, the ministers, the friends, the  _______ , the army, the forts and the state itself.
10.7.4.explanation: These are the king, the ministers, the friends, the treasury, the army, the forts and the state itself.

10.7.4.question: The king’s signs are his golden rod or  _______  and an umbrella that is held over his head.
10.7.4.explanation: The king’s signs are his golden rod or sceptre and an umbrella that is held over his head.

10.8.1.question: The string of the bow should be pulled back such that the tassel of the arrow is between the  _______ ’s ear and right eye.
10.8.1.explanation: The string of the bow should be pulled back such that the tassel of the arrow is between the archer’s ear and right eye.

10.8.1.question: The target has to be in line with the left fist and the  _______ ’s posture has to be like that of a triangle.
10.8.1.explanation: The target has to be in line with the left fist and the archer’s posture has to be like that of a triangle.

10.8.1.question: The bow should now be raised and the lower end of the bow should be in line with the  _______ ’s navel.
10.8.1.explanation: The bow should now be raised and the lower end of the bow should be in line with the archer’s navel.

10.8.1.question: The  _______  has to be still as a pillar.
10.8.1.explanation: The archer has to be still as a pillar.

10.8.1.question: A noose ( _______ ) is ten arms in length, with both ends of the weapon being circular.
10.8.1.explanation: A noose (pasha) is ten arms in length, with both ends of the weapon being circular.

10.8.3.question: The Brahmavaivarta Purana is for the month of  _______ , the Linga Purana for the month of Falguna and the Varaha Purana for the month of Chaitra.
10.8.3.explanation: The Brahmavaivarta Purana is for the month of Magha, the Linga Purana for the month of Falguna and the Varaha Purana for the month of Chaitra.

10.8.4.question: Tara was eventually restored to Brihaspati, but  _______  and Tara had a son named Budha.
10.8.4.explanation: Tara was eventually restored to Brihaspati, but Soma and Tara had a son named Budha.

10.8.4.question: Having performed the sacrifice,  _______  became the ruler of all the worlds.
10.8.4.explanation: Having performed the sacrifice, Soma became the ruler of all the worlds.

10.8.4.question: Brahma also had a son named Atri and Atri had a son named  _______ .
10.8.4.explanation: Brahma also had a son named Atri and Atri had a son named Soma.

10.8.4.question: _______  performed a rajasuya yajna (royal sacrifice).
10.8.4.explanation: Soma performed a rajasuya yajna (royal sacrifice).

10.8.4.question: The fifth war between the devas and the asuras took place over the abduction of  _______  and this came to be known as the  _______ kamaya war.
10.8.4.explanation: The fifth war between the devas and the asuras took place over the abduction of Tara and this came to be known as the Tarakamaya war.

10.8.4.question: _______  was eventually restored to Brihaspati, but Soma and  _______  had a son named Budha.
10.8.4.explanation: Tara was eventually restored to Brihaspati, but Soma and Tara had a son named Budha.

10.8.4.question: _______  was eventually restored to Brihaspati, but Soma and  _______  had a son named Budha.
10.8.4.explanation: Tara was eventually restored to Brihaspati, but Soma and Tara had a son named Budha.

10.8.4.question: This made him very arrogant and he abducted the sage Brihaspati’s wife  _______ .
10.8.4.explanation: This made him very arrogant and he abducted the sage Brihaspati’s wife Tara.

10.9.2.explanation: Yama then decides whether the dead person should go to heaven or to hell.

10.9.2.explanation: After he has served his time in heaven or in hell, he is born again.

10.9.2.explanation: Some sinners are fed heated iron balls, others are fed blood and rubbish.

10.9.2.question: Some sinners are  _______  heated iron balls, others are  _______  blood and rubbish.
10.9.2.explanation: Some sinners are fed heated iron balls, others are fed blood and rubbish.

10.9.3.explanation: Alternatively, one can visualise the paramatman in a blaze of light, in the centre of the lotus.

10.9.3.question: One thinks that detachment is the stem of the  _______  and praying to Vishnu its stamen.
10.9.3.explanation: One thinks that detachment is the stem of the lotus and praying to Vishnu its stamen.

10.9.3.question: Right in the centre of the  _______  is a pure spark of fire and that is the paramatman.
10.9.3.explanation: Right in the centre of the lotus is a pure spark of fire and that is the paramatman.

10.9.3.question: Padmasana ( _______  position) is one such recommended posture.
10.9.3.explanation: Padmasana (lotus position) is one such recommended posture.

10.9.3.question: In the centre of the circles is a divine  _______ .
10.9.3.explanation: In the centre of the circles is a divine lotus.

10.9.3.question: Since the senses are controlled, one goes to heaven and avoids going to  _______ .
10.9.3.explanation: Since the senses are controlled, one goes to heaven and avoids going to hell.

10.9.3.question: Such a meditator automatically gets to know all the knowledge that can be gleaned from the  _______  or the shastras.
10.9.3.explanation: Such a meditator automatically gets to know all the knowledge that can be gleaned from the Vedas or the shastras.

10.9.3.question: One sits on such a seat and tries to purify one’s atman by controlling one’s mind and senses through  _______ .
10.9.3.explanation: One sits on such a seat and tries to purify one’s atman by controlling one’s mind and senses through yoga.

10.9.3.question: One who practices  _______  should not go around collecting material possessions.
10.9.3.explanation: One who practices yoga should not go around collecting material possessions.

10.9.3.question: _______  means union, it is the union of the jivatman with the paramatman.
10.9.3.explanation: Yoga means union, it is the union of the jivatman with the paramatman.

10.9.3.question: _______  is the way to circumvent the miseries of life.
10.9.3.explanation: Yoga is the way to circumvent the miseries of life.

10.9.3.question: The first prerequisites of  _______  is non-violence.
10.9.3.explanation: The first prerequisites of yoga is non-violence.

10.9.3.question: _______  concentrates one’s mind on the paramatman.
10.9.3.explanation: Yoga concentrates one’s mind on the paramatman.

10.9.3.question: The second requirement of  _______  is truthfulness.
10.9.3.explanation: The second requirement of yoga is truthfulness.

10.9.4.question: The brahman is the  _______  who is the origin of everything and the individual is part of the brahman.
10.9.4.explanation: The brahman is the Lord who is the origin of everything and the individual is part of the brahman.

10.9.4.question: By performing yajnas one can attain  _______ .
10.9.4.explanation: By performing yajnas one can attain heaven.

11.6.explanation: While he was speaking thus, sun-god revealed his identity to Jiva and went to Prayaga (Allahabad) and being in a happy mood he said to the demigods: “In kali-yuga, when the mlecchas will be ruling the kingdom, I will come to Vrindavana and preach for the mission of the Devas."

11.6.explanation: On the purnima, the full moon day, the sun-god came down to the earth and said to demigods: I will take birth in Kali-yuga in Vrindavana and this brahmana will execute favorable acts for the demigods.

11.7.question: Thus the sun- _______  Vishvakarma (the architect of the  _______ s) became pleased with this sacrifice and descended on the top of a big pillar in Pampasarovara, the lake named Pampa, having a brilliant shining form.
11.7.explanation: Thus the sun-god Vishvakarma (the architect of the gods) became pleased with this sacrifice and descended on the top of a big pillar in Pampasarovara, the lake named Pampa, having a brilliant shining form.

11.7.question: Whatever profit he made he used for worshipping the sun- _______  in the month of Magha (January- February) by performing sacrifices.
11.7.explanation: Whatever profit he made he used for worshipping the sun-god in the month of Magha (January- February) by performing sacrifices.

11.7.question: Saying this the sun- _______  went to Bengal and took birth in the house of a brahmana named Kanduke.
11.7.explanation: Saying this the sun-god went to Bengal and took birth in the house of a brahmana named Kanduke.

11.7.question: At the noon time, Heli offered food to the sun- _______  according to his desire.
11.7.explanation: At the noon time, Heli offered food to the sun-god according to his desire.

11.7.question: Therefore O king of devas you may worship the sun- _______ , he will help you.
11.7.explanation: Therefore O king of devas you may worship the sun-god, he will help you.

11.7.question: And after a hundred years all of them attained the kingdom of  _______ .
11.7.explanation: And after a hundred years all of them attained the kingdom of God.

11.7.question: He was a worshipper of the sun- _______  and he knew the 64 arts.
11.7.explanation: He was a worshipper of the sun-god and he knew the 64 arts.

11.7.question: Suta Goswami said: The ghostly Kutukoddina, with human nature, was situated in the kingdom of  _______ .
11.7.explanation: Suta Goswami said: The ghostly Kutukoddina, with human nature, was situated in the kingdom of Delhi.

11.7.question: When Shahoddina heard this, he came to  _______ , conquered the kings and broke all the deities.
11.7.explanation: When Shahoddina heard this, he came to Delhi, conquered the kings and broke all the deities.

11.7.question: Kutukaddin with ten-thousand warriors went there and defeated him and returned to  _______ .
11.7.explanation: Kutukaddin with ten-thousand warriors went there and defeated him and returned to Delhi.

11.7.question: Whatever profit he made he used for worshipping the sun-god in the month of  _______  (January- February) by performing sacrifices.
11.7.explanation: Whatever profit he made he used for worshipping the sun-god in the month of Magha (January- February) by performing sacrifices.

12.1.question: As for Lakshmi, some of the  _______  state that she was born as the daughter of Khyati and the sage Bhrigu.
12.1.explanation: As for Lakshmi, some of the Puranas state that she was born as the daughter of Khyati and the sage Bhrigu.

12.1.question: It is with her help that I delude the universe and its inhabitants with my illusions ( _______ ).
12.1.explanation: It is with her help that I delude the universe and its inhabitants with my illusions (maya).

12.2.question: He ruled the world well and, when he died, was reborn as a brahmana, (The brahmanas constitute the first of the four classes, their primary duties are to study the  _______  and perform sacrifices.)
12.2.explanation: He ruled the world well and, when he died, was reborn as a brahmana, (The brahmanas constitute the first of the four classes, their primary duties are to study the Vedas and perform sacrifices.)

12.2.question: There are many subjects that Vishnu’s instructions covered, but let us first start with the concept of varnashrama  _______ ,  _______  means righteousness and these precepts lay down the fundamental principles of righteous conduct.
12.2.explanation: There are many subjects that Vishnu’s instructions covered, but let us first start with the concept of varnashrama dharma, Dharma means righteousness and these precepts lay down the fundamental principles of righteous conduct.

12.3.question: Like the kshatriyas, the vaishyas can also donate  _______ , study and perform sacrifices, But their primary duty is agriculture, (In many other Puranas, trade and animal husbandry are mentioned in addition to agriculture).
12.3.explanation: Like the kshatriyas, the vaishyas can also donate alms, study and perform sacrifices, But their primary duty is agriculture, (In many other Puranas, trade and animal husbandry are mentioned in addition to agriculture).

12.3.explanation: These are yajana (performing sacrifices), yajana (acting as priests at sacrifices), dana (donation of alms), pratigraha (receiving gifts), adhyapana (teaching and adhyayana (studying).

12.3.question: A householder’s primary duties are serving guests, performing sacrifices, donating  _______ , worshipping the gods and keeping the sacred fire burning in the house at all times.
12.3.explanation: A householder’s primary duties are serving guests, performing sacrifices, donating alms, worshipping the gods and keeping the sacred fire burning in the house at all times.

12.3.question: The reason is that the  _______  provided by a householder are the means of sustenance for individuals who are in the other three stages of life.
12.3.explanation: The reason is that the alms provided by a householder are the means of sustenance for individuals who are in the other three stages of life.

12.3.question: The duties of kshatriyas include dana (donation of  _______ ), adhyayana (studying) and performing yajnas (sacrifices).
12.3.explanation: The duties of kshatriyas include dana (donation of alms), adhyayana (studying) and performing yajnas (sacrifices).

12.3.question: He has to live on  _______  that are obtained through begging.
12.3.explanation: He has to live on alms that are obtained through begging.

12.3.question: Like the  _______ , the vaishyas can also donate alms, study and perform sacrifices, But their primary duty is agriculture, (In many other Puranas, trade and animal husbandry are mentioned in addition to agriculture).
12.3.explanation: Like the kshatriyas, the vaishyas can also donate alms, study and perform sacrifices, But their primary duty is agriculture, (In many other Puranas, trade and animal husbandry are mentioned in addition to agriculture).

12.3.question: The duties of  _______  include dana (donation of alms), adhyayana (studying) and performing yajnas (sacrifices).
12.3.explanation: The duties of kshatriyas include dana (donation of alms), adhyayana (studying) and performing yajnas (sacrifices).

12.3.question: The  _______  constitute the second of the four classes.
12.3.explanation: The kshatriyas constitute the second of the four classes.

12.3.question: The primary duties of a person who is in this stage of life are studying the  _______  and serving one’s guru (teacher) well.
12.3.explanation: The primary duties of a person who is in this stage of life are studying the Vedas and serving one’s guru (teacher) well.

12.3.question: Generally speaking, all four classes have to observe the religion that is prescribed in the  _______ .
12.3.explanation: Generally speaking, all four classes have to observe the religion that is prescribed in the vedas.

12.3.question: He studies the  _______ , performs tapasya (meditation) and observes religious rites.
12.3.explanation: He studies the Vedas, performs tapasya (meditation) and observes religious rites.

12.3.question: A householder must not also forget to study a little bit of the  _______  every day.
12.3.explanation: A householder must not also forget to study a little bit of the Vedas every day.

12.3.question: But many of them are against the  _______ .
12.3.explanation: But many of them are against the Vedas.

12.4.question: The word garbha means womb and since Brahma originated from inside a golden (hiranya)  _______ , he is known as Hiranyagarbha.
12.4.explanation: The word garbha means womb and since Brahma originated from inside a golden (hiranya) egg, he is known as Hiranyagarbha.

12.4.question: Everything that there is in the universe, was already there, in in embryonic form, inside the  _______ .
12.4.explanation: Everything that there is in the universe, was already there, in in embryonic form, inside the egg.

12.4.question: The  _______  grew in size and Brahma, the creator, appeared inside the  _______ .
12.4.explanation: The egg grew in size and Brahma, the creator, appeared inside the egg.

12.4.question: The  _______  grew in size and Brahma, the creator, appeared inside the  _______ .
12.4.explanation: The egg grew in size and Brahma, the creator, appeared inside the egg.

12.4.explanation: In the water, there appeared a golden (hiranya) egg (anda).

12.4.explanation: Brahma was to be the lord (pati) of all the subjects who were going to be born (praja).

12.6.explanation: Apart from the question of raising up the earth from under the water, the story revolves around the demon Hiranyaksha.

12.6.explanation: Hiranyaksha used to live under the water and Vishnu entered the water in his form of a boar and killed Hiranyaksha.

12.6.question: Hiranyaksha used to live under the  _______  and Vishnu entered the  _______  in his form of a boar and killed Hiranyaksha.
12.6.explanation: Hiranyaksha used to live under the water and Vishnu entered the water in his form of a boar and killed Hiranyaksha.

12.6.question: Since the word nara means  _______  and ayana means resting-place, Vishnu is also referred to as Narayana.
12.6.explanation: Since the word nara means water and ayana means resting-place, Vishnu is also referred to as Narayana.

12.6.explanation: Brahma decided to start creation afresh, but discovered that the earth was submerged in water.

12.6.explanation: The boar carefully raised the earth and laid her to rest on top of the water.

12.6.explanation: He therefore requested Vishnu to bring the earth up from under the water.

12.6.question: Since the word  _______  means water and ayana means resting-place, Vishnu is also referred to as  _______ yana.
12.6.explanation: Since the word nara means water and ayana means resting-place, Vishnu is also referred to as Narayana.

12.6.question: He defeated the gods and drove them out of  _______ .
12.6.explanation: He defeated the gods and drove them out of heaven.

12.6.explanation: He also recovered the Vedas which had been stolen by Hiranyaksha.)

12.6.explanation: The other Puranas describe it at great length.

12.7.explanation: Thirteen of the twenty-four daughters were married to Brahma’s son Dharma.

12.7.explanation: (The Puranas are not at all consistent about the number of daughters Prasuti and Daksha had.

12.8.explanation: He pleased Brahma through his prayers and obtained from Brahma the boon that he would be permitted to hold up the earth on his hoods.

12.8.explanation: He pleased Brahma through his prayers and obtained from Brahma the boon that he would be permitted to hold up the earth on his hoods.

12.8.explanation: You have told us that Brahma emerged from Vishnu’s body And yet you have also told us how Brahma was born inside a golden egg.

12.8.explanation: You have told us that Brahma emerged from Vishnu’s body And yet you have also told us how Brahma was born inside a golden egg.

12.8.explanation: “Let me explain it for you.” Brahma was born from the golden egg right at the beginning, at the time of the original creation.

12.8.explanation: But at the end of every kalpa there is a minor destruction when all living beings other than Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva die.

12.8.explanation: He really found the three worlds, the gods, the demons and the humans inside Brahma’s stomach and was greatly surprise.

12.8.explanation: He emerged from Brahma’s mouth and told Brahma, “What I have seen inside your body is truly wonderful.

12.8.question: He emerged from  _______ ’s mouth and told  _______ , “What I have seen inside your body is truly wonderful.
12.8.explanation: He emerged from Brahma’s mouth and told Brahma, “What I have seen inside your body is truly wonderful.

12.8.explanation: “How dare you try to confine me inside your body?” demanded Brahma, as soon as he managed to get out.

12.8.explanation: Since padma means lotus and yoni means place of Birth, Brahma is also known as Padmayoni.

12.8.explanation: After all, you did emerge from a lotus that grew out of my navel.” “Agreed.” said Brahma.

12.8.explanation: He also gave Brahma divine eyes so that Brahma could comprehend the true nature of Shiva.

12.8.explanation: He also gave Brahma divine eyes so that Brahma could comprehend the true nature of Shiva.

12.8.explanation: Otherwise, it is inconceivable that anyone should dare to confine the great Brahma.

12.8.explanation: Then again, you have told us that Shiva was born from one of Brahma’s tears.

12.8.explanation: However, Brahma could find no way of coming out from Vishnu’s stomach.

12.8.explanation: But when Brahma did this, he could find no end to Vishnu’s stomach.

12.8.explanation: Pleased with Brahma’s prayers, Shiva agreed to grant Brahma a boon.

12.8.explanation: Pleased with Brahma’s prayers, Shiva agreed to grant Brahma a boon.

12.8.explanation: Brahma saw Vishnu sleeping on the water and woke him up.

12.8.explanation: “He looks like an upstart.” Vishnu calmed Brahma down.

12.8.explanation: “Let me see.” Vishnu thereupon entered Brahma’s body.

12.8.question: _______  then started to pray to Shiva.
12.8.explanation: Brahma then started to pray to Shiva.

12.8.question: “Who is this fellow?” asked  _______ .
12.8.explanation: “Who is this fellow?” asked Brahma.

12.8.question: _______  appeared inside the lotus.
12.8.explanation: Brahma appeared inside the lotus.

12.8.question: “Who are you?” asked  _______ .
12.8.explanation: “Who are you?” asked Brahma.

12.8.explanation: He finally jab to emerge through Vishnu’s navel, through the stalk of the lotus that was there.

12.8.question: Since padma means  _______  and yoni means place of Birth, Brahma is also known as Padmayoni.
12.8.explanation: Since padma means lotus and yoni means place of Birth, Brahma is also known as Padmayoni.

12.8.question: After all, you did emerge from a  _______  that grew out of my navel.” “Agreed.” said Brahma.
12.8.explanation: After all, you did emerge from a lotus that grew out of my navel.” “Agreed.” said Brahma.

12.8.question: the  _______  was gigantic and shone like the sun.
12.8.explanation: the lotus was gigantic and shone like the sun.

12.8.question: Brahma appeared inside the  _______ .
12.8.explanation: Brahma appeared inside the lotus.

12.8.question: Since padma means lotus and yoni means place of  _______ , Brahma is also known as Padmayoni.
12.8.explanation: Since padma means lotus and yoni means place of Birth, Brahma is also known as Padmayoni.

12.8.explanation: This was his form of Ananta, the snake (naga).

12.8.question: He finally  _______  to emerge through Vishnu’s navel, through the stalk of the lotus that was there.
12.8.explanation: He finally jab to emerge through Vishnu’s navel, through the stalk of the lotus that was there.

14.4.2.explanation: Feeding one Brahmin at Gaya brings the same virtues what one would get by feeding one crore Brahmins elsewhere.'

14.4.3.question: One day, while he was on his pilgrimage, he met a restless ghost, who requested him to perform the rituals of Pinda daan at Gaya so that not only he became liberated from the pains and tortures of being a spirit but also he (Trader) went to  _______ .

14.5.1.explanation: A Brahmin celibate should chant 'Bhavati bhiksham dehi' while seeking alms whereas a Kshatriya celibate should chant the same mantra with a slight modification ' Bhiksham bhavati dehi'.

14.5.1.question: Dwelling on length about the appropriate way of performing 'Upanayan sanskar' (Sacred thread ceremony) rituals, Lord Vishnu said-' A Brahmin child should get consecrated with the sacred thread in his eighth year while a  _______  child's consecration should be performed when he has attained the age of eleven.
14.5.1.explanation: Dwelling on length about the appropriate way of performing 'Upanayan sanskar' (Sacred thread ceremony) rituals, Lord Vishnu said-' A Brahmin child should get consecrated with the sacred thread in his eighth year while a Kshatriya child's consecration should be performed when he has attained the age of eleven.

14.5.1.question: A Brahmin celibate should chant 'Bhavati bhiksham dehi' while seeking alms whereas a  _______  celibate should chant the same mantra with a slight modification ' Bhiksham bhavati dehi'.
14.5.1.explanation: A Brahmin celibate should chant 'Bhavati bhiksham dehi' while seeking alms whereas a Kshatriya celibate should chant the same mantra with a slight modification ' Bhiksham bhavati dehi'.

14.5.1.question: After this the ritual of 'Bhikshatan' is performed whereby he seeks alms and donates everything that he gets to his  _______  as a mark of respect to him.
14.5.1.explanation: After this the ritual of 'Bhikshatan' is performed whereby he seeks alms and donates everything that he gets to his Guru as a mark of respect to him.

14.5.1.question: This particular ritual is symbolic and emphasizes the absolute necessity of subduing one's ego before acquiring knowledge from his  _______ .
14.5.1.explanation: This particular ritual is symbolic and emphasizes the absolute necessity of subduing one's ego before acquiring knowledge from his Guru.

14.5.1.question: The celibate whose Upanayan sanskar has been performed should stay at his  _______ 's hermitage till he completes his education.
14.5.1.explanation: The celibate whose Upanayan sanskar has been performed should stay at his Guru's hermitage till he completes his education.

14.5.1.question: A celibate is supposed to wear nothing but a  _______  skin and a waist band made of long reeds on his person with a sacred thread hanging across his shoulder and carry a stick in his hand.
14.5.1.explanation: A celibate is supposed to wear nothing but a Deer skin and a waist band made of long reeds on his person with a sacred thread hanging across his shoulder and carry a stick in his hand.

14.5.2.question: A Brahmin should get consecrated with this ritual in his sixteenth year while a  _______  should get it performed in his twenty- second year.
14.5.2.explanation: A Brahmin should get consecrated with this ritual in his sixteenth year while a Kshatriya should get it performed in his twenty- second year.

14.5.2.question: A  _______  should get consecrated with this ritual in his sixteenth year while a Kshatriya should get it performed in his twenty- second year.
14.5.2.explanation: A Brahmin should get consecrated with this ritual in his sixteenth year while a Kshatriya should get it performed in his twenty- second year.

14.5.3.question: But, before leaving the hermitage he should pay 'Dakshina' as a mark of gratitude to his  _______  for all the knowledge he has imparted to him.
14.5.3.explanation: But, before leaving the hermitage he should pay 'Dakshina' as a mark of gratitude to his Guru for all the knowledge he has imparted to him.

14.5.3.question: With the permission of his  _______ , he should then marry a girl who is beautiful, younger to him and belonging to different 'Gotra'.
14.5.3.explanation: With the permission of his Guru, he should then marry a girl who is beautiful, younger to him and belonging to different 'Gotra'.

14.5.3.question: Although the best option for him is to marry a woman belonging to his own  _______ , but he is allowed to marry outside his  _______ , provided the woman hails from a  _______  inferior to him but under no circumstances he should marry a woman belonging to superior  _______ .
14.5.3.explanation: Although the best option for him is to marry a woman belonging to his own caste, but he is allowed to marry outside his caste, provided the woman hails from a caste inferior to him but under no circumstances he should marry a woman belonging to superior caste.

14.5.3.question: Although the best option for him is to marry a woman belonging to his own  _______ , but he is allowed to marry outside his  _______ , provided the woman hails from a  _______  inferior to him but under no circumstances he should marry a woman belonging to superior  _______ .
14.5.3.explanation: Although the best option for him is to marry a woman belonging to his own caste, but he is allowed to marry outside his caste, provided the woman hails from a caste inferior to him but under no circumstances he should marry a woman belonging to superior caste.

14.5.3.question: Although the best option for him is to marry a woman belonging to his own  _______ , but he is allowed to marry outside his  _______ , provided the woman hails from a  _______  inferior to him but under no circumstances he should marry a woman belonging to superior  _______ .
14.5.3.explanation: Although the best option for him is to marry a woman belonging to his own caste, but he is allowed to marry outside his caste, provided the woman hails from a caste inferior to him but under no circumstances he should marry a woman belonging to superior caste.

14.5.3.question: Although the best option for him is to marry a woman belonging to his own  _______ , but he is allowed to marry outside his  _______ , provided the woman hails from a  _______  inferior to him but under no circumstances he should marry a woman belonging to superior  _______ .
14.5.3.explanation: Although the best option for him is to marry a woman belonging to his own caste, but he is allowed to marry outside his caste, provided the woman hails from a caste inferior to him but under no circumstances he should marry a woman belonging to superior caste.

14.5.5.question: Iron and  _______  vessels become pure if cleaned with ash and water.
14.5.5.explanation: Iron and Bronze vessels become pure if cleaned with ash and water.

14.5.6.question: Describing the proper way of performing Shraddh rituals, sage Yagyavalkya told the assembled sages-' A performer of Shraddh rituals should invite able  _______  and offer them seats of Kusha grass.
14.5.6.explanation: Describing the proper way of performing Shraddh rituals, sage Yagyavalkya told the assembled sages-' A performer of Shraddh rituals should invite able Brahmins and offer them seats of Kusha grass.

14.5.6.question: Subsequently, some water and a small quantity of barley is taken in a small vessel, which is then handed over to the  _______  along with other articles such as ghee lamp, garland, incense, etc.
14.5.6.explanation: Subsequently, some water and a small quantity of barley is taken in a small vessel, which is then handed over to the Brahmins along with other articles such as ghee lamp, garland, incense, etc.

14.5.6.question: Finally,  _______  are fed after which the performer of Shraddh rituals offers Pindadaan in the name of his ancestors.
14.5.6.explanation: Finally, Brahmins are fed after which the performer of Shraddh rituals offers Pindadaan in the name of his ancestors.

14.5.6.question: After that he helps all the  _______  perform 'Aachaman' and gives donations to them.
14.5.6.explanation: After that he helps all the Brahmins perform 'Aachaman' and gives donations to them.

14.5.6.question: Finally, all the  _______  are seen off with respect.
14.5.6.explanation: Finally, all the Brahmins are seen off with respect.

14.5.6.question: First of all an invocation is made to 'Vishvedeva' by chanting a mantra in his praise, an action which is followed by scattering grains of barley in the vessels kept in front of the  _______ 's idol.
14.5.6.explanation: First of all an invocation is made to 'Vishvedeva' by chanting a mantra in his praise, an action which is followed by scattering grains of barley in the vessels kept in front of the Deity's idol.

14.5.6.question: Shraddh rituals performed in the above mentioned way immensely satisfy the ancestors and help them attain to  _______ .
14.5.6.explanation: Shraddh rituals performed in the above mentioned way immensely satisfy the ancestors and help them attain to heaven.

14.6.question: A sinner, after tasting the fruits of his actions in the  _______  or hell, depending on his virtuous or sinful deeds takes re-birth on the basis of the gravity of sins committed.
14.6.explanation: A sinner, after tasting the fruits of his actions in the heaven or hell, depending on his virtuous or sinful deeds takes re-birth on the basis of the gravity of sins committed.

14.6.question: Anybody engaged in sinful deeds is definite to go to hell whereas virtuous deeds help a man to attain to  _______ .
14.6.explanation: Anybody engaged in sinful deeds is definite to go to hell whereas virtuous deeds help a man to attain to heaven.

14.6.question: Killing a Brahmin is believed to be the most heinous of sin and the person who has committed such a sin after having suffered the tortures of  _______  takes re-birth as a donkey or a dog.
14.6.explanation: Killing a Brahmin is believed to be the most heinous of sin and the person who has committed such a sin after having suffered the tortures of hell takes re-birth as a donkey or a dog.

14.6.question: A sinner, after tasting the fruits of his actions in the heaven or  _______ , depending on his virtuous or sinful deeds takes re-birth on the basis of the gravity of sins committed.
14.6.explanation: A sinner, after tasting the fruits of his actions in the heaven or hell, depending on his virtuous or sinful deeds takes re-birth on the basis of the gravity of sins committed.

14.6.question: Anybody engaged in sinful deeds is definite to go to  _______  whereas virtuous deeds help a man to attain to heaven.
14.6.explanation: Anybody engaged in sinful deeds is definite to go to hell whereas virtuous deeds help a man to attain to heaven.

14.6.question: Killing a  _______  is believed to be the most heinous of sin and the person who has committed such a sin after having suffered the tortures of hell takes re-birth as a donkey or a dog.
14.6.explanation: Killing a Brahmin is believed to be the most heinous of sin and the person who has committed such a sin after having suffered the tortures of hell takes re-birth as a donkey or a dog.

14.6.1.question: Protecting a cow's life also helps a man from getting liberated from the sin of ' _______ -hatya'.
14.6.1.explanation: Protecting a cow's life also helps a man from getting liberated from the sin of 'Brahma-hatya'.

14.6.1.question: A person who has killed a  _______  should atone for his sin by seeking alms for twelve years carrying a skull as his begging bowl.
14.6.1.explanation: A person who has killed a Brahmin should atone for his sin by seeking alms for twelve years carrying a skull as his begging bowl.

14.7.1.question: This particular austerity comprises of ten virtues- Celibacy, Forgiveness, Meditation,  _______ , Honesty, Non-violence, Not stealing, Gentleness and Self control.
14.7.1.explanation: This particular austerity comprises of ten virtues- Celibacy, Forgiveness, Meditation, Truthfulness, Honesty, Non-violence, Not stealing, Gentleness and Self control.

14.7.1.explanation: This particular austerity comprises of ten virtues- Celibacy, Forgiveness, Meditation, Truthfulness, Honesty, Non-violence, Not stealing, Gentleness and Self control.
