14.7.1.explanation: This particular austerity comprises of ten virtues- Celibacy, Forgiveness, Meditation, Truthfulness, Honesty, Non-violence, Not stealing, Gentleness and Self control.

14.7.4.question: Separate solutions of 'Palash'(Butea frondosa), 'Gular'(Ficus glomerata), 'Kamal'(  _______ ) and 'Bael' tree (wood apple) are prepared after boiling the leaves of respective vegetation mentioned above.
14.7.4.explanation: Separate solutions of 'Palash'(Butea frondosa), 'Gular'(Ficus glomerata), 'Kamal'( lotus) and 'Bael' tree (wood apple) are prepared after boiling the leaves of respective vegetation mentioned above.

14.7.12.question: In the second phase of the austerity consisting of four months and commencing from the  _______  month Chaitra, pots filled with parched grams are donated to Brahmins.
14.7.12.explanation: In the second phase of the austerity consisting of four months and commencing from the Hindu month Chaitra, pots filled with parched grams are donated to Brahmins.

14.7.12.question: It commences on the twelfth day of the bright half of the  _______  month Margashirsh and lasts for a year consisting of three phases.
14.7.12.explanation: It commences on the twelfth day of the bright half of the Hindu month Margashirsh and lasts for a year consisting of three phases.

14.7.12.question: One important characteristic of this austerity is that after four months, which is the first phase of the austerity, five vessels filled with food-grains are donated to  _______ .
14.7.12.explanation: One important characteristic of this austerity is that after four months, which is the first phase of the austerity, five vessels filled with food-grains are donated to Brahmins.

14.7.12.question: In the second phase of the austerity consisting of four months and commencing from the Hindu month Chaitra, pots filled with parched grams are donated to  _______ .
14.7.12.explanation: In the second phase of the austerity consisting of four months and commencing from the Hindu month Chaitra, pots filled with parched grams are donated to Brahmins.

14.7.12.question: Similarly, in the third and final phase of the austerity pots filled with ghee are donated to  _______ .
14.7.12.explanation: Similarly, in the third and final phase of the austerity pots filled with ghee are donated to Brahmins.

14.7.13.question: This austerity is related with the worship of Lord Shiva and a fast is observed on the fourteenth day of the dark half of the  _______  month Falgun.
14.7.13.explanation: This austerity is related with the worship of Lord Shiva and a fast is observed on the fourteenth day of the dark half of the Hindu month Falgun.

14.9.question: Having accomplished his most important mission of killing the demon king-  _______  and liberating the earth from his tyranny, Sri Krishna went on to complete his education under the tutelage of Sage Sandipani.
14.9.explanation: Having accomplished his most important mission of killing the demon king- Kansa and liberating the earth from his tyranny, Sri Krishna went on to complete his education under the tutelage of Sage Sandipani.

14.9.question: Seeing all his plans of killing Sri Krishna go in vain,  _______  sent him a message challenging for a 'duel- bought' with his court-wrestlers named 'Mushtik' and 'Chanur'.
14.9.explanation: Seeing all his plans of killing Sri Krishna go in vain, Kansa sent him a message challenging for a 'duel- bought' with his court-wrestlers named 'Mushtik' and 'Chanur'.

14.9.question: Both his parents had been kept under captivity by  _______ , who was aware of the prophesy that he would be killed by Devaki's eighth son.
14.9.explanation: Both his parents had been kept under captivity by Kansa, who was aware of the prophesy that he would be killed by Devaki's eighth son.

14.9.question: In due course of time Devaki gave birth to seven sons all of whom were mercilessly killed by  _______  one by one.
14.9.explanation: In due course of time Devaki gave birth to seven sons all of whom were mercilessly killed by Kansa one by one.

14.9.question: Once,  _______  sent an ogress named Putna, who tried to kill Sri Krishna by breast-feeding him.
14.9.explanation: Once, Kansa sent an ogress named Putna, who tried to kill Sri Krishna by breast-feeding him.

14.9.question: He then punched  _______  on his chest so hard that he died an instantaneous death.
14.9.explanation: He then punched Kansa on his chest so hard that he died an instantaneous death.

14.9.question: Making a revelation to Vyas that the Almighty God manifests himself whenever the civilization is endangered by the dominance of sinners, Lord Brahma said- 'In Dwapar yuga, Lord Vishnu incarnated as Sri Krishna to protect  _______  from being subjugated by 'A _______ ', which had become all pervasive at that time.
14.9.explanation: Making a revelation to Vyas that the Almighty God manifests himself whenever the civilization is endangered by the dominance of sinners, Lord Brahma said- 'In Dwapar yuga, Lord Vishnu incarnated as Sri Krishna to protect Dharma from being subjugated by 'Adharma', which had become all pervasive at that time.

14.10.question: Having successfully completed their period of exile, Pandavas demanded back their  _______  but Duryodhan was not even willing to part away with five villages.
14.10.explanation: Having successfully completed their period of exile, Pandavas demanded back their Kingdom but Duryodhan was not even willing to part away with five villages.

14.10.question: At the insistence of Dronacharya and Bhishma, Yudhishthir reluctantly agreed to share half of his  _______  with the Pandavas.
14.10.explanation: At the insistence of Dronacharya and Bhishma, Yudhishthir reluctantly agreed to share half of his Kingdom with the Pandavas.

14.10.question: Yudhishthir lost everything in the gamble- his whole wealth, his  _______  and even Draupadi.
14.10.explanation: Yudhishthir lost everything in the gamble- his whole wealth, his kingdom and even Draupadi.

14.10.question: Thus Pandavas started living at Indraprashth, the capital of their newly acquired  _______ .
14.10.explanation: Thus Pandavas started living at Indraprashth, the capital of their newly acquired Kingdom.

14.11.question: Lord Brahma also told him that virtuous deeds never went without being rewarded, as all good things enjoyed by a man in his life are nothing but the result of his virtuous past ' _______ '.
14.11.explanation: Lord Brahma also told him that virtuous deeds never went without being rewarded, as all good things enjoyed by a man in his life are nothing but the result of his virtuous past 'Karmas'.

14.11.question: He also revealed to Vyas that the ' _______  of sorrow' consumed everything that came into its fold and nothing remained untouched by it.
14.11.explanation: He also revealed to Vyas that the 'Fire of sorrow' consumed everything that came into its fold and nothing remained untouched by it.

14.11.question: One who sheds his life to protect his religion attains to  _______ .
14.11.explanation: One who sheds his life to protect his religion attains to heaven.

14.11.1.question: Only those who possess the 'Axe of knowledge' are successful in felling this ' _______  of ignorance' and experience the ecstasy of Divine bliss.
14.11.1.explanation: Only those who possess the 'Axe of knowledge' are successful in felling this 'Tree of ignorance' and experience the ecstasy of Divine bliss.

14.11.1.question: Sutji said-' The ' _______  of ignorance' sprouts from the seed of 'Egotism' and it receives its nutrition from sensual pleasures.
14.11.1.explanation: Sutji said-' The 'Tree of ignorance' sprouts from the seed of 'Egotism' and it receives its nutrition from sensual pleasures.

14.13.question: _______  comprises of six organs: � Pranayam ( Breathing exercises), � Japa ( chanting), � Pratyahar( restraining sense organs), � Dharana (resolution), � Dhyan (meditation) and � Samadhi (deep meditation).
14.13.explanation: Yoga comprises of six organs: � Pranayam ( Breathing exercises), � Japa ( chanting), � Pratyahar( restraining sense organs), � Dharana (resolution), � Dhyan (meditation) and � Samadhi (deep meditation).

14.13.question: Sutji said-'Practice of  _______  helps a man to live in this world with a sense of detachment and to successfully avoid the allurements of this mortal world.
14.13.explanation: Sutji said-'Practice of Yoga helps a man to live in this world with a sense of detachment and to successfully avoid the allurements of this mortal world.

14.13.question: Pranayam, an important part of  _______  is of two types-'Garbha' and 'Agarbha'.
14.13.explanation: Pranayam, an important part of Yoga is of two types-'Garbha' and 'Agarbha'.

14.13.1.question: The whole mystery of  _______  is unraveled to a man who makes incessant efforts to undertake this inner journey for if his efforts are made with a pure heart and a firm determination then he is sure to reach his goal of self realization one day or the other.
14.13.1.explanation: The whole mystery of Universe is unraveled to a man who makes incessant efforts to undertake this inner journey for if his efforts are made with a pure heart and a firm determination then he is sure to reach his goal of self realization one day or the other.

14.13.1.question: Unraveling the mystery of  _______  to sage Narad, Lord Vishnu said-' 'Brahm' is the cause behind this  _______  and one who has understood this fact can be rightly called a man of self realization.
14.13.1.explanation: Unraveling the mystery of Universe to sage Narad, Lord Vishnu said-' 'Brahm' is the cause behind this universe and one who has understood this fact can be rightly called a man of self realization.

14.13.1.question: Unraveling the mystery of  _______  to sage Narad, Lord Vishnu said-' 'Brahm' is the cause behind this  _______  and one who has understood this fact can be rightly called a man of self realization.
14.13.1.explanation: Unraveling the mystery of Universe to sage Narad, Lord Vishnu said-' 'Brahm' is the cause behind this universe and one who has understood this fact can be rightly called a man of self realization.

14.13.1.question: Instead of searching 'without' a man should seek 'within' because within him exists the  _______  just like our sense organs perceive them externally.
14.13.1.explanation: Instead of searching 'without' a man should seek 'within' because within him exists the Universe just like our sense organs perceive them externally.

14.13.1.question: All the mysteries of this  _______  are unraveled to a man of self-realization and he attains salvation.
14.13.1.explanation: All the mysteries of this Universe are unraveled to a man of self-realization and he attains salvation.

14.13.1.question: I am beyond the confinement of three basic qualities (Satva guna,  _______  guna and Tamas guna).
14.13.1.explanation: I am beyond the confinement of three basic qualities (Satva guna, Rajas guna and Tamas guna).

14.13.2.question: HE is the eternal bliss dwelling in each individual- the realization which made the  _______  to proclaim 'Tatvam Asi'(Thou is me) and who is beyond the confinement of time and space.'
14.13.2.explanation: HE is the eternal bliss dwelling in each individual- the realization which made the Vedas to proclaim 'Tatvam Asi'(Thou is me) and who is beyond the confinement of time and space.'

14.14.1.question: Lord Krishna then explained to  _______  the appropriate way of carrying the corpse to the cremation ground--" The dead body should be carried to the cremation ground by the sons an other relatives of the deceased.
14.14.1.explanation: Lord Krishna then explained to Garuda the appropriate way of carrying the corpse to the cremation ground--" The dead body should be carried to the cremation ground by the sons an other relatives of the deceased.

14.14.1.question: Deities are satisfied if kusha grass is offered to them while ancestors are satisfied by the offerings of  _______  seeds.
14.14.1.explanation: Deities are satisfied if kusha grass is offered to them while ancestors are satisfied by the offerings of sesame seeds.

14.14.1.question: _______  seeds are then sprinkled on the purified area and kusha grass is spread.
14.14.1.explanation: Sesame seeds are then sprinkled on the purified area and kusha grass is spread.

14.14.1.question: _______  seed has manifested from my sweat and hence is extremely pure.
14.14.1.explanation: Sesame seed has manifested from my sweat and hence is extremely pure.

14.14.1.question: Salt owes its origin to Me and donating it helps ancestors in attaining  _______ .
14.14.1.explanation: Salt owes its origin to Me and donating it helps ancestors in attaining heaven.

16.question: Introduction Shrimad Bhagwad is regarded as a delicious fruit of  _______ -Kalpa the period of four Yugas during which  _______ s are supposed to be written.
16.explanation: Introduction Shrimad Bhagwad is regarded as a delicious fruit of Veda-Kalpa the period of four Yugas during which Vedas are supposed to be written.

16.question: The author has beautifully woven the plays of God into enticing tales with the help of the yarns of knowledge, devotion and action: VASUDEVE BHAGVATI  _______  YOGA PRAYOJITAH | JANYATYA SHUVAIRAGYAM GYANAM CHA YADHETUKAM || EVAM PRASANN MANASO BHAGWAD  _______ YOGATAM | BHAGVATTA TTVA VIGYANAM MUKT SANGASY JAYATE || This story of God attracts the learned ones like Shiv, Sanak, Shuk etc.
16.explanation: The author has beautifully woven the plays of God into enticing tales with the help of the yarns of knowledge, devotion and action: VASUDEVE BHAGVATI BHAKTI YOGA PRAYOJITAH | JANYATYA SHUVAIRAGYAM GYANAM CHA YADHETUKAM || EVAM PRASANN MANASO BHAGWAD BHAKTIYOGATAM | BHAGVATTA TTVA VIGYANAM MUKT SANGASY JAYATE || This story of God attracts the learned ones like Shiv, Sanak, Shuk etc.

16.question: Shrimad Bhagwad is a contemporary of Vedas; there is a profuse mention of Karm (action), Upasana (worship) and Gyan (knowledge) in Vedas, but  _______  (devotion) could not find a place in Vedas.
16.explanation: Shrimad Bhagwad is a contemporary of Vedas; there is a profuse mention of Karm (action), Upasana (worship) and Gyan (knowledge) in Vedas, but Bhakti (devotion) could not find a place in Vedas.

16.question: Shrimad Bhagwad compensates for this drawback, for it has vivid and comprehensive description of  _______  (devotion).
16.explanation: Shrimad Bhagwad compensates for this drawback, for it has vivid and comprehensive description of Bhakti (devotion).

16.1.question: VASUDEVSU _______  DEVAM KANS CHANUR MARDANAM | DEVAKI PARMANANDAM KRISHAM VANDE JAGAD GURUM || NARAYANAM NAMASKRITY NARAM CHAIV NAROT _______ AM | DEVI SARASWATIM CHAIV TATO JAY MUNDIRAYET || YAH SWANU BHAVAM-KHILK SHRUTI SARMEKAM DHYATM DIPMATI TITIRSHA _______  _______ OADAM | SANSARINAM KARUNAAAH PURAN GUHYAM  _______  VYAS SUNUMUPAYAMI GURUM MUNINAM ||
16.1.explanation: VASUDEVSUTAM DEVAM KANS CHANUR MARDANAM | DEVAKI PARMANANDAM KRISHAM VANDE JAGAD GURUM || NARAYANAM NAMASKRITY NARAM CHAIV NAROTTAMAM | DEVI SARASWATIM CHAIV TATO JAY MUNDIRAYET || YAH SWANU BHAVAM-KHILK SHRUTI SARMEKAM DHYATM DIPMATI TITIRSHATAMTAMOADAM | SANSARINAM KARUNAAAH PURAN GUHYAM TAM VYAS SUNUMUPAYAMI GURUM MUNINAM ||

16.1.1.question: Shrimad Bhagwad is a delicious and relishing fruit of  _______ .
16.1.1.explanation: Shrimad Bhagwad is a delicious and relishing fruit of Vedas.

16.1.2.question: To quench the spiritual curiosity of the sages, SUTJI, the orator of  _______ , also arrived there.
16.1.2.explanation: To quench the spiritual curiosity of the sages, SUTJI, the orator of Puranas, also arrived there.

16.1.4.question: Bhagwad Mahapuran is such a scripture in which the great sage VedVyas describes the holy and pious tales of the  _______ .
16.1.4.explanation: Bhagwad Mahapuran is such a scripture in which the great sage VedVyas describes the holy and pious tales of the God.

16.1.4.question: That form of  _______  was full of pure truth and from the parts of His body, all the Lokas (worlds) got extension.
16.1.4.explanation: That form of God was full of pure truth and from the parts of His body, all the Lokas (worlds) got extension.

16.1.4.question: Metaphysicists saw the  _______  with innumerable heads, eyes, arms and legs.
16.1.4.explanation: Metaphysicists saw the God with innumerable heads, eyes, arms and legs.

16.1.6.question: Vedvyasji effected a division of  _______ , created Puranas conceptualized history (Mahabharata-which was actually jotted down by none other than Lord Ganesha.)
16.1.6.explanation: Vedvyasji effected a division of Vedas, created Puranas conceptualized history (Mahabharata-which was actually jotted down by none other than Lord Ganesha.)

16.1.6.question: Vedvyasji effected a division of Vedas, created  _______  conceptualized history (Mahabharata-which was actually jotted down by none other than Lord Ganesha.)
16.1.6.explanation: Vedvyasji effected a division of Vedas, created Puranas conceptualized history (Mahabharata-which was actually jotted down by none other than Lord Ganesha.)

16.1.7.question: Devarshi Narad then narrated the tale of  _______  and the glory of His devotees to Vyasji and said, "O great soul, look at the effect of devotion and company of the pious people that I have become Devarshi from an ordinary son of a maid" After the departure of Naradji, Vyasji sat in meditation and experienced the illusion that caught the life.
16.1.7.explanation: Devarshi Narad then narrated the tale of God and the glory of His devotees to Vyasji and said, "O great soul, look at the effect of devotion and company of the pious people that I have become Devarshi from an ordinary son of a maid" After the departure of Naradji, Vyasji sat in meditation and experienced the illusion that caught the life.

16.1.7.question: The virtues of  _______  had such a strong attraction that,lured by them, even self-indulgent Shukdevi ran back from the jungles to his father and prayed to let him read that scripture.
16.1.7.explanation: The virtues of God had such a strong attraction that,lured by them, even self-indulgent Shukdevi ran back from the jungles to his father and prayed to let him read that scripture.

16.1.7.question: Naradji told him that though he had created great epics, yet all of them lack a devotional description of  _______ .
16.1.7.explanation: Naradji told him that though he had created great epics, yet all of them lack a devotional description of God.

16.1.7.question: He also narrates the episodes of Ashwatthama the son of Guru Drona, worship of  _______  by Kunti etc.
16.1.7.explanation: He also narrates the episodes of Ashwatthama the son of Guru Drona, worship of God by Kunti etc.

16.1.8.question: For  _______  was now in the king's refuge, he did not kill him, but ordered that being an assistant of irreligious, he should at once leave the kingdom.
16.1.8.explanation: For Kali was now in the king's refuge, he did not kill him, but ordered that being an assistant of irreligious, he should at once leave the kingdom.

16.1.8.question: The king allowed  _______  to live in five things-- gambling, drinking of wine, company of women, violence and the Gold.
16.1.8.explanation: The king allowed Kali to live in five things-- gambling, drinking of wine, company of women, violence and the Gold.

16.1.8.question: Hence, anybody disirous of self-improvement must avoid these five things which are governed by  _______ .
16.1.8.explanation: Hence, anybody disirous of self-improvement must avoid these five things which are governed by Kali.

16.1.8.question: _______  then asked, " O king wherever I go, I find you ready to kill me with you bow and arrow.
16.1.8.explanation: Kali then asked, " O king wherever I go, I find you ready to kill me with you bow and arrow.

16.1.8.question: Saying this, the king Parikshit drew his sword to kill the evil  _______ .
16.1.8.explanation: Saying this, the king Parikshit drew his sword to kill the evil Kali.

16.1.8.question: But the clever  _______  fell at the feet of the king.
16.1.8.explanation: But the clever Kali fell at the feet of the king.

16.1.10.question: So, O  _______  (the great soul), kindly remove my doubts and guide me regarding the duties of a human- being?
16.1.10.explanation: So, O Mahatma (the great soul), kindly remove my doubts and guide me regarding the duties of a human- being?

16.2.1.question: Shukdevji then revealed the kinds of Mukti (salvation) as told in Vedas and said: 'O  _______ , there is no other way as beneficial as the means to achieve the affectionate devotion of Lord Vasudev.
16.2.1.explanation: Shukdevji then revealed the kinds of Mukti (salvation) as told in Vedas and said: 'O King, there is no other way as beneficial as the means to achieve the affectionate devotion of Lord Vasudev.

16.2.1.question: Shri Shukdevji says 'O  _______ , ordinary people literally waste their lives in petty matters like useless discussions, worry, sleep and feeding themselves.
16.2.1.explanation: Shri Shukdevji says 'O King, ordinary people literally waste their lives in petty matters like useless discussions, worry, sleep and feeding themselves.

16.2.1.question: Shukdevji then revealed the kinds of Mukti (salvation) as told in  _______  and said: 'O King, there is no other way as beneficial as the means to achieve the affectionate devotion of Lord Vasudev.
16.2.1.explanation: Shukdevji then revealed the kinds of Mukti (salvation) as told in Vedas and said: 'O King, there is no other way as beneficial as the means to achieve the affectionate devotion of Lord Vasudev.

16.2.2.question: He insisted again: O  _______ , now kindly explain how does the God create the universe out of illusions.
16.2.2.explanation: He insisted again: O Brahmin, now kindly explain how does the God create the universe out of illusions.

16.3.3.question: During his wandering, when he reached the banks of the river Yamuna, Vidurji met Uddhavji the selfless and calm server of  _______ .
16.3.3.explanation: During his wandering, when he reached the banks of the river Yamuna, Vidurji met Uddhavji the selfless and calm server of God.

16.3.4.question: The pious Vidurji respectfully greeted the sage Maitreya and said, "O  _______ , the people in this world perform various actions with a desire to have pleasure.
16.3.4.explanation: The pious Vidurji respectfully greeted the sage Maitreya and said, "O lord, the people in this world perform various actions with a desire to have pleasure.

16.3.4.question: _______  SADHU VARYADISH VARTM SHAM NAH, SAMRADHITO BHAGWAN YEN PUNSAM || HRIDSTHITO YACHCHHATI BHAKTI PUTE, GYANAM SATA TVADHI GAMAM PURANAM || Thus asked with devotion by Vidurji, Mahatma Maitreya illuminated the glory of God and other events like creation of universe by illusion and origin of colossus body, and said: No one can measure the eternal glory of God and the illusions created by Him.
16.3.4.explanation: TAT SADHU VARYADISH VARTM SHAM NAH, SAMRADHITO BHAGWAN YEN PUNSAM || HRIDSTHITO YACHCHHATI BHAKTI PUTE, GYANAM SATA TVADHI GAMAM PURANAM || Thus asked with devotion by Vidurji, Mahatma Maitreya illuminated the glory of God and other events like creation of universe by illusion and origin of colossus body, and said: No one can measure the eternal glory of God and the illusions created by Him.

16.3.4.question: SUKMAY KARMANI KAROTI LOKE | NA TAIH SUKMAM VANYADUPARAMAN VA || VINDETMUYAS  _______  OEVAM DUKHAM | YADATR YUKTAM BHAGWAN VADENNAM || O great among the sages, kindly preach me the way to peace, following which, one meets the God who then takes abode in the heart of his devotee and instills in him the Santan Gyan (eternal knowledge) that lets the devotee feel the direct presence of Him.
16.3.4.explanation: SUKMAY KARMANI KAROTI LOKE | NA TAIH SUKMAM VANYADUPARAMAN VA || VINDETMUYAS TAT OEVAM DUKHAM | YADATR YUKTAM BHAGWAN VADENNAM || O great among the sages, kindly preach me the way to peace, following which, one meets the God who then takes abode in the heart of his devotee and instills in him the Santan Gyan (eternal knowledge) that lets the devotee feel the direct presence of Him.

16.3.5.question: Those two gatekeepers of the  _______ 's abode Jay-Vijay appeared first as Hiranyakashipu and Hiranyaksha, second time as Ravan and Kumbhkuran and third time as Duntvakra and Shishupal.
16.3.5.explanation: Those two gatekeepers of the God's abode Jay-Vijay appeared first as Hiranyakashipu and Hiranyaksha, second time as Ravan and Kumbhkuran and third time as Duntvakra and Shishupal.

16.3.5.question: Nine out of them took permission for the creation of their offsprings, but Narad accepted celibacy and resolved to preach Bhagwad bhakti (devotion for  _______ .)
16.3.5.explanation: Nine out of them took permission for the creation of their offsprings, but Narad accepted celibacy and resolved to preach Bhagwad bhakti (devotion for God.)

16.3.5.question: By the inspiration of  _______  and because of imbalance in pious virtues, creation of Mahattatva (the soul) was the first (Mahattatva the soul).
16.3.5.explanation: By the inspiration of God and because of imbalance in pious virtues, creation of Mahattatva (the soul) was the first (Mahattatva the soul).

16.3.5.question: Thus at the beginning of the Kalp,  _______  the creator used Rajogunas (royal virtues) to create himself in the form of the universe.
16.3.5.explanation: Thus at the beginning of the Kalp, God the creator used Rajogunas (royal virtues) to create himself in the form of the universe.

16.3.5.question: Once, Sanakadi Kumar had gone to Vaikunthdham (the abode of  _______ ) to see  _______  but those two gatekeepers didn't let them in.
16.3.5.explanation: Once, Sanakadi Kumar had gone to Vaikunthdham (the abode of God) to see God but those two gatekeepers didn't let them in.

16.3.5.question: Once, Sanakadi Kumar had gone to Vaikunthdham (the abode of  _______ ) to see  _______  but those two gatekeepers didn't let them in.
16.3.5.explanation: Once, Sanakadi Kumar had gone to Vaikunthdham (the abode of God) to see God but those two gatekeepers didn't let them in.

16.3.5.question: That omnipotent  _______  created the universe just by His wish and for the sake of His play.
16.3.5.explanation: That omnipotent God created the universe just by His wish and for the sake of His play.

16.3.5.question: Maitreyaji says, " This whole creation is a manifestation of the plays of  _______ .
16.3.5.explanation: Maitreyaji says, " This whole creation is a manifestation of the plays of God.

16.3.8.question: _______  said 'O mother, Adhayatma Yoga (spiritual conjugation) is the main way of benefaction for the human beings.
16.3.8.explanation: Lord said 'O mother, Adhayatma Yoga (spiritual conjugation) is the main way of benefaction for the human beings.

16.4.2.question: Maitrey said, " Once a meeting of Brahmavadis (expounders of  _______ ) was organized.
16.4.2.explanation: Maitrey said, " Once a meeting of Brahmavadis (expounders of vedas) was organized.

16.4.3.question: Even then if you wish to have the throne, you begin to worship Lord Narayana, and take birth through me by His grace and then wait for your chance to sit in the  _______ 's lap.'
16.4.3.explanation: Even then if you wish to have the throne, you begin to worship Lord Narayana, and take birth through me by His grace and then wait for your chance to sit in the King's lap.'

16.4.3.question: Strutting at her fortune, she ridiculed Dhruv: 'Though you are also a son of the  _______ , but you have no right to sit on the throne because you are not borne to me.
16.4.3.explanation: Strutting at her fortune, she ridiculed Dhruv: 'Though you are also a son of the king, but you have no right to sit on the throne because you are not borne to me.

16.4.3.question: You are the son of queen Suniti who is neglected by the  _______ , and now lives like a mistress.
16.4.3.explanation: You are the son of queen Suniti who is neglected by the King, and now lives like a mistress.

16.4.3.question: Once the  _______  was playing with his soon Uttam who was siting in his lap.
16.4.3.explanation: Once the King was playing with his soon Uttam who was siting in his lap.

16.4.3.question: But for the fear of Suruchi the  _______  did not take Dhruv in his lap.
16.4.3.explanation: But for the fear of Suruchi the king did not take Dhruv in his lap.

16.4.3.question: Leaving the town, while going in search of  _______  he met devarshi Narad in the way.
16.4.3.explanation: Leaving the town, while going in search of solitude he met devarshi Narad in the way.

16.4.4.question: Somehow, the oblation completed, and God appeared and asked the king to seek a  _______ .
16.4.4.explanation: Somehow, the oblation completed, and God appeared and asked the king to seek a Boon.

16.4.4.question: During the rule, king's popularity spread in  _______  and bounds.
16.4.4.explanation: During the rule, king's popularity spread in leaps and bounds.

16.4.5.question: All of them were known as Prachetas, they were all devotees of  _______  and had been sunk in devotion since their childhood.
16.4.5.explanation: All of them were known as Prachetas, they were all devotees of God and had been sunk in devotion since their childhood.

16.4.5.question: It's because of non-knowledge that one sees the  _______  and the living beings differently."
16.4.5.explanation: It's because of non-knowledge that one sees the God and the living beings differently."

16.4.5.question: By the grace of Devarshi Narad, the king got a perception of  _______  and living being.
16.4.5.explanation: By the grace of Devarshi Narad, the king got a perception of God and living being.

16.4.5.question: He at once abdicated his attachment for the body and concentrated his mind in  _______ .
16.4.5.explanation: He at once abdicated his attachment for the body and concentrated his mind in God.

16.4.5.question: It means that there is no difference between the living beings and the  _______ .
16.4.5.explanation: It means that there is no difference between the living beings and the God.

16.4.5.question: " _______  is Avigyat while microcosm is Vigyat.
16.4.5.explanation: "God is Avigyat while microcosm is Vigyat.

16.5.1.question: In his chariot, he travelled around the land and divided it into seven parts and appointed each of his seven sons as the  _______  of one island.
16.5.1.explanation: In his chariot, he travelled around the land and divided it into seven parts and appointed each of his seven sons as the lord of one island.

16.5.1.question: As a gift of Yagya,  _______  had taken an incarnation in his home.
16.5.1.explanation: As a gift of Yagya, Lord had taken an incarnation in his home.

16.5.1.question: That incarnation of  _______  is known as Rishabhdev.
16.5.1.explanation: That incarnation of Lord is known as Rishabhdev.

16.5.1.question: Since the moment you've acquired the human body, enemies like Kama (sex), Krodh (anger) Moha (affection), Lobh (greed), Mada ( _______ ), Matsar (jealousy) etc.
16.5.1.explanation: Since the moment you've acquired the human body, enemies like Kama (sex), Krodh (anger) Moha (affection), Lobh (greed), Mada (ego), Matsar (jealousy) etc.

16.5.2.question: Realizing his mistake, Bharat as a deer, came to his hermitage and once again began his penance before  _______ .
16.5.2.explanation: Realizing his mistake, Bharat as a deer, came to his hermitage and once again began his penance before God.

16.5.2.question: But as long as you don't bear the dust of great men's feet on your head, you will not recognize the  _______ .
16.5.2.explanation: But as long as you don't bear the dust of great men's feet on your head, you will not recognize the God.

16.5.2.question: "Listening to the tales of the  _______  continuously is the only way to concentrate one's mind in Shri Hari.
16.5.2.explanation: "Listening to the tales of the God continuously is the only way to concentrate one's mind in Shri Hari.

16.5.2.question: So, from now on drop your attachments and start reciting  _______ 's name.
16.5.2.explanation: So, from now on drop your attachments and start reciting God's name.

16.5.2.question: By  _______ 's grace Bharat had remembrance of his previous birth.
16.5.2.explanation: By God's grace Bharat had remembrance of his previous birth.

16.5.2.question: You have got this human life by great luck and  _______ 's grace.
16.5.2.explanation: You have got this human life by great luck and God's grace.

16.5.2.question: So he always remained immersed in reflection on Hari ( _______ .
16.5.2.explanation: So he always remained immersed in reflection on Hari (God.

16.5.2.question: I have put all my burden on the shoulders of the  _______ .
16.5.2.explanation: I have put all my burden on the shoulders of the God.

16.5.2.question: There he passed his time in the worship of  _______ .
16.5.2.explanation: There he passed his time in the worship of God.

16.5.2.question: Searching a right person for the sacrifice, his men found and caught Jadabharat (In  _______  incarnation, Bharat was known by this name because of his inactivity), who was guarding his farms then.
16.5.2.explanation: Searching a right person for the sacrifice, his men found and caught Jadabharat (In Brahmin incarnation, Bharat was known by this name because of his inactivity), who was guarding his farms then.

16.5.2.question: When Bharat's deer incarnation ended, he took his next birth in a  _______ 's home.
16.5.2.explanation: When Bharat's deer incarnation ended, he took his next birth in a Brahmin's home.

16.5.2.question: One fine morning, when he was performing libations in the river, a pregnant  _______  arrived on the opposite bank to drink water.
16.5.2.explanation: One fine morning, when he was performing libations in the river, a pregnant Doe arrived on the opposite bank to drink water.

16.5.2.question: But the  _______  lost her life in the action while her foetus fell in the river.
16.5.2.explanation: But the doe lost her life in the action while her foetus fell in the river.

16.5.2.question: Frightened by the roar, the  _______  jumped into the river to save her life.
16.5.2.explanation: Frightened by the roar, the doe jumped into the river to save her life.

16.5.3.question: Hearing the tale of the  _______  Priyvrat's lineage, Parikshit asked Shukdev: "O great sage, what is the expanse of the landmass?
16.5.3.explanation: Hearing the tale of the king Priyvrat's lineage, Parikshit asked Shukdev: "O great sage, what is the expanse of the landmass?

16.5.3.question: It has a majority of Shalmali (silk cotton) trees, which comprise the abode of Garud, the  _______  of the birds.
16.5.3.explanation: It has a majority of Shalmali (silk cotton) trees, which comprise the abode of Garud, the King of the birds.

16.5.3.question: Shukdev said: 'O  _______ , illusions created by God are so vast that nobody can find their end.
16.5.3.explanation: Shukdev said: 'O King, illusions created by God are so vast that nobody can find their end.

16.5.3.question: Priyvrata's son,  _______  Ghritprishtha was the ruler of this island.
16.5.3.explanation: Priyvrata's son, King Ghritprishtha was the ruler of this island.

16.5.3.question: Priyvrata's son,  _______  Idhmjihv was the ruler of this island.
16.5.3.explanation: Priyvrata's son, King Idhmjihv was the ruler of this island.

16.5.3.question: Names of other nine Varsh are - Kinpurush, Harivarsh, Kamyak, Hiranmaya,  _______ , Bhadrashwa, Ketumal and Bharat.
16.5.3.explanation: Names of other nine Varsh are - Kinpurush, Harivarsh, Kamyak, Hiranmaya, Kuru, Bhadrashwa, Ketumal and Bharat.

16.6.1.question: Yamadutas said, "Actions dictated by  _______  are Dharma (religion) in true sense, and the actions forbidden by  _______  are Adharma (irreligious) and Veda is Narayana Himself."
16.6.1.explanation: Yamadutas said, "Actions dictated by Vedas are Dharma (religion) in true sense, and the actions forbidden by Vedas are Adharma (irreligious) and Veda is Narayana Himself."

16.6.1.question: Yamadutas said, "Actions dictated by  _______  are Dharma (religion) in true sense, and the actions forbidden by  _______  are Adharma (irreligious) and Veda is Narayana Himself."
16.6.1.explanation: Yamadutas said, "Actions dictated by Vedas are Dharma (religion) in true sense, and the actions forbidden by Vedas are Adharma (irreligious) and Veda is Narayana Himself."

16.6.1.question: Yamadutas said, "Actions dictated by Vedas are  _______  (religion) in true sense, and the actions forbidden by Vedas are A _______  (irreligious) and Veda is Narayana Himself."
16.6.1.explanation: Yamadutas said, "Actions dictated by Vedas are Dharma (religion) in true sense, and the actions forbidden by Vedas are Adharma (irreligious) and Veda is Narayana Himself."

16.6.1.question: Servers of Lord Vishnu said, "If you are the servants of  _______ raj define  _______  (religion) then."
16.6.1.explanation: Servers of Lord Vishnu said, "If you are the servants of Dharmaraj define Dharma (religion) then."

16.6.1.question: In the town of Kannauj, lived a  _______  named Ajamil.
16.6.1.explanation: In the town of Kannauj, lived a Brahmin named Ajamil.

16.6.2.question: All the God's, Digpals (guardian of the direction),  _______  and Brahma etc.
16.6.2.explanation: All the God's, Digpals (guardian of the direction), Shiv and Brahma etc.

16.6.2.question: All the God's, Digpals (guardian of the direction), Shiv and  _______  etc.
16.6.2.explanation: All the God's, Digpals (guardian of the direction), Shiv and Brahma etc.

16.6.3.question: Shukdev says, "Parikshit the names of  _______ 's ten wives were Bhanu, Lamba, Kakubhi, Jami, Vishwas, Sadhya, Marutvati, Vasu, Muhurta and Sankalpa.
16.6.3.explanation: Shukdev says, "Parikshit the names of Dharma's ten wives were Bhanu, Lamba, Kakubhi, Jami, Vishwas, Sadhya, Marutvati, Vasu, Muhurta and Sankalpa.

16.6.3.question: When they grew up, Daksh got ten of them married to  _______ .
16.6.3.explanation: When they grew up, Daksh got ten of them married to Dharma.

16.6.4.question: Forty-nine Marudganas, eight Vasus, eleven Rudras,  _______ , Ribhuganas Vishvedev, Shadhyaganas and both Ashwini Kumaras were present in the court.
16.6.4.explanation: Forty-nine Marudganas, eight Vasus, eleven Rudras, Aditya, Ribhuganas Vishvedev, Shadhyaganas and both Ashwini Kumaras were present in the court.

16.6.4.question: Groups of Siddhas, Charaus, Gandhavas, Vidyadhars, elves, Kinnars,  _______  etc.
16.6.4.explanation: Groups of Siddhas, Charaus, Gandhavas, Vidyadhars, elves, Kinnars, Nagas etc.

16.6.4.question: Indra went to the refuge of the Brahma who told the gods that they were suffering because of their wrong policies and disregarding their learned  _______ .
16.6.4.explanation: Indra went to the refuge of the Brahma who told the gods that they were suffering because of their wrong policies and disregarding their learned Guru.

16.6.4.question: Feeling of insecurity in the absence of their  _______ , strongly agitated the gods.
16.6.4.explanation: Feeling of insecurity in the absence of their Guru, strongly agitated the gods.

16.6.5.question: Thus may I be protected in water by Matsyavatar, on land by Vamanavatar, in sky by Trivikrama, from Kamapida (sexual desire)by Sanakadit, from Kupathya (diseases) by Dhanvantri, from ignorance from Vedvyas, from the hells by Kachchhap avatar (tortoise incarnation), in the war by Narsinha Avatar, in the way by Varah, on the top of the hills by Parashurama, during exile by Lord Rama along with Lakshmanaji, from Maranmohan Abhichar (death) by Lord  _______ yana, from ego by  _______ , from obstacles by Dattatreya, from the bondage of actions by Kapila, from disregarding the God by Haygreev Mutri, from the crimes by  _______ d, from the imposters by Buddha and from the faults of Kali Kaal may I be protected by Kalkidev.
16.6.5.explanation: Thus may I be protected in water by Matsyavatar, on land by Vamanavatar, in sky by Trivikrama, from Kamapida (sexual desire)by Sanakadit, from Kupathya (diseases) by Dhanvantri, from ignorance from Vedvyas, from the hells by Kachchhap avatar (tortoise incarnation), in the war by Narsinha Avatar, in the way by Varah, on the top of the hills by Parashurama, during exile by Lord Rama along with Lakshmanaji, from Maranmohan Abhichar (death) by Lord Narayana, from ego by Nara, from obstacles by Dattatreya, from the bondage of actions by Kapila, from disregarding the God by Haygreev Mutri, from the crimes by Narad, from the imposters by Buddha and from the faults of Kali Kaal may I be protected by Kalkidev.

16.6.6.question: Pleased with their faith and prayers, Lord Narayana advised them to please the great sage Dadhichi and ask for his bones to build a  _______  (mace).
16.6.6.explanation: Pleased with their faith and prayers, Lord Narayana advised them to please the great sage Dadhichi and ask for his bones to build a Vajra (mace).

16.6.6.question: Thus by the power of the Lord and aquiring a divine  _______ , Indra felt extremely strong.
16.6.6.explanation: Thus by the power of the Lord and aquiring a divine Vajra, Indra felt extremely strong.

16.6.6.question: With those bones, Vishvakarma built a massive  _______  which had thousand edges.
16.6.6.explanation: With those bones, Vishvakarma built a massive Vajra which had thousand edges.

16.6.6.question: So, indignantly Indra severed the head of Vishvarup and to get rid of the sin of Brahmahatya (killing of  _______ ) Indra distributed his sin among the land, water, tree and the woman folk, and himself escaped the sin.
16.6.6.explanation: So, indignantly Indra severed the head of Vishvarup and to get rid of the sin of Brahmahatya (killing of Brahmin) Indra distributed his sin among the land, water, tree and the woman folk, and himself escaped the sin.

16.6.7.question: Shukdev says, " Thus, O Parikshit, Vritrasur had wished to leave his body in the battlefield and get the  _______ .
16.6.7.explanation: Shukdev says, " Thus, O Parikshit, Vritrasur had wished to leave his body in the battlefield and get the God.

16.6.7.question: Thus, even in the battlefield, Vritrasur experienced direct existence of  _______ .
16.6.7.explanation: Thus, even in the battlefield, Vritrasur experienced direct existence of God.

16.6.7.question: Your patience, determination and devotion for  _______  are really remarkable.
16.6.7.explanation: Your patience, determination and devotion for God are really remarkable.

16.6.7.question: You have surmounted the illusion of  _______  that confuses ordinary ones.
16.6.7.explanation: You have surmounted the illusion of God that confuses ordinary ones.

16.6.7.question: He did not want to enjoy the luxuries of the  _______  defeating Indra."
16.6.7.explanation: He did not want to enjoy the luxuries of the heaven defeating Indra."

16.7.1.question: Virtues like Satya (chastity),  _______  (royalty) and Tamas (darkness) are of nature, and not of God and hence keep rising and falling with time.
16.7.1.explanation: Virtues like Satya (chastity), Rajas (royalty) and Tamas (darkness) are of nature, and not of God and hence keep rising and falling with time.

16.7.1.question: A rise in  _______  (royal) virtues sees a surge in demons number.
16.7.1.explanation: A rise in Rajas (royal) virtues sees a surge in demons number.

16.7.1.question: A rise in Rajas ( _______ ) virtues sees a surge in demons number.
16.7.1.explanation: A rise in Rajas (royal) virtues sees a surge in demons number.

16.7.1.question: Shukdev says, " Parikshit, God's sketches are so vivid that even the great  _______  can't comprehend them fully.
16.7.1.explanation: Shukdev says, " Parikshit, God's sketches are so vivid that even the great sages can't comprehend them fully.

16.7.1.question: When Satguna (chastity) rises, God adopts the gods and the  _______  and causes a surge in their number.
16.7.1.explanation: When Satguna (chastity) rises, God adopts the gods and the Sages and causes a surge in their number.

16.7.2.question: Indignant by the behaviour of the  _______ , Sanakadi Kumars cursed them: "Fools both of you don't deserve a presence near God.
16.7.2.explanation: Indignant by the behaviour of the Gatekeepers, Sanakadi Kumars cursed them: "Fools both of you don't deserve a presence near God.

16.7.2.question: When both the  _______  were falling from Vaikunth, the kind Sanakadi Kumars said, " O.K.
16.7.2.explanation: When both the gatekeepers were falling from Vaikunth, the kind Sanakadi Kumars said, " O.K.

16.7.2.question: But assuming them to be ordinary boys the  _______  Jay-Vijay did not allow them in.
16.7.2.explanation: But assuming them to be ordinary boys the gatekeepers Jay-Vijay did not allow them in.

16.7.2.question: They both were the  _______  of the Lord.
16.7.2.explanation: They both were the gatekeepers of the Lord.

16.7.2.question: It was by curse of  _______ , that they had to be relegated and take birth as sinful demons."
16.7.2.explanation: It was by curse of Brahmin, that they had to be relegated and take birth as sinful demons."

16.7.2.question: They both were the gatekeepers of the  _______ .
16.7.2.explanation: They both were the gatekeepers of the Lord.

16.7.3.question: By the curse of Brahmins, the gatekeepers of the  _______ , Jay-Vijay took their first birth as the demons- Hiranyakashipu and Hiranyaksh.
16.7.3.explanation: By the curse of Brahmins, the gatekeepers of the God, Jay-Vijay took their first birth as the demons- Hiranyakashipu and Hiranyaksh.

16.7.3.question: Prahlad was youngest of them, Prahlad was the greatest lover and devotee of  _______ .
16.7.3.explanation: Prahlad was youngest of them, Prahlad was the greatest lover and devotee of God.

16.7.3.question: Through a celestial voice,  _______  comforted them: 'Don't be afraid O  _______ s.
16.7.3.explanation: Through a celestial voice, God comforted them: 'Don't be afraid O gods.

16.7.3.question: Nobody else is  _______  except me.'
16.7.3.explanation: Nobody else is God except me.'

16.7.3.question: Narad says: 'O Yudhisthir, Hiranykashipu had such a brilliance that he began to receive the offerings himself of the Yagyas performed by  _______ .
16.7.3.explanation: Narad says: 'O Yudhisthir, Hiranykashipu had such a brilliance that he began to receive the offerings himself of the Yagyas performed by Brahmins.

16.7.3.question: By the curse of  _______ , the gatekeepers of the God, Jay-Vijay took their first birth as the demons- Hiranyakashipu and Hiranyaksh.
16.7.3.explanation: By the curse of Brahmins, the gatekeepers of the God, Jay-Vijay took their first birth as the demons- Hiranyakashipu and Hiranyaksh.

16.7.3.question: On all the seven islands and upto the  _______ , it was his dominion.
16.7.3.explanation: On all the seven islands and upto the heaven, it was his dominion.

16.7.3.question: Now, Hiranykashipu began to reside in  _______  itself.
16.7.3.explanation: Now, Hiranykashipu began to reside in heaven itself.

16.7.3.question: In the  _______  of Mandarachal Mountain, Hiranykashipu stood on one toe only and raised his hands towards sky.
16.7.3.explanation: In the Valley of Mandarachal Mountain, Hiranykashipu stood on one toe only and raised his hands towards sky.

16.7.4.question: Guruputras (the teacher of Prahlad) tried their best and trained Prahlad in policies of Sama,  _______ , Dand, Bhed (conviction, temptation, fear of punishment and partiality.)
16.7.4.explanation: Guruputras (the teacher of Prahlad) tried their best and trained Prahlad in policies of Sama, Dama, Dand, Bhed (conviction, temptation, fear of punishment and partiality.)

16.7.4.question: Then they trained him in Arth,  _______  and Kama (economic matters, religion and carnal knowledge.)
16.7.4.explanation: Then they trained him in Arth, Dharma and Kama (economic matters, religion and carnal knowledge.)

16.7.4.question: He also cautioned the teachers to guard Prahlad against any possible approach by a god, ascetic or  _______ .
16.7.4.explanation: He also cautioned the teachers to guard Prahlad against any possible approach by a god, ascetic or Brahmin.

16.7.4.question: When they felt satisfied with their efforts the Guruputras brought Prahald again to his  _______ , the demon king Miranykasipu.
16.7.4.explanation: When they felt satisfied with their efforts the Guruputras brought Prahald again to his father, the demon king Miranykasipu.

16.7.4.question: Prahlad said: ' _______ , in my opinion, this world is nothing but full of sorrow.
16.7.4.explanation: Prahlad said: 'Father, in my opinion, this world is nothing but full of sorrow.

16.7.4.question: Prahlad said, " _______  there are nine kinds of devotion for Lord Vishnu.
16.7.4.explanation: Prahlad said, "Father there are nine kinds of devotion for Lord Vishnu.

16.7.5.question: Narad had said, "Devaraj there is a great devotee of  _______  in this foetus, you cannot kill him.
16.7.5.explanation: Narad had said, "Devaraj there is a great devotee of God in this foetus, you cannot kill him.

16.7.5.question: So taking shelter at the feet of  _______  in this human incarnation is a success for life.
16.7.5.explanation: So taking shelter at the feet of God in this human incarnation is a success for life.

16.7.5.question: Brothers,  _______  is the friend, beloved and the soul of each and every being.
16.7.5.explanation: Brothers, God is the friend, beloved and the soul of each and every being.

16.7.5.question: At that time Prahlad's conscience was focused in  _______ .
16.7.5.explanation: At that time Prahlad's conscience was focused in God.

16.7.5.question: _______  is pleased with unconditional love only.
16.7.5.explanation: God is pleased with unconditional love only.

16.7.5.question: But this human body is a means to get  _______ .
16.7.5.explanation: But this human body is a means to get God.

16.7.5.question: One needs not work hard to please the  _______ .
16.7.5.explanation: One needs not work hard to please the God.

16.7.5.question: _______  is pleased with these actions only.
16.7.5.explanation: God is pleased with these actions only.

16.7.5.question: So you too develop devotion for  _______ ."
16.7.5.explanation: So you too develop devotion for God."

16.7.5.question: Prahlad told his fellow disciples that when his  _______  was away on Mandarachal for penance, Indra had kidnapped his mother Kayadhu.
16.7.5.explanation: Prahlad told his fellow disciples that when his father was away on Mandarachal for penance, Indra had kidnapped his mother Kayadhu.

16.7.5.question: Hearing his  _______  scoffing at Guruputras, Prahlad said, " _______  it was not taught to me by them, it is my natural inclination."
16.7.5.explanation: Hearing his father scoffing at Guruputras, Prahlad said, "Father it was not taught to me by them, it is my natural inclination."

16.7.5.question: Hearing his  _______  scoffing at Guruputras, Prahlad said, " _______  it was not taught to me by them, it is my natural inclination."
16.7.5.explanation: Hearing his father scoffing at Guruputras, Prahlad said, "Father it was not taught to me by them, it is my natural inclination."

16.7.5.question: Keep your son tied in Varunpash (the noose of varun) until our  _______  Shukracharya returns."
16.7.5.explanation: Keep your son tied in Varunpash (the noose of varun) until our father Shukracharya returns."

16.8.1.question: It was he who caused the churning of the sea and made the  _______ 's drink nectar and supported Mandarachal Mountain on his back in Kachchhap (tortoise) from during the churning.
16.8.1.explanation: It was he who caused the churning of the sea and made the God's drink nectar and supported Mandarachal Mountain on his back in Kachchhap (tortoise) from during the churning.

16.8.1.question: _______  would appear in the incarnation of Brihadbhahu as the son of Satrayana and his wife Vinata and cause the extension of Karmakand (actions)."
16.8.1.explanation: God would appear in the incarnation of Brihadbhahu as the son of Satrayana and his wife Vinata and cause the extension of Karmakand (actions)."

16.8.1.question: _______  as Sarvbhaum would snatch the kingdom of Swarga (heaven) from Purandara Indra and give it to the king Bali.
16.8.1.explanation: God as Sarvbhaum would snatch the kingdom of Swarga (heaven) from Purandara Indra and give it to the king Bali.

16.8.1.question: As the son of Satyasahay and his wife Sunrita, the  _______  would protect this Manvantara in the form of Swadham.
16.8.1.explanation: As the son of Satyasahay and his wife Sunrita, the God would protect this Manvantara in the form of Swadham.

16.8.1.question: During this Manvantara,  _______  has arrived in Vamana incarnation as the son of Kashyapa and his wife Aditi.
16.8.1.explanation: During this Manvantara, God has arrived in Vamana incarnation as the son of Kashyapa and his wife Aditi.

16.8.1.question: Also describe the plays of  _______ 's different incarnations which occurred during different Manvantaras."
16.8.1.explanation: Also describe the plays of God's different incarnations which occurred during different Manvantaras."

16.8.1.question: _______  would take birth as the incarnation of Rishabh, the son of sage Ayushmana and his wife Ambudhara.
16.8.1.explanation: God would take birth as the incarnation of Rishabh, the son of sage Ayushmana and his wife Ambudhara.

16.8.1.question: _______  had appeared in the incarnation of Vaikunth the son of the sage Shubh and his wife Vikuntha.
16.8.1.explanation: God had appeared in the incarnation of Vaikunth the son of the sage Shubh and his wife Vikuntha.

16.8.1.question: _______  would appear in the incarnation of Vishwasen as the son of Vishwasrij and his wife Vishuchi.
16.8.1.explanation: God would appear in the incarnation of Vishwasen as the son of Vishwasrij and his wife Vishuchi.

16.8.1.question: _______  would take incarnation as Sarvbhaum, the sons of Devguhya and his wife Saraswati.
16.8.1.explanation: God would take incarnation as Sarvbhaum, the sons of Devguhya and his wife Saraswati.

16.8.1.question: _______  had appeared in the incarnation of Satyasen, the son of Dharma and Sunrita.
16.8.1.explanation: God had appeared in the incarnation of Satyasen, the son of Dharma and Sunrita.

16.8.1.question: _______  would appear as Yogeshwar, the sons of Devhotra and his wife Brihati.
16.8.1.explanation: God would appear as Yogeshwar, the sons of Devhotra and his wife Brihati.

16.8.1.question: Satya, Vedshrut and Bhadra were the main Ganas (courtiers) of the  _______ .
16.8.1.explanation: Satya, Vedshrut and Bhadra were the main Ganas (courtiers) of the God.

16.8.1.question: _______  would appear as Dharmasetu, the sons of Aryak and Vaidhrita.
16.8.1.explanation: God would appear as Dharmasetu, the sons of Aryak and Vaidhrita.

16.8.2.question: When Gajendra saw that Lord Shri Hari had arrived on his vehicle  _______  from the sky, he picked a lotus from the lake and raised it in his trunk and said, "O Jagadishwar (God of all world) Narayana, here is a salutation for you."
16.8.2.explanation: When Gajendra saw that Lord Shri Hari had arrived on his vehicle Garuda from the sky, he picked a lotus from the lake and raised it in his trunk and said, "O Jagadishwar (God of all world) Narayana, here is a salutation for you."

16.8.2.question: God appointed him as his courtier and departed to his divine abode riding on  _______ ."
16.8.2.explanation: God appointed him as his courtier and departed to his divine abode riding on Garuda."

16.8.2.question: By then Lord jumped down from the  _______  and dragged both of them out of water.
16.8.2.explanation: By then Lord jumped down from the Garuda and dragged both of them out of water.

16.8.2.question: Previous  _______  of Gaja & Grah: Killed by the God, the crocodile at once acquired a divine appearance.
16.8.2.explanation: Previous Births of Gaja & Grah: Killed by the God, the crocodile at once acquired a divine appearance.

16.8.2.question: He was a good-natured Gandharva ( _______ ) named Huhu, in his previous birth.
16.8.2.explanation: He was a good-natured Gandharva (demigod) named Huhu, in his previous birth.

16.8.3.question: Distribution of  _______  by Lord as Mohini: The demons who were fighting over the potions of  _______  forgot everything when they saw Mohini, who was actually a guise of Lord Vishnu.
16.8.3.explanation: Distribution of Nectar by Lord as Mohini: The demons who were fighting over the potions of nectar forgot everything when they saw Mohini, who was actually a guise of Lord Vishnu.

16.8.3.question: Distribution of  _______  by Lord as Mohini: The demons who were fighting over the potions of  _______  forgot everything when they saw Mohini, who was actually a guise of Lord Vishnu.
16.8.3.explanation: Distribution of Nectar by Lord as Mohini: The demons who were fighting over the potions of nectar forgot everything when they saw Mohini, who was actually a guise of Lord Vishnu.

16.8.3.question: Emergence of Gems &  _______ : After Lord Shiva drank the poison, the gods and the demons began to churn the sea again with greater enthusiasm.
16.8.3.explanation: Emergence of Gems & Nectar: After Lord Shiva drank the poison, the gods and the demons began to churn the sea again with greater enthusiasm.

16.8.3.question: In Mohini's guise, Lord thought that the demons were congenitally cruel and giving  _______  to them would be akin to feeding sakes with milk.
16.8.3.explanation: In Mohini's guise, Lord thought that the demons were congenitally cruel and giving nectar to them would be akin to feeding sakes with milk.

16.8.3.question: When the  _______  was being distributed, a demon named Rahu took the guise of a god and sitting among them drank the  _______ .
16.8.3.explanation: When the nectar was being distributed, a demon named Rahu took the guise of a god and sitting among them drank the nectar.

16.8.3.question: When the  _______  was being distributed, a demon named Rahu took the guise of a god and sitting among them drank the  _______ .
16.8.3.explanation: When the nectar was being distributed, a demon named Rahu took the guise of a god and sitting among them drank the nectar.

16.8.3.question: Illusioned by God, the demons even gave the  _______  to Mohini and sat peacefully showing their confidence in her.
16.8.3.explanation: Illusioned by God, the demons even gave the nectar to Mohini and sat peacefully showing their confidence in her.

16.8.3.question: So, Mohini offered the  _______  to the gods only while offered wine to the demons.
16.8.3.explanation: So, Mohini offered the nectar to the gods only while offered wine to the demons.

16.8.3.question: The gods and demons had promised Vasuki, the Naga his due share in the  _______ .
16.8.3.explanation: The gods and demons had promised Vasuki, the Naga his due share in the nectar.

16.8.3.question: A row then began among the demons over the drinking of  _______ .
16.8.3.explanation: A row then began among the demons over the drinking of nectar.

16.8.3.question: Lord asked the gods to churn the sea and produce  _______ .
16.8.3.explanation: Lord asked the gods to churn the sea and produce nectar.

16.8.3.question: At last lord Dhanvantari emerged with an urn of  _______ .
16.8.3.explanation: At last lord Dhanvantari emerged with an urn of nectar.

16.8.3.question: But, by then Rahu had drunk enough  _______ .
16.8.3.explanation: But, by then Rahu had drunk enough nectar.

16.8.3.question: Drinking the  _______  one becomes immortal.
16.8.3.explanation: Drinking the nectar one becomes immortal.

16.8.3.question: After the singing by Brahmins in her praise, Lakshmi took  _______  garland in her hand and put it around Lord Vishnu's neck in a gesture of accepting Him as her husband.
16.8.3.explanation: After the singing by Brahmins in her praise, Lakshmi took lotus garland in her hand and put it around Lord Vishnu's neck in a gesture of accepting Him as her husband.

16.8.3.question: Then taking the  _______  in her hand, Lakshmi took a seat on the throne.
16.8.3.explanation: Then taking the lotus in her hand, Lakshmi took a seat on the throne.

16.8.3.question: Brahma presented  _______  while Nagas presented two earrings.
16.8.3.explanation: Brahma presented lotus while Nagas presented two earrings.

16.8.3.question: God asked the gods to put various medicinal plants and vegetations in Kshirsagar (sea of milk) and churn it by Mandarachal Mountain moving it with the help of Vasuki the  _______ .
16.8.3.explanation: God asked the gods to put various medicinal plants and vegetations in Kshirsagar (sea of milk) and churn it by Mandarachal Mountain moving it with the help of Vasuki the naga.

16.8.3.question: But the demons suspecting some mischief said they would hold the head and asked the gods to hold the  _______  from the tail for churning.
16.8.3.explanation: But the demons suspecting some mischief said they would hold the head and asked the gods to hold the Naga from the tail for churning.

16.8.3.question: The gods and demons had promised Vasuki, the  _______  his due share in the nectar.
16.8.3.explanation: The gods and demons had promised Vasuki, the Naga his due share in the nectar.

16.8.3.question: They all accepted to serve Indra in  _______ .
16.8.3.explanation: They all accepted to serve Indra in Heaven.

16.8.3.question: Shukdev says, "Parikshit, in the sixth Chakshush Manvantara,the demons king  _______  had defeated the gods.
16.8.3.explanation: Shukdev says, "Parikshit, in the sixth Chakshush Manvantara,the demons king Bali had defeated the gods.

16.8.3.question: Thereafter, Indra and other gods went unarmed to the demon king  _______  and told him of their intention.
16.8.3.explanation: Thereafter, Indra and other gods went unarmed to the demon king Bali and told him of their intention.

16.8.3.question: Then a horse named Uchchaishrava, emerged and taken up by  _______  the king of demons.
16.8.3.explanation: Then a horse named Uchchaishrava, emerged and taken up by Bali the king of demons.

16.8.4.question: When Indra saw that  _______  had come with full preparation and that his armies had surrounded Amaravati, he went to his teacher Brihaspati and asked about the reason for the demons' sudden uprising.
16.8.4.explanation: When Indra saw that Bali had come with full preparation and that his armies had surrounded Amaravati, he went to his teacher Brihaspati and asked about the reason for the demons' sudden uprising.

16.8.4.question: When, Shukracharya saw that his disciple  _______  was determined to violate his dictate, he cursed, " O king, soon you will be devoid of the wealth you have been enjoying."
16.8.4.explanation: When, Shukracharya saw that his disciple Bali was determined to violate his dictate, he cursed, " O king, soon you will be devoid of the wealth you have been enjoying."

16.8.4.question: When Guru Shukracharya, saw that  _______  had agreed to donate land, he tried to persuade him, "O  _______ , this Vaman is none other than indestructible Lord Vishnu.
16.8.4.explanation: When Guru Shukracharya, saw that Bali had agreed to donate land, he tried to persuade him, "O Bali, this Vaman is none other than indestructible Lord Vishnu.

16.8.4.question: When Guru Shukracharya, saw that  _______  had agreed to donate land, he tried to persuade him, "O  _______ , this Vaman is none other than indestructible Lord Vishnu.
16.8.4.explanation: When Guru Shukracharya, saw that Bali had agreed to donate land, he tried to persuade him, "O Bali, this Vaman is none other than indestructible Lord Vishnu.

16.8.4.question: Thus Lord Vishnu gave  _______  the empire of Sutal Loka (hades) that was even richer than the heaven and said: 'I will protect you there from all the obstacles.'
16.8.4.explanation: Thus Lord Vishnu gave Bali the empire of Sutal Loka (hades) that was even richer than the heaven and said: 'I will protect you there from all the obstacles.'

16.8.4.question: As soon as  _______  made the promise, Lord Vaman assumed a gigantic appearance and measured  _______ 's entire empire in his steps.
16.8.4.explanation: As soon as Bali made the promise, Lord Vaman assumed a gigantic appearance and measured Bali's entire empire in his steps.

16.8.4.question: As soon as  _______  made the promise, Lord Vaman assumed a gigantic appearance and measured  _______ 's entire empire in his steps.
16.8.4.explanation: As soon as Bali made the promise, Lord Vaman assumed a gigantic appearance and measured Bali's entire empire in his steps.

16.8.4.question: Lord ridiculed  _______  for not keeping his promise fully, "Your everything is mine now, but your promise is still incomplete.
16.8.4.explanation: Lord ridiculed Bali for not keeping his promise fully, "Your everything is mine now, but your promise is still incomplete.

16.8.4.question: _______ 's grandfather Prahlad presented him a garland while Shukracharya gave a conch.
16.8.4.explanation: Bali's grandfather Prahlad presented him a garland while Shukracharya gave a conch.

16.8.4.question: But despite having been cursed by his teacher,  _______  stayed firm to his promise.
16.8.4.explanation: But despite having been cursed by his teacher, Bali stayed firm to his promise.

16.8.4.question: With advice of his priests,  _______  organized one hundred Ashvmegh Yagyas.
16.8.4.explanation: With advice of his priests, Bali organized one hundred Ashvmegh Yagyas.

16.8.4.question: Host  _______  offered Him the best seat and washed His feet with affection.
16.8.4.explanation: Host Bali offered Him the best seat and washed His feet with affection.

16.8.4.question: Shukdev says Lord ridiculed  _______  but he remained unmoved with patience.
16.8.4.explanation: Shukdev says Lord ridiculed Bali but he remained unmoved with patience.

16.8.4.question: Thus fully prepared  _______  launched a massive attack on the heaven.
16.8.4.explanation: Thus fully prepared Bali launched a massive attack on the heaven.

16.8.4.question: After the abdication of the heaven by the gods  _______  captured it.
16.8.4.explanation: After the abdication of the heaven by the gods Bali captured it.

16.8.4.question: The survivng demons carried the dead  _______  towards Astachal.
16.8.4.explanation: The survivng demons carried the dead Bali towards Astachal.

16.8.4.question: So the Brahmins organized a Vishvjit Yagya for  _______ .
16.8.4.explanation: So the Brahmins organized a Vishvjit Yagya for Bali.

16.8.4.question: Then  _______  requested God for his service.
16.8.4.explanation: Then Bali requested God for his service.

16.8.4.question: Guru gave him Yagyopavit, Kashyap gave neck-kerchief, the earth gave black buck skin, Chandra gave scepter, Mother gave loin cloth, the sky gave umbrella, Brahma gave Kamandalu (coconut shell bowl) Saptrishi gave kush (sacred grass) while  _______ dess Saraswati presented  _______  with a string of Rosaries.
16.8.4.explanation: Guru gave him Yagyopavit, Kashyap gave neck-kerchief, the earth gave black buck skin, Chandra gave scepter, Mother gave loin cloth, the sky gave umbrella, Brahma gave Kamandalu (coconut shell bowl) Saptrishi gave kush (sacred grass) while Goddess Saraswati presented God with a string of Rosaries.

16.8.4.question: As soon as Lord Vaman reached the site, all the sages, hosts and others present there became dull before the radiance of  _______ .
16.8.4.explanation: As soon as Lord Vaman reached the site, all the sages, hosts and others present there became dull before the radiance of God.

16.8.4.question: Then, one must worship  _______  with Shodushopchar (sixteen treatments) while following the rules prescribed for daily routine.
16.8.4.explanation: Then, one must worship God with Shodushopchar (sixteen treatments) while following the rules prescribed for daily routine.

16.8.4.question: Thus everyone payed due respect to  _______  in Vaman (dwarf) incarnation who was radiating with divine glory.

16.10.78.explanation: King Bali then asked God what could he do for Him.
