16.10.78.explanation: They had once seen Brahma trying to copulate with his own daughter and hence derided at him.

16.10.78.question: Indignant  _______  had then curse them to take birth in demon incarnation.
16.10.78.explanation: Indignant Brahma had then curse them to take birth in demon incarnation.

16.10.78.question: King Bali then asked  _______  what could he do for Him.
16.10.78.explanation: King Bali then asked God what could he do for Him.

16.10.79.question: Acting as per the urge, Arjun reached Dwaraka in the guise of  _______  sage.
16.10.79.explanation: Acting as per the urge, Arjun reached Dwaraka in the guise of Vaishnava sage.

16.10.80.question: Shukdev says: "Parikshit as per your query, I told you how  _______  describe Parabrahma Paramatma who is free from natural virtues and invisible.
16.10.80.explanation: Shukdev says: "Parikshit as per your query, I told you how Vedas describe Parabrahma Paramatma who is free from natural virtues and invisible.

16.10.80.question: Description of Brahma, Indra, Agni, Surya and other gods, by us ( _______ ) appears as separate, The complete universe is not different from you.
16.10.80.explanation: Description of Brahma, Indra, Agni, Surya and other gods, by us (Vedas) appears as separate, The complete universe is not different from you.

16.10.80.question: Shrutis ( _______ ) says: "O Ajit (invincible one), you are supreme, no one can conquer you; may you win everywhere.
16.10.80.explanation: Shrutis (Vedas) says: "O Ajit (invincible one), you are supreme, no one can conquer you; may you win everywhere.

16.10.80.question: At the end of Pralaya,  _______  (Shurtis) wake Him up through the words that demonstrate Him."
16.10.80.explanation: At the end of Pralaya, Vedas (Shurtis) wake Him up through the words that demonstrate Him."

16.10.80.question: On the other hand Guna (Virtues) is the subject of all the Shrutis ( _______ ).
16.10.80.explanation: On the other hand Guna (Virtues) is the subject of all the Shrutis (Vedas).

16.10.80.question: Shrutis ( _______ ) do depict Saguna (with virtues) clearly.
16.10.80.explanation: Shrutis (Vedas) do depict Saguna (with virtues) clearly.

16.10.80.question: All the  _______  describe your merits.
16.10.80.explanation: All the Vedas describe your merits.

16.10.80.question: How do  _______  then depict Brahma?"
16.10.80.explanation: How do Vedas then depict Brahma?"

16.10.80.question: King Parikshit asked: " _______ , Brahma is beyond the limit of do's and why's.
16.10.80.explanation: King Parikshit asked: "Brahmin, Brahma is beyond the limit of do's and why's.

16.10.80.question: He is free from the virtues like Sat,  _______  and Tama.
16.10.80.explanation: He is free from the virtues like Sat, Raja and Tama.

16.10.80.question: He is free from the virtues like  _______ , Raja and Tama.
16.10.80.explanation: He is free from the virtues like Sat, Raja and Tama.

16.10.80.question: Dharma(duty), Arth ( _______ ), Kama (Sensual pleasure) and Moksha (Salvation) have no meaning for those who remember you with pure heart.
16.10.80.explanation: Dharma(duty), Arth (Wealth), Kama (Sensual pleasure) and Moksha (Salvation) have no meaning for those who remember you with pure heart.

16.10.80.question: Shukdev says: "Parikshit as per your query, I told you how Vedas describe Parabrahma Paramatma who is free from natural  _______  and invisible.
16.10.80.explanation: Shukdev says: "Parikshit as per your query, I told you how Vedas describe Parabrahma Paramatma who is free from natural virtues and invisible.

16.10.80.question: All the savants love none but you through hearing and remembering of your auspicious, benevolent  _______ .
16.10.80.explanation: All the savants love none but you through hearing and remembering of your auspicious, benevolent virtues.

16.10.80.question: Shukdev says: "Parikshit, Lord is omnipotent and a treasure of all the  _______ .
16.10.80.explanation: Shukdev says: "Parikshit, Lord is omnipotent and a treasure of all the virtues.

16.10.80.question: On the other hand Guna ( _______ ) is the subject of all the Shrutis (Vedas).
16.10.80.explanation: On the other hand Guna (Virtues) is the subject of all the Shrutis (Vedas).

16.10.80.question: So one must continuously reflect on the  _______  of Lord Shri Krishna."
16.10.80.explanation: So one must continuously reflect on the virtues of Lord Shri Krishna."

16.10.80.question: Shrutis (Vedas) do depict Saguna (with  _______ ) clearly.
16.10.80.explanation: Shrutis (Vedas) do depict Saguna (with virtues) clearly.

16.10.80.question: He is free from the  _______  like Sat, Raja and Tama.
16.10.80.explanation: He is free from the virtues like Sat, Raja and Tama.

16.10.81.question: But once they get wealth, the devotees become despotic and even forget the  _______  who had blessed them."
16.10.81.explanation: But once they get wealth, the devotees become despotic and even forget the God who had blessed them."

16.10.81.question: He had pleased Lord Shiva and sought a  _______  that the person, upon whose head the demon put his hand, should be incinerated at once.
16.10.81.explanation: He had pleased Lord Shiva and sought a boon that the person, upon whose head the demon put his hand, should be incinerated at once.

16.10.81.question: Now afraid of his own  _______ , Lord Shiva ran for his life, with the demon following him in hot pursuit.
16.10.81.explanation: Now afraid of his own boon, Lord Shiva ran for his life, with the demon following him in hot pursuit.

16.10.81.question: By the virtue of the  _______ , the demon was incinerated in no time and thus Lord Shiva could be saved.
16.10.81.explanation: By the virtue of the boon, the demon was incinerated in no time and thus Lord Shiva could be saved.

16.10.81.question: Lord Shiva granted the  _______  without considering the consequences.
16.10.81.explanation: Lord Shiva granted the boon without considering the consequences.

16.10.82.question: But instead of getting angry,  _______  got up, bowed his head before the sage and begged pardon: "O Sage, pardon me, I could not welcome you at once, at your arrival.
16.10.82.explanation: But instead of getting angry, Lord got up, bowed his head before the sage and begged pardon: "O Sage, pardon me, I could not welcome you at once, at your arrival.

16.10.82.question: Bhrigu felt very pleased by the serious talks of  _______ .
16.10.82.explanation: Bhrigu felt very pleased by the serious talks of Lord.

16.10.82.question: _______  was lying with head in the lap of Lakshmi.
16.10.82.explanation: Lord was lying with head in the lap of Lakshmi.

16.10.82.question: But instead of accepting Lord Shiva's welcome, the sage began to abuse Him, saying: "You violate the dignity of  _______ , so I will not meet with you."
16.10.82.explanation: But instead of accepting Lord Shiva's welcome, the sage began to abuse Him, saying: "You violate the dignity of Vedas, so I will not meet with you."

16.10.83.question: The  _______  took his dead son to the royal court and complained: "My Son has died because of anti- _______  and licentious actions of the king."
16.10.83.explanation: The Brahmin took his dead son to the royal court and complained: "My Son has died because of anti-Brahmin and licentious actions of the king."

16.10.83.question: The  _______  took his dead son to the royal court and complained: "My Son has died because of anti- _______  and licentious actions of the king."
16.10.83.explanation: The Brahmin took his dead son to the royal court and complained: "My Son has died because of anti-Brahmin and licentious actions of the king."

16.10.83.question: Arjun scouted through all the three worlds and even the netherworlds in search of the  _______ 's dead son, but he could not find him anywhere.
16.10.83.explanation: Arjun scouted through all the three worlds and even the netherworlds in search of the Brahmin's dead son, but he could not find him anywhere.

16.10.83.question: Lord Purushottam said in a serious voice: "O Krishna and Arjuna, only to have a sight of both of you, I brought the  _______ 's sons to me.
16.10.83.explanation: Lord Purushottam said in a serious voice: "O Krishna and Arjuna, only to have a sight of both of you, I brought the Brahmin's sons to me.

16.10.83.question: One by one, thus, eight sons were born to the  _______  couple; but they all died immediately after birth.
16.10.83.explanation: One by one, thus, eight sons were born to the Brahmin couple; but they all died immediately after birth.

16.10.83.question: Shri Krishna and Arjun again greeted Lord and returned on earth with all the sons of the  _______ .
16.10.83.explanation: Shri Krishna and Arjun again greeted Lord and returned on earth with all the sons of the Brahmin.

16.10.83.question: Training his bow and arrows, Arjun made all arrangements to protect  _______ 's tenth son.
16.10.83.explanation: Training his bow and arrows, Arjun made all arrangements to protect Brahmin's tenth son.

16.10.83.question: And the  _______  kept on dumping his dead sons at the gate of the royal palace.
16.10.83.explanation: And the Brahmin kept on dumping his dead sons at the gate of the royal palace.

16.10.83.question: At the time of next delivery, the agitated  _______  came to Arjun.
16.10.83.explanation: At the time of next delivery, the agitated Brahmin came to Arjun.

16.10.83.question: There in Dwaraka lived a  _______ .
16.10.83.explanation: There in Dwaraka lived a Brahmin.

16.10.83.question: Like common, ordinary people, the  _______  stayed on earth enjoing mundane comforts, performed Yagyas like kings, behaved like idealistic people; deterred His subjects and slayed evil kings to re-establish religion on earth.
16.10.83.explanation: Like common, ordinary people, the Lord stayed on earth enjoing mundane comforts, performed Yagyas like kings, behaved like idealistic people; deterred His subjects and slayed evil kings to re-establish religion on earth.

16.10.83.question: Shri Krishna and Arjun again greeted  _______  and returned on earth with all the sons of the Brahmin.
16.10.83.explanation: Shri Krishna and Arjun again greeted Lord and returned on earth with all the sons of the Brahmin.

16.10.83.question: Thereafter, riding a divine chariot,  _______  set out with Arjun, towards west.
16.10.83.explanation: Thereafter, riding a divine chariot, Lord set out with Arjun, towards west.

16.10.83.question: There Arjun saw that  _______  was present in Purushottams appearance.
16.10.83.explanation: There Arjun saw that Lord was present in Purushottams appearance.

16.10.83.question: Arjun was greatly surprised to see the supreme abode of  _______ .
16.10.83.explanation: Arjun was greatly surprised to see the supreme abode of Lord.

16.11.3.question: I learned forgiveness from earth, purity from the sky, holiness and cleanliness from the water, innocence and renunciation from the fire; indifferentness from the air, to remain unaffected by circumstances from moon, abdication from the Sun, incoherence from the pigeon, dependence upon fate and remain effortless from the python, to remain always happy and serious from the sea, to be under the control of sense organs and hence meet total destruction from the grasshopper, acquiring of virtues from  _______ , fault in cumulating from honey bee, to abstain sensuous talks from the Deer, to eliminate greed from the fish, sorrow in hope and happiness in desperation from the prostitute, to feel happy in uncertainty from osprey, dispute among many from the girls, concentration from the arrow-maker, to roam alone and detachment from a particular place from the snake, virtues of the creator Lord from the spider, and I learned similarity from the wasp."
16.11.3.explanation: I learned forgiveness from earth, purity from the sky, holiness and cleanliness from the water, innocence and renunciation from the fire; indifferentness from the air, to remain unaffected by circumstances from moon, abdication from the Sun, incoherence from the pigeon, dependence upon fate and remain effortless from the python, to remain always happy and serious from the sea, to be under the control of sense organs and hence meet total destruction from the grasshopper, acquiring of virtues from bumblebee, fault in cumulating from honey bee, to abstain sensuous talks from the Deer, to eliminate greed from the fish, sorrow in hope and happiness in desperation from the prostitute, to feel happy in uncertainty from osprey, dispute among many from the girls, concentration from the arrow-maker, to roam alone and detachment from a particular place from the snake, virtues of the creator Lord from the spider, and I learned similarity from the wasp."

16.11.3.question: Earth, air, sky, water, fire, the moon the sun, pigeon,  _______ , sea, grasshopper, bumblebee, honey bee, elephant, extractor of honey, deer, fish, prostitute, osprey, boy, girls, arrow-maker, snake, spider and wasp are all my teachers.

16.11.3.question: Baddh Jeevas ( _______  souls) are those who indulge in sensual pleasures and those who dislike pious company.
16.11.3.explanation: Baddh Jeevas (bound souls) are those who indulge in sensual pleasures and those who dislike pious company.

16.11.3.question: There are three kinds of Jeev - Baddh ( _______ ), Bhakt (devotee) and Mukt(liberated).
16.11.3.explanation: There are three kinds of Jeev - Baddh (Bound), Bhakt (devotee) and Mukt(liberated).

16.11.4.question: But still the  _______  did not lose his patience and regarding his present state as a result of his previous birth's deeds, he expressed his feelings thus: These people are not the cause of my miseries; neither the gods, nor body, not even planets and time, can be blamed for my miseries.
16.11.4.explanation: But still the Brahmin did not lose his patience and regarding his present state as a result of his previous birth's deeds, he expressed his feelings thus: These people are not the cause of my miseries; neither the gods, nor body, not even planets and time, can be blamed for my miseries.

16.11.4.question: That  _______  had been badly tormented by the evil people after he had lost his wealth.
16.11.4.explanation: That Brahmin had been badly tormented by the evil people after he had lost his wealth.

16.11.4.question: In this context there is a tale of a greedy  _______  who lived in Ujjain.
16.11.4.explanation: In this context there is a tale of a greedy Brahmin who lived in Ujjain.

16.11.4.question: The ultimate outcome of all the spiritual efforts like celibacy, study of  _______  etc.
16.11.4.explanation: The ultimate outcome of all the spiritual efforts like celibacy, study of Vedas etc.

16.12.1.question: Then a diplomatic  _______ , named Chanakya, would exterminate this dynasty and enthrone Chandragupt Maurya.
16.12.1.explanation: Then a diplomatic Brahmin, named Chanakya, would exterminate this dynasty and enthrone Chandragupt Maurya.

16.12.4.question: During the Satra, and invoked by the hymns of  _______ , snakes drew from far and near and got burnt in the fire.
16.12.4.explanation: During the Satra, and invoked by the hymns of Brahmins, snakes drew from far and near and got burnt in the fire.

16.12.4.question: There, on earth, Janmejay asked the  _______ : "Why has Takshak, the killer of my father, not arrived yet?"
16.12.4.explanation: There, on earth, Janmejay asked the Brahmins: "Why has Takshak, the killer of my father, not arrived yet?"

16.12.4.question: Through reconciliation,  _______  saw that Takshak was clinging to Indra's throne.
16.12.4.explanation: Through reconciliation, Brahmins saw that Takshak was clinging to Indra's throne.

16.12.5.question: Ved Vyas divided  _______  into four parts and created four Sanhitas viz, Rig, Yajur, Sama and Atharva and taught Rigsanhita to Pail, Nigad sanhita to Vaishampayan, Chhandog Sanhita to Jemini and tought Atharvangiras Sanhita to Sumantu.
16.12.5.explanation: Ved Vyas divided Vedas into four parts and created four Sanhitas viz, Rig, Yajur, Sama and Atharva and taught Rigsanhita to Pail, Nigad sanhita to Vaishampayan, Chhandog Sanhita to Jemini and tought Atharvangiras Sanhita to Sumantu.

16.12.5.question: SUTJI described about the Samhitas and divisions of  _______  to the sages like Shaunak etc.
16.12.5.explanation: SUTJI described about the Samhitas and divisions of Vedas to the sages like Shaunak etc.

16.12.5.question: Ved Vyas divided Vedas into four parts and created four Sanhitas viz,  _______ , Yajur, Sama and Atharva and taught  _______ sanhita to Pail, Nigad sanhita to Vaishampayan, Chhandog Sanhita to Jemini and tought Atharvangiras Sanhita to Sumantu.
16.12.5.explanation: Ved Vyas divided Vedas into four parts and created four Sanhitas viz, Rig, Yajur, Sama and Atharva and taught Rigsanhita to Pail, Nigad sanhita to Vaishampayan, Chhandog Sanhita to Jemini and tought Atharvangiras Sanhita to Sumantu.

16.12.5.question: Ved Vyas divided Vedas into four parts and created four Sanhitas viz, Rig, Yajur, Sama and Atharva and taught Rigsanhita to  _______ , Nigad sanhita to Vaishampayan, Chhandog Sanhita to Jemini and tought Atharvangiras Sanhita to Sumantu.
16.12.5.explanation: Ved Vyas divided Vedas into four parts and created four Sanhitas viz, Rig, Yajur, Sama and Atharva and taught Rigsanhita to Pail, Nigad sanhita to Vaishampayan, Chhandog Sanhita to Jemini and tought Atharvangiras Sanhita to Sumantu.

16.12.6.question: He prayed God to show His  _______  (illusion).
16.12.6.explanation: He prayed God to show His Maya (illusion).

16.12.6.question: On a leaf of  _______ , then he saw Bal Mukund.
16.12.6.explanation: On a leaf of Banyan, then he saw Bal Mukund.

17.1.1.question: These three deities are the expression of the three natural qualities respectively- _______ , Satva and Tamas.
17.1.1.explanation: These three deities are the expression of the three natural qualities respectively-Rajas, Satva and Tamas.

17.1.1.question: He manifests himself in all the living creatures as well as imperceptible things in the form of seven natural elements-Mahattatva (5 basic elements) Ahankara (ego), Shabda ( _______ ) Sparsh (touch), Roop (appearance), Rasa (taste) and Gandha (smell).
17.1.1.explanation: He manifests himself in all the living creatures as well as imperceptible things in the form of seven natural elements-Mahattatva (5 basic elements) Ahankara (ego), Shabda (Sound) Sparsh (touch), Roop (appearance), Rasa (taste) and Gandha (smell).

17.1.1.question: But, all these qualities become apparent in it only because of Shiva, who is imperishable and whose characteristics are the natural qualities like taste, smell, touch and  _______ .
17.1.1.explanation: But, all these qualities become apparent in it only because of Shiva, who is imperishable and whose characteristics are the natural qualities like taste, smell, touch and sound.

17.1.1.question: Among these subtle forms of matter,  _______  came into being first of all and space originated from it.
17.1.1.explanation: Among these subtle forms of matter, Sound came into being first of all and space originated from it.

17.1.1.question: From Ego manifests the Tanmantras or subtle forms of matter-  _______ , form, taste smell and touch.
17.1.1.explanation: From Ego manifests the Tanmantras or subtle forms of matter- sound, form, taste smell and touch.

17.1.1.question: He manifests himself in all the living creatures as well as imperceptible things in the form of seven natural elements-Mahattatva (5 basic elements) Ahankara ( _______ ), Shabda (Sound) Sparsh (touch), Roop (appearance), Rasa (taste) and Gandha (smell).
17.1.1.explanation: He manifests himself in all the living creatures as well as imperceptible things in the form of seven natural elements-Mahattatva (5 basic elements) Ahankara (ego), Shabda (Sound) Sparsh (touch), Roop (appearance), Rasa (taste) and Gandha (smell).

17.1.1.question: All the five organs of action (Karmendriya) sense organs and mind originated from pure  _______  (Satva ahankara).
17.1.1.explanation: All the five organs of action (Karmendriya) sense organs and mind originated from pure Ego (Satva ahankara).

17.1.1.question: From  _______  manifests the Tanmantras or subtle forms of matter- sound, form, taste smell and touch.
17.1.1.explanation: From Ego manifests the Tanmantras or subtle forms of matter- sound, form, taste smell and touch.

17.1.1.question: From Mahattatva manifests the  _______  or 'ahankara which comprises of three gunas.
17.1.1.explanation: From Mahattatva manifests the ego or 'ahankara which comprises of three gunas.

17.1.2.question: The cycle of four Yugas occur periodically for 1000 times, during which period altogether fourteen  _______  take incarnation, one after another.
17.1.2.explanation: The cycle of four Yugas occur periodically for 1000 times, during which period altogether fourteen Manus take incarnation, one after another.

17.1.4.question: He is the bestower of religiousness (Dharma), knowledge (Gyan), asceticism (Vairagya) and  _______  (Aishwarya).
17.1.4.explanation: He is the bestower of religiousness (Dharma), knowledge (Gyan), asceticism (Vairagya) and splendour (Aishwarya).

17.1.4.question: He is the bestower of religiousness ( _______ ), knowledge (Gyan), asceticism (Vairagya) and splendour (Aishwarya).
17.1.4.explanation: He is the bestower of religiousness (Dharma), knowledge (Gyan), asceticism (Vairagya) and splendour (Aishwarya).

17.1.4.question: He is engrossed in the supreme state of  _______  with effortless case.
17.1.4.explanation: He is engrossed in the supreme state of Yoga with effortless case.

17.1.6.question: It can be achieved with the help of eight means-Yama (Penance), Niyam (discipline), Aasan ( _______ ), Pranayam (Breath-control), Pratyahar (restraint of passion), Dharan (retention), Dhyan (concentration) and Samadhi (deep meditation).
17.1.6.explanation: It can be achieved with the help of eight means-Yama (Penance), Niyam (discipline), Aasan (Posture), Pranayam (Breath-control), Pratyahar (restraint of passion), Dharan (retention), Dhyan (concentration) and Samadhi (deep meditation).

17.1.6.question: It can be achieved with the help of eight means-Yama (Penance), Niyam (discipline), Aasan (Posture), Pranayam ( _______ -control), Pratyahar (restraint of passion), Dharan (retention), Dhyan (concentration) and Samadhi (deep meditation).
17.1.6.explanation: It can be achieved with the help of eight means-Yama (Penance), Niyam (discipline), Aasan (Posture), Pranayam (Breath-control), Pratyahar (restraint of passion), Dharan (retention), Dhyan (concentration) and Samadhi (deep meditation).

17.1.6.question: He should then retain his  _______  as long as possible and visualize lord Shiva within his body.
17.1.6.explanation: He should then retain his breath as long as possible and visualize lord Shiva within his body.

17.1.6.question: _______  control is an important aspect of yogic exercise.
17.1.6.explanation: Breath control is an important aspect of yogic exercise.

17.1.6.question: It can be achieved with the help of eight means-Yama ( _______ ), Niyam (discipline), Aasan (Posture), Pranayam (Breath-control), Pratyahar (restraint of passion), Dharan (retention), Dhyan (concentration) and Samadhi (deep meditation).
17.1.6.explanation: It can be achieved with the help of eight means-Yama (Penance), Niyam (discipline), Aasan (Posture), Pranayam (Breath-control), Pratyahar (restraint of passion), Dharan (retention), Dhyan (concentration) and Samadhi (deep meditation).

17.1.6.question: There are some specific spots in the human body concentrating upon which, enables a man to attain the state of yoga-spot between the eyebrows, lower part of the throat,  _______  and six inches above it etc.
17.1.6.explanation: There are some specific spots in the human body concentrating upon which, enables a man to attain the state of yoga-spot between the eyebrows, lower part of the throat, Navel and six inches above it etc.

17.1.9.question: Sutji replied-During the Kalpa named Shwetalohit, once lord Brahma witnessed the manifestation of a divine child who was of mixed (red &  _______ ) complexion.
17.1.9.explanation: Sutji replied-During the Kalpa named Shwetalohit, once lord Brahma witnessed the manifestation of a divine child who was of mixed (red & white) complexion.

17.1.9.question: Sutji replied-During the Kalpa named Shwetalohit, once lord Brahma witnessed the manifestation of a divine child who was of mixed ( _______  & white) complexion.
17.1.9.explanation: Sutji replied-During the Kalpa named Shwetalohit, once lord Brahma witnessed the manifestation of a divine child who was of mixed (red & white) complexion.

17.1.9.question: The child had a Shikha ( _______ ) on his head.
17.1.9.explanation: The child had a Shikha (topknot) on his head.

17.1.11.question: Even his turban, sacred- thread and  _______  were yellow in colour.
17.1.11.explanation: Even his turban, sacred- thread and garland were yellow in colour.

17.1.12.question: Not only that he had put on  _______  apparels and a  _______  crown on his head.
17.1.12.explanation: Not only that he had put on black apparels and a black crown on his head.

17.1.12.question: Not only that he had put on  _______  apparels and a  _______  crown on his head.
17.1.12.explanation: Not only that he had put on black apparels and a black crown on his head.

17.1.12.question: A  _______  sacred thread was hanging across his shoulder.
17.1.12.explanation: A black sacred thread was hanging across his shoulder.

17.1.12.question: _______  was the predominant colour of this kalpa.
17.1.12.explanation: Black was the predominant colour of this kalpa.

17.1.12.explanation: A person who worships Lord Aghoresh and has deep devotion in him becomes liberated from gravest of sins like Brahmhatya (sin acquired due to killing a Brahmin) etc.

17.1.14.explanation: The mystical form of Shivalinga is a symbolical expression of sacred mantra-AUM.

17.2.2.question: Ultimately he was successful in coming out through the tubular stalk of the  _______ .As Lord Brahma was not amused by Vishnu's behaviour, he started fighting with him.
17.2.2.explanation: Ultimately he was successful in coming out through the tubular stalk of the lotus.As Lord Brahma was not amused by Vishnu's behaviour, he started fighting with him.

17.2.2.question: Lord Brahma was seated on the  _______  flower.When Lord Brahma saw Lord Vishnu, he asked-"Who are you sleeping in this ocean?''
17.2.2.explanation: Lord Brahma was seated on the Lotus flower.When Lord Brahma saw Lord Vishnu, he asked-"Who are you sleeping in this ocean?''

17.2.2.question: The Sages requested Sutji to elucidate how Lord Brahma emerged from the navel of Vishnu seated on a  _______  flower.
17.2.2.explanation: The Sages requested Sutji to elucidate how Lord Brahma emerged from the navel of Vishnu seated on a lotus flower.

17.2.2.question: As the result of his divine play, a huge  _______  flower along with a long tubular stalk emerged from his navel.
17.2.2.explanation: As the result of his divine play, a huge lotus flower along with a long tubular stalk emerged from his navel.

17.2.2.question: His moments created high tide and strong mind, which vigorously shook the  _______  flower.
17.2.2.explanation: His moments created high tide and strong mind, which vigorously shook the lotus flower.

17.2.2.question: The  _______  requested Sutji to elucidate how Lord Brahma emerged from the navel of Vishnu seated on a lotus flower.
17.2.2.explanation: The Sages requested Sutji to elucidate how Lord Brahma emerged from the navel of Vishnu seated on a lotus flower.

17.2.2.question: Very soon, a quarrel ensures between them.Desirous of knowing the identity of the stranger, Lord Vishnu entered Brahma's  _______  through his mouth.
17.2.2.explanation: Very soon, a quarrel ensures between them.Desirous of knowing the identity of the stranger, Lord Vishnu entered Brahma's abdomen through his mouth.

17.2.2.question: Lord Brahma decided to check the authenticity of Vishnu's statement and entered into his  _______  through the mouth.
17.2.2.explanation: Lord Brahma decided to check the authenticity of Vishnu's statement and entered into his abdomen through the mouth.

17.2.2.question: Being exhausted, he came out and told Lord Brahma that even his  _______  had the same unlimited expanse.
17.2.2.explanation: Being exhausted, he came out and told Lord Brahma that even his abdomen had the same unlimited expanse.

17.2.2.question: Lord Brahma wandered inside the  _______  for thousands of year but could not find the end.
17.2.2.explanation: Lord Brahma wandered inside the abdomen for thousands of year but could not find the end.

17.2.2.question: He was amazed to find the existence of whole universe inside Brahma's  _______ .
17.2.2.explanation: He was amazed to find the existence of whole universe inside Brahma's abdomen.

17.2.4.question: He also gave in-depth description of various subjects like, the different worlds, the  _______  the four major castes etc.
17.2.4.explanation: He also gave in-depth description of various subjects like, the different worlds, the vedas the four major castes etc.

17.2.6.question: He should then worship all the deities by sprinkling water from the Shankh ( _______ ) and amidst the chanting of mantras like 'Rudren Pavamanen' etc.
17.2.6.explanation: He should then worship all the deities by sprinkling water from the Shankh (Conch) and amidst the chanting of mantras like 'Rudren Pavamanen' etc.

17.2.6.question: • Varun Snan (Taking bath in open) • Bhashma Snan (Smearing ashes on the body) •  _______  Snan (Chanting of  _______ ) Lord Shiva had stressed upon the importance of taking bath in a river or a pond.
17.2.6.explanation: • Varun Snan (Taking bath in open) • Bhashma Snan (Smearing ashes on the body) • Mantra Snan (Chanting of mantra) Lord Shiva had stressed upon the importance of taking bath in a river or a pond.

17.2.6.question: Having done, this, he should take a dip in the river after purifying the water by chanting the sacred 'Adhamarshan'  _______ .
17.2.6.explanation: Having done, this, he should take a dip in the river after purifying the water by chanting the sacred 'Adhamarshan' mantra.

17.2.6.question: While smearing mud on his body, he should chant the  _______  - Uddhatashivarahen.
17.2.6.explanation: While smearing mud on his body, he should chant the mantra - Uddhatashivarahen.

17.2.7.question: Lord Brahma narrated the following tale to them --- "Once there lived a kind hearted  _______  named Sudarshan.
17.2.7.explanation: Lord Brahma narrated the following tale to them --- "Once there lived a kind hearted Brahmin named Sudarshan.

17.2.7.question: Your conduct was unlike Sudarshan-a  _______  who by his hospitality was able to win the lord of death."
17.2.7.explanation: Your conduct was unlike Sudarshan-a Brahmin who by his hospitality was able to win the lord of death."

17.2.7.question: One day he arrived at Sudarshan's hermitage disguised as a  _______ .
17.2.7.explanation: One day he arrived at Sudarshan's hermitage disguised as a Brahmin.

17.2.7.question: They were desirous of satiating their lust but  _______  maintained silence and did not oblige them.
17.2.7.explanation: They were desirous of satiating their lust but Shiva maintained silence and did not oblige them.

17.2.8.question: He lived in a cave and engaged himself in severe penance, continuously chanting the holy name of  _______ .
17.2.8.explanation: He lived in a cave and engaged himself in severe penance, continuously chanting the holy name of Shiva.

17.2.8.question: The sages curiously asked Lord Brahma about the means with which  _______  could be pleased.
17.2.8.explanation: The sages curiously asked Lord Brahma about the means with which Shiva could be pleased.

17.2.8.question: He challenged 'Kaal' that being a devotee of  _______  he was beyond the reach of death.
17.2.8.explanation: He challenged 'Kaal' that being a devotee of Shiva he was beyond the reach of death.

17.2.10.question: It is the symbolic expression of my 'Veerya' ( _______ ).
17.2.10.explanation: It is the symbolic expression of my 'Veerya' (Semen).

17.2.12.question: Lord Vishnu expressed his inability by saying--- I don't punish a  _______ , especially if he is a devotee of Rudra.
17.2.12.explanation: Lord Vishnu expressed his inability by saying--- I don't punish a Brahmin, especially if he is a devotee of Rudra.

17.2.12.question: Lord Vishnu then went to Dadhichi's hermitage disguised as a  _______ .
17.2.12.explanation: Lord Vishnu then went to Dadhichi's hermitage disguised as a Brahmin.

17.2.13.question: At that time Lord Shiva had arrived there to bless both of them.After the departure of Lord Shiva, Vishnu took the incarnation of Varah ( _______ ) and reestablished the earth in it's original position.
17.2.13.explanation: At that time Lord Shiva had arrived there to bless both of them.After the departure of Lord Shiva, Vishnu took the incarnation of Varah (Boar) and reestablished the earth in it's original position.

17.3.1.question: Tamoguna ( _______ ) is the dominant quality prevailing during Kaliyuga.
17.3.1.explanation: Tamoguna (Dark) is the dominant quality prevailing during Kaliyuga.

17.3.1.question: Indra replied---Lord Brahma created the four eras (yugas)--Satya, Treta, Dwapar and  _______ .
17.3.1.explanation: Indra replied---Lord Brahma created the four eras (yugas)--Satya, Treta, Dwapar and Kali.

17.3.1.question: Lord Brahma created the warrior caste  _______  for the protection of virtuosity.Lord Brahma propogated the rituals of oblation during Tretayuga.
17.3.1.explanation: Lord Brahma created the warrior caste Kshatriya for the protection of virtuosity.Lord Brahma propogated the rituals of oblation during Tretayuga.

17.3.2.question: Brahmins would lose their superiority and  _______  would become the rulers.
17.3.2.explanation: Brahmins would lose their superiority and Shudras would become the rulers.

17.3.4.explanation: In course of time, Shiva manifested from the oblation site.

17.3.5.explanation: Underneath the earth lies the netherworlds which are all together seven in number-- Tala, Vitalo, Sutala etc.

17.3.5.explanation: Tala is the dwelling place of mighty warriors like Mahakumbh, Hayagreeva etc.

17.3.5.question: A _______  is of white colour and  _______  has a shade of white.
17.3.5.explanation: Atala is of white colour and Tala has a shade of white.

17.3.5.question: People in their ignorance are unware of the fact that the whole universe is nothing but a medium through which Shiva manifests himself.The various worlds like Maha, Jana,  _______ , Satya etc.
17.3.5.explanation: People in their ignorance are unware of the fact that the whole universe is nothing but a medium through which Shiva manifests himself.The various worlds like Maha, Jana, Tapa, Satya etc.

17.3.5.question: The netherworld named Mahatala is the dwelling place of Lord Muchkand and king  _______ .
17.3.5.explanation: The netherworld named Mahatala is the dwelling place of Lord Muchkand and king Bali.

17.3.5.question: People in their ignorance are unware of the fact that the whole universe is nothing but a medium through which Shiva manifests himself.The various worlds like  _______ , Jana, Tapa, Satya etc.
17.3.5.explanation: People in their ignorance are unware of the fact that the whole universe is nothing but a medium through which Shiva manifests himself.The various worlds like Maha, Jana, Tapa, Satya etc.

17.3.7.explanation: He had nine sons--Nabhi, Kimpurush, Harivarsha, Ilavrata, Ramya, Hiranyamaan, Kuru, Bhadrashva and Ketumaal.
