17.4.1.question: At last, lord Vishnu became pleased and appeared before him mounted on  _______ .
17.4.1.explanation: At last, lord Vishnu became pleased and appeared before him mounted on Garuda.

17.4.2.question: When these girls grew up, Daksha married to different sages--ten of them were married to  _______ , thirteen to Kashyap, twenty-seven to Soma, four to Arishtanemi, two to Bhrigu's son, two to Krishashwa and the remaining two were married to Angira.
17.4.2.explanation: When these girls grew up, Daksha married to different sages--ten of them were married to Dharma, thirteen to Kashyap, twenty-seven to Soma, four to Arishtanemi, two to Bhrigu's son, two to Krishashwa and the remaining two were married to Angira.

17.4.2.question: The named of  _______ 's wives were Marutivati, Vasu, Aryama, Lamba, Bhanu, Arundhati, Sankalpa, Muhurta, Sadhya and Vishwabhamini.Vishwabhamini was the mother of Vishvedeva, while Sadhya gave birth to Sadhva.
17.4.2.explanation: The named of Dharma's wives were Marutivati, Vasu, Aryama, Lamba, Bhanu, Arundhati, Sankalpa, Muhurta, Sadhya and Vishwabhamini.Vishwabhamini was the mother of Vishvedeva, while Sadhya gave birth to Sadhva.

17.4.3.question: The  _______  asked Sutji how Shakti had been devoured by a demon named Rudhir.
17.4.3.explanation: The Sages asked Sutji how Shakti had been devoured by a demon named Rudhir.

17.4.4.question: On being enquired by the  _______  about the respective lineage of Aaditya (Sun) and Soma (moon) Sutji replied--- Sage Kashyap had a son--Aaditya, from Aditi.
17.4.4.explanation: On being enquired by the Sages about the respective lineage of Aaditya (Sun) and Soma (moon) Sutji replied--- Sage Kashyap had a son--Aaditya, from Aditi.

17.4.5.question: _______ netra was the son of  _______  and himself had two sons--Kirti and Sanjay.Sanjay's son was Mahishman and Bhadrashrenya was Mahishman's son.
17.4.5.explanation: Dharmanetra was the son of Dharma and himself had two sons--Kirti and Sanjay.Sanjay's son was Mahishman and Bhadrashrenya was Mahishman's son.

17.4.6.question: Vasudeva had exchanged Sri Krishna with the daughter of Yashoda as Sri Krishna's life was under threat from  _______ .
17.4.6.explanation: Vasudeva had exchanged Sri Krishna with the daughter of Yashoda as Sri Krishna's life was under threat from Kansa.

17.4.6.question: When  _______  tried to kill her, She slipped away from her hand and ascended towards the sky.
17.4.6.explanation: When Kansa tried to kill her, She slipped away from her hand and ascended towards the sky.

17.4.6.question: Her prophesy came to be truth and  _______  was ultimately killed by Sri Krishna.
17.4.6.explanation: Her prophesy came to be truth and Kansa was ultimately killed by Sri Krishna.

17.4.6.question: Aahuk's youngest son, Ugrasen had nice sons among  _______  was the eldest.
17.4.6.explanation: Aahuk's youngest son, Ugrasen had nice sons among Kansa was the eldest.

17.4.7.question: The  _______  asked Sutji as to how did Maya--The demon acquire three well fortified forts from Lord Brahma and how was lord Shiva finally successful in destroying them.
17.4.7.explanation: The Sages asked Sutji as to how did Maya--The demon acquire three well fortified forts from Lord Brahma and how was lord Shiva finally successful in destroying them.

17.4.7.question: The Sages asked Sutji as to how did  _______ --The demon acquire three well fortified forts from Lord Brahma and how was lord Shiva finally successful in destroying them.
17.4.7.explanation: The Sages asked Sutji as to how did Maya--The demon acquire three well fortified forts from Lord Brahma and how was lord Shiva finally successful in destroying them.

17.4.7.question: _______ , then did an austere penance and with the help of divine powers attained from it, constructed three forts at three different places.
17.4.7.explanation: Maya, then did an austere penance and with the help of divine powers attained from it, constructed three forts at three different places.

17.4.7.question: The gold- _______  was given to Tarakaksha, the silver- _______  to Kamalaksha and the iron- _______  was given to Vidyunmali.
17.4.7.explanation: The gold-fort was given to Tarakaksha, the silver-fort to Kamalaksha and the iron-fort was given to Vidyunmali.

17.4.7.question: The gold- _______  was given to Tarakaksha, the silver- _______  to Kamalaksha and the iron- _______  was given to Vidyunmali.
17.4.7.explanation: The gold-fort was given to Tarakaksha, the silver-fort to Kamalaksha and the iron-fort was given to Vidyunmali.

17.4.7.question: The gold- _______  was given to Tarakaksha, the silver- _______  to Kamalaksha and the iron- _______  was given to Vidyunmali.
17.4.7.explanation: The gold-fort was given to Tarakaksha, the silver-fort to Kamalaksha and the iron-fort was given to Vidyunmali.

17.4.7.question: The  _______  made of gold was situated in the heaven, while the silver- _______  was situated in the space.
17.4.7.explanation: The fort made of gold was situated in the heaven, while the silver-fort was situated in the space.

17.4.7.question: The  _______  made of gold was situated in the heaven, while the silver- _______  was situated in the space.
17.4.7.explanation: The fort made of gold was situated in the heaven, while the silver-fort was situated in the space.

17.4.7.question: The third  _______ , which was made of iron, was situated on the earth.
17.4.7.explanation: The third fort, which was made of iron, was situated on the earth.

17.4.7.question: The fort made of gold was situated in the  _______ , while the silver-fort was situated in the space.
17.4.7.explanation: The fort made of gold was situated in the heaven, while the silver-fort was situated in the space.

17.4.8.question: On being asked by the  _______  how Andhak--the demon was appointed as the lord of Ganas by Lord Shiva, Sutji narrated the following tale to them.--The mighty demon, Andhak was Hiranyaksh's son.
17.4.8.explanation: On being asked by the Sages how Andhak--the demon was appointed as the lord of Ganas by Lord Shiva, Sutji narrated the following tale to them.--The mighty demon, Andhak was Hiranyaksh's son.

17.4.9.question: The Sages were curious to know how Lord Vishnu in his incarnation of Varah ( _______ ), had liberated the earth from the captivity of Hiranyaksha.
17.4.9.explanation: The Sages were curious to know how Lord Vishnu in his incarnation of Varah (Boar), had liberated the earth from the captivity of Hiranyaksha.

17.4.9.question: Lord Vishnu then took the incarnation of Varaha ( _______ ) and killed Hiranyaksha with his sharp horns.
17.4.9.explanation: Lord Vishnu then took the incarnation of Varaha (boar) and killed Hiranyaksha with his sharp horns.

17.4.9.question: Lord Shiva adorned and himself with the ornament carved out from the horn of that  _______ .
17.4.9.explanation: Lord Shiva adorned and himself with the ornament carved out from the horn of that boar.

17.4.9.question: They also wanted to know why Lord Shiva adorned himself with the horn of that  _______ .
17.4.9.explanation: They also wanted to know why Lord Shiva adorned himself with the horn of that boar.

17.4.9.question: This is the reason why he is also called 'Danshtri' (wild  _______ ).
17.4.9.explanation: This is the reason why he is also called 'Danshtri' (wild boar).

17.4.9.question: The  _______  were curious to know how Lord Vishnu in his incarnation of Varah (Boar), had liberated the earth from the captivity of Hiranyaksha.
17.4.9.explanation: The Sages were curious to know how Lord Vishnu in his incarnation of Varah (Boar), had liberated the earth from the captivity of Hiranyaksha.

17.4.12.question: The extreme anger of  _______  had resulted into the manifestation of eight divine entities who became famous as 'Kshetrapaal.
17.4.12.explanation: The extreme anger of Kali had resulted into the manifestation of eight divine entities who became famous as 'Kshetrapaal.

17.4.12.question: Lord Shiva then performed his famous dance--Tandav for the first time to bring  _______  back to consciousness.
17.4.12.explanation: Lord Shiva then performed his famous dance--Tandav for the first time to bring Kali back to consciousness.

17.4.12.question: When  _______  regained her consciousness she found Shiva dancing.
17.4.12.explanation: When Kali regained her consciousness she found Shiva dancing.

17.4.12.question: He was accompanied by all the  _______  and spirits in his terrific dance.
17.4.12.explanation: He was accompanied by all the Ghosts and spirits in his terrific dance.

17.5.1.question: When Upamanyu failed in his attempt to kill  _______ , he tried to kill himself by chanting 'Aagneya mantra'.
17.5.1.explanation: When Upamanyu failed in his attempt to kill Shiva, he tried to kill himself by chanting 'Aagneya mantra'.

17.5.1.question: Upamanyu decided then and there to please  _______  by his penance and attain an ocean of milk from him.
17.5.1.explanation: Upamanyu decided then and there to please Shiva by his penance and attain an ocean of milk from him.

17.5.1.question: He started abusing  _______  which made Upamanyu so angry that he tried to kill him.
17.5.1.explanation: He started abusing Shiva which made Upamanyu so angry that he tried to kill him.

17.5.1.question: Only a devotee of  _______  is entitled to all kinds of comfort and pleasure.'
17.5.1.explanation: Only a devotee of Shiva is entitled to all kinds of comfort and pleasure.'

17.5.5.question: It is only by his blessings that the  _______ -Prakriti, creates intelligence--buddhi.
17.5.5.explanation: It is only by his blessings that the Nature-Prakriti, creates intelligence--buddhi.

17.5.5.question: He is the Purusha and she is the  _______  or Prakriti.
17.5.5.explanation: He is the Purusha and she is the nature or Prakriti.

17.5.5.question: Everything that is capable of creating is nothing but the form of  _______ .
17.5.5.explanation: Everything that is capable of creating is nothing but the form of Uma.

17.5.6.question: The  _______  radiates twelve different types of rays which have specific impacts and influences on the world.
17.5.6.explanation: The Sun radiates twelve different types of rays which have specific impacts and influences on the world.

17.5.6.question: Lord Shiva manifests himself in the form of  _______ .
17.5.6.explanation: Lord Shiva manifests himself in the form of Sun.

17.5.6.question: • The sixth ray is called Sanyadwasu and it nurtures the planet-- _______ .
17.5.6.explanation: • The sixth ray is called Sanyadwasu and it nurtures the planet--Mars.

17.5.7.question: Even these sages are of the opinion that Hiranyagarbho, Pradhan, Purush and enjoyer are the manifestations of  _______ .
17.5.7.explanation: Even these sages are of the opinion that Hiranyagarbho, Pradhan, Purush and enjoyer are the manifestations of Shiva.

17.5.7.question: The learned and sages call  _______  by many names --- Kshetragya, Prakriti Vyakta, Kalatma etc.
17.5.7.explanation: The learned and sages call Shiva by many names --- Kshetragya, Prakriti Vyakta, Kalatma etc.

17.5.7.question: Some sages call Hiranyagarbha (Brahma) as the Purush and  _______  as Pradhan.
17.5.7.explanation: Some sages call Hiranyagarbha (Brahma) as the Purush and Shiva as Pradhan.

17.5.8.question: The almighty Shiva manifested in the form of Sthanu ( _______ ) from his imperceptible form and looked at Lord Brahma.
17.5.8.explanation: The almighty Shiva manifested in the form of Sthanu (Pillar) from his imperceptible form and looked at Lord Brahma.

17.5.8.question: He also created ' _______ ' which is required for the performance of 'Yagya'.
17.5.8.explanation: He also created 'Soma' which is required for the performance of 'Yagya'.

17.5.8.question: This world, including all the deities are the embodiments of  _______ .
17.5.8.explanation: This world, including all the deities are the embodiments of Soma.

17.5.9.question: A  _______  should try to test the worthiness of his disciple by employing different means for three years.Once, the  _______  has accepted a person as his disciple, he should try to impart all the knowledge to him.
17.5.9.explanation: A guru should try to test the worthiness of his disciple by employing different means for three years.Once, the Guru has accepted a person as his disciple, he should try to impart all the knowledge to him.

17.5.9.question: A  _______  should try to test the worthiness of his disciple by employing different means for three years.Once, the  _______  has accepted a person as his disciple, he should try to impart all the knowledge to him.
17.5.9.explanation: A guru should try to test the worthiness of his disciple by employing different means for three years.Once, the Guru has accepted a person as his disciple, he should try to impart all the knowledge to him.

17.5.9.question: A devotee should commence the worship of Lord Shiva only after taking permission from his  _______ , Only such a person is worthy of being called a  _______  who is virtuous and well versed in the scripture.
17.5.9.explanation: A devotee should commence the worship of Lord Shiva only after taking permission from his Guru, Only such a person is worthy of being called a Guru who is virtuous and well versed in the scripture.

17.5.9.question: A devotee should commence the worship of Lord Shiva only after taking permission from his  _______ , Only such a person is worthy of being called a  _______  who is virtuous and well versed in the scripture.
17.5.9.explanation: A devotee should commence the worship of Lord Shiva only after taking permission from his Guru, Only such a person is worthy of being called a Guru who is virtuous and well versed in the scripture.

17.5.9.question: A disciple should unwavering by be in the service of his  _______  and should try to please him by his devotion because only he ( _______ ) is capable of liberating him from the miseries of world.
17.5.9.explanation: A disciple should unwavering by be in the service of his Guru and should try to please him by his devotion because only he (Guru) is capable of liberating him from the miseries of world.

17.5.9.question: A disciple should unwavering by be in the service of his  _______  and should try to please him by his devotion because only he ( _______ ) is capable of liberating him from the miseries of world.
17.5.9.explanation: A disciple should unwavering by be in the service of his Guru and should try to please him by his devotion because only he (Guru) is capable of liberating him from the miseries of world.

17.5.9.question: It is the duty of a  _______  to make his disciple destitute of flaws and shortcomings.
17.5.9.explanation: It is the duty of a Guru to make his disciple destitute of flaws and shortcomings.

17.5.10.question: Before commencing the rituals of initiation, the  _______  should purify the place where the rites are supposed to be performed.
17.5.10.explanation: Before commencing the rituals of initiation, the Guru should purify the place where the rites are supposed to be performed.

17.5.10.question: The  _______  should instructed his old disciples to sit towards the south of altar.
17.5.10.explanation: The Guru should instructed his old disciples to sit towards the south of altar.

17.5.10.question: The  _______  should then purify all the directions by chanting different mantras.
17.5.10.explanation: The Guru should then purify all the directions by chanting different mantras.

17.5.10.question: The  _______  then sprinkles holy water on the new disciples.
17.5.10.explanation: The Guru then sprinkles holy water on the new disciples.

17.5.10.question: He should make an attar and draw an eight-petalled  _______  at its centre.
17.5.10.explanation: He should make an attar and draw an eight-petalled lotus at its centre.

17.5.12.question: The devotee should worship  _______  (a spear) and make offerings in the sacrificial fire holding it ( _______ ) in his hand.
17.5.12.explanation: The devotee should worship Vajra (a spear) and make offerings in the sacrificial fire holding it (Vajra) in his hand.

17.5.12.question: The devotee should worship  _______  (a spear) and make offerings in the sacrificial fire holding it ( _______ ) in his hand.
17.5.12.explanation: The devotee should worship Vajra (a spear) and make offerings in the sacrificial fire holding it (Vajra) in his hand.

17.5.12.question: Instead of ghee he can also make offerings of ghee and  _______  seeds OR dhoob grass, ghee, milk and honey.
17.5.12.explanation: Instead of ghee he can also make offerings of ghee and sesame seeds OR dhoob grass, ghee, milk and honey.

17.5.13.question: In this type of  _______ , a man acquires perfection in breath-control by constantly practicing various exercises like Rechak (Exhalation), Kumbhak (retention), etc.
17.5.13.explanation: In this type of yoga, a man acquires perfection in breath-control by constantly practicing various exercises like Rechak (Exhalation), Kumbhak (retention), etc.

17.5.13.question: The sages asked Sutji as to how should a devotee meditate on Lord Triyambak following the path of  _______ .
17.5.13.explanation: The sages asked Sutji as to how should a devotee meditate on Lord Triyambak following the path of Yoga.

17.5.13.question: This state of mind can not be attained unless the two former types of  _______  have been mastered.
17.5.13.explanation: This state of mind can not be attained unless the two former types of yoga have been mastered.

17.5.13.question: In this type of  _______  a devotee tries to attain deep state of meditation by chanting mantras.
17.5.13.explanation: In this type of yoga a devotee tries to attain deep state of meditation by chanting mantras.

17.5.13.question: The secret of  _______  should be revealed to worthy disciples--who are virtuous and religious."
17.5.13.explanation: The secret of Yoga should be revealed to worthy disciples--who are virtuous and religious."

17.5.13.question: When a man has mastered this particular  _______  his ego is subdued in totality.
17.5.13.explanation: When a man has mastered this particular yoga his ego is subdued in totality.

17.5.13.question: The second type of  _______  is known as Sparsh  _______ .
17.5.13.explanation: The second type of Yoga is known as Sparsh Yoga.

17.5.13.question: The third type of  _______  is known as Bhava  _______ .
17.5.13.explanation: The third type of yoga is known as Bhava Yoga.

17.5.13.question: The fourth type of  _______  is called Abhava- _______ .
17.5.13.explanation: The fourth type of Yoga is called Abhava-yoga.

17.5.13.question: The fourth type of  _______  is called Abhava- _______ .
17.5.13.explanation: The fourth type of Yoga is called Abhava-yoga.

17.5.13.question: The first type of  _______  is called Mantra  _______ .
17.5.13.explanation: The first type of Yoga is called Mantra Yoga.

17.5.13.question: The fifth type of  _______  is called Maha  _______ .
17.5.13.explanation: The fifth type of yoga is called Maha yoga.

17.5.13.question: The fifth type of  _______  is called Maha  _______ .
17.5.13.explanation: The fifth type of yoga is called Maha yoga.

17.5.13.question: The study of Linga Puran fulfills all the four worldly aspirations of a man- _______ , Artha, Kaam and Moksha.It also helps a man to attain salvation.
17.5.13.explanation: The study of Linga Puran fulfills all the four worldly aspirations of a man-Dharma, Artha, Kaam and Moksha.It also helps a man to attain salvation.

17.5.13.question: In this type of yoga, a man acquires perfection in breath-control by constantly practicing various exercises like Rechak ( _______ ), Kumbhak (retention), etc.
17.5.13.explanation: In this type of yoga, a man acquires perfection in breath-control by constantly practicing various exercises like Rechak (Exhalation), Kumbhak (retention), etc.

17.5.13.question: The fifth type of yoga is called  _______  yoga.
17.5.13.explanation: The fifth type of yoga is called Maha yoga.

18.question: This  _______  contains detailed description of major places of pilgrimage.
18.explanation: This Purana contains detailed description of major places of pilgrimage.

18.question: _______  are regarded as the oldest scriptures in the entire known history of human civilization.
18.explanation: Vedas are regarded as the oldest scriptures in the entire known history of human civilization.

18.question: _______  emerged thereafter from his mouth.
18.explanation: Vedas emerged thereafter from his mouth.

18.question: Even the  _______  speak about Puranas.
18.explanation: Even the Vedas speak about Puranas.

18.1.question: During their stay in Naimisharanya, those sages called a huge assembly to discuss about the means of attaining all the four goals of life like  _______ , Arth, Kama and Moksha.
18.1.explanation: During their stay in Naimisharanya, those sages called a huge assembly to discuss about the means of attaining all the four goals of life like Dharma, Arth, Kama and Moksha.

18.1.question: I narrate to you, the great  _______ , which was once narrated by the great saint Sanatkumar to Devarshi Narad and now known as Narad  _______ ."
18.1.explanation: I narrate to you, the great Purana, which was once narrated by the great saint Sanatkumar to Devarshi Narad and now known as Narad Purana."

18.2.question: Once, he was going towards the peaks of the mighty Meru Mountains ( _______ ) when on the way, he happened to sight the sacred Ganges.
18.2.explanation: Once, he was going towards the peaks of the mighty Meru Mountains (Himalayas) when on the way, he happened to sight the sacred Ganges.

18.2.question: Towards the north of the great saline sea and towards the south of the great  _______  is situated the Holy Land of India.
18.2.explanation: Towards the north of the great saline sea and towards the south of the great Himalayas is situated the Holy Land of India.

18.2.question: Those ignorant people, who do not seek salvation despite having been born in  _______ , have to suffer the tortures of hell as long as the Sun and the Moon shine in the sky.
18.2.explanation: Those ignorant people, who do not seek salvation despite having been born in India, have to suffer the tortures of hell as long as the Sun and the Moon shine in the sky.

18.2.question: Towards the north of the great saline sea and towards the south of the great Himalayas is situated the Holy Land of  _______ .
18.2.explanation: Towards the north of the great saline sea and towards the south of the great Himalayas is situated the Holy Land of India.

18.2.question: Those ignorant people, who do not seek salvation despite having been born in India, have to suffer the tortures of hell as long as the Sun and the  _______  shine in the sky.
18.2.explanation: Those ignorant people, who do not seek salvation despite having been born in India, have to suffer the tortures of hell as long as the Sun and the Moon shine in the sky.

18.2.question: Those ignorant people, who do not seek salvation despite having been born in India, have to suffer the tortures of hell as long as the  _______  and the Moon shine in the sky.
18.2.explanation: Those ignorant people, who do not seek salvation despite having been born in India, have to suffer the tortures of hell as long as the Sun and the Moon shine in the sky.

18.3.question: It is also the giver of four supreme goals of life like  _______ , Arth, Kama and Moksha.
18.3.explanation: It is also the giver of four supreme goals of life like Dharma, Arth, Kama and Moksha.

18.3.question: He had observed a very severe penance at the  _______  pilgrimage center of Shaligram.
18.3.explanation: He had observed a very severe penance at the holy pilgrimage center of Shaligram.

18.3.question: Fallen are those who, despite having the knowledge of  _______ , do not comply with the moral code of conduct of their clan.
18.3.explanation: Fallen are those who, despite having the knowledge of Vedas, do not comply with the moral code of conduct of their clan.

18.3.question: Neither  _______  nor even devotion can salve such people.
18.3.explanation: Neither Vedas nor even devotion can salve such people.

18.4.question: Those who protect the human beings, cows,  _______ , vegetation and remain engrossed in discussion of Lord’s virtues.
18.4.explanation: Those who protect the human beings, cows, Brahmins, vegetation and remain engrossed in discussion of Lord’s virtues.

18.4.question: The  _______  say that during the Pralay, Markandeya had witnessed the direct appearance of Lord Vishnu’s illusion.
18.4.explanation: The Puranas say that during the Pralay, Markandeya had witnessed the direct appearance of Lord Vishnu’s illusion.

18.4.question: In his fifth year, he carried out the thread ceremony of his son and started to educate him in  _______ .
18.4.explanation: In his fifth year, he carried out the thread ceremony of his son and started to educate him in Vedas.

18.6.question: With time, evils like envy and  _______  began to rise in the mind of Baahu.
18.6.explanation: With time, evils like envy and ego began to rise in the mind of Baahu.

18.6.question: With time, evils like  _______  and ego began to rise in the mind of Baahu.
18.6.explanation: With time, evils like envy and ego began to rise in the mind of Baahu.

18.9.question: With a huge army,  _______  launched a massive attack on heaven and soon a fierce battle broke out.
18.9.explanation: With a huge army, Bali launched a massive attack on heaven and soon a fierce battle broke out.

18.9.question: In the lineage of Prahlad, occurred the great king  _______  who was the son of Virochan.
18.9.explanation: In the lineage of Prahlad, occurred the great king Bali who was the son of Virochan.

18.9.question: _______  had two ministers, Kubhand and Koopkarna and an equally prowessive son Baan.
18.9.explanation: Bali had two ministers, Kubhand and Koopkarna and an equally prowessive son Baan.

18.9.question: Defeating the gods, the king  _______  organized many Ashwamedha Yagyas.
18.9.explanation: Defeating the gods, the king Bali organized many Ashwamedha Yagyas.

18.9.question: _______  had conquered entire earth and was now eyeing the heaven.
18.9.explanation: Bali had conquered entire earth and was now eyeing the heaven.

18.9.question: At last, the gods lost the  _______  to the demons and began to wander here and there in search of solace.
18.9.explanation: At last, the gods lost the heaven to the demons and began to wander here and there in search of solace.

18.9.question: With a huge army, Bali launched a massive attack on  _______  and soon a fierce battle broke out.
18.9.explanation: With a huge army, Bali launched a massive attack on heaven and soon a fierce battle broke out.

18.9.question: Bali had conquered entire earth and was now eyeing the  _______ .
18.9.explanation: Bali had conquered entire earth and was now eyeing the heaven.

18.9.question: Kindly narrate the tale of the  _______ ’ origin from the feet of lord Vishnu."
18.9.explanation: Kindly narrate the tale of the Ganges’ origin from the feet of lord Vishnu."

18.9.question: Feeling sorry for the plight of her sons, Aditi began a severe penance on the  _______ .
18.9.explanation: Feeling sorry for the plight of her sons, Aditi began a severe penance on the Himalayas.

18.10.question: As the last attempt to prevent  _______  from making a vow, Shukracharya assumed a miniature appearance and clogged the snout of the kamandalu.
18.10.explanation: As the last attempt to prevent Bali from making a vow, Shukracharya assumed a miniature appearance and clogged the snout of the kamandalu.

18.10.question: As soon as  _______  granted the demand, Vaaman assumed a gigantic appearance and measured the entire earth and heaven in his two steps.
18.10.explanation: As soon as Bali granted the demand, Vaaman assumed a gigantic appearance and measured the entire earth and heaven in his two steps.

18.10.question: Sanatkumar says: "Oblations offered without hymns and alms given to undeserving person constitute the food for  _______ .
18.10.explanation: Sanatkumar says: "Oblations offered without hymns and alms given to undeserving person constitute the food for Bali.

18.10.question: As there was no other room left for the Lord to put His third step,  _______  presented his own head for the purpose.
18.10.explanation: As there was no other room left for the Lord to put His third step, Bali presented his own head for the purpose.

18.10.question: Thus, the Lord snatched the kingdom of heaven from  _______  without any bloodshed and returned it to the gods."
18.10.explanation: Thus, the Lord snatched the kingdom of heaven from Bali without any bloodshed and returned it to the gods."

18.10.question: He also advised  _______  to abide by his dictate or he would have to face severe consequences.
18.10.explanation: He also advised Bali to abide by his dictate or he would have to face severe consequences.

18.10.question: Vaaman put his third step on  _______ ’s head and pressed him down into the hades.
18.10.explanation: Vaaman put his third step on Bali’s head and pressed him down into the hades.

18.10.question: He cautioned  _______  in isolation not to grant any demand of Vaaman.
18.10.explanation: He cautioned Bali in isolation not to grant any demand of Vaaman.

18.10.question: How did the Lord arrange for  _______ ’s food in the nether world?"
18.10.explanation: How did the Lord arrange for Bali’s food in the nether world?"

18.10.question: At last  _______  agreed to grant his demand.
18.10.explanation: At last Bali agreed to grant his demand.

18.10.question: She intimated the  _______  about the plight of her sons and sought that He should help them to regain the heaven without killing the demons for they were also her sons though step.
18.10.explanation: She intimated the Lord about the plight of her sons and sought that He should help them to regain the heaven without killing the demons for they were also her sons though step.

18.10.question: As there was no other room left for the  _______  to put His third step, Bali presented his own head for the purpose.
18.10.explanation: As there was no other room left for the Lord to put His third step, Bali presented his own head for the purpose.

18.10.question: Thus, the  _______  snatched the kingdom of heaven from Bali without any bloodshed and returned it to the gods."
18.10.explanation: Thus, the Lord snatched the kingdom of heaven from Bali without any bloodshed and returned it to the gods."

18.10.question: The omniscient  _______  pricked the snout with a sharp stem and pricked Shukracharya’s one eye.
18.10.explanation: The omniscient Lord pricked the snout with a sharp stem and pricked Shukracharya’s one eye.

18.10.question: Feeling elated with exhilaration, Aditi fell flat at the  _______ ’s feet.
18.10.explanation: Feeling elated with exhilaration, Aditi fell flat at the Lord’s feet.

18.10.question: Then, the  _______  presented Aditi with His garland and disappeared.
18.10.explanation: Then, the Lord presented Aditi with His garland and disappeared.

18.10.question: How did the  _______  arrange for Bali’s food in the nether world?"
18.10.explanation: How did the Lord arrange for Bali’s food in the nether world?"

18.10.question: She intimated the Lord about the plight of her sons and sought that He should help them to regain the  _______  without killing the demons for they were also her sons though step.
18.10.explanation: She intimated the Lord about the plight of her sons and sought that He should help them to regain the heaven without killing the demons for they were also her sons though step.

18.10.question: As soon as Bali granted the demand, Vaaman assumed a gigantic appearance and measured the entire earth and  _______  in his two steps.
18.10.explanation: As soon as Bali granted the demand, Vaaman assumed a gigantic appearance and measured the entire earth and heaven in his two steps.

18.10.question: Thus, the Lord snatched the kingdom of  _______  from Bali without any bloodshed and returned it to the gods."
18.10.explanation: Thus, the Lord snatched the kingdom of heaven from Bali without any bloodshed and returned it to the gods."

18.10.question: In the course of their flow, these streams merged into a single mightier stream and, sanctifying Brahma and other deities, fell on the mighty Sumeru Mountain ( _______ ).
18.10.explanation: In the course of their flow, these streams merged into a single mightier stream and, sanctifying Brahma and other deities, fell on the mighty Sumeru Mountain (Himalayas).

18.10.question: In the course of their flow, these  _______  merged into a single mightier stream and, sanctifying Brahma and other deities, fell on the mighty Sumeru Mountain (Himalayas).
18.10.explanation: In the course of their flow, these streams merged into a single mightier stream and, sanctifying Brahma and other deities, fell on the mighty Sumeru Mountain (Himalayas).

18.10.question: With the tearing of the universe, millions of  _______  sprang out.
18.10.explanation: With the tearing of the universe, millions of streams sprang out.

18.11.question: Providing a  _______  family or a Vedapathi  _______  with a means of sustenance is the most virtuous donation.
18.11.explanation: Providing a Brahmin family or a Vedapathi Brahmin with a means of sustenance is the most virtuous donation.

18.11.question: Inspiring others to make donation to such a  _______  is also equally fruitful.
18.11.explanation: Inspiring others to make donation to such a Brahmin is also equally fruitful.

18.11.question: A  _______  can accept donation candidly but not a Vaishya or a Kshatriya.
18.11.explanation: A Brahmin can accept donation candidly but not a Vaishya or a Kshatriya.

18.11.question: _______  is considered as the excellent among all the four castes.
18.11.explanation: Brahmin is considered as the excellent among all the four castes.

18.11.question: A Brahmin can accept donation candidly but not a Vaishya or a  _______ .
18.11.explanation: A Brahmin can accept donation candidly but not a Vaishya or a Kshatriya.

18.11.question: Besides these, Brahmins who habitually enjoy sensual pleasures during  _______ , who dine during the dusk, who have been boycotted by their brothers and society, who have taken birth illegitimately or after the death of their real father because of dubious relations of their mother, whose younger brother have married earlier and those who are always controlled by lusty women, who act as pimps or remain indulged in mean activities also do not deserve donation.
18.11.explanation: Besides these, Brahmins who habitually enjoy sensual pleasures during siesta, who dine during the dusk, who have been boycotted by their brothers and society, who have taken birth illegitimately or after the death of their real father because of dubious relations of their mother, whose younger brother have married earlier and those who are always controlled by lusty women, who act as pimps or remain indulged in mean activities also do not deserve donation.

18.11.question: These are- Brahmins who practice astrology, act against the religion, who are greedy, who sell scriptures and other religious materials, who have relations with other women than their wives, who are envious, ungrateful, singer, who have characterless wife, who are soldiers, priests, harbinger, cook, poet, doctor, who eat meat and cereals given by a  _______ , who carry out cremation and the Brahmins who consume the food given by prostitutes.
18.11.explanation: These are- Brahmins who practice astrology, act against the religion, who are greedy, who sell scriptures and other religious materials, who have relations with other women than their wives, who are envious, ungrateful, singer, who have characterless wife, who are soldiers, priests, harbinger, cook, poet, doctor, who eat meat and cereals given by a Shudra, who carry out cremation and the Brahmins who consume the food given by prostitutes.

18.12.question: Similarly, those who bathe  _______ ’s idol with coconut milk, sugarcane juice, and water containing flowers or filtered water get free from all their sins.
18.12.explanation: Similarly, those who bathe Lord’s idol with coconut milk, sugarcane juice, and water containing flowers or filtered water get free from all their sins.

18.12.question: Similarly, those who bathe the  _______ ’s idol with milk on Dwadashi and Poornamaasi salve millions of their ancestors.
18.12.explanation: Similarly, those who bathe the Lord’s idol with milk on Dwadashi and Poornamaasi salve millions of their ancestors.

18.12.question: Those who bathe  _______ ’s idol with Panchamrit on Ekadashi receive everlasting joy and salvation.
18.12.explanation: Those who bathe Lord’s idol with Panchamrit on Ekadashi receive everlasting joy and salvation.

18.12.question: Those who serve the  _______  deities or cow, those who play instruments, bell, and blow conch or clap in the temple enjoy intimacy with divine beauties in the heaven for five Kalpas.
18.12.explanation: Those who serve the Brahmin deities or cow, those who play instruments, bell, and blow conch or clap in the temple enjoy intimacy with divine beauties in the heaven for five Kalpas.

18.12.question: Those who arrange for the cremation of an orphaned  _______  receive virtues equal to thousands of Ashwamedha Yagyas.
18.12.explanation: Those who arrange for the cremation of an orphaned Brahmin receive virtues equal to thousands of Ashwamedha Yagyas.

18.12.question: Virtues of donating land and milch cow to a  _______  cannot be described in words.
18.12.explanation: Virtues of donating land and milch cow to a Brahmin cannot be described in words.

18.12.question: "Those who worship Lord Vishnu and Shiva offering them flowers of lotus,  _______ , and particularly offer Dhatura to Lord Shiva attain their respective abodes.
18.12.explanation: "Those who worship Lord Vishnu and Shiva offering them flowers of lotus, Pandanus, and particularly offer Dhatura to Lord Shiva attain their respective abodes.

18.12.question: "Those who worship Lord Vishnu and Shiva offering them flowers of  _______ , Pandanus, and particularly offer Dhatura to Lord Shiva attain their respective abodes.
18.12.explanation: "Those who worship Lord Vishnu and Shiva offering them flowers of lotus, Pandanus, and particularly offer Dhatura to Lord Shiva attain their respective abodes.

18.12.question: It is the case with the donation of knowledge, Shaligram, Shivalinga, horse,  _______ , elephant or any other vehicle.
18.12.explanation: It is the case with the donation of knowledge, Shaligram, Shivalinga, horse, buffalo, elephant or any other vehicle.

18.12.question: Those who serve the Brahmin deities or cow, those who play instruments, bell, and blow conch or clap in the temple enjoy intimacy with divine beauties in the  _______  for five Kalpas.
18.12.explanation: Those who serve the Brahmin deities or cow, those who play instruments, bell, and blow conch or clap in the temple enjoy intimacy with divine beauties in the heaven for five Kalpas.

18.13.question: One should not  _______  the soil collected from pond’s bottom, termite’s mound, mo _______  burrow, barren land, road, cremation ground and ground  _______ d for defecation purpose.
18.13.explanation: One should not use the soil collected from pond’s bottom, termite’s mound, mouse burrow, barren land, road, cremation ground and ground used for defecation purpose.

18.13.question: _______  of Panchgavya washes even the most severe sin.
18.13.explanation: Use of Panchgavya washes even the most severe sin.

18.13.question: One should not use the soil collected from pond’s bottom, termite’s mound, mouse  _______ , barren land, road, cremation ground and ground used for defecation purpose.
18.13.explanation: One should not use the soil collected from pond’s bottom, termite’s mound, mouse burrow, barren land, road, cremation ground and ground used for defecation purpose.

18.13.question: _______  resulted because of touching a woman in menses takes fast for three nights to get purified."
18.13.explanation: Impurity resulted because of touching a woman in menses takes fast for three nights to get purified."

18.13.question: If a  _______  defecates during dining, he must give up his food at once and take water only.
18.13.explanation: If a Brahmin defecates during dining, he must give up his food at once and take water only.

18.14.question: Those who abuse Lord Vishnu and Shiva are fed with salt only for crores of years then they are thrown into Raurav  _______ , which is full of hot scorching sand.
18.14.explanation: Those who abuse Lord Vishnu and Shiva are fed with salt only for crores of years then they are thrown into Raurav hell, which is full of hot scorching sand.

18.14.question: Those who torture Brahmins through their thoughts, actions and words always fall in the  _______ .
18.14.explanation: Those who torture Brahmins through their thoughts, actions and words always fall in the hell.

18.14.question: Those who commit severe sin on earth are bound to suffer equally severe torturing in  _______ .
18.14.explanation: Those who commit severe sin on earth are bound to suffer equally severe torturing in hell.

18.14.question: Those who falsely blame gentlepeople have to live in the  _______  for crores of years.
18.14.explanation: Those who falsely blame gentlepeople have to live in the hell for crores of years.

18.14.question: Those who give up a fast before stipulated period go to the  _______  named Asipatra.
18.14.explanation: Those who give up a fast before stipulated period go to the hell named Asipatra.

18.14.question: Those who consume cow’s flesh live in Vingbhojya  _______  for thousands of years.
18.14.explanation: Those who consume cow’s flesh live in Vingbhojya hell for thousands of years.

18.14.question: Those who do not curb immoral traffic despite being capable go to  _______ .
18.14.explanation: Those who do not curb immoral traffic despite being capable go to hell.

18.14.question: are some of the tortures one has to face for his sins in the  _______ .
18.14.explanation: are some of the tortures one has to face for his sins in the hell.

18.14.question: They are then thrown into Kumbhipaak  _______ .
18.14.explanation: They are then thrown into Kumbhipaak hell.

18.14.question: All of them deserve a place in the  _______ ."
18.14.explanation: All of them deserve a place in the hell."

18.14.question: It was due to the severe penance of king Bhagirath that the  _______  descended on the earth and salved the sixty thousand deceased sons of Sagar."
18.14.explanation: It was due to the severe penance of king Bhagirath that the Ganges descended on the earth and salved the sixty thousand deceased sons of Sagar."

18.14.question: Since now onwards, cultivate devotion for Lord Vishnu and invoke the  _______  to descend on earth in order to salve your sinister ancestors.
18.14.explanation: Since now onwards, cultivate devotion for Lord Vishnu and invoke the Ganges to descend on earth in order to salve your sinister ancestors.

18.14.question: Sight of the  _______  and basil, singing of devotional songs, magnanimity and non-violence attenuate the effect of the sin.
18.14.explanation: Sight of the Ganges and basil, singing of devotional songs, magnanimity and non-violence attenuate the effect of the sin.

18.14.question: Only the  _______  is capable of salving one and all."
18.14.explanation: Only the Ganges is capable of salving one and all."

18.14.question: _______  of the Ganges and basil, singing of devotional songs, magnanimity and non-violence attenuate the effect of the sin.
18.14.explanation: Sight of the Ganges and basil, singing of devotional songs, magnanimity and non-violence attenuate the effect of the sin.

18.14.question: Thus preaching the king Sagar, Dharmaraaj disappeared from the  _______ .
18.14.explanation: Thus preaching the king Sagar, Dharmaraaj disappeared from the sight.

18.14.question: Those who abuse Lord Vishnu and  _______  are fed with salt only for crores of years then they are thrown into Raurav hell, which is full of hot scorching sand.
18.14.explanation: Those who abuse Lord Vishnu and Shiva are fed with salt only for crores of years then they are thrown into Raurav hell, which is full of hot scorching sand.

18.16.question: The required mantra is GOVINDAAY NAMASTUBHYAM On the same day in the month of Chaitra, there is a provision of bathing Vishnu’s idol with five liters of ghee and making oblations of honey, ghee and sesame seeds one hundred and eight times while reciting - NAMOSTU VISHNAVE TUBHYAM Then four kilos of rice are donated to a  _______ .
18.16.explanation: The required mantra is GOVINDAAY NAMASTUBHYAM On the same day in the month of Chaitra, there is a provision of bathing Vishnu’s idol with five liters of ghee and making oblations of honey, ghee and sesame seeds one hundred and eight times while reciting - NAMOSTU VISHNAVE TUBHYAM Then four kilos of rice are donated to a Brahmin.

18.16.question: At the end of the worship, one should donate sweetmeats made of milk, ghee and coconut to  _______  while reciting-‘May the Lord materialize all my wishes.’ Seeing off the  _______ , one should break his fast at the end.
18.16.explanation: At the end of the worship, one should donate sweetmeats made of milk, ghee and coconut to Brahmin while reciting-‘May the Lord materialize all my wishes.’ Seeing off the Brahmin, one should break his fast at the end.

18.16.question: At the end of the worship, one should donate sweetmeats made of milk, ghee and coconut to  _______  while reciting-‘May the Lord materialize all my wishes.’ Seeing off the  _______ , one should break his fast at the end.
18.16.explanation: At the end of the worship, one should donate sweetmeats made of milk, ghee and coconut to Brahmin while reciting-‘May the Lord materialize all my wishes.’ Seeing off the Brahmin, one should break his fast at the end.

18.16.question: This worship is closed with donating five types of edible items to a deserving  _______ , feeding him and seeing him off with Dakshina.
18.16.explanation: This worship is closed with donating five types of edible items to a deserving Brahmin, feeding him and seeing him off with Dakshina.

18.16.question: Twenty Maalpuas (wheat flour kneaded in milk and sugar and fried in ghee) are donated to a  _______ .
18.16.explanation: Twenty Maalpuas (wheat flour kneaded in milk and sugar and fried in ghee) are donated to a Brahmin.

18.16.question: Then four liters of milk, clothes and two golden earrings are donated to the  _______ .
18.16.explanation: Then four liters of milk, clothes and two golden earrings are donated to the Brahmin.

18.16.question: Two hundred and fifty grams of honey are donated to a  _______ .
18.16.explanation: Two hundred and fifty grams of honey are donated to a Brahmin.

18.16.question: The required mantra is GOVINDAAY NAMASTUBHYAM On the same day in the month of Chaitra, there is a provision of bathing Vishnu’s idol with five liters of ghee and making oblations of honey, ghee and  _______  seeds one hundred and eight times while reciting - NAMOSTU VISHNAVE TUBHYAM Then four kilos of rice are donated to a Brahmin.
18.16.explanation: The required mantra is GOVINDAAY NAMASTUBHYAM On the same day in the month of Chaitra, there is a provision of bathing Vishnu’s idol with five liters of ghee and making oblations of honey, ghee and sesame seeds one hundred and eight times while reciting - NAMOSTU VISHNAVE TUBHYAM Then four kilos of rice are donated to a Brahmin.

18.16.question: Then, one hundred and eight oblations are offered with ghee,  _______  seeds and rice reciting - NAMASTE PADMANAABHAAY.
18.16.explanation: Then, one hundred and eight oblations are offered with ghee, sesame seeds and rice reciting - NAMASTE PADMANAABHAAY.

18.16.question: Next morning, oblations are offered with  _______  seeds reciting all the twelve mantras described above.
18.16.explanation: Next morning, oblations are offered with sesame seeds reciting all the twelve mantras described above.

18.16.question: Then, one hundred and eight oblations are offered with  _______  seeds mixed with honey and ghee.
18.16.explanation: Then, one hundred and eight oblations are offered with sesame seeds mixed with honey and ghee.

18.16.question: Then one hundred and eight oblations of  _______  seeds and ghee are made to the sacred fire.
18.16.explanation: Then one hundred and eight oblations of sesame seeds and ghee are made to the sacred fire.

18.16.question: One should then offer oblations of ghee and  _______  seeds in sacred fire.
18.16.explanation: One should then offer oblations of ghee and sesame seeds in sacred fire.

18.16.question: This time, five kilos of  _______  seeds are donated to the Brahmins.
18.16.explanation: This time, five kilos of sesame seeds are donated to the Brahmins.

18.16.question: On the twelfth day of Shukla Paksha in  _______ , one should bathe Shri Hari’s idol with five liters of milk.
18.16.explanation: On the twelfth day of Shukla Paksha in Phagun, one should bathe Shri Hari’s idol with five liters of milk.

18.17.question: Like the fast of Dwadashi, this fast is also begun from the month of Maargsheersh and observed continuously on every full  _______  day of succeeding months till Kartik when it is closed with proper rituals".
18.17.explanation: Like the fast of Dwadashi, this fast is also begun from the month of Maargsheersh and observed continuously on every full Moon day of succeeding months till Kartik when it is closed with proper rituals".

18.17.question: To begin with, one should start worshipping Lord Vishnu since the morning of full  _______  day in the month of Maargsheersh wearing white clothes and reciting NAMO NAARAAYANAA.
18.17.explanation: To begin with, one should start worshipping Lord Vishnu since the morning of full Moon day in the month of Maargsheersh wearing white clothes and reciting NAMO NAARAAYANAA.

18.17.question: Rituals for closing this fast in the month of Kartik on full  _______  day are also elaborate.
18.17.explanation: Rituals for closing this fast in the month of Kartik on full Moon day are also elaborate.

18.17.question: Observing fast on full  _______  day is considered excellent among all the fasts.
18.17.explanation: Observing fast on full Moon day is considered excellent among all the fasts.

18.17.question: In the evening, the same things are offered to the rising full  _______  also.
18.17.explanation: In the evening, the same things are offered to the rising full Moon also.

18.17.question: Like the fast of Dwadashi, this fast is also begun from the month of Maargsheersh and observed continuously on every full Moon day of succeeding months till  _______  when it is closed with proper rituals".
18.17.explanation: Like the fast of Dwadashi, this fast is also begun from the month of Maargsheersh and observed continuously on every full Moon day of succeeding months till Kartik when it is closed with proper rituals".

18.17.question: Rituals for closing this fast in the month of  _______  on full Moon day are also elaborate.
18.17.explanation: Rituals for closing this fast in the month of Kartik on full Moon day are also elaborate.

18.17.question: Next day, donations are made to the  _______  after performing usual worship.
18.17.explanation: Next day, donations are made to the Brahmins after performing usual worship.

18.17.question: It is followed by feeding of  _______ .
18.17.explanation: It is followed by feeding of Brahmins.

18.17.question: After the worship, the devotee must perform a Havan on a square-shaped altar offering oblations with cooked cereals,  _______  seeds, ghee etc.
18.17.explanation: After the worship, the devotee must perform a Havan on a square-shaped altar offering oblations with cooked cereals, sesame seeds, ghee etc.

18.17.question: All these rituals are closed with performing a Havan offering  _______  seeds as oblation.
18.17.explanation: All these rituals are closed with performing a Havan offering sesame seeds as oblation.

18.17.question: White flowers, unbroken rice grains and water are offered to the  _______ .
18.17.explanation: White flowers, unbroken rice grains and water are offered to the Lord.

18.18.question: It is followed by oblations offered to the Sun, the  _______  and Kaamadhenu.
18.18.explanation: It is followed by oblations offered to the Sun, the Moon and Kaamadhenu.

18.18.question: He should then worship the Sun, the  _______  and Garud.
18.18.explanation: He should then worship the Sun, the Moon and Garud.

18.18.question: It is followed by oblations offered to the  _______ , the Moon and Kaamadhenu.
18.18.explanation: It is followed by oblations offered to the Sun, the Moon and Kaamadhenu.

18.18.question: He should then worship the  _______ , the Moon and Garud.
18.18.explanation: He should then worship the Sun, the Moon and Garud.

18.18.question: This fast accords virtues equal to those of donating one thousand carats of gold to a  _______  or those attained taking bath in the Ganges and worshipping Shivalinga and basil sapling. "
18.18.explanation: This fast accords virtues equal to those of donating one thousand carats of gold to a Brahmin or those attained taking bath in the Ganges and worshipping Shivalinga and basil sapling. "

18.18.question: The devotee should observe this fast on the tenth day of the brighter phase in the month of  _______ .
18.18.explanation: The devotee should observe this fast on the tenth day of the brighter phase in the month of Kartik.

18.19.question: In the previous birth, I was a  _______  named Maalini and always engaged in appalling activities.
18.19.explanation: In the previous birth, I was a Shudra named Maalini and always engaged in appalling activities.

18.19.question: Saadhvi says: "I was born in the family of  _______ , Daaruk was my father.
18.19.explanation: Saadhvi says: "I was born in the family of oarsman, Daaruk was my father.

18.20.question: It is observed for five days in the month of Maargsheersh starting from the tenth day of the brighter phase till the full  _______  day.
18.20.explanation: It is observed for five days in the month of Maargsheersh starting from the tenth day of the brighter phase till the full Moon day.

18.20.question: That whole night and also the subsequent nights till full  _______  night are passed reciting Lord’s name and singing devotional songs.
18.20.explanation: That whole night and also the subsequent nights till full Moon night are passed reciting Lord’s name and singing devotional songs.

18.20.question: Bathing of Lord’s idol with milk containing ghee, curd, honey and dry fruits continues in the morning everyday till full  _______  day.
18.20.explanation: Bathing of Lord’s idol with milk containing ghee, curd, honey and dry fruits continues in the morning everyday till full Moon day.

18.20.question: On the full  _______  day, Havan is performed with oblations of sesame seeds and donations.
18.20.explanation: On the full Moon day, Havan is performed with oblations of sesame seeds and donations.

18.20.question: On the sixth day, the devotee must drink Panchgavya and worship Shri Hari, feed  _______  and only then should take meal silently.
18.20.explanation: On the sixth day, the devotee must drink Panchgavya and worship Shri Hari, feed Brahmins and only then should take meal silently.

18.20.question: He should then feed the  _______  before himself taking any meal.
18.20.explanation: He should then feed the Brahmins before himself taking any meal.

18.20.question: Bathing of Lord’s idol with milk containing ghee,  _______ , honey and dry fruits continues in the morning everyday till full Moon day.
18.20.explanation: Bathing of Lord’s idol with milk containing ghee, curd, honey and dry fruits continues in the morning everyday till full Moon day.

18.20.question: Next day, Lord’s idol is bathed with milk containing ghee,  _______ , honey and five types of dry fruits followed by usual worship.
18.20.explanation: Next day, Lord’s idol is bathed with milk containing ghee, curd, honey and five types of dry fruits followed by usual worship.

18.20.question: This fast is observed every month till  _______  and closing rituals are taken up in the month of Maargsheersh next year.
18.20.explanation: This fast is observed every month till Kartik and closing rituals are taken up in the month of Maargsheersh next year.

18.21.question: Then, reciting scriptures in the guidance of learned  _______ , he should take a vow to observe a month long fast praying Lord Vishnu to protect him from any unforeseen crises.
18.21.explanation: Then, reciting scriptures in the guidance of learned Brahmins, he should take a vow to observe a month long fast praying Lord Vishnu to protect him from any unforeseen crises.

18.21.question: According to the provision of fast, the devotee should feed at least twelve  _______  and donate jewelry.
18.21.explanation: According to the provision of fast, the devotee should feed at least twelve Brahmins and donate jewelry.

18.21.question: Everyday, he should bathe the idol with milk containing ghee,  _______ , honey and dry fruits and light the lamps before the idol.
18.21.explanation: Everyday, he should bathe the idol with milk containing ghee, curd, honey and dry fruits and light the lamps before the idol.

18.22.question: Salvation from sins like killing a  _______  is possible but there is no method to eliminate the sins incurred because of dining on the eleventh day.
18.22.explanation: Salvation from sins like killing a Brahmin is possible but there is no method to eliminate the sins incurred because of dining on the eleventh day.

18.22.question: On the eleventh  _______ , the devotee should worship Shri Hari in the morning and take an oath to observe fast during the  _______  and pray the Lord to protect him from calamities.
18.22.explanation: On the eleventh day, the devotee should worship Shri Hari in the morning and take an oath to observe fast during the day and pray the Lord to protect him from calamities.

18.22.question: On the eleventh  _______ , the devotee should worship Shri Hari in the morning and take an oath to observe fast during the  _______  and pray the Lord to protect him from calamities.
18.22.explanation: On the eleventh day, the devotee should worship Shri Hari in the morning and take an oath to observe fast during the day and pray the Lord to protect him from calamities.

18.22.question: Salvation from sins like killing a Brahmin is possible but there is no method to eliminate the sins incurred because of dining on the eleventh  _______ .
18.22.explanation: Salvation from sins like killing a Brahmin is possible but there is no method to eliminate the sins incurred because of dining on the eleventh day.

18.22.question: He also would tell his friends to always worship Lord Vishnu and observe fast on the eleventh  _______  of every phase in every month.
18.22.explanation: He also would tell his friends to always worship Lord Vishnu and observe fast on the eleventh day of every phase in every month.

18.22.question: A fast on Ekadashi (eleventh  _______ ) in both the phases of a month pleases Shri Hari and fulfills all the desires.
18.22.explanation: A fast on Ekadashi (eleventh day) in both the phases of a month pleases Shri Hari and fulfills all the desires.

18.22.question: Brahmins should essentially observe fast on the eleventh  _______  of each phase.
18.22.explanation: Brahmins should essentially observe fast on the eleventh day of each phase.

18.22.question: In the morning of the twelfth  _______ , he should worship Lord Vishnu as usual.
18.22.explanation: In the morning of the twelfth day, he should worship Lord Vishnu as usual.

18.22.question: The preparations for Ekadashi Vrata start on the tenth  _______ .
18.22.explanation: The preparations for Ekadashi Vrata start on the tenth day.

18.22.question: On the eleventh  _______  of each phase, one should not dine.
18.22.explanation: On the eleventh day of each phase, one should not dine.

18.22.question: Those who dine on the eleventh  _______  commit severe sins.
18.22.explanation: Those who dine on the eleventh day commit severe sins.

18.22.question: One  _______ , I went to the forest hunting.
18.22.explanation: One day, I went to the forest hunting.
